3.description: We dropped by on Sunday afternoon for a wine tasting. One of the employees stood with us by an open chest refrigerator in the back and allowed us to try practically every mead they sell. That was cool. There were a number of unique flavors, my favorite being the Pirate's Blood, which has a deep color and is infused with hot peppers. The combination of sweet and heat works for me. Their "tasting room" is also their office, and it was very small and crowded. The employee who was helping us with the tasting told us they are moving to a larger space with a warehouse, a real tasting room and possibly space for a banquet hall.Wild Blossom was very hard to find. They are on the East side of Western Ave. between 100th and 101st street in Beverly. There is no sign out front. They share space with the Bevart brewer supply company, which has it's name on the door, but there is no awning or anything to alert a driver passing by that they are there.  Better signage at the new location will go a long way. Also, Beverly is a dry neighborhood, so when we asked to purchase wine, we were directed to the sketchy liquor store on the other side of Western, which is apparently in a different neighborhood. Parking is free on the street and was plentiful, at least on Sunday.Enjoyed the afternoon, but probably won't make a return trip. If I find them in a local liquor store I would buy their mead again.

1.description: Went yesterday to do a tasting with the ladies. The wines were amazing! We were able to each sample about 6 wines. The tasting itself includes 5 but if you wanted to sample another they were completely okay with that. It's recommended you don't try too many because the flavors tend to blend together. I'm looking forward to the tasting room opening which is close to this location but your able to purchase the wines there. The downfall was if we wanted to purchase any we have to go to either binnys or the store which was near. If you have never tried mead wines you definitely should!

2.description: We did a Mead tasting last weekend: The mead is awesome!! Greg & Joe were very generous in all of the tastings (tried quite a few) and answered all of our questions and dealt with our "tipsy"-ness graciously (love how potent the mead is!!). Can't wait til their new location opens up in 2015 which will have the "tasting room-style" vibe we've all become accustomed to from wine vineyards across the country.

5.description: You can buy it at Bottles and Cans in North Center, Chicago!

6.description: If you think mead is just something to swill at the Renaissance Faire or that stuff brewed by your weird hippie neighbor, let me school you. Chicago has a meadery, its name is Wild Blossom, and they make a damn fine mead, or two, or ten.Wild Blossom Meadery operates out of the brewing supply shop Beverage Art on Western Avenue in Beverly. I'd read about their mead (honey wine) in a couple of  places within a short span of time and was stirred to find out whether they did tastings or anything of that nature. I called to find out; it took a couple of calls to get in touch with Greg, the master brewer/vintner, and we set up a tasting (he apparently does all kinds of them, even for bachelorette parties etc.) A friend and I decided to truck down to Beverly to check out the goods.Greg walked us through the wares, offering us samplings of varieties  including Blanc de Fleur (a dry mead), "Prairie Passion" (a traditional sweeter mead; this is what I am accustomed to), plus meads flavored with pomegranate (a nice, tart flavor to offset the honey sweeteness), blueberry (a bit too intense to me), mulberry (better balance of berry and honey), hibiscus (I couldn't taste the floral note, but I'd just drunk the blueberry, so this probably needed to be done in a different order is all), chocolate (an unexpected hit with me, and he said it's good warm, which he discovered after leaving a bottle in his car where it heated up!), and "Sweet Desire", which is aged in bourbon casks so it attains a complex, smoky, vanilla-y accord (I LOVED this one). It was too bad that they didn't have the cran-nectar flavor in stock, but we tried a whole raft of others, so it was hard to be disappointed. They can't sell the meads in-store (due to some weird liquor zoning in the area), but a liquor store literally across the street sells the products, and they helpfully have a list of other stores (plus bars and restaurants...including Medieval Times!) in Chicagoland that carry them too. They're also available online through their web site. Prices are not sky-high, as one might expect, since they have a corner on the market; $14-18 was about average at the store across the street we went to (the one higher-priced one was the Sweet Desire, perhaps due to the longer aging? Even that one was still in the range of an affordable wine.)Greg's knowledge of his wares, mead in general, as well as honey and wildflowers is quite extensive; we learned more than we expected to on this visit. I for one do not think about the fact that beehives are on rooftops around the city; many of these bees are patiently gathering local pollen to create local honey for Wild Blossom Meadery's amazing array of products.It was a pretty casual set-up (we were just standing around in the shop's back room), and it wasn't the most relaxing experience (there was a dog barking its head off further in the back, and the phone was ringing a lot), but we did get an informative session and tried something different! My knowledge of mead has definitely been expanded. Greg said they have a mead club (you can get in on short-run meads only offered to those in the club), and they also have mead dinners paired at different local restaurants.Overall, this was quite an unusual way to spend a Monday! I'll lift a glass to Wild Blossom in thanks for their information, service and outstanding products!

7.description: Their Apple Riesling is delicious!They came out to the Beverly Arts Center and did a couple of wine tastings for our young Adult Board. (Thanks again Wild Blossom!)The crowds loved them! Both times they came everyone had fun and the meads were unique and delicious.I just wish they were sold at more stores. I'd buy that Apple Riesling more often!

0.description: Their Blueberry Mead is amazing! Cannot wait to try their Chocolate Honey Buzz & especially their Chicago's Bulls Blood. This winery/meadery is dedicated to using local & sustainable ingredients in their products. I discovered them at the Chicago Green Festival 2011.Check out their cute website for more info (honeybees & wildflowers!) & support local & sustainable businesses like Wild Blossom. Highly recommend!

4.description: I cannot believe this winery does not have an email address on its website. I tried some its mead wines at the Famous wines and beer event at Springfield IL last weekend.  I tried many of their mead wines especially the Prairie Passion and the warm Apple Cinnamon were excellent. Such interesting mead wines that excite your taste buds Chocolate Cherry Buzz and Pirates Blood.  I just wish that had an email associated to their website so people would know where to buy their wine locally.

1.description: I am very pleased with my experience with Dr. Tseng and his staff. My eye exam was thorough and we took our time with some elements -- I never felt rushed or like I was putting him out. As a result, I left with greater understanding about my personal eye health.I was getting a prescription to order glasses online, and Dr. Tseng gently suggested I consider their frames. I wasn't budging, but I didn't feel pressure from him, either. From what I understand, they have a wide array of frames available, so they can certainly meet needs on that end.Without question, I will be back for my regular check-ups. This was the best experience I've had with an optometrist.

2.description: The nicest staff and Optometrist I've ever had the pleasure to encounter. Extremely thorough with my exam, patiently answering all my questions. The office is warm and inviting, their selection of eyeware superb. I honestly cannot say enough kind things about Dr. Tseng, his staff, and the services they provide. I'll be recommending Chicagoland Eye Associates to all my family and friends. Thank you Dr. Tseng!

0.description: My family and I (6 of us altogether) come here for our annual eye exam. We love coming here and they also accept a variety of insurance plans so just call to make sure. Very comprehensive and personable experience, you will love your experience.

This place is ok. I find their nail color selection a little sparse and they're always a bit empty too. However alot of people work there so the wait is usually pretty short. Good prices. And they are great at brow waxing.

As much as Walgreens tries with their fancy new buildings and such, everyone knows Walgreens is an old school drug store. As a kid, I could do all of my Christmas shopping in one shot. Mom's crappy, crayon-colored bath granules in a glass genie lamp was sure to gather dust on top of the toilet for years to come and Dad...poor Dad and that big ole' bottle of Brut. Good times. Yes, I still love Walgreens because if they don't have it, NOBODY does. Can't find it? They'll order it for you. Many of them are 24 hours and no matter where you travel in the U.S., you can be sure there's a Walgreens somewhere around the corner. Their own product line is on par with most major brands and can save you a pretty penny going that route . This parking lot is maddening because it's so busy and so I sometimes walk to this location. Friendly peeps on staff here, "Dove Bars" and every product you could possibly want that's "As Seen On TV"; The cosmetics/hair-goods section at this particular store could use a bit of expanding, but I just picked up a Sponge Bob Chia Pet that I'm rather excited about so five d*mn stars it is!

This nail salon gets 4 stars because of the guy that does my nails! He really takes his time and focuses on what he is doing and he can design his tail off. He's super meticulous, so if you go here, go to the young boy, you won't be sorry. S.N.: I took away 1 star because there is an annoying guy that wanders around in there, but I guess it's because they know him. :-/

28.description: The menu is incredibly diverse and everything we've tried has been a "hit."Seating is quick and comfortable, staff very nice, and the food excellent. The crepes are to die for.  Omlettes don't come w/ a side of grease as they do in many "Greek" restaurants.  Also, in the a.m. you can come in for a quick coffee or carry out. I don't understand why the Original Pancake House down the street is standing room only when this place is just as good.

1.description: HAIRY FOOD and manager very rude and arrogant!!!!I went there with my Mom today and she had a skillet which looked great. I had the eggs and sausage with french toast. Before we could take a bite I noticed that The French toast had 2 strings of hair in it and I showed the server. She got the manager which is also the owner. He was extremely rude and proceeded to try to convince me in an argumentative tone that it wasn't hair. I was totally offended and shocked that someone would go to the extreme to convince a PAYING customer to eat hair. Even if it really wasn't hair the most appropriate thing to do is first be polite and apologize and remake the dish. It's only three pieces of bread which is not costing much of a loss to the restaurant especially if it helps you retain a customer. But he did the opposite by explaining that he was a cook for 30 years and he knows this is the way it always looks. His behavior made us decide to leave without anything. I will never ever ever ever again entertain the thought of eating at this place.

9.description: I have been a fan of this place every since they opened.  It is a great place to go to get fast but fresh food and tasty pancakes to boot.The coffee is great, the staff is great, I mean you are greeted the moment you walk in the door and treated like an old friend even if its your first time there.I was just here a couple of weeks ago and I had the groupon, since it was just me I really didn't need the groupon but it afforded me to get one of there rib eye steaks which was cooked to perfection, the eggs were cooked like I asked the only thing that wasn't so hot but not a deal breaker for me was the hash browns good but not great.I will be back and I tell all my friends if they are going to be in the area this is the place to go!

29.description: Not bad....I was pleasantly surprised by this place!  The menu is crazy!  So many choices.  The restaurant is rather large, clean and very comfortable.  My son and I both had breakfast.  I had apple pancakes, side of bacon and coffee.  All were pretty good.  Prices were reasonable and portions were large.  Service was average.

23.description: I have been a fan of this place every since they opened.  It is a great place to go to get fast but fresh food and tasty pancakes to boot.The coffee is great, the staff is great, I mean you are greeted the moment you walk in the door and treated like an old friend even if its your first time there.I was just here a couple of weeks ago and I had the groupon, since it was just me I really didn't need the groupon but it afforded me to get one of there rib eye steaks which was cooked to perfection, the eggs were cooked like I asked the only thing that wasn't so hot but not a deal breaker for me was the hash browns good but not great.I will be back and I tell all my friends if they are going to be in the area this is the place to go!

5.description: Restaurant nice, food is lousy like the biscuits are bland, eggs are blah, the need a new chef.

25.description: Atmosphere was very pleasant. Had breakfast here and had a great variety in their menu.I had a wonderful waitress named Michelle. She was very nice and gave terrific service!

12.description: Great breakfast food . I've been multiple times and the food is always great . They make the best breakfast skillets . Their chicken and waffles is alright , not great . Food can be over priced at times . They offer a variety of food .

21.description: I had such bad service that I am not sure I could give the food a proper review.  What I do know, I left there feeling like I had just given away $30 for a headache for myself and my mother.

16.description: I really like it. Every time I go here I have a smooth, pleasant experience. I enjoy their panini and sometimes for breakfast I'll have a waffle or french toast. Casual American dining done right.

17.description: Prices are reasonable.  You get a lot of food which is worth the price.  I had a Greek skillet and is was good.  It also came with pancakes and eggs so very filling.  The server was very helpful with suggestions.  I enjoyed my breakfast will visit again.

10.description: Not a bad little spot. Have not had to with very long for tables or food, staff is nice and attentive. They have a nice variety of dishes on the menu, as well as daily specials. Love that it's walking distance from my sister's house.

11.description: Not a bad little spot. Have not had to with very long for tables or food, staff is nice and attentive. They have a nice variety of dishes on the menu, as well as daily specials. Love that it's walking distance from my boyfriend's sister's house.

26.description: I have been to Hearty Cafe' Several times, and it is aleays good! Last visit I had the fresh strawberry crepes' with bananas and a side of bacon. DELICIOUS! I was joined by 4friends that had never been there and they were pleased as well. I've never had to wait for seating and service is excellent.

27.description: Chicago's southwest side has some pretty good breakfast spots, Hearty Cafe Pancake House is not one of them. We did not have to wait long to be seated for breakfast which should be a dead give away for mediocre food. Here is the run down: Coffee great, food presentation two thumbs down, and staff C-. Our waitress must of been new because she wasn't knowledgeable about the menu offerings. I was excited about my Sweet Potato Belgian Waffle which was actually pretty good. The breakfast sandwich we ordered was tasty but sloppy! The rest of my meal and some other dishes we ordered terrible. The turkey sausage was cold, not flavorful, my Feta Cheese omelet looked like it had cottage cheese in it, the hash browns were dry ,and the strawberry crepes were rubbery!Breakfast is my favorite meal of the day so I had to make sure that any other breakfast food lovers know this is not the ideal spot to get a quality meal. The gentlemen whom I  presume was the owner seemed kinda rude.Our food experience overall was mediocre at best and that's being generous.Save your money and go wait in line somewhere else for a good breakfast! Cheers!

0.description: breakfastrules.blogspot.…Well, this was a pretty positive outing for our first time back to breakfast in a while.We found a popular new spot on the City's southwest side that served up some fairly decent dishes out of very all-encompassing menu. Like we mentioned before, the egg dishes were really good. We wonder if Hearty Cafe uses some sort of above-standard eggs. It wouldn't be a surprise. One thing we noticed from this place is that there was a certain quality to the ingredients put in their dishes that we've seen lacking from some nearby establishments. Now, this wasn't a spectacular breakfast--"my omelette tastes like any other omelette," said K.P. Loudmouth--but it certainly was far from a disappointment. And while Dr. Nick gave a his lunch a negative diagnosis, we have to remember that we are here to rate breakfasts. So based on the food, service, wait time and quick turnaround on a Sunday morning, the Organization That Eats & Then Rates Breakfasts gives Hearty Cafe a commendable 4 out of 5 Brent Clown Faces.

20.description: Lately, I've been on the hunt for some tasty country fried steak here. I finally found it here. It's excellent with a gravy that's got great flavor. Plus, there are very large portions here as well, I like the hash browns too. My daughters don't like the pancakes as much as Original House, but I don't know why since those pancakes aren't very good to me. I knew I shouldn't have written this before breakfast. I'm heading there now!

19.description: The food is good, the price is fair, and theportions are more than generous. My wifeand I have being going here since they opened, and have never been disappointed. The staff makes you feel at home.

2.description: I really love the fresh coffee this morning that make my day good by!

18.description: Their chocolate pancakes r pretty good. The Bacon is AWESOME!!!!!¡¡¡¡ Try their fruit punch..... It's ...... Different

13.description: ehhhhh....mom always said to say something nice.  I am trying..... wait I am thinking....hold on a minute....ok got it...it is close to work.  other than that, I got nothing.  don't waste your time.

4.description: It was my first time coming here and overall I had a good experience. Service was very good, the wait for two wasn't long and the food was fine. It's not a fancy breakfast spot, but everything I had was good and when I didn't like my turkey bacon the waitress immediately offered to replace it with whatever I would like. There are a ton of menu options-- something for everyone. I would go back there again on a day that I'm not interested in cooking.

24.description: Good eats, friendly wait staff, healthy options, little touches like flavored creamers and a good bottomless cup of joe.  Rib-sticking pancakes, waffles and omelettes. Their behemoth baked apple pancake could feed a small village and is nearly identical to my own: You have no idea how it kills me to say that. To me, that's their standout dish. Basic Greek diner menu, but I appreciate that the food, atmosphere, and service are comfortable and consistent. Most of the time, I get egg whites with fresh spinach and fruit.  The staff here is incredibly kind. 3 star fare, but the servers bump this up to 4. (1 Star is JUST for the ladies here!!) I recommend you ask to sit in Darlene's section. In winter, I swing by to sit a spell and bask in the steam of their spectacular soup. Their creamy potato is carbalicious, culinary perfection.  When I'm laid up with the flu, a take-home pint of their chicken noodle does the trick. I stick to the basics and it's all good. Dig their liver and onions and BLT club with fries. Sadly, no cakes or pie; Oh, why....

6.description: Good eats, friendly wait staff, healthy options, little touches like flavored creamers and a good bottomless cup of joe.  Rib-sticking pancakes, waffles and omelettes. Their behemoth baked apple pancake could feed a small village and is nearly identical to my own: You have no idea how it kills me to say that. To me, that's their standout dish. Basic Greek diner menu, but I appreciate that the food, atmosphere, and service are comfortable and consistent. Most of the time, I get egg whites with fresh spinach and fruit.  The staff here is incredibly kind. 3 star fare, but the servers bump this up to 4. (1 Star is JUST for the ladies here!!) I recommend you ask to sit in Darlene's section. In winter, I swing by to sit a spell and bask in the steam of their spectacular soup. Their creamy potato is carbalicious, culinary perfection.  When I'm laid up with the flu, a take-home pint of their chicken noodle does the trick. I stick to the basics and it's all good. Dig their liver and onions and BLT club with fries. Sadly, no cakes or pie; Oh, why....

22.description: More than expected. Great food, hearty as advertised and very friendly servers. Great place to take friends & family or have a small meeting. My only complaint is they close early.

15.description: My server was awesome. Friendly, complementary, informative, and helpful.My food was disappointing. Cold turkey sausage, flavorless eggs, and flavorless grits. However, the Belgian waffle was pretty good.I will not return but I'd love to see that server relocate to the Original Pancake House so that I can enjoy my service and my meal!

7.description: The service is good but the food is not!   I wish I could give them a HALF star for the FOOD....I've lived in the area 30+ years and never tried this place until today.... I now know why I have been passing this place up and I don't hear people talking about them..... It was all bad once we started looking at the menu...it never takes me long to decide on a meal but  when I couldn't make I decision I knew this breakfast spot was not a good choice... the taffy apple pancakes should've been called apple pie pancakes and the hash browns in my skillet looked like soft rice.. I hate when my pancakes taste like other foods that are cooked on the grill... The pancakes just were not good and fluffy like pancakes should taste...My water and coffee were delicious though!

8.description: My mom and I came here for a Sunday brunch and I had the nastiest biscuits for my biscuits and gravy. they tasted old, freezer burnt, not pillowy soft like I like. But that gravy, was to DIE for. I wanted to pick the plate up and lick all the gravy off the plate. I even asked the waitress to bring me a side of gravy to go. That awesome, wonderful gravy was amazing. I also had the Canadian bacon, very delish and my mom's pecan waffles were pillowy, the way my biscuits should have been. Get those biscuits together Hearty Cafe Pancake House.

3.description: Feces, excrement, bodily waste, waste matter, ordure, dung, manure, excreta, stools, droppings, dirt, filth, muck, mess, a deuce, night soil, poop, pooh, doo-doo, turds, poo, caca, dookie, boo boo, sh**, number 2.Now you may think, that by starting my yelp review with synonyms for feces, that I'd be using it to the describe either, the decor, management, food, location, or service of this establishment. Well you're wrong. When I went here there was literal HUMAN feces, excrement, bodily waste, waste matter, ordure, dung, manure, excreta, stools, droppings; dirt, filth, muck, mess, a deuce, night soil, poop pooh, doo-doo, turds, poo, caca, dookie, boo boo, sh** ,  number 2 on the floor. "Please explain the Yelper I know as Dennis B.", you might say. "Well I'll be more than happy to", I reply.In order for restaurants to make as much money as possible, they'll squeeze as many tables that'll possibly fit into their dining area. At this restaurant the mens and womens bathroom are literally right off of the dining area. These geniuses decided to place a table directly in front of the bathroom entryways. So not only do you get that beautiful bathroom atmosphere, but you get to watch who goes into the bathroom,  and then look them in the eye when they exit, as well as smell what they did every time the doors open and close.So me and my wife got the privilege of sitting at this table placed directly in front of the bathroom. While I was at the table lollygagging  in daydream land, my wife tells me to help this elderly gentleman who can barely walk, with opening the door to the bathroom. But by the time I leave daydream land he's already thru the door. But then I start to smell something. I look down on the floor and their's a fresh, moist, brown with a hint of green, perfectly cylindrical human turd on the floor.I had to stop 2 waitresses, who didn't see it and later walked off in disgust, from walking in it. After about 5 minutes of that beautiful turd smell permeating the smell of my meal, the manager has a dishwasher come out from the back to clean it up. Because of that they lose a star on my yelp review. The manager should of cleaned it up himself, out of embarrasment to his customers. And I use to be a dishwasher, so out of respect for my fellow dishwasher brethren they lose another yelp review star.After all this, here comes the elderly gentleman out of the bathroom. Of course, I looked him in the eye and smelled what he did in there as I did with all the other bathroom patrons, because I didnt want anyone to fill left out and I believe in equal treatment regardless of race, sex, religion, age, creed, nationality, or beliefs. From the bottom of his shoe to the top of his socks was the skid marks from the turd. So obviously he had no drawers on and that turd slid all the way down his pants leg. Someone should of been with him due to his mobility issues and he should of been wearing adult diapers. Because I had to look him in the eye upon his exiting the bathroom, and not only smell, but SEE what he did in there due to the proximity of my table to the bathroom, they lose another star.Now you'd think my meal would've been comped. IT WASNT. All I got was an apology from the manager. I still had to pay for my food even though I couldnt finish it for obvious reasons. Thats another star they lose.The food here is nothing special. They'd lose a star for that to but Almighty yelp doesnt allow that or half stars for some unexplicable, the yelp CEO must be a huge idiot, reason.I wont be going back.

14.description: This is your typical pancake house, although I would not recommend ordering anything too fancy. I like getting skillets with a side of pancakes. Perfect on a Sunday morning!

3.description: Good little potbelly's location close to work and always accomodating to my bestie's very specific orders on salads. Their wreck flatbread sandwhich with a Nantucket orange mango juice is very good and their peanut butter jelly sandwhich with a banana chocolate shake is a great combo to try. Their soups and chili are also a good option when things get repetitive.

1.description: Oh. My. Goodness.... Can I say poor customer service? There was a computer error, which caused a 20 minute delay in my delivery order. I was never notified, I called when it was 5 minutes late, and wasn't told anything. Then, my 2 salads came without dressing. I called again to complain. I said that 'Potbelly's screwed up' to my coworkers... Which she found offensive... So she came up here to reprimand me, and said she wanted to call my boss.

2.description: I am incredibly disappointed with my service today.  I always try to be a pleasant customer.  I smile as I place my order.  While my servers weren't exactly rude not a single one returned my smile which was confusing.  I could sense frustration from the two customers ahead of me waiting on order corrections.  Then the register went down.  Only the manager had the foresight to explain what was happening and apologized to me.  The cashier however looked at me as though it was my fault and also refused to return my smile when I said I understood.  It was a very unpleasant experience but then when I sat down to eat I realized they had given me the wrong sandwich.  Clearly none of these workers cared a thing for me as a customer or the two previous customers who also had problems.  Awful experience.

5.description: I love the shakes here and the customer service is always excellent. Perfect environment after a stressful day.

6.description: Nice little sandwich shop in the heart of Beverly Hills. Originally, I had planned to eat in Evergreen Plaza Shopping Mall, which is right across the street; however, the mall has closed down, and many new businesses have sprouted up in the past decade. I had been planning to visit this shop for years and was glad to finally go inside. They serve many different sandwiches, soups and salads. I wanted a salad and finally decided on the Uptown salad, which was made of lettuce, apple slices, grapes, dried cranberries walnuts, grilled chicken, and crumbly bleu cheese. The salad was delicious with a fat-free vinagrette dressing. Ranch dressing was an alternative. The interior of the restaurant is also nice, with wooden tables and chairs in the center of the room and wooden booths at the windows. I enjoyed my dining experience here. Next time I'll try soup or a sandwich.

7.description: Skinny Turkey is delish...and only 300 calories.   The Southwestern veggie soup is great too. You can't lose here.

0.description: Always great service and the store manager is very friendly! The food is always made in a timely manner!

4.description: The shakes and sandwiches are pretty darn good, and it is the cleanest eatery in Beverly, or the entire South Side, for that matter. I wish more people would eat in.

3.description: As a frequent thrift shopper, I have to say Root Consignment is an absolute favorite. The fact that they're local and have high-end style in their store from furniture to shoes to jewelry and more, it's such a great find! The staff is friendly and every time I walk in there are newer great finds! Beverly hasn't had many thrift stores in the area so this one better be here to stay! :)

1.description: If Yelp puts this store is in the thrift store category, then its the classiest thrift store I have ever stepped foot in. They have gently used high quality items. Root is constantly getting new items, it is never stale. They carry vintage furniture pieces and other eclectic decorative items. We bought a very nice dresser here last summer and a cute little desk in the fall. I am still kicking myself for not buying the comfiest little baker love seat they had. Also, I have consigned a few items here myself. They always reasonably price everything and are realistic about what will sell and what won't. I  believe if things do not sell after a certain amount of time they will donate it.Can't forget to give a shout-out to the super friendly and helpful staff!

2.description: This place is worth checking out. The interior was chic and the selection was good. They had a lot of vintage furniture in great condition - wooden desks, sitting chairs, mirrors, etc. Prices were reasonable. Stop by on your way home from the train, just to take a look. They have a lot of neat stuff!

5.description: Great new addition to Beverly...even more specifically, it's a great addition to 103rd street!!  Beautifully done both inside and out.  Prices are good and owners are friendly and helpful.  Man...woman...young...old....impossible to go in and not find something cool.

0.description: Amazing finds! So thrilled its in the hood.

4.description: Love Root.You can always find something in here-lots of great lamps. Larger pieces of furniture depend weekly-sometimes there are lots and sometimes not but what is there is fabulous so when you see something you like jump on it and they will hold it for you and also check back often. Usually very good quality sofas and armchairs. Also they stock gorgeous soy candles that are $25 but burn forever and fill your house with fragrance. If you live in the area Root is the place to pop to if you have people coming over and u want to run in quick and grab one or two reasonably priced things that are unique pieces that will transform a room. Prices drop as time goes on but there are also sales frequently so watch their FB site-I only wish they would post their latest stuff on FB more often so us local Root enthusiasts could be the first to get in there and grab it!!

3.description: I waited 10 minutes for a chicken sandwich. My QP was not warm and the bun was stale. Cashier seemed nice enough, but it was so annoying to wait in the drive thru lane while everyone behind me had to drive around me to get to the exit lane. No apologies for the long wait from the person who brought the bag to my car. Saw a couple workers in their uniforms outside chatting. One plus was a couple ketchup packets in my fries that I didn't ask for and they did give me plenty of napkins.

1.description: Easily, this is the worst experience I've had with a fast food place. Ever. Not only did it take half an hour for a very simplistic order, the food was made poorly. The fries didn't have any salt on them. Also, the wait to order in the drive-thru itself look about fifteen minutes. After ordering, getting the food itself took an unbelievable amount of time. The employees were completely lacking. McDonald's is usually substantial, and the worst you can expect is a mistake with the order, but this is beyond that. Who forgets to salt the fries? It's what gives the fries flavor. This service is absolutely unacceptable. Something needs to be done.

2.description: I rarely eat McDonalds, however today a friend requested to go so I agreed.  I ordered 3 medium fries,  a mcchicken, a double cheese burger, a m&m mcflurry,  and an oreos mcflurry w/ extra oreos.  (Medium fry and oreo mcflurry which I purchased for myself). The fries were fresh which was certainly a plus,  however the boxes were scarcely filled, like literally each box may have had 12-15 fries in it (a medium fry), I paid extra to have extra oreos however was very dissatisfied with that fact that I felt as though I was eating plain  vanilla ice cream with a sprinkle of oreos on top... (did I mention I paid extra ).

5.description: Went inside to use the bathroom. Most. Disgusting. Bathroom. Ever. Homeless people and drug addicts taking showers. Period blood all over. Unbelievable!

6.description: They gave me burnt fries(mixed in with some un fried ones), and two hamburgers that you could tell were thrown together. The meat was literally halfway hanging out the bun, and the wrapper was ripped.  I understand they get busy, and only make minimum wage but have some pride in the work you do. Don't  serve someone something you wouldn't eat  yourself. It's that simple. Food went straight in the trash. Mad because I don't normally eat Mc Donalds and now I remember why. Could have taken that $5 and put it toward some Starbucks, at least I know it would have been hot & fresh. Sigh.

7.description: bty, they will quickly subsitute an item for something else without informing you. i.e will subitute a round egg in a saugage mcmuffin for a square egg. This place is a real joke.

8.description: Went here tons. The service is super fast and they make the best premium Chicken Sandwiches...yummy

0.description: In all my years of eating at McDonald's, this is by far one of the best ones I have used. I use this location several times a week for breakfast and maybe once a week for lunch. The staff is always polite and helpful. My food is always hot, fresh, and exactly the way I ordered it. And whether there is one person or car in from of me or 10, the lines move very quickly.

4.description: It's was the worst McDonalds u can go to. I went there today and I ordered a egg mcmuffin and it took 20-25 mins to get it and when I did get it the sandwich was cold cashier girl has an aweful attitude, they didn't greet me when I wanted 2 order... It was a very bad experience

1.description: This is a real shoe store - not a Payless.  These are actual shoe salespeople who know what's available and how to properly fit you.  I have narrow feet, do a lot of dance, and have two kids in dance.  We always find what we need here, the salespeople are helpful, and they always steer us in the right direction.  They also put taps on shoes for you across the street while you wait.  Pretty cool.

2.description: I'm a traditionalist . .. and a machocist.  Returned to this store to buy sandals for my grandchild.  Waited for an hour to be helped by the single salesperson, only to find that  there was only one sandal available in my child's size -- the same style I purchased last year.  Poor service and selection; unmerited high prices..

0.description: Wonderful place!  They take the time to measure your child and try on multiple shoes for the perfect fit.  They have a nice selection of shoes and a good rewards program.  We don't go anyplace else!

3.description: Went here for the first time this weekend. I've been to a vast majority of the bars on Western more than a handful of times. I expected Sean's to be a little nicer on the inside, based on the exterior. Typical neighborhood Pub, long bar on one side with a number of older big screen TVs, a bunch of tables on the other side, etc. The kitchen smelled good, I did not partake, and seemed to be open late. The night I went seemed to be a St Rita's reunion, everyone had on some form of SR attire. I'd go back.

1.description: My favorite place. It's great for any sports games and it always filled with great people

2.description: Rhino just remodeled their bar top with wood from the bowling lanes at Bleekers. Really nice. Plus new bar stools and a new tap system with craft beer. Real nice place to hang out and watch sports.

5.description: I wish I could give this place ZERO stars. I would never go back to this place. The bartenders give horrible service! It took most people 30-45 mins just to get a drink--Ridiculous! They just completely ignored people and kept serving only certain people. Apparently they only like to serve their "friends"...mainly underage kids. It gets crowded and when the night is over they yell in your face to "GET OUT!" Never been to a place that was more rude to the customers. At this rate, I would be surprised if that bar does not go out of business.

6.description: This is the place where all the lads and lasses from Beverly can get their drink on.  It kinda feels like a dive bar and a wal-mart kissed- a little cheap and plasticky and also slightly dingy but not at all dirty.  No complaints, no powerful compliments- this rhino bar does what bars do.

7.description: For a Beverly bar, this place ain't bad.I mean, slanty tables, broken stools and a smoke filled place...so why the four stars?Well for starters, people will leave you alone if you want to be left alone. Find a table in the back and get a mule to bring you your drinks and you're set up solid. If you wanna hook up and dig the BevLadies that can drink you under the table, cuss like a sailor, and smoke like a chimney, this may be your joint.During the summer, every Tuesday night had a jam band performing that reminded some of the Dead with a Skynard twist. It really didn't do it for me, but people dug, and I can see why (come on, there was a guy playing spoons on his chest!). Though I hate smokey bars that charged 3 bucks for a Miller Lite, this place is pretty solid as long as you do your laundry the night that your wallet got lighter.

8.description: Brutal.  A loud college bar in Beverly.  Don't bother.

0.description: Rhino is such a fun place to go to! There are huge TV's for all sports games and deals like no other! The staff is always friendly and nice! I can't wait to go back soon!

4.description: I have no idea how this bar came to be called as it is, but I'd wager that the owner needed to do something with his huge bas-relief of a rhinoceros drinking a beer.  Mrs. Sean probably was having no part of that staying in the house, so Sean needed to open a bar just to have a home for it.  There's nothing exceptional about Sean's, unless of course you consider the Internet jukebox holding court in the center of the joint.  I can't figure out why every bar in the world hasn't latched onto this concept yet.  A jukebox that can play virtually any song ever written?  Hell yes.  Even if you're at the point of the evening where you couldn't even name more than 5-10 songs period, it's nice to know that you have thousands upon thousands at your disposal.  The next great jukebox innovation: throw in 5 bucks and cancel someone else's upcoming song.  Friends don't let friends play Bon Jovi.

12.description: Jerk is ok. I visited for the 1st time on a slow weekday to order the two piece chicken special that was advertised outside. The woman behind the counter told me nothing came with the chicken and was not courteous at all. The chicken skin was completely blackened. The sauce improved the taste. No bread slice given with the meat. Won't be back. Mostly because their customer service was nonexistent.

7.description: Can almost feel the Caribbean breeze as I savor all the deliciousness. The late is a little long but the food is worth it.

3.description: First and foremost. There food is excellent. Their food is superb. Good night it was so good!! However. They only had jerk chicken. Nothing else. Customer service? Not sure they heard of it. But let me say. The food was very good. Very good. Rice was excellent. Service was not.

1.description: Went there last night 8-27-15. No Red SnapperNo Jerk Tacos, No dark meat ( Chicken)No greens, No bread with the orders  ( EVER) & diffinitly no good customer service. That same lady is so unpolite to all customers. It seems like she hates her job and does not want to work there, well why are you there taking orders and making ugly faces? Geezzzz Now that Kingston Jerk is closed on 95th in Beverly I have no choice but to go here, but never again, I'm sure they will be closing soon with the way they operate....

2.description: Ridiculous!  After 20 min, I will never return here.I walked out with NO FOOD because of these reasons:1. Yelp community patrons advised me to order 45 minutes +\~ for an order, yet there is no menu on yelp, no official website, nor a personal email of the the menu when asked. We're new "potential" customers so how else should we place a pick-up order?2. Why is there only one worker in the whole restaurant at lunch. She is the cashier, cook, and, server. Cool, but no one else is here and it's busy.3. It's 11:45am on a Thursday and no more Catfish?  Really???? 4.  Okay, "May I have a beef patty ($2.00)?" The response is "$2.50."  After IL tax, it is not that amount. I contested and was told, "this is how we sell it." That's illegal. I can do math!5.  After the horrible customer service, I took my $ and went to a nearby Uncle Joe on Vincennes and got a bomb arse jerk catfish lunch.I will try again, but "no" on that customer service and price adjustment.

9.description: This was my 1st visit and the food was amazing. I  got the Jerk Tilapia it was seasoned just right along with the cabbage and yams....delicious...the only thing that I would change is that I called the order in and was told that it would be done in 30 minutes. My order was not even written up until I got there, what was the purpose of me calling. I had to wait an additional 40 minutes, not cool

10.description: We have been eating here since they first opened. The food is outstanding. And if you have to wait for your order it's because the food is just that fresh.

13.description: This place is great.  The food was DELICIOUS!!!! I was skeptical trying a new place, but I was pleasantly surprised!  I will definitely be returning!!!

16.description: My husband and I are new to the area and were told that the Jerk here was really good so we went to see for ourselves and I must say that not only were we impressed but this is the best jerk we've eaten by far. #1 for the Robinsons!!!

17.description: To whom it my concern irie island does not intend to dis please any of its customers. Our customer service goal is first class or #1 to all customer, race, gender, cultures or national origin. we apologize to any dissatisfied customers. And if necessary we will give any disgruntled customer their food twice with evidence & truth to make them happy. Once again we stand behind our product and we intend to keep serving and pleasing our customers thank you!

15.description: If you love delicious Jamaican food and quality customer service, then Irie Island is definitely an establishment you want to visit.  This is NOT a "fast food joint"... if you are a bit pressed for time, call ahead and place your order. Either way, the food will prove to be worth the wait. As soon as you walk in the door, the aroma of the food assures you that this location offers an island dining experience right here in Chicago.  The jerk chicken is DEFINITELY authentic and the dinner portions are generous. When I order the jerk chicken dinner, I typically have enough for dinner and lunch the next day. The chicken is grilled to perfection (not dried out like some of the other establishments I've tried) and the jerk seasoning is comparable to what I experienced while dining in the islands... not just 'hot seasonings'; the flavor profile is flavorful, spicy, and aromatic. The cabbage is very well seasoned and pairs well with the red beans and rice or the mac and cheese.   My son (a mac & cheese connoisseur) LOVES their mac & cheese because it is creamy & savory.  Also, if you like plantains, you will appreciate the fact that they don't over cook the plantains.  They offer a variety of jerk seafood, too. Thus far, I've tried the red snapper and it was quite satisfying. I look forward to trying the jerk shrimp & jerk catfish on a return visit. The ambiance is inviting... (considering the frigid weather, you can't help but think about retreating to a tropical island once you step into this place.) The establishment is clean and contemporary. The food is fresh and the flavors are distinctive in a way that has converted me into a repeat customer. Thus far, I can attest to the consistency in the quality of the food and the service.

0.description: @jesus B u re just a bitter person ,have saw all ur review about other people's business.i don't think u have a job bcos if u do u'll not been write shit about other people's business!!!!!change ur name to devil Bam a good customer of irie island and they are good to  my family and friends so who are u!!!!

5.description: I went there and I've been there several times for the stew oxtail dinner. First off let me say when I called in the lady was extremely rude and unprofessional and rush me off the phone second of they were really skimpy with the oxtails I think I had four or five and they were small I ate a that night and got really sick, stomach start hurting and hour later had to keep running to the bathroom would not be returning

11.description: I've been here twice and both times they were out of what I wanted. The first time they were out of the jerk chicken salads, they had no greens, no yams and no jerk shrimp. The second time I went they were out of the greens, the jerk shrimp and jerk sauce. How can a jerk chicken restaurant run out of jerk sauce? The food I did get was good, however I will not be returning to this establishment.

8.description: Stopped in one morning when they opened after visiting the nearby cleaners and being drawn into this restaurant by the aroma of Caribbean spices. The restaurant was very clean and the ambience was one of the best for Caribbean restaurants in Chicago area. We actually opted to dine in due to the comfort level and cleanliness. The food arrived piping hot. We ordered the jerk chicken wing lunch special. The wings were on the small side but the flavor was undeniably authentic and delicious. On my next visit I will order the jerk chicken and not the wings. The cabbage was so good I wanted to ask for the recipe. The owner was very personable and admitted when he first opened his cook didn't represent him will but his new cook does him good. Agreed. Will definitely return. Praying for consistency as this was my first visit.

4.description: The oxtail plate with sides of cabbage and red beans and rice = 5stsrs!Jerk chicken plate with sides of cabbage and plantain = 2.75.  But I really like their way of cooking here, so 4/5stars.

14.description: This all occurred at about 815pm...Walked in...looked clean and the food area was darker than the rest of the place...hmmmm...I waited my turn in line and said "hello how are you" to the cashier and she just stared at me...ok...can I have a forth jerk lunch with with more cabbage than rice and peas...didn't wait to long...got home and opened my container to a sad sad forth dark lunch with more peas and rice and more skin than chicken (ok my fault for not checking before I left...but hummm I've never checked my order before leaving a jerk chicken establishment!)  Not returning!!

6.description: If God made jerk it would taste like this!! :) Best jerk spot in Beverly hands down!!

12.description: This is a taco stand and they do tacos very well. Try the al pastor tacos. Excellent.

3.description: Okay food but causes very bad diara

1.description: My thoughts:-Convenient. A small Mexican restaurant with a parking lot to park 8 or so cars with a drive thru as well. -Was greeted by the lady. No smile or nothing but I don't care. -I ordered 3 steak tacos and a horchata. Total was just under 9 dollars. -Food came out in less than 5 minutes (I hate when restaurants do that, I lose trust in my food, but let's see..) -Look down at my plate. In my head, "That's it? That's all I get?'-Well at least it tastes good and food didn't feel undercooked. My final thoughts: While the food tasted good and my food was prepared quickly, I left the restaurant with the same feeling I walked in with, hungry. #Shame

2.description: The staff is unenthusiastic about being there, but the tacos are pretty damn good. Decent quality on all of the chicken, pastor, and steak tacos. I was impressed that the large rice was basically a bucket. I hate when places skimp on rice, it is so cheap! If this place was open late they would be a goldmine, especially with the convenient drive-thru.

9.description: Very yummy food ! The guacamole is delicious .  Prices are alright drinks are a little much . Good and quick place to grab lunch to go!

10.description: Can't beat the authentic Mexican food for the price. No ambience inside, nothing special about the service - but for a quick counter lunch or takeout, it hits the spot. Tacos are ultra-flavorful - not too greasy and plenty of options (chile relleno tacos, lengua, etc in addition to the more typical chicken, barbacoa, al pastor).  Love that they offer housemade horchata.  Delicious guacamole & salsa (just wish they offered a slightly hotter version).  I have family in the neighborhood and go here every time I visit.

13.description: I have been here both on Parade Day and also a couple times on the weekends. Let's just say there's nothing like drinking that makes you crave yummy beef tacos. The tacos were very good and packed with taco goodness. What I like is the fact that their tacos are not completely overflowing and messy where then it looks like you were having an orgy of taco ingredients on your shirt. I would say, they are probably the best in the area. The tacos always do their job by settling those post pub time hunger pains. FYI: Bring cash, no credit cards allowed.

16.description: Came here for a snack during the South Side Irish Parade...chicken tacos were delicious! Perfect amount of filling and not greasy at all. Everyone went crazy for the fresh guacamole, too - the base was very creamy but you still got a few chunks of avocado with every scoop. Too bad I don't live nearby...this place is great!

6.description: The food here is made right in front of you, which I like. I love there Chicharron Tacos. Its one of the few mexican restaurants I go to where you can get them. I just wish their tacos came with cheese and wasn't extra.You have to spend a minimum of $5 to use a credit card when most places are $10.The only reason I'm giving them 3 stars is because I don't understand how the bilingual cashier, who I think was new, confused the word Chicharrón (chee-cha-ROAN) with chicken (chi-ken). I only go hear when I have a taste for chicharrón tacos and I hate chicken tacos. Yet when I got home thats what I had, chicken tacos. Pronounced (Chi-ken) Two syllables not three, nor is there a rolling of the tongue to pronounce the double R's in Chicharrón. Next time I'm going to say pork skin.

15.description: My pops took me here on my last birthday. He had a fairly involved conversation with the manager working the register as the cooks put together our enchiladas and tacos. I'm sure they get a lot of their business from boozehounds on Irish death marches down Western, but it's cool that they get to know neighborhood regulars.The food was delish, pretty much as good as you can expect to get without going to Pilsen or Blue Island. The guac tasted fresh even late on Wednesday night.I've seen a few restaurants fold at this location over the years. I think it's great that something finally worked, and Beverly finally got a respectable Mexican take-out joint. They've got some more exotic ingredients like tongue, plus tilapia tacos with those purple pickled onions, just like XOCO. Unfortunately they've had to take some of the deeper cuts such as pozole off the menu, but they're still making a solid effort to go beyond the perennial favorites.

0.description: Went again and much better and now they take credit cards. I ordered steak taco dinner. Will come again.  Not many Mexican spots in the area so I am glad for the improvements.

5.description: My favorite taco joint!!!! This place has fantastic guac, terrific turkey tacos and delicious chicken and tilapia tacos with a special sauce! I come here at least twice a month and they are always friendly and fast!!! #highlyfavored

11.description: F this place......seriously.   I'm allergic to flour.  Which takes out most canned beans which contain it.  I specifically asked the clerk is the beans were canned or not.  She lied and said they were made there.  Complete BS, they gave me an allergic reaction.  The cashier lady can suck a fart out of my butt.  Screw her.  She lied to protect some "taco stand rep" on having homemade beans or something?? Wth is that?  It cost me lady, muchos gracias.  Avoid this place......even with their decent tacos.  There's better tacos close by, their bigger too for better value.  And at least they told me the beans were canned.  Freaking lady......eat me!

8.description: Had lunch here for the first time. Wasn't bad they had good food and wait time wasn't long.

4.description: If you want good quality, traditional Mexican fast food in Beverly, this is the place. No frills, exactly what you'd expect and want for Mexican take-out. Thank goodness they are there and seem to always be open so I can get my steak taco fix!

14.description: Hole in the wall place for sure, but I love the chicken quesadillas. Can't really speak for a lot of the other dishes, but at least they marinate the chicken, so I'm sure the tacos are good too.

7.description: Insanely good tacos!  We love grabbing a few steak or chicken tacos.  They're done to perfection very simply with onions and cilantro.  They're salsa is delicious and the fajitas are quite good, as well.  This is also the ONLY healthy restaurant I have found with a drive through.  So great when you're out running around and want to hit a drive through and eat actual food. I think they have seating and possible indoor seating but I've only ever used the drive through.  Love this place!!!

3.description: I was not impressed with this place at all. It has one of those towny-bar feels, kinds dark and creepy. The bar tender was very nice and the drinks were cheap, but those were the only good things. There was a guy there that I'm pretty sure had been drinking since 2PM...they probably should have stopped serving him. I don't think I would go back here.

1.description: The most racist bar I have ever been to. Was told by a customer to "get out because you are black." Told staff and nothing was done about it. NEVER go there. Was also told by a customer , "this is for honkies only." The customers stared like they never saw two black women before. Disgusting and offensive so called business.

2.description: This is not the same bar from "The Accused" but it is close. I spent a Sunday evening drinking at my favorite Western Avenue bar (Cork and Kerry) when I decided to venture down the street for one last drink. I walked into Dinger's and encountered the Sausage Fest of all Sausage Fests. Seriously, the only woman in the place was the bartender. If I were a woman I would have walked out immediately. Anyway, a guy who was identified as the owner seemed to be heavily intoxicated. There was also some loud drunken fire lieutenant who kept spontaneously yelling at a friend (at least I presume they were friends). It was creepy. Anyway, not to be intimidated, I ordered a drink. I then ordered another. I really didn't have any problems. Nobody started a fight. Dinger's is actually huge. There are a lot of tables and the flat screen behind the bar must be 96 inches big. Will I be back? Probably not. There are nicer places on Western to go. I think "Bar Rescue" should be called. This place can be saved.

5.description: Clean, sterile, inoffensive.  Words that are acceptable when describing a public restroom, but not a bar.*Dinger's has been one of the stops on several of the recent Young Irish Fellowship South Side Pub Crawls.  It's probably okay if you're looking for a quick one (which is basically what it's been for us on recent crawls), but I couldn't see myself spending an afternoon here.  It has the look and feel of a strip mall bar, the kind of place you'd pop into while your wife gets her nails done next door and your kids hit the arcade.  They really could use a revolving door (or some separate entryway) for the colder months.  The entire bar gets a chill whenever someone walks in or out.*It's worth noting that the restrooms here are actually quite clean, sterile, and and inoffensive.

6.description: Neighborhood bar owned by guys from the neighborhood

7.description: The bartender was so slow and rude. he paid more attention to the TV screen than his beer guggling clients. This is an average bar on the South Side of Chicago where there are many better bars arund to walk to. None of them are that impressive, but the service at this place makes this place perhaps the worse.

8.description: I got a kick out of some of the other reviews on here... I really like this place.  It's one of the best places to watch a sports game in the area.

0.description: I'm really surprised at some of the reviews here because I had a great time. First of all, the prices are incredible. We ordered two craft drinks (Three Floyds Pride & Joy and Sam Adams Winter, I believe) and it was $6. TOTAL! Anywhere else, a craft beer will run you that amount for just one. That's an immediate win for me. Anytime you can get craft beer that cheap, it's like you've hit a home run.So this is very much a sports bar. Sports stuff everywhere, TVs showing some basketball games, and a dart board and one of those golf arcade games. My friends and I played some darts for a while and it was a lot of fun. There's a back room where it looked like some people were having a party. Overall, I think it's a good atmosphere. There was a mix of regulars and some younger folk bar hopping (like us). They also have a silly cigarrette machine by the dart board that looks like it's from the 90s. Does anyone still use those? Regardless, I loved this bar and I'll definitely be back.

4.description: Im being very generous with 2 stars.  I know it;s the southside and I know it's Beverly.  The only reason theyre getting the extra star is because they know better than to f*ck people the way that Cork & Kerry does with prices.  Very cheap to drink here, you can come with $30 and leave a drunk mess, which is great.However, anyone that runs a successful bar needs to realize that their staff has to be on point.  Ive been here a few times and theres either two girls behind the bar or a guy.  The guy is awesome.  He's fast, attentive, and will often refill you without even asking.  The women on the other hand are absolutely brain dead.  How can you have a bar with almost all tables taken, and half the bar stools filled, and go out to smoke while leaving the bar unattended with people waiting to place drink orders?

1.description: Gia does a awesome job!! I had a facial, massage and steam. I left feeling like a new person. She makes you feel comfortable and she is great at her craft... She also has great deals on yelp...I just scheduled my next massage appointment, If your looking for a great massage she is the person to go to, I had a swedish the first time, this time I'm checking out the deep tissue.

0.description: Great place with free parking behind the building.  Jackie is a great massage therapist. She gave a good deep tissue massage and used heating pads strategically placed throughout the massage. It was a great free addition. Everybody I ran into was very friendly. I'll definitely be back.

3.description: Don't come here expecting someone to hug you, that's for sure.  Because, when it comes down to it, you are literally paying five dollars to sign your own police and/or death warrant.Once you enter those famed doors, all bets are off.  It's like international waters.  You'll most likely be immediately greeted with the sights and sounds of girls violently sobbing and/or openly vomiting on the floor, as well as some sort of physical altercation that leads to at least one person bleeding.  Like it is martial law.  Plus, as previously stated by other reviewers, they charge you for water.  For water.  So there is little to no safe haven to rescue you from a violent descent into a blacked out abyss. Getting punched repeatedly in the face. Getting pregnant. Getting taken away in an ambulance.  I feel these are the three most common things that occur after a night at The Bake.  But alas, when you find yourself on Western blacked out after bar close, you owe it to yourself to go.  Because it's just so Southside.  Like street fights.  And Irish last names.

1.description: Don't do it, you'll regret it.Bound to get into a fight with either an underage kid or a bouncer! Either or, I'm sure you'll end up arrested! Only cash too! What day and age is this?!

2.description: Not a good place and won't be going back. After paying a $5 cover for a dead bar I tried to get a drink and it took forever to be served. The bartenders were rude and after I paid I never got my change. Even after I reminded the bartender they never gave it to me. She threatened to kick me out so instead of arguing I left. I do not recommend this bar at all.

9.description: Any bar that makes a list to keep out trouble makers is good in my eyes. I went on a slow night and it is nice to have such a big bar to yourself or group of people. The pool table was so far away from the main bar and drunks that it made playing the game in a bar comforting. The staff was friendly and the place huge. maybe on th weekends when the brat packs come out this place is much more unpleasent, but I will never know. I am way too old to even attempt to see what it is like on the weekends after the other bars close. Brewbakers is what it is ..a bar in a irish area of a large city.

10.description: Patrick is right on the mark. We went here once several years ago on "assignment" as "Mystery Shoppers." I was the hardest $50 we ever earned. Aside from the fact that it's like 65 miles away, we had to sit at the bar, observe everything, look like "normal" customers and linger for FOUR HOURS starting at 10pm. It was the longest and worst fours hours we have ever spent. Nursing  drinks, trying to act like we belonged, Observing a bunch of idiot losers. and then driving all the way home and writing a report about suspicious behaviors like employee theft, serving minors,  free pours etc. We felt like very conspicuous aliens the whole time and I'm sure I was the only one there drinking wine spritzers (to stay sober) and one Irish Coffee (to stay awake...)It was like, WHO CARES!

4.description: This F*****G place gets negative stars. This place is not any sort of  "Southside" Security acts like tough guys and in reality couldn't fight their way outta a wet paper bag. Cash bar with one ATM. Joking right. $5 to walk through the door. Earth Wind and Fire pumping through the "Dj's" speakers. and a ton of  barely of age if not underage kids not knowing where they are at. Oh and a line to get in.....WTF! finish the night at a friends apt. seriously dont waste your time. Place should be closed down and burned to the ground! What a S**t show of a business. The only reason I might go back is to ask them to put me on the blacklist so If i ever am to drunk to realize I've stumbled in that crack shack they won't let me make the mistake!

6.description: Brewbakers is one of the scariest places I've ever been to. Since it doesn't open til 4, there is no reason you should be here, especially since you have to pay cover, and who would ever pay cover on Western? There are security guards, this is also a joke, although I guess useful at times. They charge you for water, I'm sorry what? Many people hope to be black listed from this place just so they never have to face it again. If you are looking for something late night on Western you should be at Mr. Sub.

12.description: Ended up here on the day of the St. Patty's south side parade as it was the first bar we came upon when getting to the parade via the 103 bus.  We had a good time despite the incredibly slow service and millions of highschool/college kids drunkenly swarming the area.  Probably would have made it down to Cork & Kerry if it wasn't so cold out.  We were able to get a hot dog (real irish) and more beer at a sidestand pretty easily.  Not a bad deal at $15 for a "pail" of bud light (about 5 beers).  However, for the ridiculously long time it took us to get here from our homes in river north and the gold coast, we'll never be coming back to the south side irish parade.  We'll stick to being north side snobs, thank you.

5.description: Brewbakers is like meeting a somewhat attractive guy at the bar and then taking him home only to discover he's wearing BVDs. Then you spend the rest of the night crying in the bathroom. Okay, it's not like that at all because Brewbakers could never be considered "attractive," it's more like the drunken bum passed out in the alley on Western. This place probably centers somewhere around the 5th level of Hell. The idea of paying $5 for this type of experience just floors me. I'm an experienced drinker and been to plenty of dive bars. But those places have atmosphere and character. Here, the only atmosphere is the drunken alpha males grunting, huffing and clamouring to get your attention. Please boys, the dried vomit on your shirt is not sweetening the deal. The music is awful, the clientele is Neanderthal and the staff is rude. In my 26 years of life, I don't think I can say I've been to any place that was worse than this.

11.description: Hard not to agree with what has already been said: this place is terrible. I know, I know, what to do when all the other bars close?! Think you might snag a lady if you just stay out a little longer?  My advice--try a cold shower, as it will be immensely more pleasurable than a night at "the 'bake".Though as a result of my one visit, I was drunkenly interviewed at 5am for the evening news as an eyewitness to a police cruiser that ran into a building and caused an explosion.  Yeah, i didn't see anything.  See, I generally don't lie, but one night at this place and I'm f'in Pinocchio.

8.description: I struggle to give this place 2 stars. First of all the only reason why I do give it 2 stars is because the drinks on off nights are more than reasonable. Other than that, if i could give a half a star for the fact that they remain open, I would. So on that note let me give you some insight into a night leading up to brewbakers. Drinking at one of the many well established pubs along western avenue so much that you don't realize that you will be encountering such shenanigans. And the only reason why you are going to Brewbakers is because all of the other bars close at 2am. Before you know it, you're stopped at the door in order to give five dollars (weekend) to the doorman. Which pains me. Then you are asked to produce ID so that they can look at the extensive blacklist they have. Now that should be the first warning sign that you may not know what you are getting yourself into. When the blacklist name list has more names than mccarthy did, there may be a problem. So after your cleared to show that you don't have a tendancy to get into a fight, you walk through the second door to get your hand stamped. And once you get past the stamper, it's a lead zeppelin from there. It's very loud, very hot, very smelly, and the music doesn't help. The guys in there all feel as though they have something to prove, which they don't. If I wanted to talk shit, or shit get talked to me I would wear a Cubs jersey to "the cell". The girls over there are in their own little world. And that has a double meaning. A majority of them are the size of a world. I know that the burrito station is right down the street, but that doesn't mean it's part of a nutritious breakfast, lunch, and dinner. The dj can't really be considered a "dj" per say. You hear a lot of repeats and songs that just utterly suck. When you just click songs off a laptop, I can't consider you a dj. I can only hear that shitty grease song one time in a night before I wanna rip someone's head off. But I digress. Go there if you only have a couple bucks in your pocket, on a weekday. Other than that your on your own. But weekdays can be sketchy too. One day I went out afterhours because I didn't get out of work till late, so I just wanted a couple of beers. Low and behold I was there for only an hour and a half, and what do I get. I walk out to go to my car and drop my buddy off, and in the middle of the street is my sideview mirror. Now come on. Who does that? My mirrors are supposed to sway as well. So that just means someone purposely ripped off my mirror and threw it in the middle of the street. If you're angry, fight a person not a car. I think this person was pissed off because the only chance of getting laid from that bar was by some chick that looked like a shaved buffalo. So save your time and effort, go somewhere else before you rest on this decision. It may cost you more than you know.

0.description: This ain't no "Beverly" Hills... Welcome to the Souffside!!Good Lord where do you even start with "The Bake"? Star wise I couldn't even give it 1, but the entertainment factor is pretty freakin high!!! My drink wasn't bad either, and to be honest I was drunk enough not to even remember how much it cost?!? I can say I have now been to The Bake. Wham bam no thank you ever again man!! Here is what I witnessed... 1. There are people standing in line and actually pay to get in this hell hole! Whatever it was $5 bucks...2. They flash your ID up on a screen to see if your even allowed in this joint. That alone should be a clear sign screaming at you to RUN!! 3. There is a DJ who plays shit ass music! Even if you tip him to play what you want?? Hey dumb ass... I mean DJ... look at your clientele and take the requests and make some $$$ when you can. It cannot be that often!4. The stage... OMG... It's in the corner, raised, and honestly why do people want to be that crowded?? There is plenty of room to shake it in front of the stage. Hey ladies, if your trying to get noticed nobody can see you up there. However, it might be the only chance they would ever get to dance on stage. Honestly, it looked like some drunk ass would fall off it.5. Fighting... Kids sheesh! The bouncers are waiting to kick your ass and throw you out. Then black list you. Hmmmmm? Maybe that's not a bad idea? All I can say is if you feel the need to go once... OK.... but I would never step foot in that dump again... Not even to LMAO!You have been warned! However, read some of the other reviews here.... HILARIOUS!!

7.description: Don't go.  Trust me: don't go.  They call it "The Mistake" for a reason.  I've known people to try to get thrown out of this place and put on their permanent "do-not-allow-in" list, just in case they're too drunk to remember what a mistake it would be to come back.    Take my sage advice: if a buddy is clamoring for a trip to "The Bake" after the other Beverly bars are closed (even if that buddy is me), cut your losses.  If he refuses to go home, prevail upon him to instead go across the street to Dunkin' Donuts for a tasty bacon, egg, 'n' cheese croissant prepared by the indefatigable Danny.   It's the better decision.  P.S. My advice is functionally equivalent if the suggested late-night destination is an establishment of ill repute known as BG Fellows.  Don't be cougar-prey; be the predator, and hunt yourself a late-night snack at Mr. Sub to reward yourself for your good judgment.

1.description: My husband and I are Oak Parkers but found ourselves here one night after star gazing along Beverly Shores. And what a great find! It felt like a bustling neighborhood supper club out of another era. Sinatra was the sound track of choice all evening. A big, raucous group came in to celebrate Mardi Gras so it wasn't quiet, but it was definitely friendly. The servers managed to keep up with them and still pay attention to us. I ordered a simple chicken vesuvio. While it took a while to show up to the table, it seems they were taking time to perfect it. I didn't expect much but it was fantastic - lemony, rich and smooth. We will be back for more!

9.description: Go in a couple times a month, knowing they are a bit more slow paced. Today we went in sat down the lady took our drink order right away but then took 10 mins to give them to us the bartender noticed we were neglected n after about 7 mins came n gave is menus. After our drinks came she walked away and continued to ignore us for another 10 mins when she came back my mom said we were ready to order n she fired back with attitude like we inconvenienced her... Wow so unnecessary we were just hungry and ready to order we proceeded to leave hungry if you didn't want to serve us why are you open ... Bridge burned won't be going back the server would be upset she has to work.

23.description: This is a curious little joint around the corner from me.  It looked like it was usually crowded and had an interesting look about it...like it had some local personality.  Well, if this is the local 'personality', I'm dismayed to be a local.We took a couple friends there...big mistake.  The service was, simply put, rude and dismissive.  The server spent most of her time on the bar side, which appeared to be full of regulars, and made no efforts to hide her annoyance when we had the nerve to ask for her attention.  At one time, when we had been trying to track her down (mind you, this place is very small) for about 10 minutes, we asked another staff person for a piece of bread...or something simple like that.  Then our server swooped in...seeming super-offended that we went 'over her head' or made her look bad...or something.  What we received then was a piece of really stinky Wonder bread.  I kid you not.  Wonder bread.  The busser, bless his 12 year old heart, couldn't even refill our water once...so I sat empty the majority of the meal.  And trying to get our check?  Forget it.Anyway...the food was mediocre, at best...but the suckiness of the service is what really stands out.  Just don't go.

12.description: I've had dinner at least 4 or 5 times at Ken's.  Food is excellent!  Last time, I had braised oxtails, and they sublime.  Service has always been good.  If you want trendy and a server who sits at the table with you, go somewhere else.  If you want wonderful food and service which is just fine. try Ken's.  I love this place.

21.description: Ken's just serves consistently good meals, no frills, no gimmicks.  It kind of reminds me of old steak joints that you would find in small towns in the south.

16.description: Dont waste your time. We went on a Thursday evening around 4pm. We stood at the door for a good  10 mintues before anyone would acknowlege our presence (place was not crowded). At first I thought it was a race issue (we are black). Everyone at the bar turned around to stare at us as we stood feeling awkward. Finally the waitress seated us. We sat and we sat (there was one table of four people there), finally she came over, and asked what we were having. I asked for the oxtail dinner, she abrutly told me I couldn't have it because of the groupon coupon and it was considered a special. I informed her that according her to the menu, it was considered a special for either Tuesday or Wednesday (can't ememeber exact date it was listed as a special) None the less I asked for the Liver and onions. The decor has not been updated since the 70's. This place is definitly for their special crowd, which by the way were older white people. Whenever they camed in, they were seated promply and they were very  attentive to them.I guess some things never change, there will always be a Good Old Boys Club. It would save others if they just post on the door "Don't bother" . Food was not worh the humilation and degradation.

17.description: Overpriced. Mediocre food. Decor unimpressive. I live within blocks of this place. I hadn't been there before. I won't return. Service was pretty slow. The place was packed, so they'll do fine, but it's certainly not my kind of place.

10.description: Ken's is the best kept secret on the south side. Their recipes are consistently good with special shout outs to the prime rib, breaded shrimp and amazing pork chops! The relish tray and other accompaniments served before dinner are delicious: sweet pickled peppers, tangy cole slaw and savory pizza bread, to name a few. Cocktails are reasonably priced and always ice cold. Many desserts made from scratch (like the tiramisu) and are enough for two to share!

5.description: Awesome place on the South-side of Chicago (Beverly area) . My brother and sister in law took us here for Mother's Day, ALL I can say. is I WANT TO GO BACK. The atmosphere very lay back.
