11.description: Happy for the reminder to see Ken's on YELP.  I haven't been here in a while but I don't get out much.  I have only had excellent food and service here.  The relish tray is a great throwback and the cheese bread is so good.  I have had the butt steak several times and it was excellent. I also remember the complete chicken dinner on Sunday. So much food and tasted so home cooked.   I will make a point to go back there soon.  I love this lifetime neighborhood establishment.

22.description: I love how a previous reviewer gives this place a single star because of service. Really? Your going to tell thousands of people not to go because you had one bad experience? If life worked like that, none of us guys would have had sex beyond our first time! Our women simply would have given up. I went there for the first time last Friday. The place was very busy with an older crowd but we were seated promptly. The server was just fine, food was old fashioned but good, and bill came out to be quite cheap. There's a reason this place has been around forever.

0.description: Love this place . Great old school Chicago resteraurant . The food is great . People in the area sometimes forget about this place. Give it a shot. Well worth it.

20.description: Drove by this place like a million times but never stopped in.  Glad we did last night.  This place has an old school feel to it. They even have a cash register behind the bar from the 20's or something that still works.  Our waitress was very busy but was still very attentive to us.  Ken's starts out your meal with bread and a relish tray- nice touch.  I had one of the specials of the night :pork cutlets with portabella mushrooms.  It was great.  My wife enjoyed her chicken parm.  We will be back

19.description: I love how a previous reviewer gives this place a single star because of service. Really? Your going to tell thousands of people not to go because you had one bad experience? If life worked like that, none of us guys would have had sex beyond our first time! Our women simply would have given up. I went there for the first time last Friday. The place was very busy with an older crowd but we were seated promptly. The server was just fine, food was old fashioned but good, and bill came out to be quite cheap. There's a reason this place has been around forever.

2.description: I've been going to Ken's with my dad since I was a kid but admittedly haven't gone in about 5 years. Boy am I glad that I did!We used to go for lunch as my dad was always a bit on the frugal side. Same delicious food, even better price. Tonight we stopped in...First we were given coleslaw (that was some of the best I've ever had), a relish tray, and perfectly cooked pizza bread (all complimentary). The chicken noodle soup was fantastic! For the main course I had a spicy penne with a light cream sauce and chicken. I was nervous because it's summer, but the sauce was very light (not thick) and the flavor was perfect. You'd have to like spicy food for this dish but it's soooo good. The portions are HUGE so you'll have lunch for tomorrow. My dad got the perch dinner with a double baked potato. It deceivingly looks like a small portion, but he could barely eat it. Tender, buttered and lightly breaded to perfection. It was perfect. Plus we had SO much food even before it arrived. The service from the server, busser and even maybe an owner were super attentive and so kind...always making sure we were taken care of. For those saying it has too much of a 70s vibe, I disagree... It's not. You can opt for the cool 60s lounge-y vibe with intimate wrap around booths in the bar, or you can go to the left for a more finer dining old school Italian feel. Sure it's nothing ultra hip, but more importantly it's consistent and delicious. Keep up the good work!

18.description: Hi again! I went back during a week day for lunch! My waitress was very attentive. I was the only patron in the restaurant section although a few carry-outs came in for pick-up. That's it, that's all!

13.description: this is one of the best places in the neighborhood.....From the relish trays with the awesome pizza bread to all of their entrees.BTW - disregard Diane V. review - she is clearly wrong and what people that go to dinner at 4pm?  I didnt even know they opened that early

4.description: They give you a ton of homestyle food for a great price! My favorites are the fried zucchini app, London Broil, New York Strip, and variety of pastas. The lasagna has a LOT of ground beef so if you're not a huge meat lover, I'd recommend one of the other pasta dishes. The fish is always a sure thing as well!

6.description: Had an amazing dinner at Ken's. Great service from our waitress and the most amazing attention from our busboy Declan, (that young man is going places!). We enjoyed the strip steak and shrimp de Jong the real mashed potato's were delish as well as the minestrone and clam chowder soup. Love, love the relish tray starter! What a great way to start a meal with free appetizers placed right in front of you as soon as you sit with hot pizza bread, French bread and an assortment of salads. Kens is a wonderful local iconic restaurant. Under new ownership related to the past owners they are making great changes and updates to everything slowly but surely. Gets better and better every time we return! Keep it up!

15.description: I have been passing by this place for years.  Well I finally stopped and sure glad I did.  The place is very small and very old, which is exactly what I thought it would be.  I was by myself so I got a seat at the bar.  Not a very large bar but it was very well stocked.  I ordered a drink and started looking at the menu.  The others at the bar were very friendly and we talked a lot.   About an hour went by and I finally placed my order (I was talking to much so my fault for the delay).  Ordered the Sunday turkey special.  WOW was it good.  Found out later that they sell out of the special every Sunday and I know why.  It was a perfect amount of each item.  Almost like I was at home eating with family.  That is what I like about this place they treat you like family.  Everyone in the restaurant seemed to be enjoying themselves.  I will most definitely be back soon.

7.description: Solid family, neighborhood restaurant.  I haven't been here in years, but not much has changed.  Generous relish tray with homemade pizza bread to start.  London broil was perfectly cooked.  Most importantly, super friendly servers.   Our 17 month old daughter was with us and our server brought over a cup of water, with a lid and a straw, for her the moment she brought our waters.  Very nice folks.

8.description: Had dinner at Kens after our sons confirmation and it was excellent.  The relish tray and pizza bread was a great start because we were starving and it came right away.  The London broil was melt in my mouth perfect and the shrimp was the best I've tasted in years.  I had all intentions of having dessert but we were way too full.  Our service was great and the atmosphere was super nice.  The manager was super friendly, asked if everything was tasting good.  Bartender was really cute and she knows how to make a killer French martini.  We will definitely be back.  Oh, by the way, My husband said his filet mignon was excellent and he doesn't use that word to describe food very often.  Worth every penny! A hidden gem in little ole Beverly!

3.description: Hands down my favorite meal out on the south side, and there is no substitute. There is a reason is been there 50 years. I recommend the fried catfish.

14.description: Went back 3 weeks later, just as good, fun, sat at bar. Will continue to go when I'm in  town staying south.

3.description: I will not go back. The owner was dismissive and dishonest. Ms. Veola lost her customer service when she did not want to honor my 100.00 gift card. She turned me away at least two times. When she realized it was indeed her error she never apologized. So I used the gift card but I will never go there again. Aside from this the place had ants. Betty-O's in Hyde Park is much much better.

1.description: I receieved my very first massage here, it was giving by the owners daughter. Who was very nice and welcoming, I didnt know that it was her daughter until i went to pay for my massage and the owner came out to speak with her and she greated me and asked what I did for a living and was all around really nice. She even offered me a job if I wanted to change from a d.a to a massage therapist since I expressed I had always thought about pursing that. I havent been back only because I have bad time management but I will return simply because of the customer service. The only thing it was really cool in there, considering I was receieving a full body massage I thoyght it wld be warmer but they addressed it and brought me an extra space heater.

2.description: I've had wonderful massages at Veola's plus great facials. I didn't experience any negatives and will return regularly.

0.description: After the last incident, I got a call about 3 weeks ago from the owner and she insisted that I come in for a facial that she would personally administer herself. Reluctantly, I threw on some clothes and made the trek from my place to the spa. She greeted me warmly and told me that we'd have a discussion about what had taken place the last time I tried to book an appointment. This visit was on a Tuesday, which apparently is Veola's day off; she'd made a special trip just to do my facial.I must say that she knows what she's doing; I was glowing when I left there and I was sent home with a bag of goodies specifically chosen to maintain that glow.Will I go back? Sure, but only if the owner is there.

4.description: For all of the ingrown hair, zit faced men out encroach on the women's territory. I have been a customer at Veola's Day Spa since the day it opened.  Veola is one of sweetest people that you would ever want to meet.  Her caring nature transmit through her hands.  She is the ultimate professional when it comes to skin care.  I had black heads, white heads and scattered facial hair. Men deserve to treat ourselves every now and then.  I don't get off too much with manicures so this is my treat.  Deep cleansing of my skin, exfoliation and hydration.  The unsolicited compliments satisfies me.

1.description: No star...this is been such a horrible experience!! I have never had to wait over a month for a pair of glasses. They have sent me for a loop for over a month and can't even offer any thing for my inconvenience. This is utterly ridiculous and will not be coming here in the near future. Not to mention I had to use my insurance and still come out of pocket over $200. Never again will they get me.

2.description: I have been going to For Eyes since they were a single location on the North Side.  Their Beverly location is stocked w/contemporary frames at good prices, particularly when you catch them on sale. Unlike the local optomistrist, you get your glasses within a few days instead of weeks. Plus, the staff is very accommodating.

0.description: This is a rewrite of my previous review, I think I was a little harsh. After speaking with the customer service dept. and store manager Nichole she was very pleasant to deal with and we got everything taken care. Very Happy with outcome!!!!!!!

3.description: I loved this shop. Tina and her sister Grace were so flexible with my schedule! They were sweet, professional and fast. My twists are hot! And they have rear parking

1.description: I'm definitely going to be getting my hair braided here more often.....they're prices are reasonable, very clean environment, professional, friendly and proficient....my box braids came out to be beautiful...I recommend this place wholeheartedly

2.description: Warning! Do not come to this shop. Process is too long and my head is a complete mess !

5.description: Wonderful sew in done by Clarke himself he is very skilled

0.description: Clean, personable and my hair WAS NOT braided super tight which is my preference (thank God!) . Clean and friendly atmosphere. I will be back.

4.description: I called to make an appointment to get Havana Twist. Since It's hard to find someone who actually does Havana twist I called first to see if they could do them and how much they would cost. I was told that they did do Havana twist and the price would range from $100. so I made an appointment. When I got there I showed them a picture and said this is how I want my hair. They appeared to not even be aware of what Havana twist looked like and proceeded to do Senegalese twist, on  top of that because I requested they be larger, I ended up paying $150 more than expected and Week 4 has rolled around and I have lost a large amount of braids as well as my hair being pulled in the front from the tightness. I will not be returning ..

12.description: Great little shop in Beverly.  I went in last weekend and the place was packed, so I'd recommend an appointment on the weekends and during prom & wedding season.  These ladies know how to fit ya and they aren't shy about moving the flesh around to show you how to work it.  Definitely for the D-cup ladies, though; Sally Ann's doesn't have much selection for us B-C cup gals.  Even the smaller bras are mini-versions of serious support garments.  This ain't no Victoria's Secret.

7.description: My grandmother in-law has been going here for years.  I went here over 5 years ago to get some garments for my wedding.  I am going today, to get a corset for my birthday outfit.    I need to go to this place a lot more often!

3.description: Being a busty gal, I decided to get a corset for my wedding.  The woman who greeted me was extremely friendly, and was an expert.  She took one measurement, and brought me back a corset that fit perfectly.  Bra shopping has never been so easy and affordable!  Even if you live on the north side like I do, it's completely worth the trip.  You will pay twice as much downtown!

1.description: I have been coming to this place for many years. This is the place for your under garments for all occasions.I like the fact that the ladies take the time out to size you up and make sure that you are getting the best quality.I have tons of lingerie from then and the hosiery is very nice. It's very easy to drive right by this place. But if you see Mr.  Submarine it's in the same area.  Parking is nuts. So be patient you may have to park and walk.

2.description: Friendly, helpful, personalized service and great selection of bras for the well-endowed. Shopping here for years and would never go anywhere else to get fitted even though I don't live in the city anymore. Products last and are well worth the price.

9.description: Not for the true corset wearer. Smallest size was 32, costume construction, no corsets actually displayed. Worst of all, no interest in becoming a true quality corset shop.

10.description: Unbelievable. What a difference a bra can make. These ladies will fit it to ya too. Hope you're not shy!!

13.description: Large Busted Ladies - THIS IS THE PLACE!  The shop is not chi-chi like some more expensive shops but the service more than makes up for it.My visit was spur of the moment and the two sales ladies were busy.  They greeted me several times and put me in a fitting room within 15 minutes.  I believe you can make an appointment.The sales lady measured me and we chatted about what I wanted.  She brought several styles and sizes and showed me how to properly fit into the bras.  The selection in my size was limited but I was thrilled with the choices.  They were pretty and there were even a few colors to choose from.  Prices ranged from $40 to $48 - a far cry from the not-as-nice-at-twice-the-price I encountered at Intimacy (see my review).I filled out a customer information card and was impressed when three months later I received a phone call telling me that they had one of the bras I liked in another color.  I had them hold it on a credit card and found two more when I arrived to pick it up.  I was even willing to spend $32 on matching panties.The sales ladies at Sally Ann are everything you could ask for in this setting.  I'm sure many large busted women experience the same stress I do when shopping for bras.  I will not shop any place else for bras from now on.

16.description: I got so many compliments when I had this great foundation on it was like magic.  Talke about curves.............

17.description: Excellent Service!  Fair prices!  What more can I say?  Ladies, don't waste your time on Michigan Avenue.  On a Saturday morning, it is about a 15 minute ride from the Loop.  I highly recommend it.

15.description: this place is like heaven for busty women... i had to stop in there and pick out what was described to me as a corset for my wedding dress, but turned out to be a strapless bra that comes down to your waist -- like a half corset, and bottoms -- like a girdle.  omg.  i can wear it all the time!!  itty bitty lil waist i have!!!   the owner, who i assume is sally - maybe not, but lets go with it - is SOOO great.  she measured me in TWO spots and had me fitted perfectly into the strapless, regular bras, and the girdle.  these bras are the best bras i have ever owned and am so sad that i hadn't discovered sally anns long ago.  a must do at least once to have an undergarment fit to your body just perfectly!

0.description: I have been shoppig here since I was in high school and looking for a strapless bra for prom. years later even though i have lost weight and buy bras at a regular department store Sally Ann is still my go to store. She measures you everytime you go and the bras are great. If you want the perfect look go here for a great fitting.

5.description: I am not a busty person in any way, however, I bought some control panties many years ago and they are still as good as new.  Ladies are wonderful and we are so lucky to have them in our neighborhood.  Quality was outstanding and I hope it is still the same.  My future daughter-in-law can only shop here and does not know what she would do without them.  Keep up the good work ladies and again we are so lucky to have your shop in our neighborhood.  Please don't ever leave.  In fact i have added some pounds and should go back there very soon.

11.description: This place is so amazing that I finally signed up on Yelp just to write about it.  My wedding is coming up in a little more than a month and I got hit with a wedding dress crisis.  I cannot find a bra that will fit my large chest/tiny frame and stay properly out of sight under my dress.  I got to the point that I thought I would have to just order a dress online and cross my fingers that it got here in time and hope that it looked halfway decent.  But then my bff and I found Sally Ann Corset Salon.  Those ladies were so sweet and helpful and educational!  Stephanie especially was a huge sweetheart and got me everything I needed in less than an hour.   I had brought my dress to make sure we could find something that worked and they all came in to see me in it and made me feel infinitely better.  AND it is so reasonably priced!  I got a bustier, matching undies, lace top nylons, a wedding emergency kit, and an everyday bra for barely more than I would have to spend on 1 bra from an online store or a place like Intimacy.  Even with the drive from Ukie Village to Beverly, this will definitely be my go to bra store from now on.

8.description: Stopped in to find a corset for my wedding day. Was quickly shown to a fitting room, measured, and given a few options to try on. I found the perfect undergarment for my wedding day in under 30 minutes and at a totally reasonable price. Very friendly and helpful ladies working here, would definitely recommend!

4.description: I always feel comfortable and confident that Sally Ann Corset will have the right size for me. Big bust and all!

14.description: This is indeed the place for overly endowed.  I went there for some undergarments for my wedding day to keep everything in place.  There are a couple of older Jewish ladies running the place and there is no judgment when they are measuring and pouring you into different things.  By the end you may feel like you are in a scuba suit, but your dress will show no lines and everything will stay in place!

6.description: I love this store. Its a very tiny store but for the most part very good (: very helpful. I did have one lady that told me i was a 4x when the other lady knew i wasnt !! Im a 2x i was kind of insulted. However they are reasonbly priced and the lady that did help me was very sweet. I will for sure be coming back.

12.description: Vu and Mimi, the owners, are the BEST. The others that work there, not so much.  it's best to try and get them on slow days such as Tuesday and Wednesday . They're neat, clean, and very professional. They also build report with frequent customers which I really love.  One of the best and largest polish selections I've seen,  good polish brands like OPI, Essie, China Glaze. And all products are available for retail also. Great pedicure chairs. I would suggest getting here at the open of the shop during the week if you can. Otherwise they're always crowded, which a sign of good work in my opinion.

7.description: OK, I use yelp A LOT and although I'm an avid user I have never reviewed a business before. It's only right for this to be my first one.  I am 100% satisfied with this place for a couple reasons: 1) The level of skill and care that goes into making sure your nails are nothing short of on point 2) The level of professionalism and kindness. I don't care how good you are at what you do in ANY business, customer service is still what will make you stand out from the rest. I followed this place a long time on IG before trying them out and I'm so happy I did. Vu is simply the best. I've seen the work of some of the others and they are good as well, but, he specifically did mine and I've been hooked ever since. I have gone to him twice so far and have been completely satisfied both times. He forever has a loyal new client. Go check out GBN nails you won't be disappointed!!

19.description: I love the owner Vu, he really does my nails the way I like. His work is comparable to any nail salon downtown. I have recommended him to many of my friends. He is in high demand, so I usually go on his slow days on Tuesdays and Wednesdays.

1.description: Seriously, you don't like black people or black money? Wow   I thought money was currency and it didn't have a color only the paper but I'm  guessing your stupid ass  don't know  any better!  I'll make sure none of my friends come to such a racist establishment ! you like white money?  that's a joke

2.description: There is nothing special about this shop.  They do the same nails as everyone else.  The wait is 4 hours or more, even on weekdays, mostly due to them only having a couple people doing nails.  There is nothing o.k. about waiting for hours for nails!  Yes, the people were nice, but, again, there is nothing special about this place, and nothing about their work thats worth waiting for.  Find a shop that respects your time by having enough good people to serve you.  What other ethnic group would sit for hours, week after week, for acrylic nails?  They would not get away with this with a different clientele because they would stop coming!

9.description: I've been going to GBN since December, & I am sold. My nails ALWAYS look great, my pedicure water is always the perfect temperature & their paint jobs have been consistently neat. I am officially a regular. I would give 5 stars if they expanded (to cut wait time). That's my ONLY gripe. :)

6.description: Sooo I have had issues in the past with this shop both good and bad but today took the cake. Mind you I have definitely put up with nasty attitude of the brother of MiMi and personal opinions from MiMi's dear Hubby about Blacks in a Korean establishments. Water under the bridge though right???  As I try to come get my nails done, I ask if there's a wait. I'm told "why so you can write a bad review??" Me: what review? Him: "on Yelp." Me: isn't that what Yelp is for? To discuss your experience in an establishment? If I gave a bad review lets turn it around!  Him: "that was bogus and if you can say that about us maybe you shouldn't get your nails done here" Me: So A) I can't be honest about my experience and B) I can't get my nails done??? Him: *snidely* No! Me: *Drops sign in pen and walks out* Ha! How dare you??? I have been here Atleast twice since my horror experience that caused me to write a bad Yelp over 4 months ago and nothing was ever said and furthermore this ain't Korea bitch! I can say what the F*CK I want based on my experience!!!!! I will never set foot in this shop again! Quite frankly I never really felt welcome Minus MiMi, Hanna and 2 others. Wow! I'm so blown! Clearly, He has me mistaken for someone who cares

18.description: I love getting my nails done and when I was going out on in Beverly after work one night, I asked my coworker who lived in the area where to go to get a quick mani.  She recommended GBN right away... I believed her... oops!The salon itself was dirty.  The floor had to be clean and there were two workers not doing anything.  One was talking (very loudly) on speaker phone so the whole salon heard his conversation.  Another was watching a movie on his computer.  Why couldn't they clean the place?The women who did my nails was very nice but the manicure itself was crap.  After filing my nails, they still felt rough and unshaped.  She used cuticle oil instead of lotion to massage my hands and fingers but did use enough so the massage was uncomfortable.  The paint job also looks like it did it myself.  I will give this salon 1 star just for cheap prices... Mon-Wed you can get a pedi for $17.  But I don't think I could force myself to go back.

10.description: GBN Nails is the best nail salon that I have ever been to. Vu and his crew always give the best quality service from nails to eyebrows. They have an array of services for every customer. The time spent there is worth every second and I'm proud to be consistent customer. So happy my bestie told me about this place and showed me the light!!!

13.description: I love GBN. I been with mini since 79th. Mimi and Vu aim to please and every tech is capable. Great service. Fun people. Early arrival is highly suggested but great work takes time.

16.description: I am here every two weeks like clock work I love Vu and Mimi they do incredible work on my nails! I drive all the way from Lake Shore to get my nails done by them. Its a bit pricy but you pay for quality!

17.description: I go to this salon every 2 wks the salon has history in the Beverly area...I followed the nail tech that use to work for Tip Top Nail Shop over in east Chicago and I'm proud to say this shop is very relaxing from all the commotion from the previous shop....They have renovated the Salon so it is more up to date than before from the previous review...Ive tried allot of salons high end or cheap but the way they do nails to me is something special usually my nails break or polish chips when i go to other shop but GBN has never done my nails wrong lol my nails seemed strong enough to grow out naturally faster....I recommend this shop to anyone that wants ur nails done the way u want them done....Although sometimes the techs can be loud with their conversations.....

15.description: This shop is amazing, I was recommended by a good friend to go here and I've been very pleased. I love the exotic designs they do and how they stay on top of the popular trends. 5 stars/2 thumbs up!

0.description: I searched for a nail salon (I'm very picky) for a very long time before I found GBN ..I LOVE this place !!! Everyone's super nice and patient(specially when I don't know what color I want) !!!! They always take their time & make sure I'm satisfied !  Thanks Vu.

5.description: They don't EVER schedule appts!! The excuse was people stopped coming in. Oh well. That's ridiculous! What business operates like that? There are some of us who have lives & don't want to wait 3 hrs in a dirty, loud ratchet nail salon. What the hell? You can't get satisfied & repeat customers that way. If it doesn't bother you, maybe your standards need to be raised. Also, I watched the lady double & triple dip the stick into the wax when she was doing eyebrows, which is a health code violation. She wasn't disinfecting her tools between people either. They can keep it! On to the next.

11.description: I was recommended by one of my co workers to go to GBN. Her nails were always on point! And she always has designs I've never seen! So I had to try them! So I went for my birthday. The owner VU did my nails. He took his time and did an awesome job. While talking to him he let me know that they're crowded most of the time because they pride themselves on QUALITY work and that he prefers a customer comes back for the quality and not how many people they can get in and out. I appreciated this detail. The owner Mimi is the truth! I BARELY have eyebrows and took her time arched and filled them in! I must say it makes me look like a whole new woman? Now, I ONLY go to this nail shop. EVERYONE does a good job there!

8.description: Love love love my nails. The owner and Ryan were so nice. Ryan took his time and made sure my nails were polished and designed to perfection. So happy I tried them out. I'm positive I will be back.

3.description: I went in today to have a eyebrow tint. The place was crowded standing room only. I put my name on the list due to them not taking appointments. I ask the young lady that would provide my services if it was ok for me to go grab a bit to eat she said yes "I won't be ready for you for another 2 to 3 hours." Upon me returning after one hour I found my name taken off the list not because she was ready to serve me, but because when she decided to call out names on list (doing a head count) I wasn't there. REALLY!!! I was told I needed to put my name back on the list with wait time being 3hours. I explained to her that she told me it was ok to leave, she said "I know but clients say that all the time so you need to sign-in again." WOW poor customer service.... I will never patronize them

14.description: this a truely honest review! i only go here to get my eyebrow done including a tint with mimi she does a great job but the wait is terrible!i literally just left there, its 1:20pm. i tried to get there when they open which is 10:30am and got there at 11:00. so yes i was sitting for 2 hours just to get eyebrows done and was never services....so frustrating...to top it off this is the 3rd time this has happen... i always wait for atleast 2 hours. great work just to long of a wait just for eyebrows

4.description: When I tell you this is THEE BEST salon I've ever been to,  THEE BEST. I've been a client of Vu's for over 10 years now,  I moved to Virginia and can't find quality and service like they provide here. Every time I go to GBN I feel beautiful and well taken care of.  MiMi does the best eyebrows and lashes I've ever seen. Everytime I come in town I have to get pampered by the best.  VERY well mannered, easy to talk to and they put pride in their work.  I must address a post I saw while reading these reviews,  racist - NOT AT ALL most of the clients they serve are African American, and they return religiously; rude- ARE YOU KIDDING ME some of the nicest people I've met in my life; slow- not one bit was there at 4:45 Ish was gone before 5:30 ; busy- why wouldn't they be EVERYONE LOVES THEIR WORK. If they are busy they are definitely worth the wait, and or the return later. I tell EVERYONE  about this place because that's how great they make me feel.  What salon do you know that everyone in there does a great job at what they do?  This is the only one,  TRUST ME.  When you go tell them Aris sent you,  you won't regret it.

29.description: I think I found my new favorite deep dish. I have wanted to try this place for well over a year now. How is it that I live 4 miles from here and it took me that long!? It's a small place. I would say they have about 15 tables and a small (beautiful) patio in the back. They do take reservations. We didn't need them on a Sunday evening. I'm not sure what weekends look like though. We started with the chicken wings and mozzarella sticks. Not mind blowing but solid. The wings had a nice kick to them. The pizza takes a good 45 minutes. You can really taste the freshness. My usual favorite is Lou's and this pizza won hands down. We ordered sausage and garlic. This is the way to go if you're a garlic lover. I could taste it in every bite. The sauce had a nice sweetness to it (which I like) and the crust was phenomenal. We had a party of 4 and everyone raved about this being the best pizza they have had in a long time. They are BYOB (no alcohol sold here) so come prepared. This is the only thing keeping it from 5 stars. I love BYOB. I was just shocked at all the rules here. I'm used to the restaurant keeping my beer chilled for me. They can't do that here. Most people bring a cooler with them. I'm not sure if this is a random rule or the other places I go just break the rules? It's not a deal breaker. Just know going in you may need a small cooler. Service was great though. She was sweet and brought us plenty of ice and was helpful with our beer situation.

42.description: My husband and I just enjoyed a delicious homemade deep dish pizza at this restaurant with a casual atmosphere, jazz music playing in the background.  Bring your own booze, but we will definitely be coming back!

23.description: Great Deep dish pizza!!  Better tasting  and less expensive than some of the pizzeria specialty houses in the downtown area.  I will totally return again and again!!Renee G.

47.description: Good pizza, most similar to Lou Malnati's (except yummier)!  I'm looking forward to going back and sitting on their patio with a nice bottle of red wine...A little on the pricey side.

8.description: I love pizza so I'm always up for trying new places, especially if its deep dish pizza! A small restaurant and not too crowded for a Saturday night. The individual pizza's are quite filling and delicious and the garlic bread was decent. This place is BYOB so that's nice. The server was really friendly & told us about the live jazz they feature sometimes. The staff was nice and service was relatively good. Nice place to try out if you love pizza!

31.description: I'm always on the search for BYOB restaurants in the SW burbs - trust me, there are only a few.  I came across this pizza place on Yelp and decided to check it out.   Made a reservation for 5:00pm for a group of 12.....ended up with 8 people showing. Service was friendly and attentive.  The place is small inside, but cute and clean.   There is also an outdoor patio in the back, which was a surprise.  It was a small patio - maybe 5 tables of 4.They only serve deep dish pizza - check out the menu on line, it is very small and limited.  We ordered garlic cheese bread and tomato bread to start with.  Both were EXCELLENT!  For pizza, 2 people ordered individual pizzas and the rest of us split a large veggie pizza and a large sausage/pepperoni.   It took over an hour for the pizzas to come out.   But when they did, they were pipping hot and huge!   The sauce is slightly sweet.   The crust is about 1/4" thick of a corn-mealish crust - very hard to cut through.  Wasn't a huge fan.  The toppings were good - vegetables were very fresh.  The sausage was a huge patty pressed into the dough.   There wasn't much cheese that I could tell, so maybe order extra cheese.The place was like a sauna inside and we were all going to die of heat stroke.  They said the air was on, but it was probably 90 degrees inside.  It was beyond uncomfortable.  For this fact alone, I would never go back here.  It took about 1/2 hour for us to get the check - not sure why, we asked for it several times.   When we left, one of the workers came running out after us telling us that we had to take all our empty bottles with us (beer and wine) and throw them out, somewhere outside of the restaurant.  This was bizzare.

34.description: Great pizza, the best deep-dish I've ever had. Nice, quiet little place, the BYOB is a nice touch. We'll be back.

16.description: My boss had been talking about this place for a while. He raved about the best deep dish pizza he's ever had. He recently decided to treat his whole team to dinner,  and this is the place he had in mind.  I love that this place is BYOB.  Chicken wings were super good.  Pizza, even better.  The crust is excellent.  We had a really good time.  The staff was great.  Brendan was our server, and really took care of us.  I told my husband we would come back so he could try it. FYI this place only serves deep dish pizza.

13.description: This place has the best pizza.  You can sit outside in the back and it's really quiet and secluded.  Best of all its Bob!!! Get there early because it gets really busy after 6pm

11.description: My favorite Deep Dish in the whole city.   Cool neighborhood spot, great food.   I've had a slow server once or twice on a busy night, but it comes with the territory sometimes with a small spot like this.    I recommend it to anyone with a love of deep dish, menu is straight to the point, Pizza, and a few things to eat while you wait for your pizza.    It's also BYOB which makes it perfect to go and have a few drinks and conversation.

39.description: Awesome! Had pick-up last night. After arriving to pick up, I definitely will come back to enjoy dinner here in this wonderful little restaurant conveniently located at the 99th St. Rock Island line station. The sauce was the best that we've had on the Southside. The crust was a close second. I can't wait to have some more!

37.description: Pizzeria Deepo used to be excellent. Savory, saucy pizza with chunks of tomato in the sauce. Sadly, my pizza has not been good for the last two months. Weird tasting cheese and far less sauce then they used to have. Worst of all, the last third of each slice is nothing but crust! I don't know if they have a new recipe, a new cook, or maybe they just got cheap. Either way, I am no longer a fan and I have deleted their contact info from my phone.

0.description: Their deep-dish sausage pizza is phenomenal.  The crust is amazing, buttery, crisp on the outside with the right amount of chew.  This is local Chicago pizza at its finest.  It is made hot to order and it is definitely worth it.  Call in an order on your way home on the Rock-Island line!!

38.description: Unlike other area pizza joints,  and as the name suggest, Pizzeria Deepo specializes in deep dish.  So if you're looking for thin crust, seek elsewhere. They make a mean spinach pizza and the sauce is fresh and tomatoey.So why only 3-stars? The pizza is excellent. I've never dined-in--only have done carry-out. Seems like they need to do a better job at predicting when your carry-out order will be ready to be picked up.The typical wait for their pizza is usually an 60 minutes, but I've also called and given a 90-minute wait. I don't mind waiting for a good pizza. Here's the rub though. If they give you a pick-up time, they SHOULD be able to stick to it, right? Not my experience. Several times I've had to wait as long as 15 - 25 minutes once I arrived. Granted this is typically a weekend, but how come most of the other local pizza joints can seem to have your order time down. I chalked the first time up to the fact that they had just moved to the new location on 99th, but it's happend practically every  time. Bottom line, is it worth the wait? You bet, Just be prepared to add 15 minutes to the pick up time they tell you. Better yet, if you're in the neighborhood, maybe they can  ask them to call YOU when your pizza is ready for pick-up.

27.description: I really can't rate this place because we didn't eat there. We drove 25 miles to get there at 3:00 on a Sunday. They unlocked the door for us and told us "you can come in but the cooks are not here" really? You open at 3:00 but your cooks aren't here?? We sat down and at 3:15 when they still weren't there we left. We told the Girl we were leaving and she said "ok". Certainly did not care either way. How do you run a business like that?? I heard how good the pizza is from a co-worker but I will never set foot in this place!! We drove past numerous good pizza places. What a waste of time and Gas.

32.description: So irritated by this experience. My family and I decided to visit after seeing the restaurant on an episode of Chicago's Best. After arriving at 4:30 p.m., since they open at 4, I assumed they would be prepared to serve. It was very cold Wednesday, April 10, 2013 and since 'soup of the day' is on the menu, I ordered soup. Much to my dismay, there was no soup. No, not the soup is not ready, but "we don't have any soup today, we just opened." No coffee, hot chocolate, or tea. It was just as cold inside as it was outside. I asked could you adjust the heat? " We just opened." Ok, second time our inexperienced server used that excuse.  Anyway, we decided to order since we came for the pizza anyway.  We ordered appetizers, chicken wings, that took almost as long as the pizza to cook. After finally receiving our food at almost 6:00p.m., I was really ready to leave. We took our pizza to go. I think the B.Y.O.B. idea is ok,, but  if you don't plan to drink at 4:30 p.m. while waiting for 2 hour appetizers and pizza,it's not that appealing. Also, the bathroom was missing paper towels and a garbage can. If a restaurant opens at 4:00p.m. Be prepared for diners at 4:00p.m. Some restaurant owners  and employees arrive earlier to prepare.... Will not be going back there. Too many great places in Chicago with great pizza to attempt this again.

48.description: Based on other reviews, I brought a crowbar to work my way through the crowd to pick up my pizza, but it was totally unneccesary.  There were even tables available.  Since the original Pizza Deepo (and I just caught on to the double entendre in the name) closed, I mourned the loss of this deep dish pizza that is not an avalanche of cheese like some places downtown but a perfect balance of crust, sauce, cheese, and fillings.  Pizza pound for pound, less expensive than thin crust from other local joints.

44.description: When First opened I was thrilled to have a new restaurant in Beverly. I would give the pizza 5stars but the management one star.  This past week I ordered pizza for pick up.  I was told one hour which is a pretty long time compared to most deep dish establishments. I arrived one hour later and the pizza was not ready.  I attempted to pay for the pizza prior to it coming out and was given a bad attitude from the cashier.  The unappreciative attitude was mind boggling. I was so turned off by the lack of customer friendly service that I told the girl to keep my pizza and vowed to never return.  I then sent a letter to the owners attention thinking they might want to call and apologize.  They never called.  I will not support a business that doesn't treat it's customers with respect.

24.description: I'm glad that they finally opened a vintage deep dish place in Beverly. They only serve deep dish, which is fine by me, It's loaded with sausage and cheese and the crust is just right. It's BYOB which is nice, and has live music in the summers. There isnt a whole lot of room, so be sure to go early on weekends to make sure you get a seat.

7.description: All the pizzas are great (large) and very tasty.  I recommend ordering the minestrone as an app along with a salad.  The only complaint is it does take time to cook the pizza, but that's because they take the time to make it right.  Also, cannot beat BYOB.

49.description: I read the two reviews that were here and decided I'd take a chance.  I only gave it 4 stars because of my comments below.  Nonetheless, once I got the pizza home and warmed it a bit, it was delicious!  I would definitely go back.  If you have a taste for Gino's East or Uno and don't feel like making the drive down town, this is great!  I'm actually tempted to say it's better than Gino's.  It was good!  BTW...  It's B.Y.O.B.  Ok, so...  I called in at 4:30pm and was told there would be a 45min wait for pick-up (Ok, cool).  I ran some errands and arrived at 5:20pm (which was only 5 min later than I was told), my pizza was already warm (not piping hot).  I'm a stickler for hot pizza, I like my cheese fluid (not stiff).  This means they tell everyone the same time no matter the business flow.  There were only 2 tables occupied and I could have come earlier.    When I arrived, there was a woman (the hostess) on the phone w/one finger up telling me to wait.  (Are you serious?)

40.description: Pizza is very good, much better than most of the Chicago deep dish places, which are mostly sliding on their reputations of 30 years ago.  Service is a little, actually a lot, weird and not terribly efficient.  But the pizza is good.

30.description: Set up a night out with friends from different areas in the city, tried to call to get a reservation and was rudely told, "we don't take reservations the day of".  We went ahead, figuring that we would be able to get a table and with our last minute plans were willing to wait, after great reviews of the pizza.  Upon arrival, there were 2 tables open, one marked reserved and one not, I was told I could sit outside (54 degrees out) or again rudely, "we are at full house". Not an offer to put us on a list or how long for a wait, just dismissed. Terrible. Disappointing because I am walking distance from this restaurant and I suggested it! Never again!

46.description: The pizza here was definitely  5 star! I agree with other posters - it actually IS better than Lou's!  The only reason for 4 stars in my review is that I had to wait 30 min. longer than expected for my pizza (1hr 16 min) -carry out.  Understandably they are a new restaurant and have some "kinks" to work out.  I'm really hoping that they do!  Note - this restaurant is BYOB.

1.description: Wow. I was not expecting this. I've driven by this little restaurant so many times and I've never stopped. One friend insisted so many times, so after driving around the area decided to give the place a chance. It was just as he said. Probably one the best pizzas in the city. The crust is quite different from other places. It's less bread than what I can describe almost sconce like, is like a dense biscuit.  Now the sauce. That was outstanding. Wet, flavorful. We added some ingredients but there was no need. Cheese,the sauce maybe basil is enough.  Just plain good. Will definitely come back.

9.description: that's how good It was awesomeSAUCE!!‼The food was delicious! We had a deep dish pizza with onions, green peppers, and mushrooms. It was to die for! There could have been more deserts and different appetizers. I would give the atmosphere a thumbs up because there was candles and lights on the windows. The best part was how nice the employees were. I've been there before and I will still be coming back. It's BYOB so bring your wine or beer. Reviewed by Brownie and Flapjack!

26.description: Great pizza place. I went there on a Tuesday night & it wasn't crowded at all. There were plenty of open tables. We ordered the garlic bread with cheese & tomatoes. Glad to say that they had fresh mozzarella & tomatoes. Yumm. We then ordered a large deep dish, with sausage & spinach. The pizza took about 45 minutes, which is to be expected with a good deep dish pizza. The pizza was amazing. What I love most about the pizza is that you can taste each ingredient put into the pizza & it made the flavor thebomb.com. We each only had one piece & we were stuffed. It's B.Y.O.B. But Plan in advance because there aren't any stores around there that sell. Great experience. I took off a star because the communication between the two servers was poor, & it was FREEZING in the restaurant (yes, I understand that when I went it was -3 outside) I had to keep my coat on the entire time I was there even in the restroom (which was very clean, but soooo cold. ) I'd go back.

25.description: Not to bad of pizza. small nice simple place. Pricy though compared to other pizza around but it is good. I would go back. BYOB remember that if you bring wine make sure you bring a wine opener with that.

12.description: The place is wonderful and great place to dine in with large groups. This is the Lou Malnati's of the south side !!

21.description: My boss had been talking about this place for a while. He raved about the best deep dish pizza he's ever had. He recently decided to treat his whole team to dinner,  and this is the place he had in mind.  I love that this place is BYOB.  Chicken wings were super good.  Pizza, even better.  The crust is excellent.  We had a really good time.  The staff was great.  Brendan was our server, and really took care of us.  I told my husband we would come back so he could try it. FYI this place only serves deep dish pizza.

17.description: I think I found my new favorite deep dish. I have wanted to try this place for well over a year now. How is it that I live 4 miles from here and it took me that long!? It's a small place. I would say they have about 15 tables and a small (beautiful) patio in the back. They do take reservations. We didn't need them on a Sunday evening. I'm not sure what weekends look like though. We started with the chicken wings and mozzarella sticks. Not mind blowing but solid. The wings had a nice kick to them. The pizza takes a good 45 minutes. You can really taste the freshness. My usual favorite is Lou's and this pizza won hands down. We ordered sausage and garlic. This is the way to go if you're a garlic lover. I could taste it in every bite. The sauce had a nice sweetness to it (which I like) and the crust was phenomenal. We had a party of 4 and everyone raved about this being the best pizza they have had in a long time. They are BYOB (no alcohol sold here) so come prepared. This is the only thing keeping it from 5 stars. I love BYOB. I was just shocked at all the rules here. I'm used to the restaurant keeping my beer chilled for me. They can't do that here. Most people bring a cooler with them. I'm not sure if this is a random rule or the other places I go just break the rules? It's not a deal breaker. Just know going in you may need a small cooler. Service was great though. She was sweet and brought us plenty of ice and was helpful with our beer situation.

10.description: The food was amazing! The BYOB part, is also a plus...the service..HORRIBLE. Not the first time that we've experienced this kind of "service." We ordered an hour ahead and when we got there, they didn't have our reservation on record. We were ok with that but, had to wait an extra 45 minutes for the pizza. After waiting, they gave us only 2 pizzas when we originally ordered 3. The server came in and handed us a sandwich. We told him what we ordered and blamed us for not making it clear. Instead of him asking us what he could do, he continued saying it was due to US informing him. I also asked for habanero peppers and he forgot about them until we left. Even then, he didn't bring them. The food was amazing but they should really have a manager at all times and perhaps hire a new staff.

5.description: Why is there nobody there it's one of the best deep dish pizzas that had in Chicago and I've been here 50 years?

3.description: Best deep dish pizza I've ever had. A hidden gem on the south side of Chicago. Great food, great service, and even better prices. You can't lose!  We will be coming every week without a doubt.

35.description: When I first tried Pizza Deepo it was delicious. The last few pizzas I've ordered have been almost all crust and no cheese or ingredients. The last pizza I ordered was a cheese and spinach but it was all bread! It was hard to find the cheese and the spinach was burned on the top. Not sure I'll order again any time soon. Can't pay hard earned $$ for a loaf of bread when I want a pizza.

19.description: My boyfriend and I have been meaning to check out this neighborhood gem for quite some time, and finally had the chance to enjoy the Deepo today. I loved the cute& cozy atmosphere, sweet&efficient service.... oh and did I mention the pizza?!? Best spinach deep dish pizza I've ever had! Of course, with anything good in life there's a wait for the deep-dish, but it's so so worth it. I was sure to take advantage of the BYOB and brought a bottle of wine to enjoy while we waited.  Yay for pizza!!

28.description: Was pleasantly surprised, service was great and pizza was the best I've ever had

45.description: Pizza is great!! Definitely the BEST spot on the Southside for Deep Dish Pizza!

33.description: So disappointed. I walked in and noticed that the restaurant was pretty busy. I had called earlier in the week to ask if they required reservations and was told no. EVERY table was reserved.  That isn't the worst part. I walked in and stood at the host's podium for about 10 minutes before I had to stop someone to ask if the entire night was booked. No one greeted me when I walked in. Several employees walked by me and never even made eye contact! A gentleman came in to pick up his pizza and when he paid with a credit card the kid at the counter asked for an i.d. Ok, no problem right? He hands the i.d. and credit card to a young lady sitting at a table behind the counter. She proceeded to study the i.d. and then the customer. This went on for far longer than it should have. She finally processed his payment and I was kinda wierded out by the whole place. Sadly, I was to give a review to several coworkers and I have nothing good to say.

43.description: Pizza is avg at best and way over priced! Thats not deep dish pizza! It's called pan pizza

2.description: The concept of a BYOB deep dish spot is intriguing. I loved the atmosphere. Love the location. And the staff was pleasant enough. But the food was lack luster at best. The crust was very hard and burnt. The pizza was put together in a way that left a lot to be desired. There was a thin layer of "topping" on top of a huge hunk of cheese. I'm a fan of deep dish that has toppings throughout. For the price, it was just thrown together with no effort. I ordered a salad that was all lettuce. There was just no prep. We called in our pizza at 6:30pm. Got to the restaurant at 7:15. And weren't served our pizza until 8:20. I get that deep dish takes a while to prepare but two hours??? I wouldn't go back and I wouldn't recommend it to anyone. It's a shame bc again, it's an awesome concept in a location that I love

18.description: I'm always on the search for BYOB restaurants in the SW burbs - trust me, there are only a few.  I came across this pizza place on Yelp and decided to check it out.   Made a reservation for 5:00pm for a group of 12.....ended up with 8 people showing. Service was friendly and attentive.  The place is small inside, but cute and clean.   There is also an outdoor patio in the back, which was a surprise.  It was a small patio - maybe 5 tables of 4.They only serve deep dish pizza - check out the menu on line, it is very small and limited.  We ordered garlic cheese bread and tomato bread to start with.  Both were EXCELLENT!  For pizza, 2 people ordered individual pizzas and the rest of us split a large veggie pizza and a large sausage/pepperoni.   It took over an hour for the pizzas to come out.   But when they did, they were pipping hot and huge!   The sauce is slightly sweet.   The crust is about 1/4" thick of a corn-mealish crust - very hard to cut through.  Wasn't a huge fan.  The toppings were good - vegetables were very fresh.  The sausage was a huge patty pressed into the dough.   There wasn't much cheese that I could tell, so maybe order extra cheese.The place was like a sauna inside and we were all going to die of heat stroke.  They said the air was on, but it was probably 90 degrees inside.  It was beyond uncomfortable.  For this fact alone, I would never go back here.  It took about 1/2 hour for us to get the check - not sure why, we asked for it several times.   When we left, one of the workers came running out after us telling us that we had to take all our empty bottles with us (beer and wine) and throw them out, somewhere outside of the restaurant.  This was bizzare.

41.description: We ordered a pizza for pick up.  It was ready on time and was better than we expected it.  Will try again in the future..

50.description: Great deep dish pizza on the south side.  On par with Lou Malnatti's and Unos, believe it or not.  I know, I was surprised too.Their still ironing out a few kinks at this location but the pizza was delicious.

4.description: A BYOB gem with no corking fee and an outdoor patio. The deep dish pizza (which is excellent) takes a while to cook. So get there early, bring a bottle of wine and enjoy the company of friends and family!

6.description: This place is magical! A pure hidden treasure. My friend and I are always in search of BYOB's, and we struck gold with this one! The pizza was excellent! The ambiance was warm, cozy and inviting. It felt like I was having dinner in my livingroom, with family and friends. I would absolutely recommend this place to others, with the great customer service, food, ambiance, and BYOB benefits, you surely won't be disappointed! I myself, have found a new wonderful place to enjoy good food and great company....."Enjoy!!"

22.description: Delicious deep dish pizza. The fresh basil is a nice touch on the garlic bread. Outdoor optional dining is relaxing and private. Love the BYOB. Friendly, courteous wait staff. A great surprise in the Beverly neighborhood.

15.description: I live really close to this place  and have never tried them. I decided to give them a try on New Years Eve yesterday. I heard their pizza was really good.  I placed an order  of veggie  pizza, sausage  pizza and hot wings for pickup. Order was ready as quoted  so no complaints there.  The hot wings were very tasty.  The pizza was soooo disappointing.  It looked  great but upon cutting and attempting  to eat, the crust was hard and the pizza was dry. It had a small amount  and thin layer of sauce in some places with a few veggies  at best on the pizza with a huge thick layer of cheese.  My pizza consisted of hard thick crust a small amount of sauce and veggies with a  huge  layer thick with cheese. It was overbearing and took away from the taste.  The ingredients  did not mesh together.  The same situation  with the sausage cheese.  This place is within walking  distance maybe a block away. I am so disappointed  that this pizza joint is not a viable option for me again. It does  have so much potential  if they care to make consistently  great pizza.

20.description: Great pizza! Of course with all things great there's a wait, but well worth it. Service was amazing! And BYOB.....can't go wrong

36.description: Good food, and love the byob, but it really seems that the staff is inexperienced in the restaurant world. They were all very friendly, but we waited an hour for our pizza, and had to ask for everything...water, ice, etc. Good food but they need a major crash course in customer service.

14.description: Nice quaint place for a date. Deep Dish pizza, Meh!! Ya'll ain't Lou Malnatis, you can't just throw hand crushed tomatoes on top of pizza. Lou can do that because they've mastered it over the years. But the sauce is to watery and it's just tomatoes, very bland. The crust could have been pressed a little more but good flavor. Not a place i would bring someone from outta town for their first try at deep dish.

0.description: I went to this establishment for a curly perm.  Tammy washed my hair in icy water.  Then later she put something on my head she said was a booster.  My scalp itched and burned so badly as if it was on fire.  I complained and she told me to deal with it.  My scalp hurt for two months.  I feel as if I have been assaulted.  Her actions were willful.  I will never go to Paris Salon again, if you do avoid Tammy.

29.description: It's usually crowded, but come on, ya gotta go.  The pancakes are thick and fluffy.  Waffles are delicious as well. Other than Ridge Country Club, I haven't had a better breakfast in the area.  The price was reasonable; it's more than Denny's or some other such place, but I would pay even more for the quality of food at OHOP.  Also, unlike many Beverly attractions, the crowd is diverse.PS: Never say these words while in OHOP--or anywhere else:"Kanda. Estrata. Amantos. Ilres. Lagt. Nousferatus. Kanda. Amantos. Kanda."

42.description: Somewhat standard diner-ish breakfast only food, with an emphasis on pancakes of course.  3 star average atmosphere, service, and food in general...  They have a wide selection of pancakes... My curiosity caused me to order the Dutch Garden with mushrooms and broccoli and other stuff in it.  This was great...  The Dutch baby is a pancake batter poured into a bowl and oven baked with various toppings...   Kind of like an omelette meets pancake.  It was worth having again.  While the quality of ingredients was probably your average high-corn everything, the OJ was "fresh squeezed" ...One of the only options in Beverly for a decent breakfast/brunch.$85 for 5 adults, 1 kid.3.5 to be more fair...

23.description: My wife brought me here (my favorite restaurant) for Father's Day.  We ordered 49'er Flapjacks, a cheese omelette and, of course, buttermilk pancakes.It should be against the law for pancakes to taste this good.  Great Day In The Morning!!!!  I was so happy when I left the pancake house, in fact, I just had to get up and leave or I would have kept ordering more pancakes.  The breakfast here is on a completely different level of delicious.  Our waitress was very nice, the food came out super fast and everything was piping hot and fresh.*Update*The portion sizes have decreased, especially the size of the pancakes, (trust me, I watch that like a hawk), while the prices have increased.Please don't do that OPH.  The prices don't bother me as much as the portion sizes.  Don't get greedy.  You have a great thing going.

8.description: I don't know I'm just sitting down and they seated me pretty quick the issue I'm having is that everything seems to be extra.  I basically ordered an omelette, hashbrowns and a side of sausage and I think this is going to be over $20 and it's just me no telling also about the serving portions.

31.description: I am a huge fan of pancakes and this place has good food, coffee and service.  Not to mention, their pancakes are the BEST!!.

34.description: Wow 45 years this location has been churning out great food!I was lucky to go to this location w/cousin & girlfriend for breakfast while I was visiting Chicago.It was packed!Service was still great!  1 starCoffee hot and readily available! 1 starFood was as good as it gets! 1 starCleanliness was great! 1 starMood / Atmosphere was good! 1 starSo my cousin orders this veggie omelete and all orders come w/3 pancakes, the omelete was the full size of his plate!Girlfriend orders Swedish pancakes the fruit spread was good, the pancakes were fluffy.I order 2eggs 2 sausage patties & I knew I was getting pancakes so my stomach was ready!  The food was to my liking & what I ordered eggs over medium.  pancakes were super fluffy & not dry!Can't wait to try the one in seattle!The back of the menu didnt even show this location that's how long they been open! 45 years they definitely doin something right!

16.description: As soon as we walked in I knew it would be trash... the carpet was soaked in filth and there were 3 women gossiping at the front counter... of course no one said hello. So we sit down and see a waiter come back and forth to the table next to us. Ignores us in the process. Cool. So we decide to leave cus we didn't get any water or attention. Empty, atrocious restaurant with lazy gossiping employees. Good luck surviving as a business...

13.description: They really should offer meals that include the waffles! Not every one eats pancakes! They won't even let you substitute them in place of the pancakes! Should have driven a few miles over to ihop! At least they are a bit more flexible with your preferences. I am giving 2 stars because the hot chocolate was great!

11.description: CHECK HOURS ONLINE! DIFFERENT FROM WHAT'S POSTED ON THE DOOR. I no longer count the years I've been coming here. We love, love,  the food! I typically stick to my normal meal, a 2x4 with pecans, strawberries and whipped cream. Mmmm. The service is good, except today when the waitress gave me the receipt and said there is no rush. About 10 minutes later, the cashier comes to ask for our money because she wanted to close out her register. According to my time, they weren't supposed to close for another 35 minutes, and that is extremely rude. Like I said before, LOVE, LOVE  THE FOOD!

39.description: To be honest, the service in this place has always been horrible. I don't think I ever had a meal where I've been able to get more than two cups of coffee. It seems like the staff is pushing you out before you've even finished your meal. Typically, I would believe that they want to turn over the tables quickly on the weekends, but this has happen during the weekday as well. The food is average and nothing spectacular. The reason I go here is mainly based on the location. Other than that, it's just okay quality-wise.

37.description: Strawberry pancakes; the only way to fly. The food is really good, I just hate their parking lot and how slow they are to get you to a table.  Food-5 Stars, everything else-2 stars.  Caution: Their coffee is battery acid, stop somewhere else on the way and bring it in with you.

0.description: An old favourite. If you're looking for a great morning after date breakfast or brunch, this is the place. While the prices are a little high, the portions and quality are worth it. Everything is perfect. The apple pancakes and Swedish pancakes are the stuff of legend. But it IS a food coma waiting to happen.

38.description: Nothing says awesomeness like their bake apple pancakes. WOW! mmmmmmm!!! Seriously, these little crack-cakes could bring Osama bin Laden "out" of hiding! wow, they're good. This specific location is always crowded, so be careful if you're trying to park your car in the tiny lot. Service is lacking, but I can't blame the servers, as there weren't enough servers on the floor (I blame management). All in all, I'll be back!

27.description: Nice pancake house not far from where I live. The Baked Apple Pancake was HUGE and so succulent- almost sinful! Wasn't too impressed with the sausage but I guess you don't come here for that. Clearly the pancakes are where it's at!The OPH isn't the cheapest place in the world either. Although huge, the Baked Apple Pancaked ran me around 10 bucks. Two medium sized glasses of grapefruit juice also cost me $10. Overall, this was a good place to visit seeing that it was right up the street from my residence- just a lil pricey. Will I be back? Maybe.

32.description: The service cant be beat - I have eaten here over 100 times and dealt with many different waitors/waitresses and they are all very friendly and effecient. The food is always outstanding and will be on your table shortly after ordering no matter how packed the restaurant is.  Outstanding Service & Food - what more can you ask for from a restaurant?!

44.description: They consider fried salami a breakfast meat.  Which pretty much makes them the shit, right off the bat.Sourdough pancakes - thin, huge, almost gooey in the middle...ohhh....  Decor - Kind of like how Kathy Bates' house looked in "Misery."  It's all just all around awesome.  And the menus charmingly look at least 40 years old, sometimes with syrup on them.  Actually, most likely with some syrup on them.  And like with all of the Original Pancake Houses, every single one seems to have a totally different menu than every other one.But they so kind of stick it to you, cause you have to buy the meat in addition to the pancakes.  But it is seriously all so good, so you will buy it and you will love it.  Breakfast for two, with two plates of pancakes, two extra meaty things and coffee is always just over $20.  And totally worth it.  And the waitresses are nice.  But don't even think about trying to come here Sunday morning unless you have some serious patience.

24.description: Went on Sunday after church.  Food was fast and good.  Pancakes are nice and fluffy!  Server could have been a bit more attentive but otherwise I would go again.  Definitely will need to get there early on Sunday though.  There was quite a line as we were heading out.

7.description: I had a long day ahead of me as I had my brought my car in for repairs early morning on 7/23/15.  I was hungry along with wanting to get some exercise in on what was going to be a hot day.  So I walked a mile to this establishment.  I had been here before but felt like my experience was totally different because I sat in a totally different section which was nice and quiet along with being dimly lit and decided to be adventurous by trying a different item than I usually get when I go to this restaurant.  I decided that based off the menu description of the peach crepes, it sounded like something that may be refreshing and good and it was!  Fresh warm peach compote and the crepes were filled with peach pieces.  I really really enjoyed them.  The chicken sausage is always my favorite and if it doesn't sound like something you'd enjoy, think again!  Wonderful flavor, I love 'em!  What I really enjoyed is that I stayed in that establishment for hours, using my computer and reading my paper to just enjoy my time there while waiting on my car to be finished.  My waitress was fine but I think she got off work while I was still there and I still got great service by another waitress waiting on patrons in my seating area.  No one rushed me out, to which I appreciated.  Thank you Original Pancake House, I appreciate your good service!

40.description: The pancake house is ingrained in my mind as an after church meal.  After a years long absence my family and I went in on a Friday afternoon and without thinking I said "shit it's one a clock, we're never going to beat the church crowd."And they say Catholicism doesn't scar people for life.  In 2009 writing a review of the food at the Pancake House is pretty pointless.  Anecdotal evidence is the only purpose.  Quality stuff.

30.description: Finally went to The Original Pancake House after hearing about it from family members for years.  While not the cheapest breakfast (seems most things are a la carte), the food was great.  The service was good, and they really seem to be able to move people in and out.  Would definitely recommend.

46.description: The apple pancake is better than sex.

1.description: I grew up going to this restaurant with my mom. We would go on Sunday morning and split an apple pancake. We decided to go and split an apple pancake recently, probably about 20 years since I've been there, and I have to say, it was almost everything that I remember. Taste was amazing, size was good, and I definitely want to go back and get another.

9.description: Would give it 4 and a half stars honestly... Been coming here for years and they never disappoint. Great food, fresh ingredients, close to home, good service. Only real gripe is the wait. They stay pretty crowded and for good reason, but they do a good job getting people in and out.

26.description: You cannot go wrong with any breakfast item here. Our absolute favorite spot on the south side. Everyone is so welcoming, it feels like your family inviting you in for a weekend brunch.Get: strawberry pancakes with a hot coffee and side of bacon. Their bacon game is on point - crispy and always perfect. Good to know: bathrooms do not have changing tables and you will wait on Saturday and Sunday mornings, though they are prompt at turning tables around.Overall: amazing breakfast for amazing prices. Fresh ingredients, killer coffee. A must try.

25.description: On point every time. This is the best OPH location. Their bacon is perfect. Love the Dutch baby!

12.description: I went to this location on a Monday, around 11:15 am,  I was seated and waited and waited for a waitress to come and take my order.  I observed that 4 other tables that were seated after me were served before me, and one of the tables had finished their meal and left the restaurant by the time my food arrived.  The service I received was slow and sloppy.  The food was OK and hot, but one of the ingredients in my omelet was omitted.  I will not patronize this business again, they are just too disorganized and slow!!

21.description: I was hoping for more after seeing 4 stars on yelp.   The waitress was very nice, good service.  Food though - MEH.   I had the eggs benedict...and it was very very average... and the sauce was really kind of - thick and well, not that great.     I think our party's overall experience with food quality was 'disappointed'.

17.description: I was hoping for more after seeing 4 stars on yelp.   The waitress was very nice, good service.  Food though - MEH.   I had the eggs benedict...and it was very very average... and the sauce was really kind of - thick and well, not that great.     I think our party's overall experience with food quality was 'disappointed'.

10.description: Amazing breakfast after partying in Chicago for the Dead shows, whew I needed that. I ordered the eggs Benedict which was flavorful and used quality wholesome products. The dish was served with potato pancakes, MMMMM! The best part about the meal was the fresh squeezed orange juice. It was pricey, for 5 of us we spent $100, but I will stop on my way to Chicago every time. A little ways off the road but totally worth it. Lastly, our service was incredible. Thank you!

5.description: I absolutely love the food at this Beverly location, however we have missed several SAFE SERVING And HANDLING PROCEDURES.   Today my pancakes arrived to my table with my servers Thumb and nail print in my pancakes.  She did ask if I wanted them remade, however my issue is this is very unsanitary and not appealing to the visual or mental Palette.    Another discrepancy that is a major issue is the staff uses the washrooms with their Aprons on.    This has been a constant complaint of mine to the staff between the fingers always in our plates and the aprons on in the washroom.  I hope that the staff become better trained in Food Service and Sanitation requirements.  This will possibly lead to someone getting an illness from cross contamination.  Please Look into this matter.  It has gone unnoticed and unresolved for too long.

3.description: One reason I hate going to corporate restaurants is that it's already cooked when it arrives. Bacon, sausage etc etc comes in precooked and all they gotta do is heat it up.  The food is blahhhhhh. All they have going is they're syrup. The servers like to pick their teeth and serve food!!! Never again

35.description: The food omg is awesome pancakes are soft and fluffy in the right way...I personally hated pancakes until my sister bet that I would love the pancakes so I tried them and I'm hooked I have been going every week since Oct 2010....I never thought I would b a breakfast person...Although their service is horrible and some what unprofessional they also forget that when they give u your food then your check that u still have to finish your meal and need refills on your drinks......

19.description: Yesterday I had a savory omelette, The Santa Fe. Everything was so fresh tasting. As an additional pleasant surprise the omelette came with a serving of the best salsa sauce I ever had. I learned from The waitress that the salsa is made fresh in house, like everything else. I wish I could have bought a container Togo. I also ordered their bacon, which is simply out of this world, had the lightest buttermilk pancakes, which come with the meal. And if you have not had it, be sure to have a glass of their fresh squeezed OJ, it's AWESOME!  The ambiance was great, I really felt at home in their family friendly surroundings.

28.description: first of all the staff are not friendly whether  if it's crowded or not. however none of the staff smile, also me and my 2 children were waiting at the table literally 20 minutes before a waitress came to take our order. i ordered a vegetarian omelette when i cut into it to take my first bite, as i was chewing, i immediately started to notice that something in my mouth was'nt right. i spit the food into a napkin to observe the sharp object in my mouth and it was a piece of glass. i'm 6 months pregnant what if, i did'nt notice something strange in my mouth as chewing, i could've had some serious cpmplications. i immediately flagged down the waitress to inform her of what's going on with the breakfast. i showed her what was in my omelette as well as ended up in my mouth, she picked up the little piece of glass and said let me get a manager ok. however it took the manager literally 30 minutes to come to my table and address this situation terrible. luckly i'm not a dramatic ignorant type of woman or else that could have been on the news and i'm pregnant. when the manager finally came she plainly said, i'm sorry for your wait and for the glass being in your omelette, i won't charge you anything ,i'm sorry. my point is it's definitely not money the situation was not handled appropiately point blank period. i would'nt recommend a homeless starving person to have breakfast at this place unprofessional as well as careless  sloppycooks that rush food orders! this took place on 05/25/2012

45.description: STRAWBERRY WAFFLE. The waffle is three times the size of your face and the strawberry syrup is so good, I could swim in it. Save room for hashbrowns too. Oh god.

33.description: This is a very nice breakfast place. The food is very good and the service is fast. The wait staff is very friendly and reasonably efficient. I have been here several times. Every so often you might have to wait for 10-15 minutes for seating but that is not a bad wait. The food is almost always cooked exactly to order (only once were my over medium eggs over-cooked), and delicious. Parking in the lot is a bit limited but there is street parking available. As a breakfast place, it is very good. I can't guarantee a great experience, but I will say you wont have a bad one.

43.description: I went here after Toy for Tots in 2007. I had a great experience. The food was well priced and came in unbelievable proportions. You must have the baked apple pancake. The service was very fast even though the place was packed with families. Regulars and newbies seemed to get ample amounts of attention. Great all around.

2.description: #awesomeness everytime I go here they are beyond the call of duty they always make sure your happy and make your stay very enjoyable. They are always professional and I enjoy everytime I come here which is 5 or 10 times per visit twice a year. .can't wait til tomorrow

18.description: The food and service was nice. I had the Pecan Waffle very tasty! The place was not crowded and we were seated very quickly!
