41.description: Personally, I don't like this place.  While the food is ok, the service is crap and just TRY getting  a parking space EVER. Not worth the hassle, especially since their prices are getting outrageous.

4.description: Delicious blueberry crepes and Dutch fruit bowls. This is one of my favorite breakfast restaurants. Great waitstaff also!

6.description: I'm so sad. This was my favorite breakfast place for years. YEARS. Keyword: was. The experience I had recently just solidified my decision to move on to other breakfast places.    Service has always been slow. Waiting at this place is inevitable. But the last time I was there, the waiting times were obscene. I'm not talking about waiting for a table either (actually the breakfast house was half empty and people were still waiting for tables, probably because the restaurant is understaffed, but that's a whole other issue). Waiting to order, waiting for food, waiting for condiments, waiting for the bill. See a theme? For breakfast we were probably there for well over an hour (after grabbing a table).    The waitress that we had has worked there for years. Honestly, I think she's just given up on the place. She was nonexistent pretty much the whole time we were there. Tracking down employees= not fun. The food this time was so overly greasy-it was pretty gross. I feel like I ate it just based on previous allegiances. Paying the bill took forever-even the cashier looked panic (someone was breathing down her neck for a take out order placed 30 minutes earlier that they couldn't find). Sigh.    For the price of everything, you would expect things to come out much, much better. If you know me, you know how hard it is for me to write a review like this. It almost feels like a food betrayal. Unfortunately, I think the time has come to move on.

22.description: I have a weakness for breakfast food and The Original Pancake House forces me to indulge at least once a month! The service is always with a smile, and the food is  delicious. I usually order an omelette that comes with an order of pancakes.  I'm set for the whole day after I eat here,  because the food portions are so large!  I love the cozy atmosphere and the coffee! If there was one thing I could change, it would be the prices.  As I mentioned earlier, the food portions are large and the quality of the food is great, so I suppose it's worth the extra bucks.

15.description: Awesome Food - Awesome Service  - What's not to LOVE about this place!My daughter loves the chocolate chip waffles, says they are the BEST.I cannot get enough of the bacon!  If you love bacon you will not be disappointed.The staff is always super friendly and very attentive.  Looking forward to another trip there this weekend!

20.description: As soon as we walked in I knew it would be trash... the carpet was soaked in filth and there were 3 women gossiping at the front counter... of course no one said hello. So we sit down and see a waiter come back and forth to the table next to us. Ignores us in the process. Cool. So we decide to leave cus we didn't get any water or attention. Empty, atrocious restaurant with lazy gossiping employees. Good luck surviving as a business...

36.description: BEST breakfast place! IHOP does NOT compare lol.Very packed, especially on Sundays- prepare to wait, but well worth it.Delicous food- I love the crepes, apple pancakes and coffee.

14.description: Omg! The Dutch Fruit bowl is amazing! I am also addicted to the French toast and the thick cut BACON!!!

0.description: This Walgreens has gone downhill. The new staff is making huge mistakes with  filling prescriptions.

3.description: With so many mom and pop authentic Mexican restaurants, why would anyone go to a chain? Put a kid through school instead of buying a yacht for a corporate executive.

1.description: Taco Bell has bad customer service everytime I call they never pick up

2.description: Just got tacos, nachos and chalupa a. It is the worst food on the market. The girl barely put meat in the tacos. Just a lot if sour cream and lettuce. Dont go here! It's terrible The way the food is prepared. Shameful

5.description: Out of all the Taco Bell locations in all of Chicago, DO NOT, and I mean, DO NOT come to this location. The customer service here is shallow and pedantic, and they do NOT consider the customer at ALL in the ordering process. The quality of the food itself is terrible, and the taco shells have a stale consistency to them upon eating them. This is one of the most TERRIBLE locations in Chicago, and does not represent the value for good food and great customer service that the company [Taco Bell] itself holds in such high regard. I would not send my own worst enemy to this location, and I implore you to not visit this location and waste something as precious as your time and money.

6.description: Standard Taco Bell service and food.

7.description: I go through 2-3 times a month for lunch while at work. Never had a bad experience. Always hot and fresh. Staff is always courteous and pleasant.

0.description: I have been coming to this Taco Bell for years and I never had a bad experience the food is just the way I like it and the service is awesome everyone is polite and courteous. Now it's even better looking inside after the renovation. Keep up the good work!

4.description: The service sucked and the food was not up to par.

3.description: This was my first visit to this particular Michael's. I came in to purchase the Rainbow Loom for my daughter. When I first came in the line was extremely long and there was only one cashier. I spotted at least 5 other employees on the floor and no one came for back up. Once I found my item I browsed the store in hopes that the long line would go down. Unfortunately it didn't. I waited in line for at least 15 minutes! Once I left the store I realized there was a 40% off coupon posted on their site. So I went back into the store with my receipt and the coupon on my mobile device and waited in line yet again for another 15 minutes. Once I reached the counter, I explained to the cashier that I wanted the 40% off on the Rainbow Loom I just purchased since it was a regular priced item. And the cashier looks at my receipt and then tell me I need to bring the item back into the store. And then he said I would have to get back in line. So at this point I'm highly pissed! I go to my car to get the item and waited in line for ANOTHER 15 minutes. As soon as I reached the counter he then tells me that the Rainbow Loom is excluded from the offer. And once I read the very fine print it did state that the Rainbow Loom was excluded. I couldn't argue with that. But my issue was that when he first saw my receipt he KNEW I was inquiring about the Rainbow Loom. And the fact he made me go get the item and wait back in line just to tell me it was excluded was unbelievable!!! So now at this point I'm beyond pissed and ask to speak with a manger. I waited 45 minutes to speak with a manger! Her name was Estella and she was the night shift manager. So at this point my blood is boiling!!!! Once the manger approached me she said it took her so long because she was working with two customers in the framing department which takes time and she's the only person that can do that task. She apologized repeatedly and that wasn't enough for me. She explained that even if she tried to give me 40% of the Rainbow Loom it wouldn't go through which I believe she was lying! So she asked if I wanted to purchase anything else and receive 40% off. I immediately let her know that I would not spend another dime in that store and that on Monday morning I will be calling customer service to file a complaint. I have never been through such a long and irritating battle like this before. I could understand the cashier being an ass but not the manager as well. This team sucks and I will make sure I file a complaint!

1.description: Visited on a Monday holiday afternoon, I would have expected there to be more people on staff. This was my first visit to this location and I needed help looking for some things on my list. I wasn't able to find anyone on the floor and eventually found the things on my list. There was only 2 people for check out and it was a particularly long line. The only redeeming factor was that my purchase was 25% due to a coupon for President's Day.

2.description: I usually know exactly what I want when I come so I don't spend too much time browsing.  Line can get kind of long and the store is set up a little strange.  Yarn selection is ok.

0.description: Had a hard time finding what I needed, also couldn't find anyone to help me find what I came in for. After wandering for 15 minutes I did find the items. Only to wait in line for a long time because they had only one cashier. I guess it would be fine if they hired some people.

58.description: More than any other pizza, Fox's really says "Chicago style pizza" to me.  First of all, my boyfriend used to love it, so everytime we would get pizza for like my first two years straight of living in Chicago, we got one from here.  More importantly, it is cut into little squares instead of "regular" pizza wedges - real Chicagoish.It has a thin, almost soft crust that is covered in cheese and a sweetish sauce and is really, really greasy.  But it's pretty good.  My daughter though HATES the sausage here and refuses to eat it.  I find it a bit grizzly and wouldn't ever choose it as a first choice for a topping and would instead go for the pepperoni.  I also find the pizza prices to be about one or two bucks more than for other pizzas in the area.  I've only eaten inside once or twice, pre-smoking ban mind you, and it was both rank and dank in there with foul air.  I'd have to imagine that has improved since.But, since they don't deliver to my house, I've stopped going there almost entirely, especially since there are multiple pizza places within the same vicinity of Fox's that do deliver to my house - which is about 20 some odd city blocks away from the restaurant.  I think the whole delivery thing is best summed up in my Leona's review  yelp.com/biz/leonas-neig… In fact, I'm pretty sure their delivery map strongly resembles a gerrymandered Texas congressional district. Of course, if you're cool with that, like I said, the pizza is decent.

56.description: Green beer. Irish reubens. Pizza. Live Irish singer with an accordian. Dive-ish decor. Four stars.

29.description: I visited the new location in Hinsdale on York rd. and had a great experience.  It appears they have hired a top notch wait  staff who were right on top of our needs.  Our server, Joe, did a great job with our party.  The pizza was great as usual, but I had the rib-eye steak sandwich and give it two thumbs up.  I think they get that you have to employ high energy qualified people to make a new business as this one succeed.  I am sure they will be around for a long time.

42.description: I'm not sure where Fox's toppings come from, but there is no excuse for the high cost of their pizza, which is definitely made by the mighty hands of local high schoolers. False Fox's.

23.description: I would rather go to the one in oak lawn. Beverly one has screwed up our orders to many times pick up and delivery. The pizza is great, Irish nachos are very good I like them with the cheese sauce. Beef and meatball sandwiches very good also!

47.description: Ahhh....when my good friend and colleague drove us all the way here for dinner from East Chicago, IN I was wondering....why?!  It's a good 45 minutes from where we were staying.  I'm glad he did.Apparently, he use to live around the corner from this Pizza joint back in the 90's....and he wanted to share Fox's Pizza goodness with us.  After looking at the menu, we decided to order a Family Size (17") Fox's Special Pizza (Sausage, Mushrooms, Green Peppers & Onions, $26.99) well done and an order of 18 Chicken Wings ($14.99).  Were we hungry?  Hell ya!The place was packed, so we expected to be waiting a while.  Nope, we were served our food pretty quickly.I couldn't wait to dig into the Pizza, so I went at it first.  It's a Chicago Thin Crust style Pizza....not the huge thick crust stuff that will fill you up after one slice.  The Pizza was delicious!  I like my Pizza well done if given the choice and they do it just right.  The proportion of toppings was perfect.Next I tried the Wings.  They were pretty good.....not the best I've had, but above average.We washed it down with some Beer.  I had an Amstel Light and my colleagues had Guinness!  How they could drink Guinness with all of this food is beside me.....Guinness is like a liquid meal to me.Overall, it was a great dining experience.  I'm glad my friend drove us out here.Will I return?  Not sure I could find it again, but would love to.

8.description: Some of my favorite thin crust on the south side. Their pizza is distinct, you know its foxes pizza even if you're blindfolded. I also love their baked pastas, veal parm, and Irish nachos appetizer. My dad swears by their ribs too. I wish they didn't stop selling spaghetti buckets to go, those were great in a pinch. And I wish the parking situation wasn't such a mindf*ck sometimes but its really not a big deal. This place is great for what its meant to be, a small Irish pizza pub that's good for take out or dining in.

31.description: My wife and I had dinner at Fox's last night.  I have been a fan of this place since 1972.  Haven't been back in a while, though.Our waitress, Marge, was terrific as my wife has diet restrictions and Marge negotiated the menu for her like a pro.  Wife had the short rib dinner (Monday special) and I had 10" sausage pizza.  Still as good as ever.If you are hungry, you can't go wrong at Fox's.  Full bar and clean, clean clean.They still do a great job.

34.description: I love this place mostly because of the memories, and the first time I tried good thin crust Chicago Style Pizza.  Quant, but tight dining room is the only complaint.  You can feel how tight the Beverly community is by entering this place.  Must try!

16.description: Worst customer service experience ever!!!First, let me say, that Fox's pizza has been my favorite pizza for the last 35 years. I no longer live in the area, but last night I was in close proximity so I ordered a pizza for pick up. When I called to order, I was given my total and told to give them "a good 30 minutes" I arrived at the restaurant 30 minutes later and gave my name to the young lady at the counter. She couldn't find my order. She asked me if I was sure that I ordered from the Beverly location, to which I answered yes. She then proceeded to ask me to tell her the phone number I called. Since I've been ordering from the place longer than the girl has been alive, I had no problem telling her that I called 239-2312 as I STILL know the number by heart. She then asked me 3 more times how to spell my name and if there was a possibility the order could be under another name, to which I continued to say NO.Thankfully there was a young man at the counter who was able to figure out what the error was on THEIR part. They sent my order out for delivery. Since I don't live in the area, I asked how that could be possible and he rattled off an address. I said "oh yes, that would be a bowling alley where we previously had a party for one of my son's sports teams, I don't live there." Side note: I did order about 10 family size pizzas for that party and the parties held there previously.The young man informed me that the driver just left and he would call him to tell him to come back. They seemed to be disinterested in me any further until the young lady offered me a free 2 liter of pop which I declined.  I conversed with other customers in the waiting area who were also shocked at their nonchalance of their error because at this point, no apology had been provided. The young lady spoke to me again and asked me if I would like to pay while I was waiting!!  I said "Pay for a pizza that isn't here when I ordered for pick up?? NO!" I asked the young man if I could speak to the person in charge and he said he would get the manager.The woman came to the counter and as I attempted to explain what happened, she interrupted me and said she was aware. That's funny, if she was aware, why didn't she address ME?? Why did I have to ask to speak with her?? At any rate, I asked why there was no offer to make me a fresh pizza. She responded that they were busy and that would take at least 30 minutes. She then issued the first apology and asked me, "What do you want me to do, give you a discount?!?" I said NO. She then rang up a total which was about $5 less than the initial total I was provided over the phone. At this point, the driver came in and plopped my pizza on the counter which was 15 minutes AFTER I walked in to pick it up.  I said to the manager, "Now I'm paying for a cold pizza." Her snippy comment was, "it was in a box." Why didn't I walk out without the pizza?? Because I had two hungry children with me who already waited 45 minutes. Maybe my one pizza didn't matter to the workers at Fox's last night, but it's a shame that I will no longer be ordering my favorite pizza from that location for my family or future team parties. I'm VERY disappointed!!!  And by the way manager - the pizza was COLD!

13.description: Just tried to order a pizza on Saturday night and they closed early. What kind of pizza place closes an hour before there supposed to close. That is how dirty Irish pizza places do business!

11.description: This is by far my favorite Chicago thin crust pie. Sometimes you get one that is a bit sub-par, buts thats few and far between.  Whole menu is killer though. If u want South Side thin crust, Fox's is a must try!

39.description: I wavered between a three and a four, but ultimately a cheap steak can always win my heart.  I'm kind of easy like that.  A steak you say?  At a pizza joint in Beverly?  I know, it's kind of amazing.  Sometimes a little risk brings a big reward.  Sometimes not, but at Fox's?  Jackpot.  Let's get this one thing out of the way, the parking "lot" is a travesty.  It's like three spaces along the side of the building with a few spaces behind so that people can block you in and make you want to have a conniption.  Luckily there's street parking that's not too horrible if you can get a spot on the West side of Western so you don't have to cross the street praying for your life.  Now that that's said and done, let's get to the good stuff.  The space is smallish and cozy and the staff is super friendly.  My companion ordered an individual size pizza and had enough to eat that night, last night, and I  think there's probably some more leftover for lunch.  It was sizable, not skimpy on the toppings by a long shot, and had a nice garlicky flavor to it that he liked.  It's on the greasy side, but it's pizza, not a salad.  It's not offensively greasy, it just might need a blot or two, but again, it's pizza.I went out on a bit of a limb and ordered the sirloin butt steak.  Is it because I wanted to say "butt?"  Probably.  Ok, yes, but I also needed some iron.  The steak was cooked to order and enough to split in half and eat the rest of later.  It came with a potato choice and a soup or salad.  In the future I might ask for a separate plate because it comes out on one of those Chili's esque fajita type platters and if you leave it on there too long, your steak might just keep cooking while it's on the table.  I'll either order rare or grab a regular plate next time.  And there will be a next time.  Fox's will probably be my go-to after things at the Beverly Art Center now that Franconello's has tragically exploded.

37.description: Although they're known for pizza, Fox's feels very much like a diner when you're not carrying out.  It's definitely a neighborhood joint.  This is the kind of place you may have hung out at in high school when you weren't going to the movies or drinking wine coolers and Natty Light in Erin Gallagher's basement.  I've always found Fox's pizza to be underwhelming.  You could do better at Roseangela's or much better at Vito & Nick's.  The rest of the menu is on roughly the same level.  But they do get a nod for being one of the few non-chain restaurants open later in the evening.

0.description: I used to go to Fox's in the early 90's while I was driving a Limo and decided to return last night after 25 years for a late sandwich after a concert downtown.  The Beef sandwich and garlic tomato bread were great as was our server, Mike.  Don't let the bad reviews dissuade you from going here, as it is still very good just as it was 25 years ago.  I will return.  Thank You

38.description: This is the most inconsistent pizza ever.  You never know what you are going to get.  If you are lucky that day, bonus!!

51.description: Best pizza in the world! Thin crust pepperoni with a Harp beer.  I can hear Irish eyes a smiling. I love it.

27.description: This isn't my favorite pizza ever--but when my usual pizza partner--my mom-- gets to pick the pie, Fox's is her favorite. As for me....I give it a resounding "I wouldn't kick it out of bed for eating crackers, but...." The sauce, IMHO, needs a little more OOMPH--maybe a little more acidity?--and the sausage needs decidedly less fennel. That's just my taste; others, obviously, are free to disagree.There's much LESS room for disagreement re: the parking situation, which during busy hours is just.....grim. Dismal. Grismal, in fact.  I went in at 8 PM on the World's Stormiest Friday Night and after making a full 2-block circuit in search of a place to park, ended up in a bus zone with my hazards a-flashing. Needs moar parking, pls. Summary: Decent pizza, but get it delivered.

32.description: Does thin crust pizza get any better than Fox's? If it does I don't wanna know about it. Had Fox's Special last night when back in Beverly. Sweet sauce, that ridiculous fennel-y sausage, crispy, slightly burnt crust. Perfection. If you're on the south-side looking for pizza and don't get Fox's you're doing yourself a disservice.

48.description: Something has changed at Fox's.  This has been my lifelong pizza of choice, but quality has slipped.  Recently, the crust was undercooked and toppings sparse.  A new owner, perhaps?

44.description: Weekends are for golfing and splurging. I preface with that to say we went to Fox's and ordered the wings, the Irish nachos, and a medium sausage pizza that was like a large.  Commence chow down. Irish nachos, yum scrum. Waffle fries, crisp not greasy.  And stayed crispy throughout. Covered with real cheese on every loaded layer along with bacon, tomatoes, green onions. We topped it with sour cream, lil salt, lots of pepper. Kinda wanted to fight for that one top part just loaded with lots of all the gud stuff. Didn't have to, though, it was all like that. Had to stop eating them to try the rest. The wings were so so. The breading was spiced instead of sauce on them. I've had really gud wings like that. The flavor on these was average. Added hot sauce on top and they were better.The pizza was good. Yes it was greasy but to me, not the drip off the slice unedible greasy.  The sauce was sweet and tangy. The only thing that didn't give it a total thumbs up was a distinct, different taste of the sausage. To me, that taste didn't go 100% with the rest. The service was quick and we weren't left needing to ask for anything. She was on top of it.

24.description: This is classic Chicago, no thrills pizza, plenty of cheap meat options (butt steak, corned beef etc,) great burgers, a full bar, closely packed, always busy, neighborhood favorite. Fox's is not going to blow anybody away with their menu, it is what it is, a cheap place to grab a meal with friends. What does Fox's have?Phenomenal pizza. Be warned going forward that it will be thin and it will be greasy. However, the cheese is succulent, the crust is burnt to perfection, and the sausage will melt your mind! I don't want to sit here and pretend that Fox's deserves to be in the "best pizza" conversation, but it is a leading candidate for "best of the rest!" Couple that with a lively environment, friendly wait staff, and the feeling of being a part of a neighborhood and you have one of the best pizza JOINTS in the city.

7.description: I love Fox's. We usually do delivery but every now and then we dine in, and it's really cozy! Friendly staff & good pizza. My son loves the different coloring sheets they give him & I appreciate the quality crayons! Lol.

49.description: This place was a long-time favorite of my father-in-law while he grew up in the area.  After hearing about it for quite some time, we visited for the famous thin-crust pizza.  I can honestly say it's been my favorite thin-crust pizza to date.  The mushrooms were extremely fresh.  I did not care for the sausage that everyone else had, but sausage is not really my thing anyway.  I could not stop eating!  I continued to think about Fox's long after our visit.  I only wish they were closer to us.I would be willing to make the trip back out to Beverly for Fox's.

40.description: This is my "guilty pleasure" restaurant, pizza, fried chicken, mushrooms, salads, etc. all well done in a dark cozy family environment. The decor screams south side Irish. It's a very small dark candlelit room filled with tiny booths that can only accommodate 4 diners. There is a small 8 person bar that you can rarely get a seat at because the neighbor regulars are holding court. The pizza is some of the best in the city and I always make a point to order a larger size so that I have leftovers. The remaining menu are all outstanding and I have yet to be disappointed. The service is consistently friendly, prompt and accommodating. This is a great place to take a date, grab pizza with friends, or bring the kids after  little league.

53.description: Full disclosure, this is basically what I ate once a week for 18 years growing up in Beverly. I absolutely despised it by the time I left, but now for some bizarre reason I leap at the opportunity to come down and split a pie with my dad.Its greasy, thin crust, simple stuff cooked up by local high schoolers (my brothers were one time chefs) that is not meant to be gourmet but merely gives Beverly residents their pizza fix for reasonable prices. It is an acquired taste but when you get a hankering for it, nothing else will substitute.I suggest the sausage pizza, or any other meat pizza since they are always generous with the meat. Also, the pizza bread brings that special, artery clogging taste that really is the best in Beverly (that was actually meant as a compliment)As stated before, is it worth the trip to Beverly, God no, but if you have a South Sider with you who needs his Fox's, don't be surprised if he insists on going.

30.description: Since we moved to Beverley I grew fond of this pizza joint. We made new friends here and the staff is awesome.I have their phone number moved to one of my free speed dial number sports. They make very large thin crust Pizza's very tasty and possibly from a different planet.You need 5 stars but your parking outside attest to your popularity but sadly its not enough space for all your fans. Please make it bigger.

46.description: Well, maybe I was wrong about Fox's pizza.  Having a Fox pizza at the Cicero Ave. Fox's last summer, I definitely was not a fan.  This time, my cousin suggested the original Fox's on Western.  We ordered salads, which were very good, like the other fox's.  When we ordered the pizza, my cousin requested extra napkins so we can blot off all the grease on the pizza.  Once we did this, the pizza was absolutely wonderful!And, even more importantly, no stinkin' white sox junk around- just bears stuff...maybe I will avoid Fox's pizza only during the summer.

1.description: Good luck placing an order! Just tried calling and the phone was answered by a girl who sounded like she was 10 and giggling. Thought I had the wrong number, gave her a couple chances to use correct phone script , she just kept giggling. I had  to ask"is this Fox's?" She said yes( giggling) I asked to speak to a manager and she sounded like the older sister who apologized and said she didnt know she had to "Be up here babysitting"Explains it all, no more Fox's, you lost this customer!!

55.description: Irish pizza?  Please.  It's greasy and floppy and gross.  There are plenty of better pizza places in the area.The non-pizza food items are okay, but the service can be terrible at times.  For example, on one visit, I was dining with my aunt and uncle (both Irish Chicago cops).  They asked for water, so the waitress brought over a pitcher and literally dropped it on the table.  It nearly tipped over and water splashed everywhere.  She turned around and walked away without a word.  My uncle politely told the manager that the waitress probably should've filled our glasses instead of splashing water all over the table. Apropos of nothing, the manager replied that his last name was "Fox," and he'd do whatever he pleases.  So, I guess what I'm trying to say is that I don't eat there any more.

9.description: Yeah, five stars. I am talking mostly about their pizza.  I don't know what they did, but their pizza has been outstanding as of late. They've also been insanely generous with the coupons, offering $5 off coupons in the local papers. $5 off a $20 pizza is pretty dang good.But, like I said, the taste has improved. While I like the soup, I can't say that I like the rest of their menu as much as some other local places, but the pizza makes up for it.

26.description: An Institutition  that's still holding its own.  Consistantly good.  Not much parking, but usually enough.  Thin crust pizza is quite good.   Prices are too high, but mainly because of all the Chicsgo, Illinois Taxes added on.

25.description: Home sweet home I couldn't wait to get back to Chicago. I'm taking a pizza back to New York. I have enjoyed your food for over 30 years.

12.description: I needed something to warm me up and this was a familiar choice. Not a lot going on at lunch time. So I should have been over served. I got the corn beef on marbled rye. As the menu said. I was asked what my two sides were. Fries and slaw. I get my plate and the first thing I notice is the bread. Maybe the marbles were in the menu writers head? Because it was just rye. Nice and moist though. As I am eating I realize that I don't have any slaw. I am sitting there in a quite empty dining room looking for my waitress.It was easier to get her attention before I ordered. I finally get the slaw and a refill. They must have put it through a grinder because it was more like mash. The sandwich was right on the money though! So I am waiting for the bill that I asked for twice. I should have started when I sat down, because it took longer to get to the table than the food. As I am walking to my car I see that someone had double parked behind me. I was the only one lucky enough for this to happen to. I walk back in and ask who had the blue Saturn? So they know that it's the delivery guy and this kid comes strolling out after 5 mintutes with a shitty look on his face. Doesn't say anything except with his expression. Oh, sorry that I put you out. What was I thinking asking you to put your phone down to let a customer leave. I'm thinking I won't be back!

59.description: Ehh.. REALLY greasy and that's about it... but, like Dan, sometimes I have a hankering for this shiiiit.

21.description: Delicious thin crust pizza! A little crunch and crispness to the crust which i love and their sauce is flavorful with just a hint of sweet. They don't skimp on the toppings and its slightly greasy which makes it so addictive, but not drippy greasy which is gross. Definitely becoming one of my top favorites for pizza in Chicago. The fried mushrooms appetizer was perfect~not soggy at all. It's served with cheese; i prefer ranch and they brought us a healthy portion. Cozy wood booths and a full bar, great service!

17.description: Hate to do this but on our recent trip we were not very satisfied at all.  My daughter ordered lasagna and it was cold in the middle.  Microwaved?  We mentioned it and they said they would have a new one out immediately.  This one was frozen still in the middle.  Should have figured after getting it in 3 minutes.  DEFINITELY MICROWAVED.Beware!The pizza has never impressed me and this time it impressed me even less.  Tasted like tomato soup as the pizza sauce.The Rueben was pretty good, would get again.  My wife liked her sausage sandwich.  I guess i would say beware of things that might be microwavable, because thats what is preparing them.

10.description: Grew up on Fox's, even worked there as a teen.  I can honestly say, this place does not run the same without Mrs. Fox, or Mike Lymon for that matter. This isn't the same quality of food you remember from 'back in the day'. Salad never arrived, but was on the bill, and quickly removed when pointed out.BBQ chicken pizza is touted a sa New Menu Item- bland chicken, missing spices and cilantro.Overcooked pasta and overpriced kids meals at $7.49 lead me to believe they really don't want your dine in business!  I will stick to pizza for delivery form now on. Our waitress was friendly and we did appreciate her service, even though the salad was forgotten.

5.description: Service was so so... Had to ask where my beer order was even though she was convinced someone had sprite and we were missing a lemonade (we we not).  Buffalo chicken sandwich was fairly tasty - fries not so much (some tasted freezer burned). Blue cheese burger was OK, just nothing we would go out of my way to order again.Chopped salad was huge and a bit warm, but tasted fine. Pizza was insanely greasy, although the sausage had a nice amount of caraway seeds.  Unfortunately the crust was soggy, Place overall was not very clean and nothing the 15 of us would go out out of our way to come back to.The ratings and comments that led us here, definitely do not match reality.

3.description: This was the worst pizza, I have ever had.  The restaurant was so cold, we ask for heat was told it was, even the cooks said they were cold. I will never come back

35.description: Grew up on Fox's pizza. Employees and their services are great here. five stars all the way.

19.description: Ill admit the thin crust was smaller than I usually prefer, but they make up for it with the sauce and the sausage, they add some sort of special seasoning that makes it taste really good, idk what it is but i really enjoy it, it's a beverly staple, so if youre down in the area it's worth checking out

28.description: Freaking love this place!I've only eaten in the restaurant a few times (the burgers and salads are fantastic).Mostly, I get pizza delivery or pick-up. Oh man, their pizza is so greasy good and the crust is so thin and it's just perfect! I usually opt for sausage and green peppers, but sometimes I just like plain cheese. The sausage is "real" and the green peppers are always fresh. If you're starving, pick it up yourself.... they are quick and all business. If you're lazy, have a nice, thoroughbred Southside irish kid deliver it for you. Either way, you won't be disappointed.

45.description: Best pizza ever!!  I have been getting Fox's pizza since I was a kid.  Even when I lived out of state I would also return to Fox's.  My visits were not complete unless I had Fox's.  The one in Oak Lawn is generic.  The real Fox's is the Beverly location.

33.description: Good thin crust pizza and somehow it does a really good job of inspiring loyalty/nostalgia.  I grew up listening to fond stories from my dad of how he'd waste whole afternoons watching the employees toss the pizza dough in the air.  I never really thought much of the pizza as a small kid, but now I get really excited at the chance to eat there just for that reason.

43.description: I've been wanting to try the Fox for the longest time. I kept hearing good things about it. So when I actually wasn't on Western for the sole purpose of drinking, my mom and I decided to pop it.We started with an appetizer of fried mushrooms. They came to the table with a side of melted (Velveeta?) cheese and not the usual side of ranch. Is this a tradition? Because growing up on the south side, I never had an inkling to put cheese on breaded mushrooms (cauliflower, maybe). But that's just me. The mushrooms themselves were very good, just disappointed in the dipping sauce.Trying to flag down the waitress was another task in itself. Where she went, I don't know. But it would have been nice to get a drink refill or the aforementioned side of ranch.   On to the main event..the pizza. The Fox's pizza is probably one of the saltiest I have ever ate. It really took away from the crust and sauce, which in itself was good. I liked the pizza, just be prepared to drink a lot of water back home.Overall I liked the atmosphere of the place. Everyone was laid back, no children running around and people into their own thing. Typical city establishment which I love.FYI: don't fully pull your car up to the building. Doing so will mean someone will double park behind you, leaving you blocked in. Yes, I learned the hard way for about 20 minutes.

2.description: When you order take out pizza or delivery it is just ok, however when you dine in the pizza is made in the back kitchen and taste like Indian food served in a diaper. In the past year I've ordered three times and it never fails to disappoint. If you want to pay home run in prices for little cedars pizza this may be the place for you.

18.description: This is classic Chicago, no thrills pizza, plenty of cheap meat options (butt steak, corned beef etc,) great burgers, a full bar, closely packed, always busy, neighborhood favorite. Fox's is not going to blow anybody away with their menu, it is what it is, a cheap place to grab a meal with friends. What does Fox's have?Phenomenal pizza. Be warned going forward that it will be thin and it will be greasy. However, the cheese is succulent, the crust is burnt to perfection, and the sausage will melt your mind! I don't want to sit here and pretend that Fox's deserves to be in the "best pizza" conversation, but it is a leading candidate for "best of the rest!" Couple that with a lively environment, friendly wait staff, and the feeling of being a part of a neighborhood and you have one of the best pizza JOINTS in the city.

41.description: I wish I could give this place 2 and 1/2 stars, because it isn't quite 2 but it isn't quite 3. I've been coming here for 30 years, so obviously it's not a BAD choice. But.....On the plus side, the thin crust pizza is pretty good. Not great, by South Side Chicago standards, pretty good. Their recipe hasn't changed in decades. They put pieces of veggies on the pizza--not just little tiny shards. So if you like onions, you get ONIONS. The dining room atmosphere is classic. It's small, with nothing but booths. Very intimate and warm. I have never had bad service here. It seems that the waitstaff really likes interacting with customers, but they're not in your face. Just very concerned that you get what you want and enjoy your meal. On the minus side, they recently updated their menu--including the price column! My lunch yesterday was 30% higher than usual...Italian beef sandwich with sides of baked beans (their signature side) and fries, and two beers, set me back $18. Granted, Chicago has a high food tax, but I thought this was a little high. Not outrageously so, but still.Then, the food wasn't at its usual calibre....the Italian beef is usually heaped with meat, and this amount was okay but not great. My friend ordered the Irish Rueben (everything at Fox's is Irish) which is usually a great choice, but this was...so-so.  Maybe the chef was having an off day. I should also mention that my friend always starts with a bloody Mary, and she always requests celery--that's as standard as asking for an olive with a martini--and they always say, "Sorry! No celery!" I know that's a small thing, but drink recipes include garnishes. The biggest issue with Fox's is the parking. It's really limited. Street parking is limited to one hour, and then you have to move your car. You could take a chance, but we have maniac parking police in this neighborhood who start salivating at the possibility of giving out tickets. There's a small lot next to the building, which accomodates two rows of cars....but the row next to the building is boxed in, and patrons who do the boxing in get annoyed if they have to come out to release you from the lot.  You can park down the street, but no one wants to walk half a block, so if you score a good spot be prepared for an unpleasant confrontation. Fox's is reliably decent, although the price hike plus the parking means that you have to really WANT to come here.

52.description: So, came here with my buddy who recommended this place. (I always fall for it.) Needless to say, not impressed. Actually sub-impressed. We were sat in an uncomfortable wooden booth and waited about ten minutes before a waitress came over, understandable because they were busy, but for some reason the place has a weird feel to it. It's dark, the booth next to us had kids climbing all over everything and the parents weren't doing a thing about it, and the clientele almost all looked like they were depressed in some order or another. Like the people with the kids just looked like they hated eachother and were on the brink of divorce. Maybe that's why they were out for pizza with the kids because nobody wanted to cook for the other because they hated eachother. I don't know, but this was the feeling that I was getting. Then I look to my left, and there it is. Some old ass group of people that couldn't hear anything the other was saying so they had to yell it, not to mention they all smelled like a nursing home. So this could've been their field trip or something, but just saying it's the feel of the place that got to me. As for the food, gosh. If you guys have ever had Jack's frozen pizza, this is it in fresh form. It's soggy, the sauce is Chef Boy-r-dee, and the pepperoni is sparse. The "hot" wings we were served were over cooked in the deep frier, and didn't have any sauce. So, overall it's poopy. It gets two stars. I save the one stars for just god awful places. But this place came close. Bad pizza, mediocre service, terrible atmoshphere.

50.description: Fox's Beverly Pub serves one of The Best thin crust pizza's on the Southside. I love just cheese and sauage, ask for it to be a little well done so the edges come carmelized. Among folks that grew up in Beverly there's lot's of conjecture on better or best thin crust pizza out here, but in reality no one does a better pizza than Fox's. Most that disagree are lost sheep that have grown tired of really great pizza and have scurried off to other dumps outside Beverly, but they are dead wrong and if they were on death row awaiting execution they would utter their last confession and secretly ask for Fox's pizza before they were escorted to the lethal injection veiwing booth. Don't be fooled by people here who complain of service or other items on the menu. The only reason to go to Fox's is thin crust pizza. The sausage is tinged with a hint of fennel and the sauce is thin and not sweet or salty. Great pizza will always prevail over cracker crust imitations. Fox's serves great pizza. Amen

4.description: On 23 December 15 I was and still am really P.O.'d that after 30 plus yrs of going here a kid at the counter gets order wrong does not catch it and then thinks it's funny!!! Been coming here since the 80's.The mgr (Older lady) was the one who caught it no one ever offered to make it right just a "if you still want it you can wait 30 MORE mins and we can make you a new one." They gave someone my pizza and was going to give me their's!!! Now they have two pissed off customers. Hell I drive from downtown to get pizza here. I grew up on their pizza and to be done like this and laughed at WAS not right!! maybe I will just spread the word and see what happens. /S/   Longtime upset customer, wonder if I will ever go back!! :(

6.description: Great atmosphere, friendly service and the classics like the vegetable beef soup and the Irish Reuben make it a great repeat choice.  The price is always reasonable.

22.description: Ill admit the thin crust was smaller than I usually prefer, but they make up for it with the sauce and the sausage, they add some sort of special seasoning that makes it taste really good, idk what it is but i really enjoy it, it's a beverly staple, so if youre down in the area it's worth checking out

15.description: Outstanding thin crust pizza. The bestwaitress we could ask for. Comfortable and fun environment. So good that we ordered another pizza to take with us. Well done foxes. One of the gems on the southside. We just moved to this area and are looking for any other ideas for good thin crust on the south side of Chicago With a bar for a real CHITOWN night out!  Didn't really care for Chucks, crust too thick,  Barracos has gone downhill but heard there was another good thin crust one on Pulaski? Any comments? Suggestions?

57.description: This four-star review is brought to you courtesy of a single pizza that hit the spot at the right time...(drum roll...)...Fox's new Bruschetta Pizza!Should you make a special trip out here just to try it? Probably not (though I'm a Northsider that only makes the occasional trip south of Roosevelt). But should you happen to be in the neighborhood, in the mood for non-chain pizza, I think you'll be in a pleasant surprise.(I won't vouch for their non-Bruchetta pizza for now.)Other details:Small parking lot adjacent to location.Restaurant with small bar area and at least one non-flat screen television tuned to whatever sports might be on at the time.

20.description: I tried this place three times now for their Julienne salad.  The first two times I was really impressed with the presentation and freshness of their salad. This past weekend I chose to call in for a salad and the chef must have been counting pennies. My salad was made from the core from a head of lettuce. Not one green leaf. The lettuce & tomatoes were old and it was the worst salad I've has in quite a while.  Very disappointed

36.description: An original neighborhood classic. The thin crust pizza is consistently the best. Unfortunately it's getting pricey...look for the coupons.

14.description: OMG, get the Steak House Burger. It's out of this world.If I told you how long I've been going to Fox's, it would give away how old I am (groan). Fox's is a neighborhood institution, the first place you think of when you want to get a bite after work, or when friends are in town, or... for no reason at all. There are places that are trendier, or seat bigger groups (seating is all booths, and the bigger ones seat 4), but for comfort food, you can't beat Fox's.And before I forget - in season, the Sox games are on TV. That, with the good food, makes it pretty much perfect.

3.description: I have a misfortunate experience with shops on the southside to begin with. Came in for a pedi. No approximate wait time given. Man points to me for the chair. The tub had visible dirt, so I asked if he could clean it again (I did not see anyone clean it). He shook his head no. Needless to say, my toes are not done.

1.description: This place is vile. Went for a no chip and the woman ruined my nails. Disgusting. The products they use are filthy as well. Stay away. This place is an infection waiting to happen. Worst ever.

2.description: I will never come here again. I posted a pic to show how swollen my finger is after coming here.

5.description: Came here because 3d nails down the street was full and so were they.. I waited patiently for 30 mins because I reaally needed my nails done. However, after the wait, I was pretty disappointed. Because they were so busy, they really didn't pay attention to detail on my nails. I had to point out things like cracks on my nail, my nails being uneven lengths or the polish that she left on my skin. The staff is very friendly though!

0.description: I remember this nail salon from when it use to be in the Evergreen Plaza.  I REALLY wanted a mani pedi & my usual salon was packed so I thought I'd give it a chance.Sigh. Though everyone was extremely nice, they were very short staffed and there was unnecessary stuff everywhere. Items that should be in a storage room or break room was out on the salon floor, especially behind the nails booths at the front. It was very junky and messy. Even near where waxing is done, the garbage can where the wax strips are thrown away was overflowing and there was dried wax and hair on the floor. Ew.  I really want to like this salon only because they did such an excellent job on my mani and pedi. I got an extremely relaxing footrub.  I'm just concerned about the cleanliness of this place.

4.description: I love this place! It's clean..very good nail techs...awesome pedicure spa and reasonable prices! Lynn is the bomb on eyebrows and the staff is very friendly! Check them out..you won't be disappointed

1.description: great local place.  love the staff and their quality merchandise. very helpful here to beginners.

2.description: Can't think of a better golf shop in Chicago.  They have an extremely knowledgable staff that will help set you up with the perfect set of clubs.  They are very friendly and really take the time to talk with you and figure out exactly what set of clubs best fits your needs.  I highly recommend this shop for all your golf needs!

0.description: If you want a personalized touch, This is your golf store. Charlie is great with recommendations. The staff is knowledgeable. Good supply of demo clubs.

1.description: The best boutique in the city. This shop has it all, maternity, women's clothing, baby items that range from gear to toys to hair accessories and tons of adorable jewelry. The most adorable things you can find! The owner and employees are so knowledgeable , helpful and down to earth. They host fun events as well. Can't get enough of this place!

0.description: It's always been my dream to be able to go shopping near my house at a great boutique - and finally I can!!! Bellē Up Boutique has THE fashion pieces for every season and all the accessories to match. The entire store is so fresh and pretty, it's enjoyable just looking around (but I can never resist making a purchase). Skip the trip to the mall - and go here instead!!

3.description: Bridget came to my home and the tan was incredible!  Pricing was great as well... definitely will hit  her up again.

1.description: Bridget is the best!! I have been to quite a few places for spray tans, but since I have found You Glow Girl I haven't gone anywhere else. The spray is done in minutes and is flawless!! The coloring is always perfect and gives the perfect amount of tan. I have recommended You Glow Girl to many people & all have had positive outcomes as well!! Definitely will be going back.

2.description: This was my first time getting a spray tan and I was super nervous to say the least. I have seen so many girls who get a spray tan and look orange after- but this was not the case with You Glow Girl! The tan was natural looking and they were no streaks or "orangeness" at all. The price is also very affordable which is great considering the quality. Bridget is very personable and friendly and makes you feel comfortable right away. Also, the You Glow Girl space is so cute and cozy!

0.description: She is awesome and does a great job! Will be going back to her for sure ! She is professional and does to make you feel uncomfortable at all.

4.description: The spray tan was natural looking and flawless. Price is extremely low for the quality of service! I would never go to another person. Great experience!!  Just opened a store in Evergreen Park looks, very glamorous!

1.description: Mr. Sub is a weekly staple of mine.  The sandwiches are basic and reliable.  The garlic fries with cheese are delicious.  Word to the wise, be prepared for mediocre service and errors in your order- this is all part of the Mr. Sub experience.  They may not always get your order right, but when they do, it tastes just like it did last time you got your correct order.  Their bread is fresh and delicious.  They have great hours and a drive thru.  Other Mr Subs in the area don't compare.

9.description: Awesome subs, great hours!  The pastrami and pastrami/corned beef combo sandwiches are OUTSTANDING!

23.description: 4 words. Ham sandwich. Cheese fries.Oh yeah, and no onion - I like it, it doesn't like me. "Mr. Submarino", as I like to call it, rocks. Whether it be a lunch in between classes, or a late night stop after a long night of work, this place is always satisfying. Granted, I do get nothing other than subs and fries. I have had the broccoli cheese soup before (to dunk my sandwich in, that is), and it is good only for that. Not too tasty on its own. But hey, if you gotta stick with what you know, Mr. Submarino knows subs. And cheese fries. But what are these garlic fries everyone speaks of?? I must have them.

5.description: Best food for the late night enebriated stupors. Get the pizza puffs and garlic fries. So good and greasy.

25.description: The shit here is just awful.  Gyro meat looks (and tasted - eeeww!)  like rancid pimento loaf and those garlic fries - What in the hell? There was like a whole can of Old Bay-ish spice dumped all on it.  It is not good.  And there was no garlic or butter anywhere on that.  And does Alpo make pizza puffs now? I actually returned all of my food.  And they must be really used to that, because it was really easy to get my money back and there are postings of the return policy prominently displayed in the drive-thru.

12.description: First of all EW.  Walked in here starving and the place was a mess.  Food all over the floor, messy tables etc.  But it was late and I was working and didn't have much of an option.  Order my food from the cashier guy who was a total ASSHOLE he was rude, and acted like everyone in there was a complete bother to him.  I was starving so I didn't care.  There was a HUGE cicada in there which a customer caught and threw outside.  I even let that go.  I sit down, open my sandwhich, take a bite, and BAM there goes MR. COCHROACH crawling across the table.  I just about puked.  I threw my sandwhich away and walked out.  OH and the pickle I ordered and attempted to eat was freaking brown.  LONG STORY SHORT....stay away from here.  Before I left I looked behind the counter and it too was filthy, place is nasty and I plan to call the board of health.

21.description: I resisted this place for a long time, but my kids convinced me to try it and the food is good. Plus it's open when everything else in Beverly closes up.

16.description: Love me some Mr Sub! Sandwiches are awesome, and everything is sliced fresh so you know you aren't getting some pre packaged tomatoes that were sliced a week ago. Turano delivers fresh bread every morning! You can get any sub hot which tastes (and smells) so amazing. Prices are super reasonable and for an extra $1.99 you can add a drink and fries, chips, or soup. I hate leaving some sandwich places having just spent $10 and I'm still hungry. Not here!

17.description: My "Mr. Sub" addiction rolls on. And this location in Beverly seems to be the location we hit up most. Unlike some locations, the french fries here are crinkle cut. Always salted to perfection. Our order always comes out correct despite that helpless feeling of "you know they're going to screw something up."My only gripe is the parking lot is super small due to the fact that it's located in the tiniest strip mall ever. You must be cautious when exiting the drive-thru onto Western because parked cars generally prevent you from seeing traffic heading towards you.Otherwise, not much else to say besides this Mr. Sub rocks my world.

10.description: Well decided to try this place again.  For some reason the people that work at night do not understand the words NO ONIONS.  Sandwich was supposed to be hot as well.  Oh well I tried.

11.description: BUGGY FOOD!!!!   On 11/21/14 I got a reg. Mr. Sub to go.  Got home, ate half of it when I noticed 2 ants on my plate!!!!  Just read another review that said a cockroach ran across her table while eating inside.  BEWARE of the extra unwanted protein in your food!  Calling the Health Dept. on Monday.

26.description: I adore the garlic fries. I can go there and only get the garlic fries. In fact, I want to go NOW and get some garlic fries. They have a drive thru and that's what's up.

22.description: My "Mr. Sub" addiction rolls on. And this location in Beverly seems to be the location we hit up most. Unlike some locations, the french fries here are crinkle cut. Always salted to perfection. Our order always comes out correct despite that helpless feeling of "you know they're going to screw something up."My only gripe is the parking lot is super small due to the fact that it's located in the tiniest strip mall ever. You must be cautious when exiting the drive-thru onto Western because parked cars generally prevent you from seeing traffic heading towards you.Otherwise, not much else to say besides this Mr. Sub rocks my world.

0.description: Way better than Subway.Sandwiches are very substantial and you have more choices than just cold cuts.Plus they have fries, breaded mushrooms , chicken tenders... Why do people even subway?

20.description: memories. great food, awesome employees, open late, can walk through the drive-thru, and too many stories from being young and stupid with friends in here. thank you, mr. sub.

19.description: 4 words. Ham sandwich. Cheese fries.Oh yeah, and no onion - I like it, it doesn't like me. "Mr. Submarino", as I like to call it, rocks. Whether it be a lunch in between classes, or a late night stop after a long night of work, this place is always satisfying. Granted, I do get nothing other than subs and fries. I have had the broccoli cheese soup before (to dunk my sandwich in, that is), and it is good only for that. Not too tasty on its own. But hey, if you gotta stick with what you know, Mr. Submarino knows subs. And cheese fries. But what are these garlic fries everyone speaks of?? I must have them.

2.description: If I could give half a star I would and only because they got the cheese sticks right!!!So I order 3 sandwiches all on wheat and 2 with extra mayo and oil, cheese sticks and a side of Giardiniera. I get my order and they are all on white. The guy tells me "Well I didn't take your order"...Ok (yes he was right) but you had to know what my order was to prepare it! So I get the corrected order and it's not correct!...they left off the mayo!!! So the guy says "OMG just give em the mayo packages...REALLY?? Since I was so frustrated and I didn't feel like waiting, I took the packages and left. Well I had to come back for my Giardiniera... :-( I will not be coming back here again!!! I've been going here for over 15 years! I guess I'll have to travel a little further for another location!

18.description: Garlic Fries. Great Price. Has never failed when out late on Western Ave.

13.description: The only place in these United States where a food establishment in a strip mall has a drive thru in the front.  Mr Sub, as the local youths call it, is the cheap fast food joint that you go to if you:A) Have had way too much to drinkB) Don't have a lot of coin in your pocketC) Looking for something quick and somewhat tastyD) All of the aboveTurns out that Mr Sub is a Canadian chain, and this is their version of Subway.  There are a plethora of both hot and cold subs, and even some seafood- wasn't that brave.  Was told to go with a pizzapuff, but instead opted for a cold corn beef.  Everything about the sandwich- bread, lettuce, tomatoes, cheese- were fine.  The meat was just there, no taste, but then again, for 4 bucks you know exactly what you are getting.  The pizza puff on the other hand was quite tasty, think of a deep fried hot pocket.This Bizarro Subway is definitely worth checking out if looking for late night memories with friends you will probably forget in the morning.

4.description: Great joint overall! The grub never fails to satisfy me, and this place is a great hangout.

24.description: yep, definitely satisfied my craving for anything edible at 3AM on saturday night / sunday morning.  we waited on foot in the drive through (only the drive through was open), surrounded by cars - breathing exhaust, but it was well worth the wait.  roast beef, mr. sub, cheese fries, and garlic fries.  can't be beat!

6.description: The food is very delicious here. The must have is the garlic fries which are awesome. My son loves the roast beef sandwich from here and says it's the best roast beef from any sandwich shop. Also, it's nice supporting small business compared to the larger chains. I get the combo which is delicious. Never had anything bad from here.

15.description: Best hot dogs. And for a great price for $2.50. Very fast at cooking. Great shakes. Is a great neighborhood fast food joint.

7.description: I Love Mr Submarine...I usually get fries and they make them fresh...Today they tasted like they were warmed or heated..I eat a lot of French fries and that was a bad batch..idk....I guess I'll just stick to the king turkey.. No fries..

8.description: The existence of 1-star reviews tells you a lot about the average American's expectation of quality food from a place that gets most of its business after bars close.It's decent quality fast food. The Beverly location in particular has been managed by the same guy since I was in high school two decades ago. I've eaten here countless times and its consistently good and about the best your going to get at 2AM on a Tuesday.

3.description: Great food for great prices very nice to big crowd of kids only flaw is no free refills but overall great joint

14.description: Their turkey subs are hands down way better than Subway or Jimmy John's. I grew up with this place and I have always had a good experience with their food.

0.description: Our family loves this place for our hair cuts. It's not just a salon for women, they give great men's hair cuts.  But the thing that stands out most to me is how great they are with kids.  Our kids have all gotten their hair cut here, and the stylists are patient and gentle with the kids, even with irritable and squirmy toddlers.  Their new shop is very pleasant and bright.

28.description: Yet another establishment that treats the people they serve as if they don't like them. If you do not care for a certain group of people, please STOP opening businesses in their communities! From the moment I walked in, I was greeted with the manager yelling at me, "YES? YOU WANT NAILS DONE?!" Perhaps he did not appreciate that I was ending a cell phone "business" call as I walked in. I was clearly, yet quietly, saying "goodbye" to the person on the phone. Yet, when I held up my finger to signal to the rude manager to wait just one moment, he repeated his question to me as if I did not understand. I should have left then but I decided to give it a try since I really needed my nails done. When I noticed that the sterilized bag of tools had NOT changed colors (salon's dirty little secret of not using clean tools) I asked the tech about it and she said, "I don't know why they don't change but I put it in the machine." So I decided I would not let her using the cuticle cutter on me. Anyway my no chip is just OK as it chipped the next day. P.S. My dear sweet grandmother recently tried the salon...and she hardly finds fault in anyone...but she, too, said that she didn't like the way the manager talked to her. THIS PLACE NEEDS TO SET UP SHOP SOMEWHERE FAR FAR AWAY!  That is why the place was sooooo empty I guess!

1.description: Classy nails has a really nice facility and decent customer service. We made an appointment for four pedicures and were all seated together. The pedicures were well done and I think the prices are fair.

9.description: Kayo was amazing! He did a French acrylic nail fill for me. It only took him 35 minutes to complete and I had 2 repairs. He was fast & accurate. The spa was clean, beautiful and tranquil. The chairs in the spa, at the drying table, and waiting area are very comfortable.  I had a great experience. For credit card payments there's a $1.00 fee added to the check. Prices were comparable to most salons. Basic Acrylic fill was $16/ repairs are $3 each and French design is $5.00 extra.

29.description: Love this place!!!  It's soooo peaceful and everyone is sooooo nice When stopping in, ask for "Angie"

23.description: Awful no chip application!!! I went here to get a no chip manicure and my nails chipped within the same week. I went to get my nails done again with no chip polish and my thumb nail chipped the next day. I went back in and they fixed my nail. As I was getting my nail fixed Angie asked who had done my nails and I pointed to where the guy sat. She told me that he didn't put an undercoat on and this is why my nails were chipping. I left after getting my nail fixed and in the morning when I woke up I had two more nails that were chipped. I called the salon after work to see if all of my nails could be repainted since the worker forgot to put the undercoat on to avoid having to drive out of way every time my nails chipped. I was told "no, we will only fix the nails that are chipped." I explained the situation to the manager about the undercoat not being applied and he said that I could just come in every time my nail chipped to get if fixed and he also blamed it on me washing my hands too much. What type of sense does that make?! This shop is beautiful on the inside and the workers are nice but they do not know how to apply no chip polish. If you like no chip don't waste your money because this place is expensive. I was also charged $3 for a "broken" nail when I was getting a fill in that was an overlay. They didn't add a fake nail but charged me for what they were going to do anyway. I'm done with this place! The 1 star is because the shop is clean and the utensils are sterile and ambiance is great.

5.description: I just went back for the Tangerine Dream pedicure and it was just as good as the 1st time I had it!  I'll be back!

25.description: I went here to get my nails done and I'll be honest this place is so beautiful and so relaxing but the workers are pretty rude. The guy who was doing my nails asked me 20 questions about my boyfriend, asked me  out and gave me his number. Then insisted that I buy some moisturizer every 10 minutes. My no chip nails came off within a week and weren't even filled in properly. Any way this place is absolutely gorgeous they have so many nail polishes to choose from, but they just need friendlier workers there.

12.description: Love this place!!!  It's soooo peaceful and everyone is sooooo nice When stopping in, ask for "Angie"

21.description: They have such a high turnover, this place is absolutely horrible!!!!! The manager has a horrible attitude, doesn't care about you and doesn't care if he's putting you in any type of pain, but he's in a rush to do you so he can get more people so you can make more money you're not going to hurt me in the process so you can make more money are you going to get sued and  you'll be paying me money.

16.description: Wow!! The Tangerine Dream pedicure was amazing! Loved the warm neck pillow, chair massage and soothing foot wrapping treatment!! I will be returning!! Also, the atmosphere was absolutely beautiful: lobby area tile-gorgeous, relaxing music, water fall and sky with clouds overhead mirage!

17.description: I love this place!!!! It so relaxing and clean. They disinfect everything. You can get different types of pedicures some with herbs some with calming scents and then the massages are amazing. Once you give them a chance you will be hooked just like i am!!!

10.description: I went here to get my nails done and I'll be honest this place is so beautiful and so relaxing but the workers are pretty rude. The guy who was doing my nails asked me 20 questions about my boyfriend, asked me  out and gave me his number. Then insisted that I buy some moisturizer every 10 minutes. My no chip nails came off within a week and weren't even filled in properly. Any way this place is absolutely gorgeous they have so many nail polishes to choose from, but they just need friendlier workers there.

11.description: This place looked really great and peaceful. When I walked in I was excited for my service. I wanted to get a mani and pedi with my cousin. But I wasn't even able to get service because they said my cousin was too big to fit in the chairs. They were really rude about it as well. They were very rude and basically told us to go somewhere else. No apologies or anything. Craziest thing is She was able to fit in the chair. They just not used to thick women so if you're thick don't go to this place!

26.description: Ok I saw the negative reviews and I had to make my own. I love this place, I live in Chicago and I am away at college so I come here only during breaks. I started coming here in the summer when it opened and the manager and some of the employees are familiar with me and know me so I have never personally experienced bad service. NOW I have seen the manager get rude with customer's once or twice but I associated that with him being particular about nail displays but recently he isnt as bad. Every time I've had a pedicure here it has been excellent, even the basic goes above and beyond most other nail salons' basic. The decor and nail polish selection is excellent I would say it is about 300 nail polishes there and all nice brands like OPI, Essie and China Glaze. That alone makes a difference. The only con I would say is the wait if you go without an appointment. Can wait for hours and even with appointment you will wait. I will continue to go here.

27.description: Absolutely terrible customer service!! Do not go here. I have given this place a chance now three times and they have failed every single time. I'm done going here and bringing my business elsewhere.

0.description: I have been here 3 times and I will continue to come. I have always had pedicures done. The pedicure room is very nicely decorated with nice blue calming lights around the ceiling area. The nail area is well designed and their polish selection is large as any other shop. I love the lighting in this salon. When getting a pedicure done they lower the lights and atmosphere is very calming. Eyebrow stations are nice and clean. Nothing messy. Here the only caveat...because English is not their first language communication can be very difficult. But a clear understanding can be meet with clear direction even using the menu services which the provide. Which leads me lastly to their menu selection.  I had the Peppermint Hot Chocolate Pedicure - smelled so good! They also have herbal Organics, Hot Stone, Tangerine Dreams, Chocolate Deluxe and Lavender Relief. Woooweeee love it!!

20.description: The physical space is beautiful. One of the best I've seen and it's on par with what you might expect of a downtown spa. The service needs improvement. It was my first time, so I asked if they had a fee schedule. The reply was, "I don't know." Then he walked away. Ummm, really?! If he didn't understand what I wanted (there was no language barrier), he should've asked. For a Friday, early afternoon, they did not have enough techs working.  I purposely came before post school/work hours. But I still waited longer than I should've.  They had a good polish selection. This is important ro me, considering so many places assume that everyone likes neon colors.  The tech was decent. I don't like when they just tap your leg for you to move. Say something or make eye contact. She went through the motions rather quickly, which wasn't pleasant because it seemed rushed.  However, I appreciated the hot towel foot treatment. I also appreciated the dim lighting and running water sounds from the waterfall. Overall, a decent pedicure. I was rather shocked when she motioned for me to get my things and head to the front. I don't think I've ever not been helped to the dryer area!! So I fumbled to gather my things as she started to clean the bowl, prior to me standing up. Hmmm, I'm not sure if I will return. Possibly another tech may be a little more enjoyable.

19.description: I have been going to this salon since they opened, the space is beautiful, but service has gone down hill.  My first red flag today was when I walked in and the manager was yelling at a customer who was asking him to stop being rude.  My 2nd was when I asked for a bottle of water that I'm pretty sure was refilled with tap water. No, thanks.  I sit for my pedi and the guy gets up and grabs a sanding tool to use on my cuticles, on my toes! After I told him to stop, he started using the cuticle scissors and cut my toe, bad enough that it bled. He gets up again and comes back with an unlabeled bottle with blue liquid to pour on it.  That was it, I walked out. Terrible. Never again. Oh, and now they add a dollar to your charge if you use a credit card.

2.description: I wish I could give them negative stars.  How do I get my money back??Worse manicure I've ever received.  My polish started peeling off about two hours after I left the salon. Four hours later, I only had one finger nail painted. Everything else had peeled off.  I should have known what to expect when the technician did not remove my previous polish, rather he buffed it out. I don't know if this is the way it's done at some places however in all the years I've been getting my nails done, this was the first time that was done. I'm already not a fan of buffing my nails as it leaves them weaker and I'm pretty sure I mentioned it to him but he kept going.   As for the rest of the experience, it was neither here nor there. This place is huge. They do manicures in the front and pedicures in the back room which had dim lights and what seemed to be a koi waterfall. I did enjoy their vast nail polish selection and the warm lotion. That too was a first, and welcomed.

18.description: Second time I've tried to go here and they don't open on time - left more than 20 minutes after posted opening time. Will not be going back.

13.description: Was a great place when it FIRST opened. I've been going here for over a year and the service has gone down. I recommended this place to everyone and now I regret that decision.The manager is very rude. He does not greet you when you walk in , rather he barks at you to sign in. It seems as if they need to hire more nail techs because everyone is always in a rush to finish.My recent manicure and pedicures have been terrible because the technician just rushes through the whole process.

4.description: Love this place but unless your getting mani and pedi your gonna wait! Bad customer service!! Shouldn't have to wait an hour!! Love Henry the best! But wait time too long!!!

24.description: I love this place!!!! It so relaxing and clean. They disinfect everything. You can get different types of pedicures some with herbs some with calming scents and then the massages are amazing. Once you give them a chance you will be hooked just like i am!!!

6.description: Decent work but way too expensive in comparison to other nail salons in the area. They aren't doing anything above & beyond that warrants the extreme upcharge. I've gone 2x. Was charged $50 for a gel overlay & polish. Next time was $40 for a fill-in & polish. I'm done.

22.description: I'm rating 0 stars. This was my first time coming here and I was very impressed with how nice it was. They had a lot of different nail polishes to choose from. I was feeling good until I sat at the pedi spa with Tony. Even though it wasn't crowded Tony rushed through my pedicure and manicure. I didn't know Tony had only put 1 coat of polish on my toes until I got home. I'm sure this will be deleted.

15.description: They have such a high turnover, this place is absolutely horrible!!!!! The manager has a horrible attitude, doesn't care about you and doesn't care if he's putting you in any type of pain, but he's in a rush to do you so he can get more people so you can make more money you're not going to hurt me in the process so you can make more money are you going to get sued and  you'll be paying me money.

7.description: Went there yesterday the prices are high and I have gone to cheaper places and they have done a better job. She didn't get all the hang nails and there in nail polish on my skin she didn't clean up after her self. One of nails wasn't filed right so it looks crooked. She was rough and was moving way to fast that's why she did a half ass job. My wife got a full set gel and they look like weird like there is air bubbles in them idk even know why she has gotten gel nails before and I have never seen them look that before. I wouldn't recommend it we its expensive and they do a half ass job.

8.description: Horrible service. My friend and I went in and the lady doing her feet had an attitude with the guy doing my feet. They ended up getting into a full out shouting match!!! Then, the lady doing my nails was irritated because I told her not to use the drill on my nail bed. The service was lazy, mediocre, and not at all relaxing! I'll never go back!!!

3.description: The physical space is beautiful. One of the best I've seen and it's on par with what you might expect of a downtown spa. The service needs improvement. It was my first time, so I asked if they had a fee schedule. The reply was, "I don't know." Then he walked away. Ummm, really?! If he didn't understand what I wanted (there was no language barrier), he should've asked. For a Friday, early afternoon, they did not have enough techs working.  I purposely came before post school/work hours. But I still waited longer than I should've.  They had a good polish selection. This is important ro me, considering so many places assume that everyone likes neon colors.  The tech was decent. I don't like when they just tap your leg for you to move. Say something or make eye contact. She went through the motions rather quickly, which wasn't pleasant because it seemed rushed.  However, I appreciated the hot towel foot treatment. I also appreciated the dim lighting and running water sounds from the waterfall. Overall, a decent pedicure. I was rather shocked when she motioned for me to get my things and head to the front. I don't think I've ever not been helped to the dryer area!! So I fumbled to gather my things as she started to clean the bowl, prior to me standing up. Hmmm, I'm not sure if I will return. Possibly another tech may be a little more enjoyable.

14.description: Came in and no one approached us yet we still signed in. Went looking for polish and still no one said anything. I'm talking to one person, a man whispers in her ear then she walks away. Next another woman who they say is the manager says they only have small chairs they can't do a pedicure but they can do my nails. No thank you, me and my friends left out of there. Not once did I see the chairs because they were in the back, but I get regular maintanence on my hands and feet & no one has ever said such a thing. I am a plus size woman no denying that but even if the chairs were too small there is an etiquete to everything.
