Many of my friends with large bottoms go there so I know that wasn't the case but their loss or should I say losses.

1.description: After disappointment with them not having Calimari and a slightly longer wait then they said it would be both my wife and I where super happy with our meal. The Bruschetta was perfect, my Aglio olio with broccoli and shrimp was outstanding and my wife was very happy with her ravioli. We are happy this all worked out.

9.description: Really good neighborhood pizza place...

12.description: I had a taste for pizza the afternoon of the Oscar telecast. I tried Pizza Hut, but they were too busy to take my order. So I checked out the Grub Hub and saw a listing for Bella's, a restaurant in Beverly Hills, near Evergreen Park, not far from where I live. I have walked by there many times wondering what the food was like and decided to find out. I phoned in and ordered a 12" barbecue pizza and an order of Jumbo Hot Wings. Both were delicious. The wings, which were still hot even though my order came later than the one hour I was promised, were large, still on the bone, and arrived with a few small pieces of bread instead of the celery or carrot sticks some restaurants include. They also didn't come with dipping sauces. That was more a surprise than a disappointment because I had plenty of sauces. The pizza was tangy with plenty of chicken and barbecue sauce. Therefore, this restaurant was a hit, a place I will add to my list of places to revisit. I carefully removed the menu from the pizza box to save for future orders. The restaurant serves salads, pasta, sandwiches, desserts and soft drinks. They are also open until 10 p.m. daily. So, if you like Italian food check it out!

21.description: I'll add to this review after I see if I get a call from the manager as I was promised after tonight's meal. A mixed bag for sure.Well I guess it's time to finish this up. She did call the next morning, and I have to admit I didn't call back, I just didn't think it was necessary since we decided that we weren't going to go back.Very cute place on the outside, and a menu with many options. For now all I can say is if you go here, make sure you have plenty of time.Ordering was painful, it took some time and a few times repeating it back and forth, we also said we were going to eat in, they packed the stuff up to go, so we unwrapped it. I ordered a bottled water, she forgot to give it to me, so I had to go get it, I worried that she would question if I  paid for it since she didn't give us a receipt.At first we thought it was our communication skills, however the two other groups that came in had the same problem, it seems that the people right after had their order really screwed up.The food, well it was okay. I actually was enjoying my food, and when the rest of my husband's order came up we noticed the cheese on the counter so I decided to put some on my food, as I'm shaking away I noticed dark, a little chunk of something, a closer look reveals that it has wings, ick a fly.Okay, realistically that could happen anywhere, I pointed it out to her and what I expected to have happen here was for her offer to remake my food, or it would have been just as easy to make what I had left which was half a calzone, but instead she said that they'd give us a credit after I speak to the manager, which of course wasn't in.As I said, this could have happened anywhere, it was the waiting to get it resolved the next day that bugged me (how ironic) I don't know if they don't trust their employees to make a judgment call on a remake of food or a credit, or whether they needed to watch the tape to make sure I didn't slip the fly into the cheese.If the food were stupendous it might be worth dealing with, but since they're so many choices, I just didn't bother taking the time to follow up.

16.description: I got to admit, the food is good, a little pricey, but good.. Ambiance is ok. Just be prepared to wait. By the time I left, I did my taxes, completed a business plan, and wrote out my 5, 10, and 20 year goals.

17.description: We had guests stop over last night so we ordered a football pizza, which is always excellent, and we had rib tips and also tried the Pasta Aglio Olio with Broccoli. It was incredible. Perfect garlic taste and broccoli wasn't mushy and best part was, the dinner was so huge that 4 of us were able to split it! Then we had Tiramisu and it was light and fluffy and again, perfect taste. The cocoa on top was tasty and just melted in your mouth.  Our guests were sad they lived so far away and promised every time they come over, we will order Bella's!!

10.description: 2nd time I have ordered takeout and this has happened. They say 45min get there an hour later and food is still not ready! Pizza is ok. Rib tips and smoked chicken is amazing. I wish the service was was better. There is better more consistent pizza closer, not planning on returning any time soon!

5.description: Bella's is a good restaurant. We had a spinach and pepperoni pizza with BBQ chicken. The pizza was warm and it was good. We just wish the pizza was a little bigger because it was good. The BBQ chicken was 8 pieces for 15 dollars which is pricy for chicken,but it was ok. The pizza wasn't the best I had but it wasn't bad. The interior looks like its being remodeled and you have to pay to park but we didn't. Its a ok restaurant.

11.description: This place is great! Great food..... great staff!  The ribs are to die for and the pizza is amazing! Highly recommended!

3.description: Not at All  a good place to order  from the food was cold  and needed to be warmed my children were very upset. management however needs to attend several classes on customer  service if I call to let you know that I'm not at All  satisfied with my order your job should be fixing the problem not telling me what is unfortunate and what can't happen. I thought when ordering wings ranch or  something comes with it I.j.S..... Got charged 50 cents I'm now stuck with a pizza and wings that are very distasteful and cold and I have to wait until the morning to get a refund because it's nothing that management can really do. Not to mention the driver had  just pulled off to tell management that she's far and can't come back. I mean management is management for a reason.

0.description: Really, good pizza!  Also Greek salad was very fresh and came with yummy bread.  They're on grub hub too.  Great local delivery spot!

20.description: We order from Bella's quite frequently from my office, and the only real complaint I have about them is that the fries are undercooked and the put packs of ketchup and mustard in your bag instead of actually dressing your burgers like a normal restaurant. Their pizzas, both thin crust and deep dish, are AMAZINGLY great. Thier burgers are really good as well, just on the small side for the price. But this is a place I would definately recommend to others. We have never had a bad meal from them.

19.description: I really like Bella's, and hit it at least once a week.  Here's why:1. Pizza by the slice, which is a great option for lunch or a quick snack 2. REALLY YUMMY PIZZA!3. Great, friendly service that is quick!4. The football pizza is huge, and serves a ton of people.  We had a kid's birthday party and ordered the football pizza for 20 people (12 kids, 8 adults).  It was the perfect size, we had enough food for the group (and then some), and it was like $25 which was AMAZINGLY reasonable. (also, the owners are super sweet and I like supporting local businesses)

2.description: Ordered a pizza, I was very impressed, very fresh, I felt like it was homemade, delicious. Would definitely recommend and order again from Bells's.

18.description: I love a good rack of ribs.  Normally, I get my ribs from Smok N Q in Evergreen (or Hog Wild in Midlothian).  But they are closed on Monday so I thought I'd try Bellas, as I had seen it on the train many times.  I was encouraged by the menu and, upon arrival, thought the place looked really nice.  Clearly the guys running the place are trying hard.  But . . . the ribs were terrible.  A good smoked rib has that nice pink ring around the middle.  Succulent meat that falls off the bone, etc.  These were nowhere near anything I would call "good."  They were dark gray - no pink ring.  Cooked to within an inch of their lives.  And the fries were certainly microwaved.  Gross.  I really wish I would have loved this place, since I try hard to support Beverly businesses.  But this place really missed the mark.

13.description: You know what's messed up?  I STILL supported this place because its a neighborhood restaurant regardless they take too long.  And now I'm reading the restaurant disrespecting me on my own HONEST review?  I tell you what....I WILL NEVER GO TO THIS PLACE AGAIN.  And I'll make sure no one on my block goes either. If I want to wait 45 minutes, I'll go to a real Italian restaurant in the area and trust me there are many more, all better.  Note to management, be mindful to how you respond to reviews.

4.description: OMG!! I'm really lost for words about this place I waited literally 1 hour & 37 minutes for delivery ( I live 10 minute drive from this location) my pasta was disgusting & the garlic bread I had to pay extra for was soggy not crispy at all I'm very disappointed in this place... NEVER EVER AGAIN!!!!

6.description: I've been ordering off and on from here for about a year or so. Everything I've had has been good, pizza, mostaccioli, rib tips, cheese sticks etc. But the other day I ordered the Broasted Chicken. OMG it was amazing, I was completely floored. I had delivery which was earlier than expected, the food was still hot and I'm about 3.5 miles away. The chicken was moist and absolutely delicious, seasoning was on point I can't say enough about it. It's hands down the best thing I've had here actually it was some of the best chicken I've ever had. Which kinda sucks cause I probably won't order anything else from here but that broasted chicken. I highly recommend it.

15.description: I'll add to this review after I see if I get a call from the manager as I was promised after tonight's meal. A mixed bag for sure.Well I guess it's time to finish this up. She did call the next morning, and I have to admit I didn't call back, I just didn't think it was necessary since we decided that we weren't going to go back.Very cute place on the outside, and a menu with many options. For now all I can say is if you go here, make sure you have plenty of time.Ordering was painful, it took some time and a few times repeating it back and forth, we also said we were going to eat in, they packed the stuff up to go, so we unwrapped it. I ordered a bottled water, she forgot to give it to me, so I had to go get it, I worried that she would question if I  paid for it since she didn't give us a receipt.At first we thought it was our communication skills, however the two other groups that came in had the same problem, it seems that the people right after had their order really screwed up.The food, well it was okay. I actually was enjoying my food, and when the rest of my husband's order came up we noticed the cheese on the counter so I decided to put some on my food, as I'm shaking away I noticed dark, a little chunk of something, a closer look reveals that it has wings, ick a fly.Okay, realistically that could happen anywhere, I pointed it out to her and what I expected to have happen here was for her offer to remake my food, or it would have been just as easy to make what I had left which was half a calzone, but instead she said that they'd give us a credit after I speak to the manager, which of course wasn't in.As I said, this could have happened anywhere, it was the waiting to get it resolved the next day that bugged me (how ironic) I don't know if they don't trust their employees to make a judgment call on a remake of food or a credit, or whether they needed to watch the tape to make sure I didn't slip the fly into the cheese.If the food were stupendous it might be worth dealing with, but since they're so many choices, I just didn't bother taking the time to follow up.

7.description: i've had a good sampling of most of the menu and the food is consistently good. i always order delivery, and i love how meticulously the items are packed and the friendliness of the drivers. have ordered dozens of times and have yet to have a single order arrive cold or with items missing. the entrees are big enough to share or are very good as leftovers the next day. i miss the broasted chicken but the rib tips were surprisingly good for an italian restaurant. one of these days i plan to stop in and eat there, but since their delivery is so efficient, i'll wait until the spring.

8.description: Recently wanted to shrimp scampi from there, definitely one of the best but I've had in a while.

14.description: Let's just say that good food doesn't make up for poor managment.  I was promised a gift certificate in the mail and never received it.  I'm not impressed with their un-kept promises.Maybe it's just me, but even if a restaurant has the BEST food around, but the restaurant can't keep it's promises to it's patrons - how can you be trusted?We're in Chicago - come on'... there's pizza EVERYWHERE.  A good way to stand out is to go the extra step to keep your patrons happy; customer service and satisfaction goes a LONG way.Should've kept your promises.

28.description: RACIST crowd.  As soon as I walked in there with my non-Asian friends, I heard at least two people from different sides of the room yell out ignorant remarks.  "Chinatown!" and some other a-hole exclamation.  F the reviews from both Yelp and RedEye.  I stayed a couple of minutes, but we walked out soon after the pretentious, unwelcoming vibe killed our buzz.  If I had to choose, Keegan's definitely gets my vote.

1.description: Very excited to have my grade school reunion here this Saturday - best beer garden on the South side (and perhaps the city)...

39.description: A great Southside Irish establishment. The beer garden is open all summer and is sometimes heated in the colder weather. Great drinks, great fun, unlimited popcorn, and if you get bored, you can always move to the next bar on the "Western crawl".

9.description: Going into a new neighborhood is always an interesting experience. You meet new people, hear new stories and better understand how all these neighborhoods make up the personality of Chicago. Take Cork and Kerry. When we walked in- we obviously were immediately identified as "not from the neighborhood". How was this possible? Was it our clothes? Our hair? Did I ask for my beer incorrectly? Who knew? But the first words out of the bartender's mouth was "Are you new to the area or just visiting?" So after a quick recovery, I said. "Both" and settled down at the bar for the evening. But then it became obvious how he knew we were new to the place . . . . .everyone else there knew each other. They lived in the area, worked in the area and many had been friends all of their lives. But no problem- the bartender must have decided that we were "okay" and once he started to talk to us, the mood in the place changed considerably. Cork and Kerry has a huge beer garden-perfect for hanging out in the warmer months. But the inside is nice too- carved wooden bar, stained glass windows, good looking bartenders (my fav ambiance!), clientele who must cater to off duty police and fire dept workers as everyone that we met was some kind of a civic worker, and a wide range of beers on tap. There is a large back room perfect for private parties. On the night we were there- there was some kind of a "girls night" out thing going on- which made for some really drunk women wandering around the bar, which could have been tragic if they hadn't been just so darn funny! One girl walked around the bar with her boyfriend's hand down the back of her jeans. Wasn't sure what he was doing but I'm going to chalk it up to him trying to keep her vertical!! Parking is pretty easy on Western, and since the place is a hang out for off duty cops, I 'd suggest if you are going to drink alot there- that you don't drive ( good advice for anywhere but especially here). I watched one guy get followed out of the bar and to his car where he was detoured into a waiting police car. Good for the rest of us on the road that night. Cork and Kerry may not be for everyone. But on this night- the beer was flowing, the people were friendly (once the initial shock wore off of an interloper in their midst!) and the beer garden was open and welcoming. Hello southside! I'll definitely be back!

29.description: If you come here at 11pm on a Friday, be prepared to have no drink in your hand. The asshats that were here claiming their stools or their stands won't let you get past unless you move them, and even then you're risking a bruising. Two stars? For the people that actually have a Lohan fascination, you'll find look alikes here, if that tickles your fancy. Gingers don't do it for me, sorry.Just, what ever you do, don't go to Keegan's next door. Don't bleed through there when you can't get service or ass, Keegan's is still respectable and quiet, well into last call. 1 'possibly' gin and tonic- 4 bucks. 25 cent tip for finally getting to me after waiting for nearly ten minutes.

23.description: Love the beer garden, its the only reason to go!

5.description: Wow... What can I say about this place? My husband and I walked in looking for a drink or two and were stared at like we were both giving birth to baby elephants. He's Mexican, although  very light skinned, and is often mistaken for Greek or Italian, and I'm white. Everyone else in the bar was white. Like frat boy, drinking beer out of a funnel, jäger bomb drinking white. Diversity is a no no at Cork & Kerry! If you have tan skin (not orange), you probably won't feel comfortable here. Actually if you're white and know anyone with tan-ish skin, you will immediately feel ashamed of your race.   The service absolutely sucked! The bartenders were lazy and full of attitude. Many of the bar goers were served too much, some visibly underage, very loud and annoying and others were in flip flops on a snowy, 13 degree night in Chicago - yea, it's THAT kinda bar. I would definitely skip this place!!!

31.description: You would have to go to City Hall after lunch to see more drunk city employees. Many still on the clock.

25.description: This place sucks massive brown balls....i work in the city and go there every now and then with a few colleagues that never invite me to the scene....i usually end up going anyways as i am fascinated w/ irish people....its unfortunate that i am forced to sit next to their cubicles as they keep talking about this place...i went in there and someone yelled 'hey brownie...why dont you wiggle your cute butt for me'.....totally inappropriate and i am scarred for life....this place gets an 'Eek! Methinks not' reveiw!!!

12.description: My parents live not too far from here and I have been going here for the past 15+ years.  There is a decent beer choice and endless spirits opportunities.  The bartenders have always been welcoming and the Southside crowd is always entertaining and makes me giggle.Who doesn't love popcorn?!?  There is a popcorn machine, in which you can help yourself to a basket and get some hot sauce from the bartender for an extra zing, if your heart desires.  At Christmas time, they usually go all out, which helps you get into the Christmas mood.Recently, they bought the space north of them and built a spacious second room.  Now you don't have to be on top of each other during peak hours!As for the beer garden?!?  Not so bad.  You forget that you are on Western Avenue on the Southside.This is my go to place when seeing family, for sure!

37.description: Located on the South Side of Chicago, you're entering the "south side pride" area!  This bar is one of my favorites to go to, especially during the summer, where the beer garden is huge. The bar features a ton (at least 25) different beers on tap, while providing a decent Guinness pour!  It's a great place to go and hang out, and there's no pressure to dress to impress.  In the winter, it's awfully cozy too, with plenty of hand carved wood, and stained glass windows, it's fun to hang out!  Stay away during the South Side (St. Patrick's Day) Parade, as there are many armatures and it's SO packed.

21.description: If you look at the Cork & Kerry from the outside, it looks pretty awesome. Inside, there's plenty of room and they have a great patio area. Everything you would want for an Irish bar on the South Side. By all accounts, it should be better than their neighbor next door. But this place is horrible. It seems like the local meatheads hang out here to see who can claim the title of King Asshole for the night. If you're not a regular, expect dirty looks from the regulars. I'm a Southsider and I still get treated like shit. To top it off, service is slow and rude too. I only take my friends in to experience what the mess is about, then we run next door to Keegan's for a much better time.

16.description: Wow. I had no idea that the KKK or the local skinhead youth group had opened a bar.As soon as I walked in, the mocking sounds of someone making fun of what they think an Asian sounds like came from MULTIPLE directions. Its not a bar with an asshole, its assholes with a bar around them.If you're the type of white person that enjoys going to whites only bars and maybe a cross burning later in the evening than this is the place for you. Otherwise, its probably a better idea to spend your money elsewhere.

17.description: Maybe the fact I am from the area clouds my view, but this is a good southside irish bar.  They are slow with service but as long as your not in a rush you should enjoy it.  Yes there are some local meatheads but you can get that at any bar really.Good place to go for a drink if your in the area.

10.description: On the south side of Chicago, Western Avenue bars are a part of one's life. Among the many offerings, this place is the best. Why? It's clean. It's classy. The beer garden is huge. The beer selection is great. Is this an Irish bar per se? The name indicates that it is but I've never really run into a bunch of turkey birds here (yes, I can say that, I'm Irish). I have, however, run into a good looking crowd and friendly staff. Go to the "Cork" in the summer and you may run into a White Sox coach or player as they occasionally have post-game broadcasts in the beer garden. The place has recently expanded and now it can host a party or benefit as well. To close, if I'm drinking on Western, it's probably at the Cork.

11.description: I ended up at Cork and Kerrys last night after meeting friends at Rhino just down the street. I liked Cork and Kerrys, plenty of tables for our group even though we got there at 11pm. Waitress was nice but stop coming around our table later in the night. Only had to get a drink at the bar once the whole night but I had fun and will definitely be back.One of my friends was like Blah to this place cuz there's too many 'Bro's' but I rarely pay attention to the other people around me unless they annoy me or something. Overall, had a good time. It wasn't too loud or too dark.

26.description: As Mike T. said this is a very "Beverly" bar, most of the people drinking their have lived within two miles of the place all their lives.  Don't expect to be greeted with smiles and hugs.  That being  said, on off nights it's not a bad place.  The beer garden is big and decorated like a Fridays.  They have free popcorn and sometimes order pizza for the bar.  Lots and lots of TV's to watch the Sox game.  Service is ok.  You can't get a freebie out of the bartender no matter how much you spend or tip, unless of course you went to grade school with her (about 30% of the patrons).   The beer selection is pretty good, although most people are drinking Miller Lite in a bottle so the lines get gummy.  They added a new room but I guess its for parties.  I prefer Keegan's or Dingers.

27.description: I can definitely see the scenario that Jesse laid out in the previous review happening.  The South Side Irish jock mentality at this place is strong, and can be sometimes overwhelming.  Forced sterilization of those creeps is the only answer. But as for the bar itself?  It's ok.  Buckets are the way to go for this place; ordering individual beer is just plain stupid.  The beer garden on a nice summer night is amazing.Despite the assholes there are usually some friendly faces around.No matter when you're there, you will run into someone you haven't seen in years.  It's a crapshoot on whether or not that's a bad thing.  Ignore the racist assholes, get drunk with friends.

35.description: I've only been to Cork & Kerry once.  I'll have to come here during the summer and experience the beergarden.  Other than that, it seemed like a generic and unpretentious Irish pub to me.I'll give it an extra star because a place like this on the North Side would be annoying and full of douchebags.  (See John Barleycorn.)

8.description: The  beer garden is lovely, but service is NON-EXISTANT.  It tooke 45 minutes before we were able to flag down a  waitress for our party of 5.  I tiipped the waitress $10 to ensure good service, and guess what? Never saw her again!  It doesn't cost management anything to hire waitresses since they make their money on tips.  I don't know why this establishment doesn't have more respect for its customers.7/26/13 yes, it gets worse. Beer garden nearly empty whenI arrived w/ 2 female friends. Waitress finally took order of male table next to ours, completely ignoring ours. Called after her that we wanted to place order too; no apology, no smile, borderline hostility. We had just come from Horse Thief Hollow where our waitress was super attentive and fun, so the snotty attitude here was especially obvious. It 's a shame b /c  I used to love this place.

0.description: Oh Western Bars...Lots and lots of choices all along that tiny strip of Western that puts a smile on the faces of many a person.  The place has decently priced drinks, stage, and an outdoor patio equipped with a bar.  I find that the staff does a pretty outstanding job taking care of the patrons and will go the extra mile for you.  I feel like it has a very casual ambience and it's one of my favorite bars on Western.  It is especially fun around St Patrick's Day and all the shenanigans that go along with that.  It's just a really fun bar to have a drink, or ten (if you have a designated driver of course) and you'll leave happy more often than not.  Check it out!-Papa Bear

38.description: I love the Irish feel of everything and the food is so good. Wear your fat jeans because you're going to keep ordering food.

20.description: Cork & Kerry offered a brief detour during a recent Western Avenue pub crawl.  I can't speak to the character of the place or its patrons in the evening, which some of the other reviews have called into question, but it seemed a perfectly innocent location to enjoy a pint on a Saturday afternoon.  Why "innocent"?  One of the neighborhood families had decided to host their (young) child's birthday party in the back room.  Were there not a host of taps and bottles before me, I'd have thought that I'd wandered into a Chuck E. Cheese.  But the whole concept seemed such a perfectly South Side Irish idea that it didn't bother me in the least.  Get the youngins started early, no?  I'll try Cork & Kerry again, but it loses a star for the $5 Guinness.  Guinness is good for you; you shouldn't have to pay so much to remain in good health.

19.description: Hmmm....not a very diverse group of patrons in this place. The service was friendly enough and prices were fine, but I'm not sure if I'd hangout here again. I can't put my finger on it, but it just didn't have a welcoming feel.

33.description: I had a party at Cork & Kerry last year and spent a couple times down there planning it.  Drinks are good-sized, Irish variety, and not too much $.  Inside is narrow wood filled bar and tables, leading back to the best part of the bar - the garden patio, deck.  This area is shut off by a door in the winter - but open once they put up the temp walls and heat lamps with a bar outside.  In the summer it's filled and nice for a group or even your parents.  Clean bathrooms, ok radio & jukebox, and plenty tvs.  No food, but free popcorn.  The owner is very nice and helpful and will help you with everything if you need to plan a party, and the staff was great too.  They're planning to expand to next door in the next year.  Only downside - the patrons can suck. Not all, just the uber s.side uber drunk ones.

2.description: Cork & Kerry on Western Ave is very, very tired looking.  It appears they have not done any updating in 10+ years.  The finish on the bar is gone - like down to bare wood, the restrooms have items that have needed repair for several years, the place has an overall dirty look, stools are wobbly  and the beautiful beer garden is looking old and worn out and the outdoor heaters no longer work.  What's going on?  The service is underwhelming also.  When you walk in, I agree with the other statements, you are stared at - not just by the other patrons but by the bar staff as well.  There were probably 6-8 people sitting at the bar when we arrived so it wasn't like the bartender was too busy to look up and smile or greet us.  She warmed up a bit while we were there, but when she left at the end of her shift she was replaced by a young guy who acted like we were interrupting his social life when asked for anything.  While we were there they turned off the music and turned the tv up to full volume in order to watch a football game.  Really?  I have some very nice memories of wonderful times at Cork & Kerry, but I will not be back anytime soon.

34.description: The best Irish bar on the south side. If you want a wide selection of draft beers and just want to drink, this is your place. The only challenge is to find a way home...Visit to the south side normally requires a DD.

32.description: Hanging out on the southside is much different than the northside night out.  I prefer the southside and it's unpretentious, laid back feel.  Although I am biased since I grew up on the southside. Cork and Kerry is one of the best bars to frequent, not only does the woodwork and stained glass make the pub classy, the beer garden is an awesome place to hang out in the summer...or even the fall when the heaters and tents are up.Although Cork and Kerry is reviewed here, why no Keegan's mention?  Keegan's is directly next door and when Cork and Kerry is too packed, and even when not!, it's a nice alternate.  The owners and bartenders hail from the Emerald Isle and Keegan's has a definite traditional Irish pub feel.  In fact, when I visited Ireland a bartender I met there had been to Keegan's and told me to tell the owners hi!

18.description: Cork & Kerry offered a brief detour during a recent Western Avenue pub crawl.  I can't speak to the character of the place or its patrons in the evening, which some of the other reviews have called into question, but it seemed a perfectly innocent location to enjoy a pint on a Saturday afternoon.  Why "innocent"?  One of the neighborhood families had decided to host their (young) child's birthday party in the back room.  Were there not a host of taps and bottles before me, I'd have thought that I'd wandered into a Chuck E. Cheese.  But the whole concept seemed such a perfectly South Side Irish idea that it didn't bother me in the least.  Get the youngins started early, no?  I'll try Cork & Kerry again, but it loses a star for the $5 Guinness.  Guinness is good for you; you shouldn't have to pay so much to remain in good health.

13.description: I'm not a person that usually feels uncomfortable anywhere but this place is somewhere I never and I mean NEVER need to step foot into again. Besides the fact that it's a place where your drinks are served in plastic cups, it had a smell of dirty mops when you walked into the main bar. Ordering a vodka and soda was difficult for the bartender who was not interested in serving anyone and said they didn't have Ketel One, there was a bottle of Ketel One Citron sitting right there! Not to mention he didn't use soda but did use water...really?!?! Let's just put it this way...this is not a bar that wants anything to do with diversity. I don't advise anyone of color to enter this place...it really makes me uncomfortable writing this because I know it's out there but it's been a while sense I have felt this way. My husband agreed and he's Irish...i'm done acknowledging this dump.

4.description: I was there last night and had great service from the waitress  and the bouncer that didn't need to check my ID because I looked over 21. Bastard. LoL. So I was there for a wristband party benefit for breast cancer awareness. Drinks were flowing and I had a great time. I stayed in our room most of the night and didn't venture off much. The beer garden there is pretty kick ass tho. Always has been.

24.description: Whats with the country music and unfriendly service? No actual waitresses for the backroom? And with all those cool tv's and such...plus they dont have food. Lots of space for such a waste.

6.description: I've been to roughly 1,000 bars in my life, including this one years ago as a semi-regular. I haven't been here in a while but was here last Friday for a family party. If there is a worse pour in the United States for a mixed drink I've never seen it. Brutal. I understand the "measured pour" but this was worse than that by quite a bit and in an Irish bar on Western Avenue. Not a bad place but my God, order beer or wine if you have to go. I won't be back.

22.description: I like it but just not as much as everybody else does I guess.  It is a bit narrow and cramped inside so I rarely go during the winter months.  Once the beer garden opens up, then you've got some breathing room.  The food is ok but nothing special at all.  Good but not great...I'd rather go to Keegan's down the street.

15.description: Cork and Kerry is alright - they have decently cheap drinks, a nice outdoor patio with plenty of seating (there is a bar outdoors as well), and plenty of seating indoors. However, the bar tenders are very slow and not very friendly, and the outdoor bar only has select beers/alcohol. I tried making conversation with one of them and they barely even smiled. Boring. Their shots were also out of a small plastic cup that basically makes you spill half of the drink everywhere and is very small (the shot should have been about 2 times the size of what it was). It looks nice on the outside, but the inside was not nearly as impressive.

7.description: If you look at the Cork & Kerry from the outside, it looks pretty awesome. Inside, there's plenty of room and they have a great patio area. Everything you would want for an Irish bar on the South Side. By all accounts, it should be better than their neighbor next door. But this place is horrible. It seems like the local meatheads hang out here to see who can claim the title of King Asshole for the night. If you're not a regular, expect dirty looks from the regulars. I'm a Southsider and I still get treated like shit. To top it off, service is slow and rude too. I only take my friends in to experience what the mess is about, then we run next door to Keegan's for a much better time.

36.description: Very friendly, upbeat atmosphere typifies this southside Irish pub.  And the "30-something" owner is just as friendly!  He will take the time to converse and make you feel at home.  It doesn't have a large seating area, because it's slim rectangular shape.  But it does open up into a cozy little cove once you walk past the bar.  The bar itself has been revamped with a rich mahogany finish and looks very contemporary.  Warning: it does get busy on a Saturday night - standing room only - so come early.  Then again, it's a good thing, especially if you want to be around and converse with lively Irish folk in their 20's and 30's.  You don't have too many flat screen TV's around to distract you.  So it's not a sports bar and definitely not an old man's pub.  In the summer, they have a beer garden with alot more seating room.  Definitely a place to check out while touring the Irish bars on the southside!

30.description: I'm not from Chicago but have lived on both the North Side & South Side. They are VERY different and I like aspects of both. However, when it comes to the bar scene, it seems like people are more laid back on the South Side and are there to drink/catch up with friends rather than be seen/get laid/wear a slutty tank top. This is the case with Cork & Kerry. It is neighborhood-y and people are generally friendly. I went here every Wednesday for nearly a year to meet up with friends. The bartender would give us a free drink, every third drink or so--isn't that what they are supposed to do? How come this doesn't happen more often?The beer garden is fantastic during the summer. I have not, however, tried the food, just the free popcorn.Clean bathroom too!

3.description: Nice Irish pub that serves cold beer and has a lovely beer garden.

14.description: A friend of mine from Chicago took us here to have a few drinks and enjoy the atmosphere of a neighborhood bar.  We've been here at least 4 times with my favorite visit being during St Patty's Day week.  While we were unable to come for St Patty's Day, it was still a ton of fun.  The place was packed and the bartenders were able to keep up with the business.We ordered Black & Tan's and shots of Jameson.  The vibe here is great and we had a blast every time we were here.Will I return?  If I'm in the neighborhood, you can count on it!

3.description: Excellent store for African American Greek Apparel

1.description: @ Beuloria W. I disagree that I was angry as you assert in your 10/31/15 post. I simply suggested that customers learn from my mistake, and research their purchase before buying items at a higher cost. I do not own a pair of Jordan's nor a $2500 handbag, but should I find myself in the market for such, I will definitely do my research as you suggest. I work hard for my income, as I'm sure you do as well, and I am not inclined to spend 70% more for an item if it can be acquired for less. Fair pricing is what the dispute is regarding. Just because an item is offered online, does not automatically mean the establishment is not brick and mortar(B&M). There are numerous B&M shops that utilize online services, be it minority owned or not. Nubian Nation, a minority owned business on Vincennes, carries many of the same items at a far lower cost. I'm sure his overhead is equal to, if not much higher, as this is a standalone building with more square footage than Alpha to Omega(A2O). Although price matching is not posted, when asked, he stated he would work with the customer to make the deal a fair exchange for both.  Again, as stated in my previous post, I was at an out of state conference where A2O had a table set up. The opportunity to do "Legwork" was not available. I was assured by the vendor that this was a sale price, offered for less than what was available in the store, because I inquired if the item could be purchased at the store, so that I would not have to carry it through the conference.As price is a deciding factor in my purchases, I will do my due diligence before purchasing in the future. I suggest you do the same, or just pay $2500 for that LV handbag that you could've acquired for $1750!

2.description: Horrible!!!!!! Customer service sucks, no follow-through on orders or request for merchandise. When you do re-inquire (because they didn't return your call the first time) the lady that answers the phone has a serious attitude.Perhaps if you only want what they have in-stock in front of your (no additional sizes or custom) it may be ok service. Hopefully other stores will open that sell similar merchandise and they will then treat their customers like they matter because now they don't!Won't be patronizing them again, would rather order on the internet and wait than experience their service again!

0.description: I am a long-time customer of Alpha II Omega and I am quite surprised by the comments of one of the reviewers where the gentleman was angry that the store did not price match an item. Stores are not obligated to price match. Stores that do this are usually larger retail chains (i.e. Best Buy, WalMart, Target, etc.). A small business such as Alpha II Omega does not have the benefit of spreading overhead cost over many locations so this makes price matching very difficult for small businesses to do. Also, he mentions that he saw the product online at a cheaper price. Everyone knows that overhead for an online shop is much lower than that of a brick-and-mortar store. I am certain that the pricing structure at Alpha II Omega is not set up to "take advantage of customers" as this gentleman so hastily accuses. They have to charge the right price so that they can pay their the rent and their employees. Alpha II Omega has a 25-year track record of serving the community. Myself and the many other  devoted customers will continue to support this amazing business. Also, if price is so important to this gentleman  he should use his energy to do the legwork to find items that meet his price-point expectations and not bash a great business. It is interesting how people will not flinch in buying a $200 pair of Air Jordans or a $2500 hand bag but take issue with paying the right price for an item at a black-owned small business. Hmmmm sounds a little hypocritical.

1.description: most of what they sell is good quality and educational, but again they are not on the cheap side... this is not a dollar store!!

2.description: I was impressed with their selection, good customer service, and great sales going on.  I was most familiar with the larger stores stores in CA, and although this was a smaller store, it seemed to have everything in it.  What I couldn't find on the shelf was retrieved from the back room by a sales person.

0.description: Great place to get stuff laminatedand get craft stuff for the kids.The store is a little tighter than the orland park location though.

1.description: This "business" is a joke. I placed an order with this company in September 2012 through the hospital I work for, and it is now March 2013 and I have still not received my order in full. I have given multiple contact people my information, including my address, to have scrubs shipped to me, but not ONCE did I receive anything in the mail. I have received random articles (a scrub top here, a pair of pants there) at random points, but never my full order. Basically, no one who works for this company wants to go out of their way to help you, they just want to go through the motions and pretend like they are "fixing" the problem when they really are ignoring the problem.

2.description: This company is horrible! My hospital decided to get uniforms from this company in the Summer of 2012.  I ordered my uniforms on time, just like the company asked us to, and submitted my form.  In the Fall of 2012 the other nurses I work with were receiving their uniforms, however I never ended up getting mine.  In January I called the company about my missing uniforms....needless to say it is May and I am still calling!!!!  I recently filed a claim with the BBB because this company is ridiculous.  My job requires me to wear these uniforms and I am stuck washing my 1 pair of scrubs( yes they actually sent me 1 pair of pants and 1 shirt that are actually my size) everyday after my 12 hour shifts, in order to just have clean scrubs for work the next day!  HORRIBLE!

0.description: It took a grand total of 9 months since my original order that I received everything. I think. It has been so long since I ordered my scrubs I couldn't even keep count of what I already had. It's quite possible I'm still missing a scrub or 2 but don't give a crap at this point. Cheap quality. Poor business.

28.description: After hearing raving reviews about the burrito bowl, I went in with a partner and we decided on ordering two bowls for the both of us.After waiting what seemed like another generation in line behind, to the side of, and in front of yelling patrons, we finally struggled and wedged our way -almost- to the see-thru counter-ish area. We tried to make up our minds in a hurry, but it just did not seem fast enough for the cooks. I ended up repeating myself, LOUDLY numerous times, simply because the people preparing the food could not hear me over everyone else, the loud music, and basically trying to rush us. Anyways, after enduring the line, we made it to the end of the counter, and a nice lady asked us if we'd like something to drink. Certainly. I'm exhausted now, and I've ended up paying nearly $20 for a headache and a darn good burrito bowl!Will I come here again? Maybe so. Not on a hot day, not after work, not during lunch. Maybe pop in when they first open or something. There's something about fighting through the crowd for your food that makes you want to just eat later when you get home.

1.description: I should know better about coming here, but now that this is the closest chipotle, I tried again.  As usual my order was not ready when arrived.  I mean it's ridiculous because this time it wasn't even crowded and I still gotta wait.  It makes no sense for me waiting in line to be easier than ordering online.   Why is this the ONLY chipotle I have been to that is this bad???

39.description: I have always been a big fan of all the food at Chipotle.  I have never had a bad experience at any one.  It is one of the few chains that I frequent. I have to admit that I was somewhat dissappointed at this location. The food was tasty and I did get it fast but it did not live up to the high expectations that i have of them.  It tased as if the steak was sitting there for a while and my burrito was not wrapped very tight so it started to fall apart as soon as I started to eat it.  It was still a good meal but not like I am used to having there.

9.description: Service sucks!!! Their excuse..."we're a high volume restaurant." Whatever. Too many other options when it comes to spending MY money.

29.description: The line in here is always absolutely absurd and they are so slow.  The employees are nice, which is why they get 2 stars, but I HATE going here.  I usually order online ahead of time.  In theory, this would mean I wouldn't have to wait when I get to the register, right? False.  Even if you show up exactly when your order was supposed to be ready you will probably have to wait at least another 10-15 minutes.  Better than waiting in the ridiculous line for 45 minutes, I guess.

23.description: The lines ARE long here, but that usually means you went on a busy day? Anywho, the food is good I got the burrito bowl and it was a mountian of food that even I couldn't finish. You get to put what you want on there, so this is something you can avoid if you want to finish your plate. Decent food, and would go with someone again!

5.description: ABSOLUTELY, the worst Chipotle I have ever been to. As soon as I entered the line was long. Don't let that fool you at all. The food doesn't have that authentic taste like at the other ones. This locationIs very unprofessional.

31.description: LOVE Chipotle but this location is the absolute WORST!!!  If want to wait 30 minutes plus deal with bad attitudes then this is your place.  They need to hire a complete new staff or this business will fail!

25.description: If I could leave zero stars I would!  This is by far the worst Chipotle in the country.  They are 0 for 50 with getting online ordered correct or ready on time.  I ordered 2 chicken bowls online for in-store pick up.  When I returned home with them and opened the bag.  Both burrito bowls did not have chicken!  How is that possible?!  This Chipotle is the WORST!  Avoid it at all costs!

12.description: Seem to have gotten the app ordering figured out. Meal ready to go at the pick up time when I arrived the last two visits.

37.description: The lines were backed up, the food was questionable, the service was not the greatest.  I do enjoy a burrito every now again from Chipotle but not this specific location.  This was a horrible experience.  I want to forewarn all of the people I know to stay away and drive somewhere else to get one.  Not a real Chipotle experience.

21.description: Line is too slow.  Employees can't move the line.

16.description: I really don't know where to begin. Every, AND I DO MEAN EVERY, time I come to this chipotle, I'm disappointed. From the cold food, to the skimpy amounts they give you and their rush to tell you it costs extra for a little more, to the negative attitude and vibe as soon as you reach the counter. The food barely has taste. If you never had Chipotle before, don't visit this location. It will make you hate it. If I didn't have it before at other locations, I would think it was the worst food. No I'm not exaggerating. It's really that bad there. I seriously think the only reason they get business is because it's the only one on the south side. If it closed, I wouldn't be sad.

17.description: The service is horrible. The staff is disrespectful and the manger is scared to discipline his staff. This by far the worst Chipotle in Chicago and its sad that Chipotle has allowed this store to continue to slip and not meet standards.

10.description: The food here is mediocre at best, and very over priced. Customer service sucks, and corporate could care less.  With so many good places that serve real Mexican food why would anyone choose this place.

11.description: What can I say? I search all around for decent tacos, and Chilpote gives me three Carnita tacos on flour with everything and a soda for around nine bucks. This may be my new default place to get my Mexican fast food fix.

26.description: I was absolutely pleased with the food and the service at this chipotle. The managers Erick and Salomon were super nice. My steak burrito was awesome as well as my chips and guac. Thanks again guys! I will keep going back!

27.description: The food was okay,  however I was irritated by the fact that some ingredients I enjoy on my burrito bowl were not yet ready even tho they had been open for 45 minutes!  This location is closer to me but I would rather drive s few more minutes down the street to the oak lawn location.

35.description: i frequent many chipotles and this is by far the SLOWEST, most crowded one. Bathrooms are TERRIBLE. I try to avoid this location if I can.

8.description: I can not agree with any of these reviews. CHIPOTLE IS KNOWN FOR A LINE.If you got at lunch time, around when everyone gets off work, or close expect a line.I go when I figure it shouldn't be a long line. And I typically never wait longer than 10 minutes (sometimes there's NO LINE)The food is delicious! I get the burrito bowl (white rice, chicken, black bean, mild, a little hot, sourcream cheese corn, extra lettuce, and I use the green hot sauce on the side!)or the burrito (brown rice, black bean, steak, corn, sourcream, mild, alittle hot, cheese and extra lettuce but with the red hot sauce and a bit of chipotle)the service is nice here. they are loud talk with a smile. But I will agree their cashier tends to walk away from the register quite a bit but it doesn't bother me much because I've worked as a cashier and understand that sometimes it's for the greater good.out of ll the chipotles I've been to... this was the best. If you hate lines never go to the one downtown. #foodforthought

0.description: Stopped in for lunch. Great visit, line as usual but it moved along smooth. Everything served as requested. Don't hesitate to stop in if in the area.

38.description: Mexican grill, my olive skinned ass!! This is tex-mex at best! The service, the tortillas, the seasoning...bleh!...Not cool. Authentic American tex mex crap on a tortilla.That is all. no more, no less.

20.description: Food is phenomenal, but just like every chipotle in densely populated areas; this joint stays packed! They accept pick up orders over the phone & those orders get priority over customers that are standing in line. Just be prepared to stand in line & only get a spoonful of meat on your burrito.

19.description: Line is too slow.  Employees can't move the line.

33.description: I try to avoid this particular Chipotle if i can. The line is always ridiculously long, and SLOW. Also, they charge extra for a little more cheese! Really?? wow.. compared to the Chipotle in Rosemont.. this one is at the bottom of the barrel. Plus, the girl who checked me out said "cash rules everything around me, dolla dolla bills y'all" O_o She was scary! Yelpers beware...

2.description: This Chipotle is pretty bad. I go to Chipotle all the time near my home, and this location is definitely worse. The service is much slower than average Chipotleservice, portions are small, and no one enjoys working there (or at least it seems).                   When I ordered a chicken bowl, the lady that worked there only filled up the spoon halfway. I would at least like to get a full portion for the price I pay. The parking lotis also very small and awkward. I would drive farther and just visit the other Chipotle location down 95th Street.

34.description: The day that you have NO Mexicans (Latin Americans???) working in a Mexican restaurant, um...there's a problem!!! I have been in the place before but there is NO reason that at 9pm, the lines are super long and I am being looked at like I'm too blame!!! And the smell was simply ridiculous, I mean are you slaughtering cows/chickens/etc in the back? R u freakin SeriOus!?!?! I will never, ever go to this place again. Yelpers, enter at your own risk!

32.description: stingy with the rice! needed more employees to help with the long line

18.description: After hearing raving reviews about the burrito bowl, I went in with a partner and we decided on ordering two bowls for the both of us.After waiting what seemed like another generation in line behind, to the side of, and in front of yelling patrons, we finally struggled and wedged our way -almost- to the see-thru counter-ish area. We tried to make up our minds in a hurry, but it just did not seem fast enough for the cooks. I ended up repeating myself, LOUDLY numerous times, simply because the people preparing the food could not hear me over everyone else, the loud music, and basically trying to rush us. Anyways, after enduring the line, we made it to the end of the counter, and a nice lady asked us if we'd like something to drink. Certainly. I'm exhausted now, and I've ended up paying nearly $20 for a headache and a darn good burrito bowl!Will I come here again? Maybe so. Not on a hot day, not after work, not during lunch. Maybe pop in when they first open or something. There's something about fighting through the crowd for your food that makes you want to just eat later when you get home.

13.description: Food is phenomenal, but just like every chipotle in densely populated areas; this joint stays packed! They accept pick up orders over the phone & those orders get priority over customers that are standing in line. Just be prepared to stand in line & only get a spoonful of meat on your burrito.

4.description: Line is slow and out the door all the time every time. Expect a 45 minute wait minimum.I was there one time and got up to the counter and was told "we're out of salsa"Bootleg-Mexican , Mexican people I know won't eat here.The staff is mostly African American who hook up the big booty sisters with big heaping scoops of steak and gobs of cheese and sour cream.What do I get?I get a racist 'whiteboy' scoop of steak and wilted lettuce. The spoon was barely a quarter full.I get home and most of my burrito bowls were upside down, open and spilled in the bag.

24.description: If I was rating just on food, I would give this place 4 stars.  That being said, the line here was terrible - and evidently typical.  It stretched all the way around the restaurant and I must have waited 20 minutes just to get to where you make your food selection.  I asked an assistant manager if it was always this busy and she said it was.  There was still a line there when I left (albeit slightly shorter) so she is probably right.  It was so busy there that you kind of had to yell to make sure they didn't screw up your order.  One positive - they have brown rice as well as white rice.  I requested brown rice and they got it wrong but I let that one slide.  Towards the end of my preparation though they asked if I wanted guacamole and lettuce and i just wanted guacamole.  They started to reach for the lettuce also and I had to yell at them to stop - they would have been re-making my burrito completely had they done that..  I also had to ask for a basket instead of a bag as I was eating in - they didn't ask me, just started grabbing for a bag (I think most people order to go here for some reason.)  Anyhow, when I got my food and drink cup I was mentally fatigued from the experience, so although the food was quite good and I am a fan of Chipotle's burritos - I don't think I'll visit this location again if I have any kind of choice.

6.description: This Chipotle is by far the worst location I've been to. I must say there was not a long line so I was in and out, but that's where the compliment ends. They are so stingy with the ingredients....I had to ask for more rice, beans and cheese, and when I did the worker acted like it was coming out his check. The young lady that rung me up was interested in her personal conversation with her coworker than ringing me up.  As for the food itself...it seemed as the meat was lacking seasoning and was a bit blah. In a nutshell...won't be back to this location.

22.description: I don't know about what goes on between the four walls of this place during regular business, but on May 17th, these guys were champs. We had a large catering order for our event, UChicago's Relay for Life, and they went above-and-beyond to make sure we had everything we needed. This is ON TOP of giving us a bunch FREE. With their help, had a fantastic event with many happy participants raving about the food. We can't thank them enough.

15.description: I love this chipotle. I come here atleast once a week. The food always seems to be fresher and the service is speedy. There may be long lines but that's because the foods delish but either way ur in and out within 15 mins. The staff is pretty awesome too! One day I forgot my wallet and they gave me my burrito on the house!!! I always recommend this chipotle in particular to all my people, so I suggest you come here as well

7.description: This is a popular restaurant and there are often long lines. This means as a restaurant you have to become more efficient. Instead I witnessed the cashier leave to take a phone call while a customer waited to pay for her food. I watched four people on the line take quite sometime to complete one order and a manager that seemed like it was his first day. The rating reflects the service of a restaurant that is too slow.

36.description: How in the world did I forget Chipotle?  Fear not, my Mexican friend, I'm here to give you stellar points.   I usually flip-flop between the 95th street (Beverly) store and the Sheridan Road (Loyola) location.   Chipotle won my heart  a while back when I first tasted their Burrito Bowl.  My personal favorite is the Burrito Bowl consisting of rice, black beans, chicken, fresh salsa, corn, cheese, lettuce and a dollop of sour cream.   The guacamole and chips at Chipotle are unrivaled and just plain good.  Contrary to other reviewers who have issues with the 95th street (Beverly) location, all my experiences have been positive.

30.description: Line too long, staff friendly-but more employees need to be scheduled during lunch time, serving size a little skimpy. Won't be back and the owner is really taking advantage of the fact that their establishment is the only one on the city southside. Terrible

3.description: I have never seen such poor customer service from employees and managers in a line restaurant. This Chipotle location needs to work on their method of training, starting with the manager and then employees!! The portions that was given was also under the "said 4 oz" that the general manager explained to me, that was regulation... I am highly disappointed in this Chipotle location! The food was good but the customer service definitely left a bad taste in my mouth... I was offered a free meal or my money back, and yes I'm going to take one of those two offers but my main concern is that the company resolve this issue! The community deserves better service than that was given to myself and others that experience the same that I experienced!!!

14.description: Always busy which is good you know they always be restocking product. Parking is awful and the parking across the street at the old boarders parking lot is blocked off so goodluck. honestly I will not be back to this one I would rather take the drive to Oaklawn

3.description: I have always prided myself with being on the forefront of glasses fabulousness: -- As a child in the 80s, I rocked those Luxotticas with the pink that faded to lavender that had a large rounded square shape and those scoop down and then swoop back up ear arms, umm hmm, yep, I did that...-- Then came the abalone - real abalone shell, mind you - paved, turquoise colored, Malcolm X styled rims - what what....-- Of course, Sally Jesse Raphael totally stole my huge red glasses look..-- And, a few years after I'd tired of it, I found out it was really "hip" to wear the thickest black, plastic frames possible...Such it was, and I prided myself on the fact that I would spend a whole paycheck on a single pair of frames and come back two weeks later to then pay additionally for the lenses. And then..Life happened...My new baby has broken two separate pairs of my glasses straight off my face and my 16-year-old "lost" hers, all at the same time -- and I just can't afford to be that cool anymore.  Enter big chain specs...Two pairs of glasses, with lenses and two separate exams AND two boxes of disposable contacts for two different prescriptions - less than $300.  Of course, only glasses folk will appreciate these figures, but for two people getting everything they need - with a turnaround time of one day - that is cheap as hell. Just don't expect a lot of courtesies, help with your "selection" or even a real selection at all, and you'll be fine.  Mine are actually cute as hell - and already coming apart do to my junior face grabber... ("Nooo..NO! Mommy doesn't like that! Don't grab Ma Ma face!!")And the doctor there?  Let's just say he was niiice to look at.... ummm, ma ma like....

1.description: This place is is absurd. I went there last year for glasses and swore I would never return. This year I decided to give them the benefit of the doubt. Mistake!!! I took a contact eye exam and this was on the third...they told me my contact should be here around seven to ten business days. Its now the 20th and they told me they are on back order...whatever that means!?!. I don't care how blind you are, it does not take almost a month to receive contact lens. Poor management , not properly trained in customer service, knowledgeable about nothing! People please stay away from vision works. You could probably get your order from India with better customer service faster.

2.description: I will never shop at Visionworks again. The wait was ridiculous over and hour and a half to purchase some contacts. I didn't even need an eye exam since my last one was less then a month ago. The store was short staff 2 employees which is absurd for a  Saturday afternoon. When I need glasses or contacts in the future it won't be at Visionworks.

0.description: Staff was polite and helpful, but it takes forever for items to come in.  I ordered glasses and contacts 12/20/2011...i was called last week that contacts are in and I am still waiting for glasses.  Will likely not return because it takes too long and the staff have no explanation as to why...im a psych major, therefore i MUST have answers!!

4.description: It was OK. The store staff was not aware of my insurance and I'm sure someone from the cta with bluecross had been in there before. They didn't. Explain all the charges until I asked. It going to take ten to fourteen days for my glasses.

12.description: I love the atmosphere here.  Very relaxing.  My favorite technician is Jenny.  She is very efficient and she does a great job every time.  The waxing technician is very good as well.  What I like about the waxing here is that everyone did not try to wax.  There is one lady and she is good at it.

3.description: I used to love this place. Not a long wait the people are nice. I usually go with my daughter but this time I did not. She was doimg fine until she started buffing my nails and she nicked my cuticle with no apology. What I excuse the first time because I understand it happens. But after the third time and more blood I had to let her know that I did not plan to pay her full price because she hurt me and did not seem to care. When I told her this she got an attitude and started speaking to her manager in her native language. Even though my nails look nice the customer service was awful I will not be returning.

1.description: They need to make sure their equipment is sterilized I caught a bad nail fungus,it started when she nicked me and again! Then my finger stated to bleed I should've stopped then! Will not go there anymore and I've been going since the opened! I used to get my eyebrows done there I stopped that a long time ago when one eyebrow was cut much much shorter!no problems with the pedicure so far! But the nail problem has cost a lot of money to clear up! Still messed up but healing! Please use sterilized files,buffers please I could've filed a lawsuit. Her name was meshell

2.description: This is by far the rudest salon I've been to. They never say hi when you come in just sign in and sometimes they don't even tell you that! I've been three times and 2 of the three I've walked out not full serviced. If Gigi wasn't so good with eyebrows I would never come again but this may be the last straw.

9.description: Only place I will let touch my nails and eyebrows,  prices are reasonable,  very clean, sterilization area is visible,  friendly nail artist,  my fave is ViVi,  I already recommended many ppl to try them out and they loved the experience,  oh and also massage chairs are to die for,  check them out asap!!!

10.description: I drove around here the day before thanksgiving looking for a quick nail fix.  I saw this place was open and went in.  I loved the vibe here.  The place was clean, had soothing music. The owner was super nice and welcoming.  I was amazed by their huge selection of nail colors.  I got my nails done by Chi and she was the most meticulous nail designer.  She really takes her time and always takes a step back to assess her work.  A sign that she takes great pride in her work.  I don't get nail stylists like that ever.  She reminds me of the nail stylists in Japan.  Dudettes, I've never been more happier with the way my nails turned out.  A surprise to find this place in river green park.

13.description: Got a no chip manicure for 35$ w/white tips and they turned black in 4 days. I went back that Saturday and they fixed them for free but tried to tell me that they turned black because I didn't use gloves while cleaning. (I didn't clean or use chemicals on anything). Even if I did... For $35 I can't clean? Wow. Then I went back today and told the lady to take it off and I would try a different color. She was so rude and rough. She scraped off the no chip with a metal tool and then files my nail till it burned. My nails ended up thin and hurt like hell. Not to mention she made me bleed with the cuticle clippers. Then she was talking about me and laughing at me in her language. (may not speak the language but I'm not stupid). After I washed my hands I decided I didn't want her touching me anymore. She charged me $15 for that Crap. I went down the street to Generation Nail and Jennifer did a slammin job on my nails. She did a no chip for Super cheap after hearing my story and told me that my nails shouldn't have turned black no matter what. She said it was their polish. I'll never go back to 3D and neither will any of my friends that used to frequent the place every week.

16.description: I've been going here since they first open and it used to be my favorite nail shop in the neighborhood. However, they've changed a bit like everything nowadays. If you don't not get the deluxe pedicure package they do a half job on you. I have went plenty of times to draw this conclusion so this is not based off one experience. Also they speak with each other about asking their current customer if they're gonna get the deluxe as if they are passing judgement on a person's appearance if they think they will get the deluxe package or not. Nonetheless, the whole deluxe package thing is more stressful than taking a taxi and trying to figure out how much you are gonna tip them while they stare at you. Whether I am getting the super deluxe package or a basic pedicure YOU SHOULD STILL DO A GOOD JOB! People who get pedi's on a regular do not need deluxe treatment all the time but they still deserve a good pedicure. Additionally, I just went there this past Saturday and got a pedi/mani and my cuticle looks like I haven't had a manicure at all. The lady did a quick mess on me and I am totally disappointed and will not be returning. I've given them enough of my money.

6.description: I've been going here for a few months and had an amazing lady named Christina. The last few times I've gone she wasn't there and the service was so completely terrible. The first time the man cut off my nails and left them uneven when I asked him to make them even he got up and walked away. Another person had to come fix my nails. Then I went less than a week ago for a fill in and was charged 27 dollars before tip and 3 of my nails have the gel already broken off. I'm so disappointed.

15.description: Clean,professional,courteous. I am a new customer. Kudos to GG and Lee. You have a new found fan. !

0.description: This Salon is very sanitary and comfortable. UNlike most Asian salons you are NOT rushed in and out.  Also UNlike most non Asian salons you are NOT overcharged for great service.  The ventilation could be better-- product fumes can give you a slight headache-- but otherwise it is GREAT!  I live in the West Loop and will travel allllll the way South to get GREAT service at a GREAT price.  It's worth the price of gas for me-- and I drive a gas guzzler. ;)Oh one other thing... I LOATHE nail salons that are right off the street for passersby to see/watch ladies (and men) being groomed.  3D is set back from the street and the setup is more conducive to semi-privacy during service.

5.description: For starters I have been coming to this nail salon for two years so I usually make appointments so this visit I made an appointment the day before so that I wouldn't sit there 5 hours because their service already takes the longest time ever, but anyway he confirmed that I was in, I get there and he has no recollection of the appointment and wants me to wait because their are 4 or 5 people ahead of me smh. I explained to him that I couldn't and proceed to make a new appointment for 3 that same day, when I return at 3:00 it's the same thing, now I want to act a fool but I refrain as I will not be returning to this Nail Salon ever after today and I have been coming here exclusively for two years now smh. This is the worst service I have ever received from a place that is supposed to be know for such I'm extremely frustrated. However as always nice nails look great so now I'm torn .

11.description: So I live in the Bronzeville area of the city,  and for the last 6 months I have commuted all the way too Evergreen Park to this salon. At first they used to have STELLAR customer service,  but now they have the WORST customer service I have EVER experienced.  During my last visit the gentleman was very rude who did my fill in service. The entire time he was doing my nails he was watching a movie on his phone? ?! .....Umm, how Rude! !! Then when he asked me if I wanted my nails trimmed down I told him no. He then told me that I should "cut them down because they were too long and that is not what I should get." ...ummm, Hello? ?? But the last time I checked if I'm paying for a service, I should be able to keep the length I want! !!!Second visit was today, just left out of there and after waiting for 25 minutes she ( some woman by the name of Chichi) tells me that there is a pedicure bowl ready for me,  I put my foot in and it was FREEZING Cold! Not luke warm, but FREEZING Cold!!!! AND when I tell her she says "Oh I can add some hot water to make it warmer" so she did.  Then,  I put my foot back in the water still FREEZING Cold!  She then directs me to go to a bowl on the other side of the salon which you probably guessed was FREEZING Cold as well. They tell me to have a seat and then they start speaking vietnamese or whatever language it is they speak looking at me as if I'm the one that told their hot water not to work!  (First off,  I personally think it's rude to speak in another language while conducting business unless the person your conducting business with speaks another language) They don't offer an apology or anything for the inconvenience,  so I have a seat and after waiting 20 more minutes I'm fed up and start putting on my coat to leave, then the lady says the water is starting to get warmer because she sees me trying to leave. ...A LOAD OF CRAP!!! I'M never giving them my money again.

8.description: I visit LA alot and out there they are very sanitary, don't use those harsh razors and do an amazing job on your feet and nails. I am happy to say that 3D Nail Salon is better than those nail shops!!!! 3D nail salon has the best customer service, the best nail technicians, and the best choices for designs and polish!! I love coming here, everyone is so nice, and the prices are reasonable as well. Please check this place out, it is a gem in the Beverly neighborhood!

4.description: This is my go to place. The prices are reasonable and they typically do a good job in my opinion. When it gets busy, however, the wait time could be long, but that's expected.

14.description: This is the only salon I go to in my neighborhood, because I know I can trust them to be sanitary.  They are fast, friendly, and always do an excellent job.  I highly suggest the No Chip manicure from here.  At $30, it's cheaper than most places, and I keep mine on for about 2 weeks before it starts growing out.  They always have relaxing music playing. The only thing I don't like is that they often speak to each other in another language--- but that is pretty standard at any nail salon of this kind.

7.description: Yesterday I went and literally got sick to my stomach. When me and my friend arrived for our foot spas, two of the nail techs prepared the bowls. My friend looked into her bowl that was filled with water and all the sea salt etc. and dead skin was floating around in the water. The man (who watches the money) kept insisting that the water was just prepared until she called him over and he saw all the dead skin floating himself. He quickly let the water out and rinsed the bowl out... I almost puked! That was so disgusting! I really like the way the two older ladies do my feet but that incident has turned me all the way off, will not be returning!

12.description: Come on people, we need to get this place up to 5 solid stars. As stated before, these guys have the best Guinness in Chicago. Sit back, order some Milanos, and enjoy!

7.description: This is probably my favorite of the Western Avenue pubs.  Since most of the people that go drinking on Western are underage...Keegan's has a slightly older crowd...now that I'm 30 I need a little of that.    Don't get me wrong cork and kerry, especially with the new addition is a great classic Irish pub...The difference is the guiness...Keegans has the best guiness pour in the entire city of Chicago and some people say west of Ireland.   I hadn't been in in 5 or 6 years and the second I walked threough the door 3 people shouted my name....gotta love it!To compare it to dingers is apples and oarnges.....being the white sox fan that I am and all the time I spent in dingers when I was 16 leaves a softspot in my heart.....You can't beat the guiness at Keegans though.Cheers!

19.description: My favorite bar on Western and quite possibly my favorite bar on the Southside. I love the Southside Irish feel, and the "Cheers"-like ambiance the bar regulars/ Western drifters create on any given night. If you go on a weeknight, I don't have to emphasize it's going to be more quiet, but it's still busy with people juke-boxing or dancing to live Irish music (so that should tell you a lot about how the weekends will be!). I haven't been here in a year or two, but writing this review I am getting extremely nostalgic. Keegans will likely inspire the same for you-- neighborhood local or not-- just due to the fact that neighboring Cork & Kerry shows you how Keegans got it right.

1.description: The craic is good here. Favorite pub on the southside. Don't come for frills none here but craic and pints are a plenty.

2.description: This is my favorite place to drink in the city. It's usually the cherry popper for my friends who are South Side drinking virgins. If you want a true pub experience, Keegan's the place to be.  It's certainly better than the place next door.Always guaranteed to be the best Guinness pour in the city of Chicago. Whenever I'm on the South Side, I make it a priority to stop in (usually before visiting the family). I considered this my home away from home. Almost makes me want to move back to the city until I have to pay yet another asinine {insert product here} tax.

9.description: My favorite Western St. pub.  An eclectic collection of expats, locals, young, old, artists, truck drivers....You get the point.I love this place.

6.description: Favorite Western bar by FAR! Chill place to hang with your friends and not have to worry about all the Western under-ageres ruining the atmosphere.

18.description: For a bar that is so close to my house I should go here more often. The crowd is very regular, as are most bars around Beverly. The beer is good and the Guinness is done right. The bartenders are good and will buy you a drink every now and then. It's an oddly laid out place with two front doors, but they do have a fire place which is nice in the winter. Lastly, there is rumor of a beer garden but I've never seen it open and the only thing I've seen out back was the bartenders dogs. Over all a great place.

10.description: everything i want in a bar:-fast and friendly service-great (and inexpensive) guinness pours with that wonderfully thick meringue-like foam-beautiful old wood and a roaring fireplace
