13.description: I went to Keegans after my colleague was stunned of my experiences at Cork & Kerry's.  " ill take Rhino, Ednd Zone, Harts, or Keegans any day" says the bloke....as soon as i got in, I sat down and ordered a Zima Light on the rocks - the bartender had a big grin on his face and made a public announcement that a man just ordered a Zima Light and i was immediatley escorted to their back room where i was violated repeatedly by their caged household squirrels and baby rabbits.  This place gets an Eek! Methinks not....gross!!

16.description: I love Keegan's! It's a great neighborhood place to go. Very laid back but always a good time.

17.description: Excellent Irish pub, best of the Western bars.

15.description: I really like this place.  The best bar in Beverly if you ask me.  it can get a little tight n there but usually it thins out a bit and you can claim some more room.  Good bands play and they always have good stuff on tap.  This is why people drink on Western!

0.description: This is my favorite Irish pub on Western Ave....and in Chicago in general.  This is a place where everyone and anyone feels welcome when they walk through the doors.  Most of the bartenders are from Ireland and have their brogue to prove it.  The drinks are reasonably priced. However, do keep in mind that it is a cash only bar.  They have an ATM on site to help you out in case you didn't realize that or if you go in for "just one drink" and end up staying until 3am and need a little more cash to keep the liquor flowing :)I prefer Keegan's Pub to the other Irish bars/pubs on Western, because they haven't succumb to changing their atmosphere into a modern day look.  Part of the beauty in Keegan's is that it is well-loved, and you can tell by the fact that the bar looks worn, as do the bar stools, the floor, and even the doors.  This is one of the most authentic feeling pubs around still.  It's as if they adopted the attitude of "Like us or hate us, this is who we are, and we ain't changing!"  I say this in reference to Cork and Kerry next door who chose to do the opposite...but I'll leave that for another review :)If you are on the Southside and looking for a down-to-earth, laid back, Irish pub...well then, my golly, get yourself over to Keegan's Pub on Western!  You may even be greeted by the bartender/owner's dog that they have in the bar every so often :)SLAINTE!

5.description: This was one of the better bars we attended in the evening. The staff was friendly, the drinks were cheap, it was nice and big (lots of seating too), and had a younger, more fun feel to it. It didn't have a dance floor or anything like that, but I could see where things could get crazy! I would come back here on a weekend to hang out again.

11.description: This is the most tolerable of Western Ave bars, which is to say its like least painful way to get in the face with a hammer. Yes, this place is going to be full of all the dipshits you went to high school with, but there just won't be as many dipshits as next door at Cork and Kerry.

8.description: Perfect pours of Guinness for 3.75? Check.Broken in bar stool with back support? Check.Two doors? Check.Random Irish songs that the whole bar sings? Check.Footrests at the bar? NegativeAdult urinals? Obvious check.Child sized urinal? Check.Hole in the wall that has been fixed with duct tape? Check.Mid-60 year old patron that looks like he stepped outta a Dick Tracy comic? Check.Book reader at the bar? Check.Getting eye balled all night by a mother who kept pushing drinks on me? Check.Being able to talk to your table mates at 1:39am and hear the quarters hit the floor? Check.Being able to give some bills to someone who's making a taco run and actually get food back? Check check.The homeless man begging for a Guinness? Check.The homeless man's posse swinging in around closing time and effectively driving away the north end of the bar? Check.ATM? NopeI think I've found my bar for SSI.

3.description: I came here for a friends birthday party and drinks. It was a lot of fun and I really loved this place. It was a Sunday night so I was expecting the bar to be empty. But it wasn't. It was very full of younger adults.Usually a prefer bars that are almost empty because you get better service. But here, the service was super fast and the bartenders knew how to handle the crowd. The bathrooms were a little small, but I enjoyed my night here and would love to go back again.I didn't order food or even ask if they had food, so I can only comment on the drinks.

14.description: What more can I say here that hasn't already been said....but to be spoken by a Beverly native and a good irish girl....Keegan's is the best bar on the south side and I wouldn't go any where else!!

4.description: I must have had a sign taped to my back that said, "new here", as certainly everyone at Keegan's on the night I was here asked me, if I was "new here".  Ha!  That alone made me laugh!  And for all who asked . . . . the answer was yes!But then I sidled up to the well worn bar, ordered a beer that the bartender wouldn't give to me (I guess Miller Lite was the wrong thing to order) and then spent the rest of the night laughing with a Guinness in my hand at the antics of the people around me.If you want fancy, this is not your place.  If you want plenty of personal space, this is not your place.  If you want an Irish bar that is all new and pretty, this is not your place.But if you want a night  out with a fun crowd that is bound and determined to make you feel right at home, check out Keegan's.  Oh, and don't order a Miller Lite!

56.description: Beverly Bakery has great coffee and baked goods.  I wish that they were open a bit earlier because I would skip dunkin donuts and head to Beverly Bakery.  I like to go on  the weekends though.  Great cafe!

42.description: Short and sweet--but, hey, that's they way we like it. Sometimes these are the best breakfasts because I can actually engage in conversation instead of writing down what five to seven hungover, goofy people are spewing while I try to snag a few mouthfuls of whatever I ordered. And Beverly Bakery & Cafe was conducive to conversation. It doesn't hurt to have fresh, strong coffee and tasty breakfast. The service was good. Our waitress was cool. The girl at the cash register could be a bit more positive, though. She seems to not want to be there on Sunday mornings. I hope she reads this. Cheer up, kid.Anyway, 4.5 Brent Faces for Beverly Bakery & Cafe. Very strong rating.breakfastrules.blogspot.…

23.description: A very classy environment. Excellent food and coffee.  A nice sitting area with tables.  Parking on the street.  For railfans, a nice view of metra trains passing by.

47.description: Beverly Bakery & Cafe is a delightful cafe for breakfast or lunch.  They have a vast amount of pastries to choose from.  It is a cozy place to gather with friends for morning coffee or lunch.  Their breakfast is very delicious, and they have a wide menu to choose from.    I will be going back for more.

8.description: Be better if they had fresh oj and bigger portions of food for the price. It was ok.  Service was great.  Friendly atmosphere.  Not for large parties however. Could be cleaner too.  Just got splashed with cold water all over legs and feet and up back by waitress who didn't even say sorry.

31.description: I was in there getting a few coffees and morsels for a visit with an old friend.  It was not my first visit but I am not a regular (I do not go anywhere for coffee or donuts regularly).  I knew I was not a regular, so did they.  The 2 ladies behind the counter almost made me feel like I was holding up the line while my things were packed up.  I took my whole order to go, part of that was 3 coffee's and I wanted the creams and sugars on the side as I was not sure what my friend and her mother wanted, so I said that and she abruptly hands me a bag and says "here, you put your creams and sugars in here".  I do not mind doing that but the way she said it was odd.  Now I have my tasty treats packed up, I have my creams and sugars and she is finishing up with the coffee.  The small coffees do not fit into the carrier with out popping off the lid if you are not paying attention.  She was not paying attention and the lid fell off.  It spilled and I said "oh, the lid is not on all the way to which she then  reached over the counter. grabbed a lid and gave to me after trying the first one and told me to put them on.  I did put them on but again, the carrier and the small cup are not matched up well so when you put them in the bottom of the lid gets knocked off fairly easily by the center of the carrier.  I have been here before no problems except I know the donuts are expensive, but they are good and not something we can get around here so ok, it is nice to have here.  The coffee really is delish and very reasonable.   I work at a small, family owned store of a different variety and regulars and non regulars are not looked at differently.  I definitely felt the cold vibe from the older ladies behind the counter when I came in and ordered more than one or 2 things like the others did.  I am not going to stop going but be pleasant to all customers please, do not make me feel like I am getting in the way especially when I am spending 4 times as much money as the quick in and out commuters.

34.description: Great breakfast and great bakery options!!

16.description: Another great breakfast at The Beverly Bakery! The French toast made with homemade thick cut bread was delicious and the special with homemade bratwurst over country potatoes with a beer cheese sauce and eggs was amazing! Fresh roasted coffee was perfect as usual. Thanks Beverly Bakery for always taking it up a notch and making things special and delicious!

13.description: The coffee alone was amazing. Breakfast and donuts were even more amazing. They brew in house and to be quite honest I didn't think I was going to like it but I loved it. The service was equally pleasant with everyone knowing everyone. Makes me wish I lived in Beverly. The donut was moist and sweet but not over done. It was perfect. We ordered the salmon Benedict which had cream cheese, smoked salmon, capers and of course hollandaise. It was perfect. Tasted like a sushi roll to me. Loved it. We also ordered the chorizo skillet which came w chorizo, poblano peppers, potatoes and onions. It was good! The potatoes here are so delicious. The cherry on top of our visit was the pancakes. DELICIOUS! Fluffy and perfect. Will be back for sure :)

11.description: Yum! I had the Spanish omelet with hash browns and it was delicious!! Thinner than many omelets that I have had but super good! It had chorizo, peppers and onions! Great flavor. Also had a bite of the French toast and it was great! Perfect bite of something sweet.

39.description: I have been wanting to ty this place for at least 8 months now. What was I waiting for? I ended up with a random Friday off and headed over there this morning. Parking seemed to be really easy with plenty of street parking and a side lot off Western. I noticed everyone raved about the coffee here and they were right. I went with the smooth blend and it was good. Our server was so sweet and in chatting with her learned they were recently featured on Chicago's Best. It seems to have brought people out of the woodwork because this place was packed for a Friday. Every employee was very friendly and helpful to new faces.I ordered the Beverly benedict with seasoned potatoes. I'm not normally a huge fan of hashbrowns, but these were awesome. I was very pleased with my benny and enjoyed the hollandaise sauce as well (I'm picky about hollandaise). I grabbed a chocolate donut on the way out for later (it didn't last long) and it was delicious. My only regret is not buying more. They offer a very extensive menu- This isn't just a bakery. Omelets, pancakes, french toast, the list goes on and on. I can't wait to go back!

37.description: I came just before the Irish Parade started,  so it was pretty busy.  Still, the staff were very welcoming and accommodating, and the owners even took the time to say hello and talk for a bit.  Good selection of coffee, including fair trade options.

0.description: Another stellar meal at the Bakery. The humble title of Grilled Vegetable Sandwich cannot convey how perfectly this meal is prepared. The vegetables were PERFECTly grilled and balanced with just the right amount of feta (my choice, your options are many) on delicious rye bread. Served piping hot. Warms the cockles of this vegetarians heart.

38.description: $28 breakfast for two people. We ordered:French ToastBaconSmoked salmon Benedict w hashbrownsLemon danishApple JuiceCup of coffeeThe french toast was decent. French Toast doesn't come with anything. They charge extra for a side of bacon (2 pieces).The eggs benedict was decent. The hashbrowns were horrible. (Extremely dry) I took the lemon danish home and i haven't eaten it yet.Actually it's a quaint little neighborhood place. I really wish i would have liked it more. The people working there were very friendly.  I don't really drink coffee and it's a little pricey to come there just for breakfast.  If the lemon danish wins me over then i'll be back to try other pastries, but if not i'll pass.

51.description: So good. Truly surpasses my beloved Starbucks for freshly roasted coffee. Impressive selection of fresh, gourmet coffees....hot and iced as well as sugar-free syrups. The tea and scones are a welcome delight. Grab a buttery pastry, yummy  muffin or delightful doughnut to savor.  I wish there were more breads and cakes readily available. Argh! Wicked carbs! Cozy neighborhood spot for breakfast or lunch with a small variety of sandwiches & brunch specials. Perfect for settling in and reading the paper or sharing  conversation over a quality beverage. The Baristas are lovely.

27.description: C'mon denizens of Beverly and Mt. Greenwood. There's a world beyond the bubble! Stopped in for a treat. Purchased a muffin and pecan roll (no real options than that), shared my purchases and waited for comments. Both items were no better than what you get from a grocery store. Dry, tasteless pieces of slightly sweetened bread.

32.description: I live in Lakeview, and I try to make it down to Beverly Cafe as much as possible. Incredible breakfast / brunch...with the nicest people ever working behind the counter. Great service / best breakfast place in Chicago hands down.

54.description: I really want to love this place. I WANT to give it five stars, but I can't.  In addition to the few times I have eaten here (all good) i have ordered special items from them three times.The first time it was a cupcake cake for a party when I earned my Masters degree. I have a music degree...the cake had music notes on it, but they were all drawn wrong.  This may not have bothered anyone else, but if you are getting paid to draw music notes on a cake, make sure they aren't all backwards.The second time was a couple of years ago when we ordered a smash cake for my daughter's first birthday.  They spelled her name wrong.The last time was this past weekend when we ordered 30 cupcakes for my son's birthday party. When my husband went to pick them up (two hours after they were originally scheduled to be picked up) not only were they not ready, it appeared as though they had completely forgotten to make us any cupcakes at all, and ended up grabbing a bunch out of the case.  We didn't get what we ordered and my husband had to sit and wait while they haphazardly threw together our order.Does Beverly Bakery make good food/cupcakes? Yes. However in my book it is three strikes and you are out.  We will not be ordering from them again. :( PS:  Posting rants on their FB page about customers doesn't exactly make them a place that I want to visit either.

48.description: This place is neat because they roast their own coffee beans, and the coffee is good.  They will ask if you want bold or smooth, I went for the bold which was an Ethiopian blend and it was good...not stellar but very good.  They also sell coffee by the pound.  I intended to have breakfast and buy a loaf of bread to take home, but they don't bake bread.  I thought that to be a bakery you baked bread.  If you only offer sweets you are a patisserie or pastry shop...well I am digressing.  The lack of a loaf of freshly baked bread was disappointing.  The breakfast my dining companion ordered was eggs over with bacon and some waffles.  It looked okay, we didn't order any sweets, but I had the oatmeal that came with raisins and brown sugar.  The order was way too much for one person, but what was great was that I was able to get a glass of soy milk (lactose intolerant) which is so lacking at a lot of breakfast places.  In addition to the oatmeal I ordered a side of fresh fruit, which ended up being some day old watermelon and honeydew melon that had seen better days...you know when them melon begins to look translucent it's been around too long.  They should not have served it.  Oh yeah they do the inevitable latte, cafe mocha, cappuccino, thing but I judge coffee by ordering a simple cup of coffee...once it's adulterated it's hard to tell.  The WiFi was down that day which is one of the other reasons I stopped by, that was disappointing since it was a sort of business meeting.  The tables and chairs are cheap and not very comfortable, and there are no booths.  But it is friendly and service is fast.  I would go back to sample other things on the menu but I don't live in the area, if you do check it out, everyone raves about the donuts so they must be good.  I prefer yeast donuts so they didn't grab my attention.  I think it you go order a latte or cappuccino some cake donuts or something from the bakery.  One patron told me the french toast was excellent.  Not a bad place for the neighborhood, but I've had just as good a cup of coffee at the Original Pancake House in Hyde Park, and minus the bakery a better breakfast.

44.description: This place is great! As soon as you walk in someone is asking you if you need help. If you look like no one is helping you then you will be asked again which is nice. They all wear smiles even when they are busy. You walk in and feel at home. They say thank you and you feel appreciated. I had a chocolate cupcake and asked if they had any without frosting, the young lady went in the back to check for me. And they did. It was scumptdiliumptious if that's a word. It was so soft and melted in my mouth. It had a great flavor, not like those "designer cupcake" places like sprinkles, magnolia bakery etc. This will be my place to get cupcakes for any occasion. I ordered a dozen cupcakes and they turned out beautifully. Picture will be uploaded. I love this place. Please stop by and get your sugar fix. I also tried a mini bundt cake which was fantastic. They have other pastries as well that I'm scared to try because I know I will become addicted!

24.description: Let me start by saying I love to use local businesses!!  So I've been to Beverly Bakery both for coffee and also to dine in for breakfast. I always thought the food was mediocre and over priced but still a local business at the end of the day.  Well this morning my wife tried to go and make a substantial purpose for her entire staff and at 6:55 the door was locked and the staff sat there looking at her through the window.  So when she told me I called and asked what time they open. I was rudely told "we are open". I politely said "that wasn't the question".  She replied "well then 7". Bottom line...you can get better food, better coffee, and better service at other spots in Beverly..both locally owned and a chain that starts with S.

7.description: One phrase to sum it up: a lovely breakfast joint with lots of CHARM.  I believe that everyone in the Beverly neighborhood comes to this place at some point of his/her life.  It's rather tiny in terms of dining room space.  We were pretty much sitting from shoulder to shoulder with one another.  The service was quick, and we were offered coffee immediately upon sitting.  Yes, it's what breakfast places should do: bring me some hot coffee and drink it until feeling the extreme jitter!  Oh well, let's not digress.  I ordered the house latte.  This cup of magic was the real deal.  Don't under-estimate the power of a family-owned business; it's where the real food comes from.  Then there came with our entrees: smoked salmon omelet for myself; chorizo skillet for the hubby.  My man has egg allergy, but there weren't many things on the menu without eggs.  With that being said, perhaps it's an idea to introduce daily specials containing no eggs or make a substitution for the entrees they offer.  My hubby is always too shy to ask for a special accommodation, but he did devour the eggs that came with the skillet.  Those eggs appeared to cook appropriately to bland with the consistency of the potatoes.  My omelet was good.  The only complain was that I wish the omelet portion outweighed the potato portion of the meal.  That way, it would have been more satisfying for me.  The entire atmosphere was informal.  The place can be packed within minutes so the key for coming on Sundays is to come early, ideally before 0900 hour.  P.S. There's a minimum cap for all credit card purchases: $10 minimum.  An average breakfast entree is in between $7 to $13 per person.  For sure you will also want coffee, and that will be another $3.

49.description: Since moving to the south side of Chicago, I have hunted for a decent cup of coffee.  Finally found a place that roasts their own beans.  Respects taste buds.  Has a great sitting, reading, computing, surfing, drinking incredible coffee place.  The breakfast potatoes are wonderful.  They have baked goods.  DO NOT start eating the cake donuts - it will be your downfall.  They never give you enough honey wheat bread - the slices are way to small.  This place is the bomb - they have 10 types of coffee - five medium roast and 5 dark roasted - the coffee is GREAT.  Go there.

40.description: This place was really cute!  I loved the vibe and feel of the entire bakery.  It was pretty busy for a Wednesday morning too!  My fiance and I got breakfast - I, eggs benedict, him a skillet.  Our food was good - not spectacular - but tasty.  The coffee was great, this is definitely a good place to get a good cup of coffee.  We got some doughnuts on the way out and they were okay, I prefer DD's vanilla long johns to theirs, but they were still good.Overall, food gets 3/5, but since I loved the decor I gave it a 4/5.

53.description: SO DELICIOUS!!!!!! I wish I found this place before, great breakfast and sweets and coffee, well everything!!!! The salmon eggs benidict and salmon omlette is amazing and the coffee is brewed fresh. They have a full bakery and I tried the scones and they were delicious. The service is also great! They prices are very reasonable and you can buy coffee by the pound too.

30.description: Delicious donuts, a great selection of boutique coffees, clean, friendly.  So why 3 stars?  This place is very poorly run. They open late. closed on mondays, 7am on weekdays, 8am on saturday- that pretty much rules out stopping by on the way to work.  Or before church. And they are REALLY unorganized.  On a couple occasions I went in for a chocolate donut.  and.... they didn't bake any that day.  I quit going because their donut variety is small and unreliable.  Got tired of picking up one kind of donut and then having to go to another bakery to get something as standard as a chocolate frosted donut for other family members. I pass this place EVERY MORNING on the way to duncan down the street because duncan is open and Beverly is not,  and that is really too bad because I prefer Beverly's product.   If they changed management and actually ran the place like a normal business this would be a neighborhood institution.  Instead, it is an exercise in frustration more often than not.

46.description: Their baked goods are somewhere between too dry and just okay, and their breakfast selections are pretty good. The prices are a bit high to make this a regular spot, and it's really not a place where you can linger over a cup of coffee, but it's pleasant and the service is friendly.

1.description: What a charming little place. This is a great representation of the lovely neighborhood of Beverly. The food is good, nothing mind-blowing, but it's delicious and each plate taste like it was made with pride. I've had the eggs benny, muffins, and a veggie omlet. All good. The roasted tomatoes are super yummy. Coffee is delicious... much better than Starbucks! It's a nice little neighborhood breakfast spot. You can get your basic breakfasts, some with a spin, but without the after-effects of a greasy spoon:)

55.description: Wow what a treat this was. The morning of the South Side parade 2012 me and my friend wandered in here after we noticed there we serve breakfast sign. It is a dope little place with there own coffee and many varieties on top of it. They had a special holiday menu but we each just opted to get bacon, eggs, coffee and wheat toast. there wheat bread was amazing. Coffee was top notch and staff wasn't far behind. I highly recommend anyone in the area to drop by.

9.description: If perhaps you haven't been to Beverly Bakery & Cafe in a while, you owe yourself a visit. They've certainly won me over with upgrades to the menu and service. A (late) breakfast spot on regular rotation, when I get jonesin' for Beverly Bakery, it means I want Eggs Benedict. I'll always grab a special if they have one, if not the Bennies on the menu are just as good. Chorizo Benny is my favorite there, with spicy chorizo smashed into a patty. You have to get it with a side of fried potatoes, these perfectly cooked spuds are the best to mop up all the gooey Benedict goodness. And the richness of the egg helps temper the sausage just right.And don't overlook their coffee roasting. Beans from around the planet, fair trade, rainforest certified, organic, you name it, roasted on site. They got super deluxe Jamaica Blue Mountain coffee too if you want to get premium.Nice, if crowded, room, a few outdoor spots on a deck in the rear, definitely check out Beverly Bakery next time you're looking for breakfast.

26.description: Coffee is delicious, food not so much.  This was my second visit to the Beverly Bakery & Cafe over the course of a year.In my first visit I had their delicious coffee with an order of their then Special of the Day, homemade corned beef hash.  The hash was way over seasoned and very dry.  I didn't say anything at the time since it was my first time there and maybe the cook was having a bad day.Fast forward to about a year or so later.  I again order a cup of coffee, but this time I order a skillet with 2 eggs over easy, and rye bread to soak up the yokey goodness.  A runner brings me my food and leaves.  I start to eat and notice that the eggs are cooked over hard, rather than over easy, but my waitress was nowhere in sight.  I went ahead and ate everything except for the eggs.  Then poof, like a magician, my waitress appears.  I let her know about the eggs and she went into the kitchen.  Apparently the cook had three orders of eggs cooking at the same time and got mine mixed up. She offered to get me new eggs, but with no more potatoes or bread to soak up the yokey goodness, I declined.  The restaurant was not busy, but maybe I ate too fast, maybe my waitress went on break, I don't know, but she should have come by at least once to check on my food.Listen, if you are a breakfast place an cannot cook more than two orders of eggs at one time without messing them up, you need to figure something out. Needless to say, I will not be back.

25.description: OK coffee..... Their breakfast is not so good cuz everything is so bland and dry! Their chocolate frosting donuts r awesome !!!!!!

12.description: An outstanding little restaurant in the heart (liver? pancreas?) of Beverly, bolstered not only by its amazing breakfasts but the folks who work there.  I've long held that people who work at restaurants are just as responsible for return visits as the items on the menu.  If you can relate to that idea, then go!  I live at least 45 minutes north of Beverly, but need to get my Beverly Bakery fix at least a couple of times a month.  Completely worth it.

59.description: Nice cozy spot for breakfast.  It's quiet, which makes a great place to get away and read my bible.  I order the omelette with salmon and cream cheese filling, which can only be described with one word: yum-mo.  The pastries look heavenly and plenty to choose.  They also have quite the array of coffee choices,  I'm not much of a coffee drinker however the aroma is incredible.  The service is good also.

21.description: I had the Reuben Benedict. It was delicious. Sorry god for it being Friday during lent. To good to pass up on that. We'll discuss that at a later date hopefully

17.description: So good. Truly surpasses my beloved Starbucks for freshly roasted coffee. Impressive selection of fresh, gourmet coffees....hot and iced as well as sugar-free syrups. The tea and scones are a welcome delight. Grab a buttery pastry, yummy  muffin or delightful doughnut to savor.  I wish there were more breads and cakes readily available. Argh! Wicked carbs! Cozy neighborhood spot for breakfast or lunch with a small variety of sandwiches & brunch specials. Perfect for settling in and reading the paper or sharing  conversation over a quality beverage. The Baristas are lovely.

10.description: Terrible service! I ordered a cake for my sons baptism there. First they told me they couldn't offer me a sheet cake and that I had to go with a round cake which was much more expensive. When I went to pick up my cake the next day, an hour before the baptism, they told me they forgot to make the cake! The place seems very unorganized and only 1 person seems to have answers to questions.  They kept telling me, "Ask her, she can help you." Needless to say, I will no longer be going there.

5.description: This is a place for coffee lovers! Oh they have good food and pastries(lots of pastries to choose from) but the coffee is the real ya-dig! I purchased the Ethiopian and the Bali Blue Moon. Love love love! I can't stop drinking this stuff!

3.description: They really need to open a little earlier on weekends. Great donuts and coffee cakes.

35.description: Donuts are delicious, but small.  I've only tried their lattes and I'm not so impressed, kind of bland.  This place is always requested when it's my turn for "donut day" at work, but every time I call ahead to have my donuts ready, they're not.  No matter how much time I give.  This may seem like a small detail, but to me, in the mornings every minute counts!Not a fan of the prices.  But again, their donuts are delicious.

19.description: I have been wanting to ty this place for at least 8 months now. What was I waiting for? I ended up with a random Friday off and headed over there this morning. Parking seemed to be really easy with plenty of street parking and a side lot off Western. I noticed everyone raved about the coffee here and they were right. I went with the smooth blend and it was good. Our server was so sweet and in chatting with her learned they were recently featured on Chicago's Best. It seems to have brought people out of the woodwork because this place was packed for a Friday. Every employee was very friendly and helpful to new faces.I ordered the Beverly benedict with seasoned potatoes. I'm not normally a huge fan of hashbrowns, but these were awesome. I was very pleased with my benny and enjoyed the hollandaise sauce as well (I'm picky about hollandaise). I grabbed a chocolate donut on the way out for later (it didn't last long) and it was delicious. My only regret is not buying more. They offer a very extensive menu- This isn't just a bakery. Omelets, pancakes, french toast, the list goes on and on. I can't wait to go back!

28.description: Great neighborhood breakfast joint/bakery.  The hot breakfasts are really good and they typically have great specials.  The baked goods are good too....maybe not as good as some old stand by bakeries like Wolf's or Iversen's, but pretty good.  And the coffee is spectacular.

45.description: I've lived in the Beverly neighborhood for decades.  I welcomed Beverly Bakery when it opened several years ago.  The owners are neighborhood people.  Jim roasts his own beans and the variety would please most palates.  The limited selection of pastries are good. Try the Hummingbird Cake -- it's second to none. Custom orders are very expensive, but I suppose that's a sign of the times.   Table service is terribly slow, so if you are pressed for time you might try somewhere else. (After dozens of visits I can make the case, but I'm retired and rarely in a hurry.)  Strange though. I recently asked them to fill an order for a delicious item I'd purchased several times before and the owner refused -- rather churlishly, I might add.  When I e-mailed my concern, they flat out ignored me -- not good!  I guess they were absent on the day customer satisfaction was taught.  Consequently they lost my business.

33.description: I just want to add that I've started going to the 103rd street location, and it's made my mornings way more bearable. The coffee is just so good, although I have to say that the tempting AMAZING pastries are a problem for me. Every time I see someone getting coffee from Starbucks I glare at them just a little, which is creepy, but why would you go to a chain that has crappy coffee and stale pastries??

43.description: I have just recently been married. We are big advocates of shopping locale. So we had our wedding cake made here. let m tell you we could not have been any happier. The service was first rate. The guests just loved the cake. The food and beverage director said it was the best cake ever served at their facilty.

2.description: This is a cute place to eat at!!! Their coffee is pretty good and I was so disappointed with their chocolate chips cookies!! Not freshly baked cookies, maybe it was just bad cookie!!!

18.description: Let me start by saying I love to use local businesses!!  So I've been to Beverly Bakery both for coffee and also to dine in for breakfast. I always thought the food was mediocre and over priced but still a local business at the end of the day.  Well this morning my wife tried to go and make a substantial purpose for her entire staff and at 6:55 the door was locked and the staff sat there looking at her through the window.  So when she told me I called and asked what time they open. I was rudely told "we are open". I politely said "that wasn't the question".  She replied "well then 7". Bottom line...you can get better food, better coffee, and better service at other spots in Beverly..both locally owned and a chain that starts with S.

41.description: This place has the most impressive coffee machine I've ever seen, and they know how to use it.  I'm not a huge coffee guy, but the black stuff at Beverly Bakery & Cafe is notably spectacular. Just the thing after a raucous Saturday night down south. The food is hearty and as good as you would get in the more pretentious north side brunch spots. I had the Crab Cake Benedict - the red pepper hollaindaise was really unique, rich and tasty. I had some of my buddies' Salmon Omelet, also awesome. It had a huge piece of salmon in it (I appreciate the lack of skimping), and the fish was nice and fresh. The place is cozy, was busy but not crammed when I was there on a Sunday morning, and is definitely oozing with old school Beverly charm.And seriously that coffee machine looks like something Willy Wonka would have at his house.

52.description: Great bakery and a cozy place for lunch. Awesome coffee and incredible chocolate donuts!

50.description: THIS place, is EXACTLY what a neighborhood coffee house and restaurant should be. Always fresh coffee, delicious food, GREAT service, and best of all, an affordable menu. I am here all of the time, and I try something new each day I am there.I would highly recommend pretty much any of their pastries. There's something about a good, buttery, donut dunked in their Honduras coffee that I just cannot explain. Their food, their service and the coffees are definitely the real deal!However, parking can be a problem, try to get there early to avoid that.

4.description: Awesome experience! I came right before close with my 6 month old and they gave me and my friend phenomenal customer service! We both ordered skillets and it was the best! I will return and quite frequently.

6.description: This place was great for a quaint dining experience.  The staff makes you feel like you're coming in to Gramma's or an old time friend's place. They have an array of coffee that will hit any coffee lover's pallet and the quality of it you can taste for sure.  If you're not sure what kind you would like to try that day, you can even ask them for the style you want (sharp, strong, smooth, etc) and they will pull up a match you will surely enjoy. The food is clearly made then and there and service is quick.  They don't waste time when it comes to food and take it seriously.  I'd highly suggest stopping by this place.

22.description: Why do I love this place?!? Because when you get there at 7:10 and your favorite doughnut is not our yet, the owner comes out from the back with the most beautiful longjohn ever! Love the food! Love, love, love the people!

15.description: Very good flavors & variety of both breakfast foods, (including pastries), and coffees. Small seating area & parking lot make it prototypically difficult during peak  breakfast times  but as thrashed goes that's the signs your looking for!!!  One of the only places I'm aware of in the city you can some times pickup bulk quantities of Jamaican blue mountain coffee.  One of the two best breakfast options in the Beverly Morgan Park area.

57.description: The caffeine cruise continues...indefinitely.They roast their own beans?  Of course I had to check it out!  It was near where we were having book club...well...near enough.Great warm place, friendly staff who laughed with us and accommodated cheerfully our every quirky request.  It seemed silly to just have coffee but we were going to have food at book club.  Oatmeal to the rescue!  Not too filling, goes great with coffee and it is absolutely delicious here.  It is served with brown sugar and raisins and this day was flavored with cinnamon.  My father would be so proud, we had oatmeal for breakfast.Our reason for coming was the coffee and it was reason enough.  My mocha latte and my daughter's latte were perfect.  Hot, smooth, silky with a kick that said wake up darling, you are drinking some darn fine coffee.  Cost:  Around 3.00Served in:  MugPreparation:  Handcrafted

20.description: The coffee is always delicious, and the chocolate cake donuts... well, you just have to try them. The atmosphere is warm and welcoming, the owners are friendly, and the food is delicious. You can't go wrong with a skillet and pastries, and don't miss the corn bread muffins -- although they're only offered seasonally. Beverly Bakery is a great little Beverly spot, and not to be missed!

36.description: Great place to buy baked party supplies, but also to eat great breakfasts (eggs benedict or with spinach or salmon!) and drink the varieties of home-roasted coffee. Run by the Quigley family who knows and welcomes EVERYBODY.

14.description: A very classy environment. Excellent food and coffee.  A nice sitting area with tables.  Parking on the street.  For railfans, a nice view of metra trains passing by.

58.description: Pure yumminess.  An excellent casual burger joint.  I love the cheese burgers and especially the fries. The pickles are like crack, haha.  The chocolate milk shakes are delicious, thick globs of goodness that are big enough to be shared.  Be careful when you are pouring the milkshake into the glasses, I have spilled the globs on more occasions than I care to count.  All in all, I highly recommend...unless you're into fancy schmancy, and then this is not your place.

56.description: Allow me to get to the meat of the matter (pun intended).  The burgers here are very juicy and flavorful.  I have had only one place that compares to the quality of these burgers.  I also had one of their shakes and found it reminiscent of Zephyr on Wilson.

29.description: Omg the best burger I had in years big juicy very flavorful keep up the good work kept hearing about it then saw Chicago best truly Chicago's best burger

42.description: I hate it when a place gets a lot of hype and doesn't live up. I never know if it's because people built it up to higher standards or if I'm being too picky.We saw something on the Travel Channel and since I'm from the south side, I was amazed I'd never heard of it. I'm a little annoyed that nobody told me sooner.So we decided to come here and celebrate something, I forget what.... end of the school semester?We got to the area and were surprised that you had to pay for parking on 95th street. It made me feel old that this change happened so close by and I had no clue. So we paid for the parking and gave ourselves 45 minutes and hoped it'd be enough.So we get a booth and reviewed the menu. We both got burgers and fries and something to drink.Let the countdown begin. We ordered fast and hoped the food would be out quickly so we didn't end up with a parking ticket. A long time passes and we see many people getting their food and nothing came to us.The waitress was so busy I couldn't flag her down and ask about our food. But we got our food and scarfed it down. Originally, we were going to get a milkshake but time didn't permit. I would try this place again but maybe for lunch on the weekend. The burger and fries were good but not spectacular.

23.description: My first time at this restaurant and definitely not my last!  One of the best burgers I have had in my life.  I see why they have been in business for so many years.  My friend and I went here today.  She had the 1/2 lb beefburger and I had the 1/2 lb beefburger patti melt. Both of us were raving how good our burgers were.  They gave me alot of fries but I will tell you, they were so good, I ate them all.  I had half of my melt to take home.  All in all, a great casual atmosphere to dine and get good food.  I look forward to my next visit!

47.description: Ahhhhhhh.......What a Delicious & Tasty Burger!! Went here for lunch for the 1st time (will not be my last)*  Old style seating & friendly and helpful services! ! Not a fancy joint...it's not suppose to be!! It is what it is....a great family friendly spot or work lunch getaway from the typical grind & not fast food!! Everything was Awesome. ..fresh cut fries....fresh toppings on mouth-watering bigass burger!!  Southside melting pot of clientele makes it perfect eating spot for city's finest in attendance & all sorts of folks! ! Great place & superb food!! Definitely coming back again! !

8.description: The Patty Melt is extreme heaven. Toasted rye bread, cheese, onions and a beef patty done perfectly and all gluey together. That is not the only excellent thing on the menu -- french fries are always perfect and crispy, too.

31.description: Truly an old Chicago gem. Great char flavor on this classic diner burger. I'll be back for sure.

34.description: Best Burger you'll have. Grab a shake while your at it, 1950's style.

16.description: Though the food was good it wasn't great like it used to be. For years this was my favorite burger joint. In visiting from Atlanta and my expectations no where near met. Instead of the thick hand packed burgers that I grew to love we received slightly thin patties (good beef patties but still patties). I was also let down because they no longer use fresh strawberries for the shakes just syrup....decided to get a root beer instead. But it's not all bad. The fries was still the same delicious and freshly cut. Yeah I will come again....because the good food is good....but it was a let down......

13.description: I hate it when a place gets a lot of hype and doesn't live up. I never know if it's because people built it up to higher standards or if I'm being too picky.We saw something on the Travel Channel and since I'm from the south side, I was amazed I'd never heard of it. I'm a little annoyed that nobody told me sooner.So we decided to come here and celebrate something, I forget what.... end of the school semester?We got to the area and were surprised that you had to pay for parking on 95th street. It made me feel old that this change happened so close by and I had no clue. So we paid for the parking and gave ourselves 45 minutes and hoped it'd be enough.So we get a booth and reviewed the menu. We both got burgers and fries and something to drink.Let the countdown begin. We ordered fast and hoped the food would be out quickly so we didn't end up with a parking ticket. A long time passes and we see many people getting their food and nothing came to us.The waitress was so busy I couldn't flag her down and ask about our food. But we got our food and scarfed it down. Originally, we were going to get a milkshake but time didn't permit. I would try this place again but maybe for lunch on the weekend. The burger and fries were good but not spectacular.

11.description: Possibly having this unique flavor of dying nostalgia from classic Americana, Top Notch is what it is.  A dive with good food.  Nothing fancy just good food.  I ordered the burger here after seeing it on the Travel Channel.  The burger itself was full of flavor and the fries were good.  The service was lacking a little, especially since it was not too busy at all.  Still, food was brought out fairly quickly and parking was fairly easy.  I must admit, I was a little reluctant at first because of its southside location.  Alas, the food delivered, but service took what would've been a four star review into a three star review.  With all that being said, I would return for another burger and possibly get a milkshake which looked quite appealing.

39.description: best  burger and fries in chicago! if anybody says anything different, their lying to you! the best!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

37.description: Waited about 15 minutes before recognized. Ordered an omlete. Got a thin layer of egg on top of a heap of ingredients. The rest of my order came about 10 minutes later. Just moved around the corner and I will be going else where for my weekly spot.

0.description: Even though I'm from the burbs, I consider myself a southsider. Sox fan, check; Irish, Catholic, Middle class; check check check.But now I feel like I've been masquerading as one all the years never having a Top Notch Burger. Alas, I can now add Top Notch Burger to my list of south-side credentials. Can't believe it has taken me all my life to experience the wonders of this place. This place has character. Old school Chicago, wood paneling, slight smell of grease in the air. Everything you want from a burger joint. Happy Eats,Jeremy L. (Kind of from the south side)

38.description: The burgers are ok. I do like that they are made to order and fresh, with fresh condiments. The onion rings are great. Gone there twice and don't see what all the rave is about. I'm more of a char-grilled burger fan. Flat top burgers just don't have that same flavor, unless it's high quality meat.

51.description: This place does not deserve to be on top burgers lists, but definately on a top fast food burger list for Chicago.  I ordered the 1/2 inch with cheese fries.  The burger was big and delicious.  It was not real juicy or anything but it had that great fast food taste, almost like a Burger King Whopper on crack!  The fries were just standard diner fries and the dipping cheese kinda sucked, so I will go regular fries the next time.  This has now become one of my main go to fast food burgers if I am ever that far on the south side.WARNING!  Do not get the 3/4 pound burger!  My brother ordered that and it was dry and not that great.  You see 3/4 burgers are too big and dry out upon cooking, especially a fast food burger.  Just stick to the 1/4 pounder or 1/2 pounder.

27.description: Burger was so so. I didn't think it was worth the hype. Onion rings were average at best. Oreo milkshake was probably the best part of the meal. not sure if I come back.

32.description: The best burgers in the city...hands down!

54.description: Awesome burgers! Great price. Fries, cheeseburger with grilled onions, and soup were all top notch!

48.description: Grew up in Beverly, raised on Top Notch. Beyond the nostalgia factor, probably my absolute favorite burger/fry combo.

44.description: I'm never disappointed with Top Notch.  I've gone here for my beer burgers for years and nothing has changed.  My kids and I go at least once a month for burgers and shakes.  My favorite topping...Mushrooms! Yum!

24.description: Burgers and fries are good, but the staff was not very friendly. Could have been I was too dark :(

7.description: One of the best burger spots in Chicago. I was never a fan of turkey burgers till I tried one from here. I always get the turkey burger with turkey bacon western style and i promise u will not be disappointed. The frys always come back soggy so I would recommend any shake and burger to go. Even the roast beef plate is good.

49.description: I love this place . Burgers are always great ! The only thing I don't like is their no free refills . What restaurant doesn't do free refills . Other than that, food and service is great . Also, it's really affordable

40.description: This place is special & well loved round these parts.  Quick service, fresh, & home made service in an authetically vintage ambiance.It is not a gourmet burger place, as another reviewer said, but rather a home style burger.  Fresh cut, deliciously fried fries.  Perfect milk shake, thick and deeeelicious.  That is all I ever get.  It is comfort food & such a treat every single time.

53.description: My favorite fries in the world!

30.description: Possibly having this unique flavor of dying nostalgia from classic Americana, Top Notch is what it is.  A dive with good food.  Nothing fancy just good food.  I ordered the burger here after seeing it on the Travel Channel.  The burger itself was full of flavor and the fries were good.  The service was lacking a little, especially since it was not too busy at all.  Still, food was brought out fairly quickly and parking was fairly easy.  I must admit, I was a little reluctant at first because of its southside location.  Alas, the food delivered, but service took what would've been a four star review into a three star review.  With all that being said, I would return for another burger and possibly get a milkshake which looked quite appealing.

46.description: I saw this place on check please. Couldn't believe it was still around. I stopped in for lunch and it hasn't changed a bit. I got the cheese beef burger. Now the cheese was only 10 cents more and it was not processed, it was thick and sliced from the block. I tried plopping some mayo on it and it slid off. Juicy, meaty and tasty all for under 5 bucks. I also got fries and a soda and the tab was still just over 7 dollars. Pleasant experience with excellent service and wonderful food.

1.description: Great neighborhood and yummy burger! Cheeseburger, fries and a chocolate malt! What could be better?!  I grew up eating here with my dad and it is always consistent. Consistently good!Parking sucks though. Metered street parking :-(

55.description: I have been meaning to write a review for Top Notch for quite a while, and it's time to bite the bullet.  Sadly, a completely underwhelming experience.  I was terribly distracted by the bottom of the bun sticking to my teeth with every bite.  Not a hell of a lot of flavor, either - the raw onions were very not oniony.  The kitchen was full of teenager cooks, and the floor understaffed.  Sweet waitress, but totally overwhelmed.  Fries were nothing special, but they were cold by the time they got to me.  I did get a great seer flavor in that last bite, but that was barely a consolation.  Sorry Top Notch, but your glory days are over.

9.description: My first time at this restaurant and definitely not my last!  One of the best burgers I have had in my life.  I see why they have been in business for so many years.  My friend and I went here today.  She had the 1/2 lb beefburger and I had the 1/2 lb beefburger patti melt. Both of us were raving how good our burgers were.  They gave me alot of fries but I will tell you, they were so good, I ate them all.  I had half of my melt to take home.  All in all, a great casual atmosphere to dine and get good food.  I look forward to my next visit!

26.description: Good burgers and shakes. Order the fries crispyAmbience is lacking but the food more than makes up for that.

25.description: Good place if u need a good burger.  The food took a little longer than it should and that's the only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5.  But other than that I enjoyed the food.

12.description: Best cheeseburger ever been eating at top notch for over 25 years I have had cheeseburgers everywhere nothing can compare it melts in your mouth

59.description: Great burger place very close to my family in Chicago!

21.description: THE BEST CHILI EVER.....the service can be a little slow but the melts, burgers and chili are very very good...

17.description: This place does not deserve to be on top burgers lists, but definately on a top fast food burger list for Chicago.  I ordered the 1/2 inch with cheese fries.  The burger was big and delicious.  It was not real juicy or anything but it had that great fast food taste, almost like a Burger King Whopper on crack!  The fries were just standard diner fries and the dipping cheese kinda sucked, so I will go regular fries the next time.  This has now become one of my main go to fast food burgers if I am ever that far on the south side.WARNING!  Do not get the 3/4 pound burger!  My brother ordered that and it was dry and not that great.  You see 3/4 burgers are too big and dry out upon cooking, especially a fast food burger.  Just stick to the 1/4 pounder or 1/2 pounder.

10.description: Definitely a fan of this Southside institution. Stopped in for a Friday lunch after seeing the rave reviews. I could smell the sizzling beef about a block away (happy me!). Glad to see plenty of seating inside, no problem finding a table. Service throughout was friendly and quick. For an old-school diner, the place was surprisingly clean and well kept. Tried the Oreo Cookie milk shake...glad I did too. Made-to-order, and quite possibly one of the best homemade/handmade shakes I've ever had. For the main course, I had to try their 3/4 lb. Super King Cheeseburger with all the fixins. No doubt a solid burger, and IMO more enjoyable sans lettuce and tomato. Ketchup, mustard, and grilled onions were all this big baby needed to rise to the occasion.  The fresh hand-cut fries were a welcome addition too; well-seasoned and made-to-order. One thing I didn't really care for was the lack of binder in the burger. Seemed to fall apart as I was eating, and could've been helped with a little egg or bread crumbs. All-in-all it was a solid burger, and quality Beverly diner. Remember, it's old school...no wi-fi, TV's, alcohol service, but credit cards are accepted. The prices, food, and service all hit the mark. Definitely made a new customer!P.S. Law enforcement friendly! Thanks Top Notch!

5.description: Best burger, fries and shake you will ever eat. Everything is fairly priced and whether it's to go or dine in, the food is phenomenal. Every time I have visitors from out of town I make it a point to come here. I've been eating here for as long as I can remember and will continue to.

3.description: Yes, a Chicago PD cop was ordering his burger as we were walking in.  Rosa J. and Daddy J. didn't follow this cop to Top Notch Beef Burgers.  We swore that never happened!  She saw an episode of "Chicago's Best," featuring this burger joint.I always have a hankering for an old-fashioned diner like Top Notch.  The ambiance is pretty causal.  You get to sit yourself at the comfy, intimate booth. Soon the friendly lady server delivered us two (2) cups of iced water while we were perusing the menu.  All the burgers and patty melt sandwiches come with sharp American cheese, unless specified or requested for a different type of cheese.  Daddy J. went with a half-pound burger (without cheese) plus a side of fries.  Did he think this burger was top notch?  I certainly thought so because he ate it all with a smile.  I, on the other hand, had the corned beef patty melt.  I'm not Irish, yet corned beef is one of my favorite things to eat.  By the way, there were two (2) large pickles included with my sandwich.  Yes, anything that comes with pickles will win Rosa J.'s heart!  Top Notch burgers also came with top notch price points.  With a bill containing the image of Andrew Jackson, we could buy (2) entree with fries before tip.  Beverly is a lovely neighborhood to stroll around.  Be sure to stop by Top Notch, a place where CPD cops have their stamped-approval.

35.description: Excellent burger!  Took awhile before I was waited on, but food arrived fairly quickly once ordered. Better than chain fastfood burgers, for sure. Would recommend a try, if ever in South Chicago.

19.description: Very great burgers n service was very fast. Will definitely come back when I'm in the Chicago area. 1/2LB burger was cooked just right.

28.description: Old-school burgers, great fries and just tasty. I just wish parking here was easier!

45.description: Top Notch is a step back to when times were simpler; before burgers were served with Brie & duck fat truffled fries. The diner atmosphere still has a counter with stools and appears to have been untouched for decades. The burgers are ground daily from eye of round and come on a toasted bun with the usual fixings. The fries are never frozen, but hand-cut daily and are fried to crispy perfection! Their chocolate malts are a great way to finish after one of the best nostalgic burgers and you can't beat the prices!!!

33.description: Definitely a fan of this Southside institution. Stopped in for a Friday lunch after seeing the rave reviews. I could smell the sizzling beef about a block away (happy me!). Glad to see plenty of seating inside, no problem finding a table. Service throughout was friendly and quick. For an old-school diner, the place was surprisingly clean and well kept. Tried the Oreo Cookie milk shake...glad I did too. Made-to-order, and quite possibly one of the best homemade/handmade shakes I've ever had. For the main course, I had to try their 3/4 lb. Super King Cheeseburger with all the fixins. No doubt a solid burger, and IMO more enjoyable sans lettuce and tomato. Ketchup, mustard, and grilled onions were all this big baby needed to rise to the occasion.  The fresh hand-cut fries were a welcome addition too; well-seasoned and made-to-order. One thing I didn't really care for was the lack of binder in the burger. Seemed to fall apart as I was eating, and could've been helped with a little egg or bread crumbs. All-in-all it was a solid burger, and quality Beverly diner. Remember, it's old school...no wi-fi, TV's, alcohol service, but credit cards are accepted. The prices, food, and service all hit the mark. Definitely made a new customer!P.S. Law enforcement friendly! Thanks Top Notch!

43.description: This was a good backyard burger. The cheese was spot on because I like a sharp American that oozes all over the burger. The bun, a freshly toasted giant sesame, was great.  However, I feel the burger could have been a little less cook time. The burger was a lean meat so it needed to be a little more juicy. The bun could handle the juice of the burger. I even got the 3/4 lb super king cheese burger. The fries we normal fries nothing to write home about but still a quality crispy normal sized fries. I don't like the greasy underdone fries so this frie although not fabulous was quite good. The cup of cheese for my fries was great. It seemed like a thick Mac-n-cheese cheese which was awesome. If I were to take a guess I feel the mayonnaise was made in house. The mayo was this fatty deliciousness. Maybe it was because I haven't eaten a good dollop of mayo lately. Also the staff was very pleasant. They came to my table at least 3 times, even bringing me a water without asking after I ordered an iced tea. The drinks are extremely large in size. One last thing a tin of police officers were here eating and relaxing. The place felt extremely safe and clean. If the police eat here you know it must be a local long time quality food joint. Sorry one more thing. I was in and out for a sit down meal in less than 30 minutes.

2.description: "Top Notch" is totally accurate when it comes to describing the burgers, fries, and shakes here. Just get a regular old cheeseburger (with grilled onions of course) and fries. I like the vanilla shake, too - it's creamy and sweet. It's hard to have a thin burger that is still juicy and pink. I tend to prefer thicker burgers because I hate my burgers too brown.  But these are thin and still perfectly cooked. The beef is nice and crumbly and the party is well spiced and really juicy.  Get all of the toppings -- they're fresh and add good crunch and flavor without overwhelming the burger at all.  The fries are just the right combination of crispy and soggy.  Plus, everything here is so dang cheap and ready in an instant.  I love it.

18.description: It's been 18+ years since I stepped through the doors of this burger paradise, but it felt like only yesterday I'd eaten here. When the owner was in the kitchen, this place was vibrant and alive. Today's visit was just a few notches (no pun intended) above walking into a funeral home. Then again, it was early on a rainy Monday morning. Our server was a bit slow to greet us after we seated ourselves and seemed kinda grim. That took some of the joy out of returning here after so many years since I would have preferred fireworks going off when I walked in the door... but whatever. Nothing was gonna stop me from enjoying this burger.THE FOODI ordered my all time favorite burger - the Patty Melt. I first fell in love with this burger down the street at the Walgreen's in Evergreen Plaza. Those were the days when some Walgreen's had a diner attached. But it was here where I became addicted and I couldn't wait to get my fix. My family order breakfast items.* The Patty Melt (3.75 stars) was perfectly sandwiched between two grilled sliced of rye bread, two glorious slices of American cheese and the perfect amount of grilled onions. Ahhhh, heaven.  The french fries weren't that great but my main reason for coming was the burger. It was delicious, but I seem to remember it tasting better back in the days when I was a regular.* The pancakes were HUGE (4 stars). Unbelievably thick!!! My kids split a stack of three that could easily have been 6 at any other restaurant. I don't normally like pancakes this thick, but they managed to make me a believer.* Egg & Cheese sandwich on grilled rye bread with turkey bacon gave my wife pleasure (4 stars). She really loved the pancakes too and said she would love to come back here on our next visit. This type of praise from her is rare.   THE VERDICTAlways a great choice, just not as much of a favorite as it once was. Too bad we didn't arrive on Friday as we originally planned. I was told by the store manager the Food Network was here filming a new series on that day which highlights America's famous burger houses around the country. What an amazing experience that would have been for my kids as I rediscovered my childhood food addiction. I was told the show will air sometime in June or July 2013.Yelp100[68]

41.description: This place does not deserve to be on the top burgers lists,But definately on a top Nasty lists im really discussed at this point. I have been meaning to write a review for Top Notch for quite a while,Sadly, a completely underwhelming experience.  I was terribly distracted by Hair being in my fries three times literally on different occasions. Not a hell of a lot of Respect or actions taking place,They were very unprofessional staff not to mention someones discussing hair being in my food three times then after giving them several times to correct the issues and not acting a fool on them cause everyone makes mistakes right but i hate when you try to consider that everyone make mistakes then they play you like its your fault it happen which i shouldn't have because that was a trumatized experience but i did before i gave up on them now they will never get my business ever again. From the begining of the first to second call nothing was done the manager jim offered me a free frie next time but i never recieved them Staff continued to charge me every other time after for fries and was kind of acting wierd and looking at me funny when i came in. Now After speaking to Staff this time there solution was your burger fine just come get another frie which its the principle three times and you still want me to eat from there and Manager Jim,Jim he walked over to my place of business to get the fries and burger with the hair in it, he seen the hair in it even pick it up never apologized once but he did offer another order and i did consider it at first only because i was starving on my lunch break but it being the principle him never apologizing this happening three times i didnt want to trust it again so i just asked him to give me a refund and ill go somewhere else for lunch cause this is ridiculous and sad. The kitchen was full of teenage cooks that doesn't wear any hair nets either and they are totally overwhelmed. I hate it when a place gets a lot of hype and doesn't live up to them. I never know if it's because people built it up to higher standards or if I'm being too picky but im very disappointed but that was barely a consolation.  Sorry Top Notch, but your glory days are over these issues has to be addressed there need to be actions taking placed for your staff. You have lost a loyal customer.....

52.description: I'm done with this place. I have been eating here for over 30 years and it has steadily been going down hill. I called today with an order for 5 people at 7:31 and they wouldn't take my order because it was past 7:30.

50.description: This is my absolute favorite burger joint! the turkey burgers are well seasoned! I love the cut fries.. They are kinda stingy w/ the fries & this usually leads to"Fry theivery" in my house!!! Its nice to top off your meal with a cookies & creme shake for the road... mmmm.....mmmm ..... the service hear is fast so you wont starve to death and its a neighborhood jewel so remember that when trying to find street parking

4.description: I had the mexican burger but it wasnt spicy but still good and you can tell meat is fresh

6.description: Worst service ever. Ordered 2 cheeseburgers and ,2 soups. Received 1 cheeseburger and 1 cheeseburger deluxe. Soup was all noodles. The bill charged us for 2 deluxe and 1 soup? Overcharged...should of been no charge for either soup. She should of tipped us for the patience we endured. Had to ask for refill on water. While a hand full of servers stood around talking. Was never like this ever. Been coming here 20 years. Not going back to soon$20.00 for 2 cheeseburgers. Not to mention a drive from Palos Hills for this unsatisfactory experience.

22.description: The best way to describe this is a good homemade burger. It was so fresh and delicious. My boyfriend got the 3/4 lb burger and ALMOST finished all of it! We both got Oreo shakes - sooooo good! And the fresh cut fries were delicious. I'd definitely come back.

15.description: Living in such close proximity to Top Notch is dangerous. This old fashioned burger joint serves up classic juicy cheeseburgers, hand cut fries and chocolate milkshakes and malts! I might be a little biased because I grew up with Top Notch, and not much has changed in the past 20 years. Casual American diner that tastes like home.

57.description: This is my second visit to a place that seems to receive good burger reviews. Even George Motz included them in his seminal "Hamburger America."  The sign over the door says something about being the greatest burger. Really?The gray piece of ground beef I was served had but one virtue: it was warm. The 1/2 pound cheeseburger here is so UNremarkable I can't imagine ever coming here again. This is simply a dinghy coffee shop with worn out furnishings and nothing to recommend it. I suggest that anyone looking for a cheeseburger should stay on 95th Street heading west and there is a new Smashburger on your left in 1/2 mile.

20.description: It's a pretty good burger place to eat. It's very vintage, not only in decor but also the way of preparing the food. If you want an old school burger (the crusty bun and a bit greasy) this is the place to go. Aside from the burger and fries, everything else we ordered was pretty mediocre.

36.description: I first tried Top Notch because they ran a groupon. Now I eat there with my son all of the time. The burgers are charred perfectly, the fries are just crisp enough and they have great milkshakes. I've had banana and strawberry. Great value for the price.

14.description: So I was told this place has GREAT burgers. That was definitely not the case for me. When the food arrived it looked uninviting. I took two bites and couldn't continue eating it. The texture was just too mushy for me. When I told the waitress I didn't like it, all she did was apologize. When the bill came I asked if she could take off the burger that I didn't eat. I was willing to pay for the fries and coffee. When the manager came to the table, he said he wasn't going to take the burger off because "there was nothing wrong with it, you just didn't like it" Huh?? There was something wrong with it to ME. I wasn't asking to have the burger for free, I just didn't want to pay for something I was unable to eat. Anyway, I definitely will not be coming back. Ever.

3.description: Of all the chicken places around, yeah Harold's, wing stop, Popeye's, theirs that have been brought over to me for lunch this is still my favorite. I could live on the original recipe chicken though I assume it would be a short life after my arteries get clogged and I die from a heart attack. Get the coupons on line, yeah they save a dollar or what not but hell that's a free soda. (Yeah I said soda not pop. POP IS A SOUND) sorry quick rant there. Great chicken despite it being a chain

1.description: Nice store. The drive thru cashier was very personable.

2.description: So disappointed with the chicken. The chicken was overcooked.  The thighs were so small I thought it was a wing. KFC is expensive to begin with so when you get bad chicken you are not a happy camper. Loved the cole slaw. Something told me to leave when I saw no customers. I will definitely NOT be coming back to this location. Good luck to those who will buy chicken from this place.

0.description: Great place servers are always nice to kids never complain when kids get a little wild in there very respectful and always appreciate paying customers. Not to mention the food is always satisfactory

28.description: I'll give them props because they're one of my local homebrew shops. Definitely like the grain closet they have and the willingness that the owner has when you ask for advice. Not the best selection for parts and stuff, a bit overpriced in that regard. But overall, can't complain, I like the beer ingredients they have to offer. And they make killer mead (Wild Blossom Meadery is the same place).

1.description: Well let's seeWife buys beer brewing kit last year and it was missing the thermometer. Went back to store and they gave me one.Today on brew day 20 degrees out and my pale ale kit does not contain the dry malt extract.It was cold so I substituted 12 oz of honey.The Muslin bag was put in the pot and little bugs came out of the bag. I dumped 5 gallons of good water down the drain and refilled my pot.The good thing here is they answer your questions. The bad thing is they answer everybody else's questions. I went in to buy additional hoops. I like my beer hoop forward. I grabbed what I wanted and had to wait for 15 minutes while some guy asked a bunch of questions about his wine brew. Some of these guys with beards will tell you 2 oz of hoops and your beer will be 'hoppy'. I fell for this only once.The place is set up like a hardware shop.Watch out on the sidewalk in front of this establishment. I almost stepped in dog feces on 2 separate occasions. Update: Greg, thanks for the offer. However I don't write reviews in order to get something free. I wouldn't consider it a bad experience. The 3 stars takes all aspects into consideration including price. I bought a 12 pack of empty bottles for $17 man! Each batch of beer that yields 2 cases is over $80. I enjoy the hobby but the price point is high.Furthermore, I'll definitely be back due to close proximity to my residence. Sometimes I wish business owners would look at the big picture and invest something back into the business.

9.description: Its snowing roads are bad, but I need one thing to make my brew day possible.  I hop in the car after work and rush over to BevArt on Western.  They close at 7pm, I wish they had better hours, but it is what it is.  I rush to this homebrew shop, in less than ideal driving conditions from my work downtown, trying to make it there before 7pm.  I arrive, look at my phone - 6:58.  I think great, I'll be in and out...I made it.  I try to open the door...locked.  I see two men inside.  I knock, ask through a locked door yelling "Can I make one quick purchase?" so they can hear me.  I look at my phone again - 6:59.  The guy comes to the door and motions no and walks away.  I look at my phone again, still 6:59.I'm baffled as to why a small business like this wouldn't want one more sale for the day....and most of all to help a customer that frequents the establishment.  If your already there, why not open the door, especially when your hours say 7pm and its 6:59. I'm tired of this place.  They never have what I am looking for and their customer service is less than stellar.  I'll send my money somewhere else from now on.

23.description: It would seem as though the first time I visited here, I just had the wrong guy behind the counter.  And frankly, that is the reason the update review isn't higher.  But after needing to journey here because my brew store of choice was out of bottles, I had a very good experience with a very friendly and helpful gentlemen.  So much so, that I felt the need to say that they seem to have a good selection and, on occasion, very helpful and friendly staff.Sadly, this does not trump my first visit; though I will no longer be so reluctant to return whenever needed.

5.description: Really good place to learn more about making wine and getting all the supplies You need. I went for my birthday with my mom and we had a blast. Definitely would go again and learn to make beer next. they literally have everything you need!

25.description: There aren't many good brewer supply stores in the city, and if there are, then they aren't as good as this place. This small little store seems to be a "mom and pop" type place. The owners are extremely knowledgeable in their field, and are very nice.You feel like you get more personal care while at this place as compared to some big company looking to throw some bull squabble at you just to get your bucks.Want to start brewing but don't know how? Take one of their classes. It's a great way to start, plus, you get your full fill of the 5 gallons of the beer of your choice you've decided to make. Then, when you're ready, pick up your Ale Pails and carboy needs. Excellent! I like my beer ingredients to come from here.

12.description: Ok...there is a place that offers wine making classes, cider making classes, and beer brewing classes (After class and material fees, each bottle of wine I made came to about $8 a bottle.  Holy awesome!!)?!?  Pinch me!  I must be dreaming...!In December, my sister and I embarked on our first wine making classes. After a few hours of wine tasting, cracker eating, wine pouring and swirling, we made the equivalence of 2+ cases.  i didn't realize it had to ferment (oops!) and we had to wait 8-10 weeks to bottle our concoction.We went on Monday to finish the wine fun and bottle and cork our "magic juice".  Yes, it was supposed to take us about 1 hour, but we ended up being there 2+ hours!  We had to taste our wines several times (and add a little of this and a little of that) to make sure that our palates were happy.Greg, the owner, was there every step of the way, and went up and beyond when it came to service.  We had countless questions and could not stop giggling and often brought him into our giddiness.  Bev-Art also makes various honey wines and some red wines.  Many honey wines can be purchased at Binny's and In Fine Spirits (among other stores around the Chicagoland area).  If I am not mistaken, there was a "wine making" event in either Lakeview or Lincoln Park and know that it has been closed down for awhile.  I have never been there, but never drawn to the idea, seemed rather rushed.The place is the real deal!!  A group of us are already planning our next field trip!

21.description: My fiancée got me a gift certificate for the beer brewing class for my birthday, so we took a trip down to the south side last Saturday.  The class was great.  Gregg was a great teacher.  He was very funny and knowledgeable and made sure each group understood the process.  After the class we went back across the street and bought our own brewing kit.  I can't wait to return and bottle the beer we made and to brew up our batch soon.

16.description: Me and my girlfriend took a wine making class here over the winter. While the staff was very friendly, knowlagable, and very accommodating, there were a few instances where I felt that we could of learned more, or it could of been more engaging at times.  With that said, I would recommend this to my friends and we are talking about coming back.

17.description: My visiting friend somehow found this place while preparing for her trip to visit me. She told me that had mead (honey wine) tastings and that they were a brewer and that the tasting was free. Free booze was pretty much all I needed to know in order to agree to this trip. So we walk into this storefront and I was very confused. It looks like a shop to buy brewing supplies. We kindly asked the guy behind the counter if they offered tastings and they do. For some reason while they brew and sell supplies to brew on site they are unable to actually sell the booze. Their side of the street is "dry" and you need to go across the street to buy the wine/beer/mead that you like. So we tried many times of mead: A regular dry mead, cranberry mead, blueberry, cherry, chocolate, and bourbon mead. Most were very good and it was interesting to try something new. Since mead is very sweet it's not for everyone but I find it a refreshing summer drink. The guy that helped us with the tasting was great.
