I think his name was Greg, and he was very informative about everything. It's interesting to hear where the fruit and honey come from and that everything is then fermented. He was also very friendly an accommodating to us. Their stuff is sold in most Binny's so should I want to buy anything I don't have to drive all the way down south. I would have to say that my friend did a good job at finding something to do in Chicago that I would never have thought to do.

10.description: I bought a Groupon for a beer making course. I had been homebrewing for sometime when I went, so the course was a review for me. The instructors knew what they were talking about, and they gave us some samples of beer and the mead that they make. My buddy and I were the only pair there that weren't also a couple (whoops!). We made a triple belgian that they chose the ingredients for. The beer turned out pretty good even if it was a little on the sweet side. They have an excellent selection of malts, hops, extracts, equipment, etc. They have everything. It is a long drive for me to get to here, but the Groupon was a good value, and I hope to make it back some time for a partial or full grain brew course.

11.description: I took the winemaking class here in 2007 and was blown away by the knowledge and helpfulness of the owner.  I have since bought all of the equipment and made 7 batches of wine...#8 goes into bottles next week!  I've also taken the beer making and cheese making classes.  This is THE place to go whether you are a novice or expert!

26.description: Updated May 8, 2009It appears that Bev-Art did a Vulcan Mind Meld and implemented the improvements envisioned in my original review.  They expanded operations into a spacious facility across the street from their storefront for all in-house classes and events.  The new space looks like a commercial lab environment--perfect for concocting delicious alcohol based elixirs.  They are currently offering a wide range of hands-on wine and beer making classes and have satisfied my requirements to be promoted to a four-star rating.  Bravo Bev-Art!

27.description: So I just started homebrewing and I have a lot of really dumb questions.  The kind of questions where, if I write them down now and save them to look at a year later, I'll laugh at myself.  Fortunately the folks at Bev-Art are extremely patient, kind and helpful.  They take the time to answer ALL of your questions (which is why I've bumped them up a star from the original 3 star score I was going to give them).  It doesn't matter how long the line is, or how many time the phone rings, they are going to make sure  you are taken care of.  I appreciate that. I do agree with some of the other reviews, they place ain't fancy.  But I don't really care.  It's also a bit disorganized and hard to spot things you need from afar (which is why I was originally going to give them 3 stars).  But once you're able to get the attention of one of the guys who works there, they'll help you find anything you need.  This is a great place to go when you're just starting out and probably a great place to go when you're more experienced.

0.description: This is such a fun place to host a birthday get together. I had a few of my friends get together for a wine making party and it was a blast. Greg one of the co-owners served plenty of wine for tasting. He gave us a great history lesson on wine and the art of how to properly enjoy it. The wines were delicious and making them was so much fun. Our group just went so we have not bottle yet, but we can't wait for the bottling process. We are going to order more wine for tasting while we bottle. I definitely recommend this place for all types of occasions. One of the other reviewers made a comment about the store and class room. Unfortunately they are right but the good news is they have purchased a new facility and it is scheduled to open in the spring of 2016. The owners of Bevart know their environment is not the most desirable that is why  they are going all out at their new location. For my event I spent a little extra to decorate the venue. Because I was allowed to bring in outside food, I saved a ton on catering. With table cloths, flowers and balloons I transformed the room and no one complained. A good time was had by all.

20.description: My visiting friend somehow found this place while preparing for her trip to visit me. She told me that had mead (honey wine) tastings and that they were a brewer and that the tasting was free. Free booze was pretty much all I needed to know in order to agree to this trip. So we walk into this storefront and I was very confused. It looks like a shop to buy brewing supplies. We kindly asked the guy behind the counter if they offered tastings and they do. For some reason while they brew and sell supplies to brew on site they are unable to actually sell the booze. Their side of the street is "dry" and you need to go across the street to buy the wine/beer/mead that you like. So we tried many times of mead: A regular dry mead, cranberry mead, blueberry, cherry, chocolate, and bourbon mead. Most were very good and it was interesting to try something new. Since mead is very sweet it's not for everyone but I find it a refreshing summer drink. The guy that helped us with the tasting was great. I think his name was Greg, and he was very informative about everything. It's interesting to hear where the fruit and honey come from and that everything is then fermented. He was also very friendly an accommodating to us. Their stuff is sold in most Binny's so should I want to buy anything I don't have to drive all the way down south. I would have to say that my friend did a good job at finding something to do in Chicago that I would never have thought to do.

19.description: It seems to be the best brewing supply store in the city. In addition to brewing supplies, they have wine making supplies, wine tastings and I don't even know what else.  Very helpful staff, good prices. Well worth the trip down to the south side!

2.description: I purchased my boyfriend a brewing gift certificate so that we could brew and bottle our own beer. We are definitely into the craft beer scene so we were excited to learn how to make our own. The class is listed as taking 2 hours. Truthfully, the actually brewing takes approximately 45 minutes. Our instructor was sharing some basic brew knowledge with us for the first hour before we started brewing. We then scheduled to come back 2-3 weeks later to bottle our brew. Bottling took about 30 minutes for 48 bottles. We learned a lot about the process, sanitation, and it was very nice to not have to purchase/clean all of the equipment needed for brewing.The reason that I did not give Bev Art 4-5 stars is because the actual facility gives the vibe that you should not be there. Both the brew site and the store are unkept and in need of some updating. I am struggling with the idea of recommending this place to friends because I know that the facility is not a welcoming environment - though the people that we worked with were all kind.

18.description: It would seem as though the first time I visited here, I just had the wrong guy behind the counter.  And frankly, that is the reason the update review isn't higher.  But after needing to journey here because my brew store of choice was out of bottles, I had a very good experience with a very friendly and helpful gentlemen.  So much so, that I felt the need to say that they seem to have a good selection and, on occasion, very helpful and friendly staff.Sadly, this does not trump my first visit; though I will no longer be so reluctant to return whenever needed.

13.description: I've been here quite a few times, and everyone I've dealt with has been great.  They really know their stuff.  They have everything you need to make your own wine, beer, and mead.Ask for a free sample of their mead, they'll be more than happy to share the end result of their hard work with you.  When you try their meads, it becomes very apparent that they know their stuff.  They sell beginner kits with all the equipment you need.I made my first batch of mead with their help, and it turned out great!  I wanted to bottle my mead in small servings, and they had these EZ cap bottles, that are basically a swing-top Grolsch style bottle, except in dark brown.Some of their prices are as low as or even lower than online stores, some of them are higher, it about evens out in the end.  I couldn't believe there was a place so close to home I could go to for last-minute equipment.I also wanted to say that they are not as -- I guess the word would be snobby -- as other places I've been to.  They asked what I was making, I told them since it was my first attempt, I was using honey from Costco to make an orange/cinnamon/clove mead, and they informed me that years ago they had tried honey and welch's grape juice to make mead! Great, down to Earth people, great selection.  5 Stars!

4.description: I have been enjoying the service of Bev-Art for decades.  Greg, Kaz and the rest of the staff have been helpful, knowledgeable and a pleasure to do business with.  Usually the store is well stocked with essential items.  Often they will order special items.  If there has been a problem, Greg has resolved it to my satisfaction.

24.description: These guys are awesome. Gregg is always busy but still takes the time to help you. Kaz (sp?) is great as well. You can tell him what kind of beer you want to make and he can work out a recipie with you. Everything I have made has been excellent. Do prepare to stay a while. I dont think I've ever come out in less than an hour.Oh and bring in a sample for them to try... they can also help give you ideas on improvements.

6.description: Surprised my girlfriend with a winemaking class and the take home wine kit about a week ago.  She absolutely loved it!  We drank all different kinds of wine while we learned about wine making, then we made our own batch of Cabernet and are really looking forward to the final product in a few months.  This place was great, very friendly and educated staff.  We'll be going back I'm sure, maybe for a brewing class next time!

22.description: It seems to be the best brewing supply store in the city. In addition to brewing supplies, they have wine making supplies, wine tastings and I don't even know what else.  Very helpful staff, good prices. Well worth the trip down to the south side!

15.description: Best brew supplies in Chicago. Cool staff and helpful. I want to take a class here.

7.description: Mad scientists...beer makers...wine snobs...nosy people. They will all love this place. I mainly buy my yeast here. No not bread yeast. Beer...They also have any material you would need for brewing or wine making. Knowledgeable staff and classes offered for the newbies. Enjoy.

8.description: I received the beer making class as a gift.  Overall the class and making beer portion turned out well.  They were informative and kind and well spoken.  They taught us about the science behind it while still keeping it pretty interesting.  The major complaint is the end result beer.  We chose to brew an IPA.  The end result, more of a brown ale or amber beer.  No hop presence and super malt forward.  I emailed them multiple times asking to see if there was a mix up and we bottled the wrong beer.  Also sent a picture of the beer in a glass to show them the result.  No response.  This place had so much upside, but in the end horribly disappointed.

3.description: Bev Art has a really cool deal on Valentine's day. My boyfriend and I went, it was held at the Marriot in downtown Chicago in a ballroom type area. In the beginning, you mix and make your own wine (red) and get to do a tasting. After that, they let you bottle it, teach you to cork it, and even put the top plastic part on it by using a machine to melt it. It was pretty cool to learn the bottling process. They also had several other wines available (red and white) to drink, as well. So people were drinking and getting loosened up prior to the actual wine making. After that, we went inside to a classroom type area and learned how they made wine and about where they actually grow their grapes. It was cool, a little too informative, but that is only my opinion, several people enjoyed the process, however, a lot of people took advantage of the drinks in the beginning and didn't have the patience for it. So that could go either way. The concept, i will say was very cool. After the presentation, we started making our own wine (we got to pre-order whatever we wanted) we chose a pinot grigio. We used water and followed the instructions, pour in ingredients, stir etc. It was pretty cool. This lasted about 30 minutes. People were continuing to drink and the couple next to us was really fun so the experience was getting even better.Later, we moved back into the room at the Marriott and had a grape stomping contest. At this point, you could kind of separate the classier people vs. a few of trashier people that attended (it was mostly classy, young couples looking to have fun) but during the grape stomping, a few drunk girls were falling out of the bucket, being dramatic, crying. I mean, c'mon girls, keep it together. I felt bad for Bev Art's staff. I would have done this before we did the wine making, as people weren't as drunk yet and things wouldn't have been so out of control (not the companies fault, just the timing and the people not being able to control their liquor). This is my only critique of the night. They also gave us boxers that we could put on to stomp so we don't get dirty and boas and were able to take them home which was cute. As we moved on to dinner, there was extra wine that they actually let us take home. There was one wine of theirs that I loved and I was able to take it home which I thought was very cool! It was their We moved on from that and went to dinner, it was a private area in the Marriott dining room. We had a four course, very classy meal, oysters, steak, cake, bread, it was great. Drinks werent included but for the price of everything, this was okay and totally acceptable.This was over by around 10:30 pm so we were still able to meet up with another couple afterwards. The best part about all of this is that it cost us (for two people the entire night) a total of about $350-$375. This included the drinks, four course meal, wine tasting, wine educational portion, and the wine we made. The wine we made will make 25-30 bottles of wine that we will get to keep once it is ready and bottled! The wine alone, pays for itself, not to mention everything else we got to do!At the end of the day, I would definitely recommend this company and their activities. It was fun, enjoyable, memorable, and educational. I hear they also have a beer one they do and I would definitely check it out.

14.description: My wife and I took the brewing course in mid October, and I have nothing but good things to say about it, and the guys at Bev-Art.  We were in the area one day, so we stopped in to talk with them, and to sign up for the course if we felt like it would be a worthwhile time.  It was and we did.The shop itself is full of brewing paraphernalia (tools, ingredients, books, etc.) as one might expect, with a couple workers on staff milling about, answering questions.  The guys we spoke with when we signed up were not beer snobs in any way; they just seemed genuinely interested in the topic, and were happy to share their knowledge with us.We showed up a little early for the class on a Saturday morning, and were taken across the street to another location, which has tables, chairs, and lots of brewing going on.  Greg was already there, and welcomed us in and explained what was going on and what he was doing.  As others started arriving, he repeated the process and we were all up to speed, ready to go.  The brewing itself was informative and actually fun.  We met a couple nice people from Naperville, and learned quite a bit about the elixir we have been drinking for several decades. The lecture/description of what we were doing was on-point and lighthearted, and I had no trouble listening and following along rather than looking at all the cool equipment around me.  Two weeks later, I returned to siphon the 'beer' into a second fermenter, and two weeks after that, we returned to bottle our beer, which is now sitting in the second shower at home as it does a final carbonation in the bottle itself.  A week from now, I expect to be drinking a decently hoppy IPA!I had hoped and expected that the class and experience would be great, and it was.  The guys were great to work with, and I know I'll be driving back out there often as we get into this new hobby of ours!

0.description: This my kind of shoe store .. Very well organized. When you see a shoe you like find your size that's it.  Simple is what I like. I've been in plenty of shoe stores and you open the shoe box to no shoes in the box.. But at this shoe store. I was able to find what I needed in the right size AND the shoes was in the box.. So with the buy 1 get the other 1 1/2 price. I Was able to get back to school shoes for my son and myself lolSo I had a great time in and out I will be back and I signed up for some free coupons. So when you visit this store don't forget to spin the wheel and sign up for your free coupons .Happy shoe shoppinnnnn

58.description: Bourbon flights, good food, friendly service. Nice spot in Beverley. See you again soon

56.description: Checked this place out after doing a wine tasting at Wild blossom.  We were told we will have to wait for a table to open because of two parties coming in. We got there at 5:30 and the first party coming wasn't until 6:30 the second party at 7. While we waited we sat at the bar. We were given samples of two beers and then our table was ready. I ordered the turkey panini with a side of Mac and cheese. It was delicious! The panini had turkey, cranberry sauce and fresh pears. Such a weird combination but out of this world! The flatbreads were a really good size as well as the salad.  Wish this place was a little closer.

29.description: This place sucks. I didn't like the beer or the food. Just drive the extra 20 minutes and go to 3 Floyds.

42.description: Everything I've had here is delicious! Some favorites are the sweet potato fries, the pretzel appetizer,  and the shrimp po boy. The owner and the staff are helpful and friendly,  and I love that they have so much art by local artists.

23.description: Spinach salad is really good! It had spinach (obviously), goat cheese, chicken, pickled onions, bacon (mmm) and a good balsamic vinaigrette. I was really pleasantly surprised with how delicious the meal was The service is interesting.. Kinda distant and uncomfortable to talk to. I didn't get asked much or get many recommendations. Drinks were ok.The restaurant is very standard with nothing decor-wise that stood out to me.

47.description: I give horse thief hollow 3 stars only because of how hard I saw our server was working.  Working as a server in Fabio Vivianis restaurant in River North has reinstated the fact that a 5 star restaurant is a fine tuned machine. If one factor is off the rest will come undone.  This is how I felt today as my family & I dined for lunch to celebrate my graduation.  As a Beverly native with 9 years in the industry I feel compelled to share my thoughts because I believe this is a unique establishment on the Southside & can be a great restaurant & brewery, as well as an attraction.  Today they were clearly understaffed in the front of the house but when looking for someone to help us order a drink and a food order that was forgotten (two separate incidents), my mom found a man who appeared to work in the kitchen but was standing drinking a beer, and I found a woman who I thought was a manager, on her phone. Being understaffed wouldn't be that big a deal if these two, along with others helped their coworkers. Keep in mind after these incidents we witnessed both these employees helping with running of drinks, clearing tables & running food. Our server seemed to be the only one on the floor with at least 12 tables.  He was weeded and needed help and his coworkers or manager (if there was one working at the time ? ) were MIA. There seemed to be no manager around to see to it that their guests were getting fine service and that things ran smoothly.  Let me be clear that I write this review not to criticize but because I love the concept, food, history & drinks & would like to come back. But until the quality of service improves this place is simply not worth it.

8.description: I'm not from the south side, but we recently met up here with my in-laws for Sunday lunch as it is a good halfway point. I wouldn't go out of my way to come back, but it's a decent option in the area. Service did not start out well for us. Our temporary server would disappear for 10-15 minutes at a time. There were probably only 3 other tables in there at the time, so I'm not really sure what took so long. Eventually they switched or something and the next guy was much better. Unfortunately the long waits at the beginning kind of soured the experience a little. Food was good, but on the average side. The biggest bummer, really, is the lack of brunch options. I'm not really a beer person so I can't speak too much on that.

31.description: What a cool place!  I can't recall what was in this space before, but the Horse Thief Hollow definitely is a nice addition to Western Ave.  I only came in for lunch so I didn't get to try the beers, but the food and service were good enough to earn them 4 stars from me.Food: we started with the whole grain pretzels.  These aren't grocery store pretzels, these are the real deal.  Packed with flavor and a perfect appetizer.  I'm sure they'd go great with some of the beer here.  Main dishes- I had a salad (I can't even remember which- it was pedestrian), and my friend had the burnt ends sandwich.  Skip the salad and get the burnt ends- this is the s**t. The sandwich literally had a pound of meat on it, and every bite was perfect.  They slow cook their brisket, and this is as good as anything you'll get in a real barbecue joint in Texas or Kansas City.  Seriously.  Trust me :)Overall a great place.  I'd recommend for anything or anytime.  It's conveniently located on Western Ave, so it's easy to get to.  I can't wait to get back to try their beers.

34.description: The food was excellent. The shrimp po boy and sweet potato fries are the best.  The service is poor - they really need to hire more staff. The waiter we had was really nice but totally overwhelmed.

16.description: By the name of this place, I thought I was being taken to a jail for animal theives or a Sleepy Hollow reenactment. HTH proved to be a good experience for its weird name. Service was a little off at first since a baptism party of 70 got there minutes before we did #suburbproblems. Once we finally had a seat and server, who was also the bartender, everything was a.o.k.I had spinach burger which was pretty damn flavorful for being primarily spinach, hubby and my FIL had burgers and FIL had bowl of green chilli that was crazy spicy, even for his giardnera-loving self. Server switched it for the gumbo in a snap with no drama. MIL had the Cuban and loved it. Cubans are always the best, I say ;).  We all had sweet potato fries which were huge, almost steak-cut and perfectly crispy. The guys really enjoyed the IPA that's brewed in Beverly while my diet drink was refilled 24/7. Server checked on us all the time and when he was busy serving drinks at the bar, had another server make sure we good. This is def one of the better places I've been outside of the city and am glad the in-laws brought us here.Weird name aside, I am all about HTH and would def make another trip to try more yummy stuff and their beer.

13.description: Passed this place and had to come back. Great comfort food with southern flare. Excellent beer as well, try the Annexation Ale.

11.description: Delicious food and friendly people! I am not a drinker but the people I went with are and they Loved the beer! Also cool layout of the restaurant and bar!

39.description: Loved the food, loved they had interesting non-alcoholic drinks as well as beers. Liked the decor. Service was fine not stellar. Glad to have a place like this on the south side. Looking forward to going back.

37.description: I am very torn about this place, the food is good, the beer is better, but the staff is unprofessional.  I came in on a slow night, July 3, 2015, and had to endure listening to the staff complain that they were't making any money tonight, sitting next tothem as they got off work and pounded drinks at the bar, hearing the bar back announce "I've gotta go smoke," listening to employee cell phones ring as they charged at the bar, seeing the fuss they made over a table of regulars, I even had to ask for silverware.  My fiancé works in the restaurant business and I know that great establishments have protocols about how their employees act around customers.  This place could take a lesson.  The only reason I may come back is the beer is that good.

0.description: This is one of the best brewery-restaurants I've been to in awhile.  Two days ago my son and I were in the area photographing local murals, including the one on the side of Horse Thief.  I couldn't drink with him in tow so I vowed to come back.  Well, tonight after wrapping up the Chicago Auto Show that opportunity became possible, so we gave HTH a shot. The food menu in itself is enough to draw me in. Add the fact that they're a brewery and you have my undivided attention.  I sat down to the Hen House BLT and a well cultivated flight this evening.  I had half of the flight prior to dinner which included the Cocovore, Purple Cow and American Stout.  The end caps were average but I really enjoyed the Purple Cow.  Very smooth milk stout with great flavor.  Dinner came and on first sight the piece of Texas toast with BLT topping and an egg to boot looked mouth watering.  It didn't disappoint...that's my kind of sandwich!  After inhaling the thing in record time I pushed the plate and pulled the flight rack near.  This time I took aim at Hollow Ground, Santa Secret Stout (a seasonal brew) and 18th Rebellion.  All three of these were well above average and the Santa was flat out phenomenal.  It's a peppermint mocha stout and easily one of a kind.Aside from the food and beer HTH has a great setup.  I liked the divided seating and local art that adorned the walls.  If you're an architecture connoisseur you'll also enjoy the ceiling woodwork.  Service here was with a smile and knowledgeable.  Our waitress wanted to pick out my flight choices for me, but I had to get my two cents in first.  We're over an hour away but I'd easily come back in a heartbeat.  I highly recommend HTH..one of the best breweries in Chicago.Cheers!

38.description: Although I love Horsethief's brews and atmosphere, I am SO heartbroken that the vegetarian flatbread with the goat cheese and veggies is off the menu! Bring it back! It's so rare to find a good beer and good vegetarian food at the same place.

51.description: This place is getting better and better. They have good beers and change the selection often enough. The service is friwndly. As brew pubs go, their food is the attraction, in my opinion, over the beer.

27.description: The Cuban sandwich is pretty good. Delicious sweet potato fries cooked perfectly. Side house salad had no croutons or cheese which is totally strange. Good beer and cocktail kist. Cool medieval atmosphere. Really busy on a Saturday night. Enjoyed it and will be back.

32.description: I'm a fan of the key aspects of dining here, but not so much others.  The craft brewed beer is excellent, and the smoked meat options are also top-drawer.  We have not experienced any service issues ... our servers have been attentive, albeit a little casual in their approach, but, hey, we're not talking a Michelin-star restaurant!  However, I would recommend skipping the food service french fries and opting for cornbread or some other side.  We have yet to had crisp, hot fries served with an entree.  They are always limp, warm, not hot, and taste like they've been sitting under the heat lamp.  The cornbread and the slaw, on the other hand, are excellent!  I'd say to the owners and chef, invest in a fry cutter, and come in a little earlier to prep!  All of the great little burger places in the neighborhood serve handcut fries.  You should too!

54.description: This is a solid 4 star restaurant.  Good craft beer selection and food is excellent.  I have tried the buffalo shrimp appetizer, the buffalo wings, pretzel appetizer, the gumbo and the combination platter.  Buffalo wings are my favorite thus far (along with the sweet potato beer).  But, all have been very good.  I did have one instance when the pretzels seem to have been baked a bit too long and were a bit hard, but even so were still pretty good.  The atmosphere is appropriate and the restaurant is perfect for the Beverly area.  It is affordable and the food is great.  I hope that Beverly has more restaurants similar to HTH that open in the area, as Western has become too saturated with national chains or bars with subpar food.  HTH is the perfect blend of a great bar with great food.

48.description: I really enjoyed the southwest chicken salad!! Fresh and tasty & gluten free!!! The service was cool the ambiance was perfect for a lunch date for 2!

44.description: Good *real* food. Excellent beer. Awesome atmosphere with all local hires and local art displayed throughout. A great part of the Beverly community

24.description: I so wanted to love this place but it was only average. I had a burger. Requested medium rare and it was overcooked. Fries were cold, the salad was crisp, cold and tossed perfectly. I'm not a drinker so I can't comment on the beer selection. The waiter never offered a refill on my Diet Coke and it took a long time to place our order and to get the check.

7.description: I found this place on yelp and it was actually really neat and nothing like I expected! They sell art on their walls and it's a nice cozy place to grab dinner and a drink! The older gentlemen that greeted us was so sweet and told us all about his favorite things on the menu since it was our first time coming in. The experience was really neat and I usually don't stick around and talk at the table. I felt no rush to leave at all and we stuck around after our meal! Great service, our server Shannon was super sweet too! I'll be in again soon

49.description: The hubs and I are big beer people, and I hate to give a brewery 3 stars, but we left here a little unimpressed. We went on a Wednesday night around 6:30pm to try their beers and have some dinner. I had the Kitchen Sink and an IPA. I thought both were decent, but nothing over the top. We had ordered our beers and dinner at the bar before deciding to move to a table to eat. So we got to our table with half of a beer each and our food came shortly after. My husband had ordered the Fat Chef with fries and ranch and I got the Gastro flatbread with a side of mac & cheese. Our fries and mac & cheese both came cold. Which was disappointing. My flatbread was really good. The pork was only ok, but I'm a sucker for goat cheese, pickled onions and arugula so it was likely going to be a winner for me no matter what. OH!! And their ranch was probably one of the best ranch dressings I've ever had. And I'm obsessed with ranch, so that says a lot. However, our server Mark was nowhere to be found through the whole dinner. We both needed another beer and had eventually moved our empty glasses to the end of the table before he came around. By the time we got our beers we were basically done with dinner and ready to go. We collect growlers so we asked for the bill along with a growler of the IPA. The bill came, we signed and were ready to go. 10 minutes later still no growler.... 10 minutes later still no growler... finally I had to flag Mark down as if our growler was ready yet. Overall between the table service, the ok beers and the cold food we likely won't return.

40.description: good food + lovely atmosphere = nice addition to Beverly and I will be sure to come back!

53.description: Loved this place, atmosphere, food and beer were fantastic. The servers were friendly, knowledgable and not pretentious. We cant wait to go back and try the dinner menu. We had lunch and drinks and without getting into detail, everything was awesome.

30.description: Great place for food and beer.  Burgers are excellent.  Terrific neighborhood place.

46.description: I really enjoy this restaurant/brewery on the southside.  I think it's a real gem. The service is great. The food is great. It's pub food, but some dishes have a nice twist. And it caters to the needs of any crowd you decide to bring, your parents, your friends, your S.O. or the kiddies. Some people may not like kids in a brewery, but I like that I can come with my friends and sit at the bar some days and also bring my nieces for lunch when I need a break and a brew. Let's break it down.Booze: You may not like all their offerings, but you will find the beer for you. You can look on the chalkboard, or read the menu for a more comprehensive profile. I've had their "fruity" beers.  They're not weak soda/juice like beers. The purple cow they had a while back packed a punch, and the Pink Pom Pom was tart and bubbly and I love it. It's just so good when it hits your lips. I appreciated them making a beer brewed with cherries and not one that was brewed and later mixed with cherry soda flavor. You can tell the difference. Have a Bloody Martyr, their take on the Bloody Mary. It's spicy and comes with a salami, pepper jack garnish.Food: Crab. Cakes. CRAB CAKES. They're doing it right. It's a ton of crab with a light breading.  Thanks for not making a ball of dough with a bit of crab sprinkled in. The sweet tomato jam and honey mustard aioli it was dressed with was on another level. The salads...meh. I like a salad that's properly dressed. I get that people like their dressing on the side, but they are stupid, so don't cater to them. Toss that lettuce in a bowl with a vinaigrette and call it a day. I had the Norcal. Nice combo. Chicken was juicy, blue cheese had a great nutty flavor, but my dressing was a glob of garlic on garlic on garlic. It killed it. The dressing needs an intervention. And salt your greens! I know I could just salt my food, and it's better to underseason than over do it, but I wanna take a bite and say yum, not take a bite and start adjusting.  Service and Ambiance: The brewery is obviously pretty big, you won't get lost, it's a wide open space, but the high ceilings and table set up may overwhelm someone on their first visit. So thanks for having a friendly greeter. They've got alot of great artwork on the wall and this week's theme was horses. They. Were. Every. Where. Which is cool. I mean, it is called Horse Thief Hollow. Speaking of art,  check out the map in the parking lot (free parking) of all the Chicago neighborhoods in neon.  Very cool. And thanks for having a great bartender. So many places have surly guys who couldn't be more annoyed with you when you order a cocktail or they never look up to take your order. They just stand their making an old fashioned with a pained look on their face wishing you'd go away. Not here. Our bartender was attentive,  polite and helpful. I wish I knew his name. He had an awesome beard and 'stache. I'll get it next time.So sit at the bar with a buddy, sit at a table with your kids, you're gonna have a good brew, good food and an overall good experience in Beverly.

1.description: Waiter messes up flights of beer - have no idea what you are drinking - resulting in miss order pintMedium burger burnt to crispIce cold crab cakesWaiters snotty nose inserted into each beer sample as he tried to figure out each mislabeled beer sampleGo bullfrogs!!

55.description: As a consumer of craft beer, I appreciate HTH a lot because they still maintain normalcy in a scene which has gotten creepy, weird, and too big. When I want to enjoy some decent brews without all the hype and overzealous craft beer silliness, this place definitely comes to mind.My most recent trip here was for the release of their first bottled beer, a barrel-aged stout called "Bad Mama Jama". There was a limit of 2 per person. It predictably lured in those mouth-breathing, self-appointed "beer gurus" who hoard such bottles of beer rather than drinking them. Like the creep that hovered over us, for example, trying to small talk us into giving up some of our allotment so he could get more than his 2 bottles. Oh, & his shithead friend who went home to change his clothes to disguise himself so he could get more than his limit. People like this can go dangle. I don't blame HTH for these vermin. They're a seemingly humble place that offers something different for the Beverly neighborhood. They may not feature the holy grail of beers, but they are legit. As is the food. I've yet to have a bad meal. I'd recommend their Cuban sandwich, the soft pretzel with an amazing cheese dip I could put on anything, and their wings. An must when this far south.

9.description: What happened? Went for lunch on a Saturday it was very slow. Our waiter was some young teen who kept forgetting our drinks. It took 20mins for each beer to hit our table after we reminded him. He was too busy talking the hostess who was zombie like and unwelcoming. We ordered the burgers and they were very very bad! They were burnt and they barely put lettuce, tomato or an onion on it...Sweet potato fries are still great and beer. Looks like maybe they hired family kids to serve and wow do they do a lousy job...Not going back...sadly

26.description: SWEET POTATO FRENCH FRIES are REDONKULOUS. lizzy & Neal are very gracious and accommodating always.   Love the local feel too. Can't wait to go back!

25.description: This brewpub is incredible! I had the 'Fat Chef' sandwich and it was topped with the most flavorful meat. From the delectable pulled pork to the sweet slaw and spicy house made sausage links, it was a sandwich worthy of reprisal! And the beers were scrumptious. The Old Bob Pilsner and the Lavender Saison were my personal favorites. My partner had the brisket cap sandwich and was a big fan! The staff were kind and attentive! Fabulous experience! I can't wait to come back!

12.description: Spinach salad is really good! It had spinach (obviously), goat cheese, chicken, pickled onions, bacon (mmm) and a good balsamic vinaigrette. I was really pleasantly surprised with how delicious the meal was The service is interesting.. Kinda distant and uncomfortable to talk to. I didn't get asked much or get many recommendations. Drinks were ok.The restaurant is very standard with nothing decor-wise that stood out to me.

59.description: The chef could use some extra training. Of the 3 times here I've had the grass fed beef burger and sweet potato fries...very good. A salad....mediocre to boring. Today tried the artichoke app...spices were off. Flat bread with peppers....blah. My friend had their ribs...pretty good. Overall you have to know  what to order...hit or miss. It's a shame Beverly doesn't have more options.

21.description: Best beef brisket I've ever had.   It legitimately puts chucks and hog wild to shame.  Unfortunately,  it is only served one day a week.   Beer for every palate, and they're all brewed exceptionally well.  The menu itself is an artwork, not to mention everything you can buy off of it

17.description: Live jams Tuesday evenings, tasty brews, solid burgers, hearty salads and featured dishes, a lively, friendly crowd and talented bartenders (Holla, Lizzy) keep me coming back. Menu rotates seasonally and there's always a yummy dish on special so be sure to ask your server!  Rustic, yet industrial feel that, while family friendly, has high boys on the bar side for when you want a child-free zone. Their Steak Salad, Chicken Dijon sandwich, Southwest Turkey Burger w/sweet potato fries and Southwest Egg Rolls have yet to disappoint. A few solid guest taps and craft cocktails made from local spirits will be sure to please if your best house brew is tapped out. Lunch menu switches to dinner at 5pm. Appetizers only after 10 pm. Lights dim evenings. If you arrive and there is a wait, there are benches inside that flank the door where you can pass the time with an icy beverage while perusing the menu. Try the chocolate cake!Check out their website and Facebook page for special events and ALWAYS PHONE AHEAD if you have your heart set on something. I always post house brews on tap *with the date* in the tips below. The owner, Neil, is  hands on and supports local artists, schools, and the community. They're listening to your feedback, so speak up if you have an issue. Beverly truly needed a joint like this, so come take a bite out of the South side...where free parking is breezy and the Sox reign regardless of the season. Cheers!

10.description: As a consumer of craft beer, I appreciate HTH a lot because they still maintain normalcy in a scene which has gotten creepy, weird, and too big. When I want to enjoy some decent brews without all the hype and overzealous craft beer silliness, this place definitely comes to mind.My most recent trip here was for the release of their first bottled beer, a barrel-aged stout called "Bad Mama Jama". There was a limit of 2 per person. It predictably lured in those mouth-breathing, self-appointed "beer gurus" who hoard such bottles of beer rather than drinking them. Like the creep that hovered over us, for example, trying to small talk us into giving up some of our allotment so he could get more than his 2 bottles. Oh, & his shithead friend who went home to change his clothes to disguise himself so he could get more than his limit. People like this can go dangle. I don't blame HTH for these vermin. They're a seemingly humble place that offers something different for the Beverly neighborhood. They may not feature the holy grail of beers, but they are legit. As is the food. I've yet to have a bad meal. I'd recommend their Cuban sandwich, the soft pretzel with an amazing cheese dip I could put on anything, and their wings. An must when this far south.

5.description: Good food. Good Beer. We were there around 4pm and unfortunately still got the lunch menu. Don't get me wrong the pulled pork sandwich was good but we were gearing up for dinner as we sat in traffic. No complaints, nothing extraordinary to say about it but I would go back.

3.description: Horse Thief Hollow has been on my list of places to check out because I love great beer, but Beverly has always seemed so far away. On a visit to Chicago over the holidays, we finally made the trek down there to check it out. Our friend, who is a Beverly native, said that this is really the only place worth going in the area. The atmosphere of the place seems a little off--they have a huge wooden antique bar that doesn't quite fit in, weird art on the walls, and a marked boundary between the bar and the dining area that is a bit awkward. Anyway, we weren't there for the ambiance, but the beer. They were out of several beers that we wanted to try, so we'd make a selection and then be told they were out of it. This was a bit disappointing. There were one or two beers that I really enjoyed. If you're in the area and like craft beer, you probably want to check out Horse Thief Hollow.

35.description: The food and drink here remain exceptional.  The hen House BLT is amazing.  I can't remember the last time that I literally cleaned my plate but every bit and bite was so good, I couldn't help myself.  Last time I had the Salmon Burger which was just as good.  The menu is very eclectic and diverse.  Hard to choose what to get.  My guideline is always to choose something I can't get somewhere else or don't or won't make at home.  HTH has many such options to choose from.The wings are good and very crunchy.  My son had the tip sand which with house Mac n cheese and really liked it.  My husband was disappointed in his chicken sand which.  The meat was overlooked and chewy.The only consistent detractors are the service and the noise level.  The high ceilings make it pretty loud.  Unfortunately, I have never had good service at HTH.  Our server last night was absent most of the time until we were finishing our meal when she started rushing us out the door without asking if we want desert.  The food runners picked up Her slack i hope she tips them well.

19.description: Best beef brisket I've ever had.   It legitimately puts chucks and hog wild to shame.  Unfortunately,  it is only served one day a week.   Beer for every palate, and they're all brewed exceptionally well.  The menu itself is an artwork, not to mention everything you can buy off of it

28.description: I've been here twice now and I just love it! The burgers and the shrimp po'boy are excellent.  I love the ever changing selection of beer and the art by locals that covers the walls. This will definitely become a regular stop for me!

45.description: I love this place and have been meaning to give my two cents..The turkey burger that comes with avocado, jalapenos and other delicious toppings, is fabulous. I've had the sweet potato and regular fries; both are delicious. I'm not that adventurous, so I tend to get the same thing. However, my boyfriend will try different dishes and asserts that his dishes are always good. The food always taste fresh and staff are attentive and professional.I also enjoy the hard ciders, as I'm not a full blown fan of beer. The ambience is nice as well and the seating is just right. I loathe restaurants that cram tables on top of each other to seat more patrons. I don't care to hear intimate conversations of the people dining next to me.

33.description: Spacious, attentive service, great beer. I feel like this place is an undiscovered gem - they have been open for a couple of tears and very few Untappd reviews?! Their Kolsch won bronze at the Great American Beer Fest, and is totally worthy. One of the best browns I have had as well (the beer necessities). Stop in!

43.description: Great beers and great food. Their house made beers are always changing with lots of cool variety and delicious staples. Lots of variety in the food menu too with vegetarian options available. Full of regular customers cause it's definitely a top 5 restaurant in the area. A must visit for beer lovers and foodies.

2.description: I live on the north side where there are the most restaurants and concepts.This place in particular I'm a big fan of.  The ambiance is super cool and the deco of the place is great.  That vintage feel along great drinks and food is a great combination.The wait staff is super nice and attentive.I highly recommend this place.It's is sensibly priced also. Keep up the good work.

18.description: Had lunch po-boy sandwich, pulled pork sandwich, and henhouse blt. Everything was delicious! Good prices. Lots of food. Would definitely come back!

41.description: I want to like you Horse Thief Hollow.  You're five minutes from home and serve food and alcohol. But after too many visits waiting by the empty hostess station and finally leaving, I think I've given you my last try.

52.description: Service is terrible. Food good, but they make you work for it by asking about it 5 times.

50.description: I no longer drink--it wasn't real pretty when I did--so I can't comment on the craft beers, but the food (grass-fed beef) and the service were both pretty darn good. I also had green beans here, and I hate green beans. But I ate 'em all. What I really liked was the atmosphere and decor; I kind of forgot I was on the SW Side. It seems like it welcomes both families and those who are there primarily for the beer. I'll be more observant next time I go (which will be soon), but I wanted to note that I left with positive vibes.

4.description: The best and freshest cuisine to go along with the freshest beer and now coffee. Go frequently and try every entree. It's great atmosphere and the owner is attentive. Staff are so.great too!!

6.description: Pre-Valentine's dinner and drinks with my boyfriend and good friend.  Put off at first when we discovered there was a band set up.  That's said, all our cares melted away and we ended up having a fabulous time.  Tall young bartender made me the best old fashioned I've ever had.  He even checked to see how I liked it.   Beers were solid.  Ambience was even better.  Service was great.  Charcuterie was reasonably priced and excellent.  Gumbo was amazing.  My friend got the ribs and said they were the best she's ever tasted.  My boyfriend got burnt ends and loved them.   Band made our night complete.  They played Al Green, Amy Winehouse and many more.  We couldn't have picked a better place to spend a Saturday.  Go now.  Order an old fashioned.  Let them make it their way.  You won't be disappointed!

22.description: The only thing fancy here is the types of liquor and decor. It's sort of a small spot but does the trick when you don't want to stay long.

15.description: This brewpub is incredible! I had the 'Fat Chef' sandwich and it was topped with the most flavorful meat. From the delectable pulled pork to the sweet slaw and spicy house made sausage links, it was a sandwich worthy of reprisal! And the beers were scrumptious. The Old Bob Pilsner and the Lavender Saison were my personal favorites. My partner had the brisket cap sandwich and was a big fan! The staff were kind and attentive! Fabulous experience! I can't wait to come back!

57.description: The ambiance and the decor of horse thief hollow is excellent. As a former resident of Beverly Im very proud to see this type of establishment in the neighborhood. the portion sizes are very large, we ordered the buffalo wings and Mrs. O'Leary's hot which were delicious. I ordered the horse shoe for my main entree the meat was high quality and will cooked however I would have preferred for seasoning.Also, it would be nice if there was a side or on the drink menu as I was not in the mood to drink beer that evening. Overall I had a good experience here and definitely will be returning.

20.description: We arrived and were seated. Our waitress was a doll and sweet was pie. I order the sweet potato fries and egg rolls. My girlfriend ordered buffalo shrimp. Nice place.

36.description: I'm not from the south side, but we recently met up here with my in-laws for Sunday lunch as it is a good halfway point. I wouldn't go out of my way to come back, but it's a decent option in the area. Service did not start out well for us. Our temporary server would disappear for 10-15 minutes at a time. There were probably only 3 other tables in there at the time, so I'm not really sure what took so long. Eventually they switched or something and the next guy was much better. Unfortunately the long waits at the beginning kind of soured the experience a little. Food was good, but on the average side. The biggest bummer, really, is the lack of brunch options. I'm not really a beer person so I can't speak too much on that.

14.description: My friends and I went to the Southside Irish Parade today for the first time. They no longer allow alcohol within 800 feet of the parade, which was fine by me because I was all about seeing the Irish dancers and hearing the bagpipes. The parade was long, and we were definitely in need of an adult refreshment afterward, especially after seeing the politicians walking the parade. Brauner, Rahmbo and Jesus? Christ, make it a double. We were looking for a place to have a Guinness, but we happened upon Horse Thief Hollow.What a find! They were only serving beer and corned beef sandwiches, but both really hit the spot. We each had a 773 Nitro Stout, and it was delicious. The corned beef sandwiches were on marble rye, and the corned beef was stacked high. There were a lot of beers on tap, both made there and at other places locally. And get this--the beers were only $5; granted they were in relatively small plastic cups for the day. But it was a deal for our thirsty palates.This was my first time in the Beverly neighborhood, and it's nice enough that I'd like to go back sometime, even if only to take a walk and look at the architecture of the houses. I could then check out the menu at the Horse Thief Hollow, and the fact that the Rock Island Railroad goes there means that we wouldn't need a designated driver.

3.description: The fruit was good and the arrangement was cute but I did not get what I ordered and there was no attempt to correct it. I  paid extra to get some peanut butter bananas...I went full out for the 22$ option and asked if half could be the PB kind and half the chocolate kind. She said no problem and she would note it on the order. Well guess what? I only got the chocolate kind - even though what I really really wanted was the PB kind. When I called to asked about it I was told "thats what the order says" - no attempts to check into it or offering a credit or anything. After another location screwed up my boyfriends Valentines Day order - this will be the last time I spend money with this company.

1.description: I have to take a moment to thank Jim from Edible Arrangements. I am not sure if he owns this franchise, manages it or is an employee...but he is awesome. Yesterday, my employer had sent me an arrangement to support me and my family, as we were going through a very difficult situation. Well, Jim had dropped off my arrangement at home (not knowing when I'd return despite his efforts to reach me...which is a whole other issue because my work phone wasn't on) and needless to say, the arrangement went bad due me being gone for 12+hours. I was super excited when I saw them but couldn't eat them. I emailed the company and within 12 hours, Jim had called me and apologized profusely, as well as delivered a fresh (and larger) bunch to my mom's house in Park Ridge...definitely above and beyond. Thank you Jim! You are the best!

2.description: Maybe this location is OK on any day other than Valentine's Day, but I can't attest to that. My order for chocolate covered strawberries wasn't able to be delivered on Valentine's (even though the order was placed in time), so they said it would arrive the morning after. This is honestly not that big of a deal until you pair it with the fact that it actually didn't show up until the end of the day on the 15th, and the strawberries were so soggy, dark, and overripe that they aren't really edible.

5.description: I haven't purchased from this place, but I did receive a wonderful basket of goodies from my best friend for my birthday today.  SO GOOD!  Lots of fresh fruit dipped in chocolate delivered to my office?  Yes please.  My tummy is full, my spirit is happy, and my coworkers love me.  What more could a girl want?

6.description: When it turned out the information on FruitFlowers' website was incorrect about their store hours, I headed over to Edible Arrangements.  Walked in the door, worried about whether I'd be able to have something in time for a party and walked out the door five minutes later with a gorgeous arrangement:  the girl behind the counter said they do their best to have one ready-to-go for just such situations.  They were less expensive then FruitFlowers as well.  They even held the door for me as I walked out.

0.description: A great place for gifts!  I sent a bouquet to my BF for Valentine's Day and he loved it, as did everyone in his office.  Instead of flowers, I always send Edible Arrangements.  The fruit is unbelievably fresh and delicious.  I always get called by the recipient with a huge thank you.  Seriously, if you're in need of a gift and don't know what to send, send one of these.  You'll be a hero.

4.description: The arrangements I had them make for my friends bridal shower were FLAWLESS... delivery was on time as well. They made the occasion even more amazing!! :)

12.description: You always know what you will get from Chucks.  The wagon wheel with the signature "C" on top has not changed is 20+ years.  Love the Fat Freddie's.  Great pizza.  A south side classic.  Calling now.......

3.description: Great pizza. I have been ordering from this place my whole life!  I usually have it delivered. Garlic bread is good also.

1.description: I love Chucks great customer service and good quality pizza. I love their turkey it's the best I've had in a long time.

2.description: Awful, awful, awful. I don't know what these other reviewers giving it positive reviews are smoking. First off, it's not cheap. How is a $22.50 pizza with canned mushrooms on it "cheap"? Yes, that's right--freaking CANNED MUSHROOMS. And the sauce is thick and sweet. It's that sickeningly sweet sauce that I imagine Chuck E Cheese's tastes like. Or if I remember correctly, it tastes like a tarted up version of the sauce Spaghetti-Os comes in. Yuck, yuck, yuck. No way.

9.description: I always love getting my dinners here while working in the southside. Its a quick walk down the street and has one of the best meatball sandwiches. The prices here are great too. 5 bucks for the sub and a liter of root beer. Its a winner every time. My only disappointment with Chucks is that they are only open for dinner. I would love to swing buy and get these sandwiches for lunch, but no so such luck.

10.description: This is the best pizza ever. We have been eating here for over 18 years. The owner is great. We always get a medium deep dish with sausage and mushrooms and the bill is never over $16. I come here anytime I want to eat pizza ( I live in the Western Burbs) If you are are in the area stop by you won't be disappointed.

13.description: Very pleasantly surprised! Chuck's a pretty awesome dude who def knows how to make a pizza. Got some sausage and green pepper - and the ONLY complaint would be that there was a little too many green peppers, but that's really a matter of personal preference. The pizza has some really good flavors - you can tell this is not Chucks first rodeo. We brought the coupon in for a discounted pizza and Chucks says "You keep this. You'll be back." HA! Love it. And yes, Chuck, we will be back.

16.description: This truly is the best (non deep dish) pizza in the city. Quite possibly the worlds best drunk food. My brother and I would def. be up for devouring a full family size on a good friday night. Plus, the owner (Chuck) is the nicest guy ever, really knows how to take care of his regulars. He hand delivered a pizza as a wedding present to my uncles wedding reception!

6.description: Been eating here for years. My ex wife grew up eating here in the 80s.  It's the best thin crust pizza in the city. Just wished they would expand their delivery area to Auburn Gresham. cheap and Good. Doesn't get better than this....

15.description: This is pretty good pizza and the customer service is fantastic.  I just moved to this neighborhood and tried another pizza restaurant on 95th and it was terrible.  I came across Chuck's Pizza, crossed my fingers and ordered.  The pizza was piping hot (we ordered one w/turkey sausage) and we got two, free liter sodas. I will definitely check out their delivery service next time.

0.description: Delicious thin crust pizza. Way better than any of the local competitors. Also very affordable.

5.description: Sorry, but their pizza is just bad. Cheap prices and the people seem really nice, but with so many other options it's hard for me to give this one any props. The crust is too thick for my taste, and it came very greasy. 5 stars for fast delivery and nice service, but 1 for the pizza.

11.description: We've  tried plenty. For us, Chuck's always does the best .

8.description: My family and I ordered our pizzas from Chuck's for over 30 years. Never had a bad one.

4.description: Some of the best pizza ive had. Chuck the owner is a real cool guy. Its family owned and everyone is courteous. Besides Nickys on 103rd of western this is hands down the best place to grab a bite from.

14.description: Chuck's, like the Phoenix, has returned!

7.description: Pizza is great and inexpensive, I love it!

3.description: Tried this today for the 1st time. I recently moved to the neighborhood and was looking for a Chinese spot besides ChiTung. I tried the egg drop and vegetable soup which were kind of bland didnt taste like much. The crab rangoon was nice and crispy I did enjoy them very much. For the main dishes I ordered the Mongolian Beef & Chicken with broccoli. Mongolian beef was very good and I would definitely get it again. The chicken with broccoli was also good but not great. Everything here is reasonably priced so I do recommend this place. I personally like chitung more but chitung is also a lot more expensive.

1.description: This use to be my favorite chinese restaurant until last week. I've been going here for over 10 years to find out the previous owner retired and gave the business to her nephew. The prices have changes and they're sky HIGH. The food doesn't taste the same anymore! Ive always wanted authentic chinese food and this was it until the change. I was highly disappointed...if the nephew had any sense he would've left everything the same!

2.description: I tried this place for the first time cash only which is a bummer and I ordered a large jumbo shrimp fry rice the shrimps were mushy they give you a lot of them but who wants to eat mushy shrimp so I will not be returning

5.description: This is a hidden gem in Beverly.   Although you could dine there, it's primarily a take-out place.  The food is quite good, prepared very quickly and exceedingly inexpensive.  I almost don't want to write a review of it as I'd rather keep it a secret.  The owner could not be more friendly either.  The best part is that if it works for you, you can order your food on the train and pick it up right when you get off and go home with delicious, affordable Chinese food!  I have had chicken fried rice, shrimp with pea pods, chicken and broccoli and it's all been tasty.  One last thing, the chef will also accommodate you if you desire no MSG in your food.  It doesn't look like much from the outside (or inside for that matter), but I highly recommend it.

6.description: Very good Chinese food, I have had a variety of dishes can say I've never been disappointed by any. Flavorful seasoned food and hefty portions for a very reasonable price. I always order out personally, it does have a few seats for you to sit there and eat but it doesn't look very comfortable. But overall good eats!

7.description: I'll be honest- I've gotten the same dishes from them for over a decade.  But, no one makes takeout shrimp egg foo young like they do!  I get shrimp fried rice with it and everything is flavorful and shrimpy.  I've had their lunch specials a few time, but it was rather greasy for my tastes. Service is always with a smile and after so loong, she knows my name.  Ordering ahead is recommended.

0.description: I've only ordered egg foo young, orange chicken and fried rice and it's always great. The customer service is awesome !! They now they take debit/credit  cards too

4.description: Like most folks who live in the area, I really do enjoy Chi Tung, but I typically only go there to dine in.  Oriental Chop Suey is definitely my go to for takeout Chinese.  The food is always fresh and delicious and the customer service cannot be beat.  I have not had one bad thing from here and I have been going for years.  Awesome!

1.description: Nope.  Keep going.   I had to order through bullet proof glass--none of the other businesses along this strip make you order through glass, and it is located in a very nice neighborhood.  There is almost no seating indoors.

2.description: There were only 2 cars in front of me in the drive-through and it took almost 15 minutes. It was at 9 AM so I don't think it should have taken half of this time.

0.description: Let me say this has always been a very slow Burger King. However,  today the service was much better!! The only thing is I wish the people at the front should speak clear and slower. The drive way should be fixed. The holes are hard to drive over and I would hate for anyone to get a flat tire :)

This is the primary and largest men, women, and children's clothing store in Chicago featuring an immense inventory of genuine African clothing and accessories. Material is available as well, plus there are tailors on site for alterations or creations. The owner is from Mali, in West Africa, and returns at least once a year for new items. Free parking. Prices are reasonable, especially considering that everything is hand made, authentic and unique.

3.description: When this place opened the staff was friendly and helpful. Since a years time help from the staff is non existent from management on down.

1.description: Now that the Menard's in Bridgeview is closed for construction I had to try out a new Menards.  I've only been there twice so far but I might have to make this my new Menards.  It's much cleaner then the one in Bridgeview and I have an easier time finding things.

2.description: I'd give this place five stars, but I'm still kinda pissed that they took green space and that they let scammers wander the store. Some guy accosted me and claimed he knew me, and I played along--until he asked for money. "("Sorry, dude," I said in my best slacker-stoner voice, "I only carry plastic! Wife's orders!" I even emitted that brief emotionless laugh stoners are always making after they say something: "Hut-ha.") I told the security guards about it, but a week later, I saw the same guy trying to scam money. Beautiful store, though--and it has stayed beautiful. It hasn't become dingy like so many other box stores on the SW Side--like Walmart, Office Max, etc.The staff is very helpful and knowledgeable. Man, I worked at Toys R Us when I was 17, and I didn't know jack, but I'd pretend like I did. The staff at this store knows what they are talking about.

5.description: I already love Menard's. This one is just closer, newer, cleaner, larger....and they sell RipIt brand energy drinks! Sold.

6.description: Upon entering Menard's, you're greeted by one of it's friendly staff or the security. Well lite and clean! My second visit to the store wasn't so pleasant. I had a bad experience in the paint dept. Not knowing a lot about paint, only what I like. The manager didn't seem friendly and seemed to be in a hurry to brush me off with the questions I was asking. Finally, I asked for the manager. The Asst. General Manager came. Very professional, friendly and most important, customer service oriented! He quickly apologized for any misunderstandings, assure me he would speak to the Paint Manager, and wished that I continued to shop as a valued customer. Well it worked! The Paint Manager is very friendly as well as the staff. Very helpful in assisting you with finding what you need. Don't rush or brush you off as Home Depot or Lowes! Easy to find an employee to help. I love this store!! I hope it continue to offer friendly and helpful employees! On another note which you rarely find while shopping in stores on the southside of Chicago, every employee smile and greet you throughout the store, which is a PLUS!!! WAY TO GO MENARD'S, KEEP UP THE GOOD WORK AND SUCCESS IS SURE TO FOLLOW!!Respectfully,A forever satisfied & valued customer

0.description: The best big box home improvement store and my favorite location.  Sometimes after pay day Friday, I'll just go in and look around and think about buying fun things.

4.description: It's Menard's, however it's one of the locations on steroids, so be prepared to get sidetracked by things you don't need. For example upon walking in there was a large display of Campbell's Soup. I have to admit, soup was the furthest thing from my mind, when I needed to look at faucets.It's a nice clean and bright store, although not one employee said hello or asked if I needed assistance, which seems to be the big thing at Home Depot now. They had all the requisite hardware stuff and then some, there was the soup of course, and then cereal, cheese puffs, chips, barbeque sauce, and some other grocery. I don't know why they feel this is necessary since they're not a full grocery store you can't prepare a list. I know what they're trying to do, they're just making more money by having you impulse purchase, I get it many stores do this, however Menard's has taken it to a new level. Not to mention the aggravation if you bring kids with you, they were just begging for the junk food.The location is North of the Plaza Mall, which is now back on the redevelopment track, it was being closed and foreclosed on so that malls future will be interesting. Next to this Menard's you have a Meijer coming in soon, along with a Micheal's and a Ross. None of which are stores I frequent, however if I had to go to one of them these locations are very accessible to anyone living on the south side.

1.description: I've been coming to this location for more than 8ys or so.   Each time I've visited the location at 95th & Western they are very friendly and welcoming.   This year my youngest son is graduating from HS.   Sam was AWSOME!!!!  He was excellent with hearing my son's ideas for his prom and luncheon.  I am very happy with what Sam and my son put togetherThere will not be any duplicate outfits at his prom or luncheonLove you - Sam

2.description: My pregnant wife and I walked into this store after driving from the north side and were kindly greeted by a couple of female associates working there, after literally taking 5 steps in, a man described as "a European white, 40 year old, poorly articulated, dressed in all black (on a 90° day) pot-bellied rude, sad excuse for a business man", starts gawking at my wife's breasts, nearly drooling as he noticeably moves into a better position to stare while he is talking on his cell phone. My wife is beautiful, so I am somewhat adjusted and used to the attention she gets, but this man was very obvious and quite disgusting about his behavior so I ask him if he works there, then abrubtly directed him to do some work and stop staring at my pregnant wife.... this man had the audacity to challenge me, tells me to "get my ass out of the store", at this time a woman and an older white man (the owner) intervenes asking what the problem is, I'm pretty upset at this business mans audacity at this point and express my displeasure to the owner while simultaneously the other man is interrupting and trying to plead his case, needless to say this business did not get a dime of the $1600 in my pocket, I stormed out after showing him that I was in there to spend money while making a mess a knocking some of there low budget pimp clothes off of the racks. This store is obviously a family owned business and the confrontational and audacious man was the son in the business, who never learned to respect anyone, particularly customers and who values nothing but the fact that his hard working, immigrant father has handed him everything.... I would not recommend that anyone patronize this business and I will be following up with the local chamber of Commerce and BBB. Shame on this man.

0.description: I been to the location in River Oaks mall, about 3 years ago.  The salesman was very knowledgable.  He suggested great selections that looked good on my husband.   We got a deal and bought 2 blazers/jackets.Our 5th year anniversay is 2/13/2014 and my husband is going to this location to buy a new blazer/jacket.  I am sure he will find a perfect one.I can't give 5 stars because i have never been to this location.  I gave it 4 stars because i love this store.  It is hard to find good clothes for men.  We either find clothes that look like they are for  younger men or few selections in my husbands size( 6'2  at 210LBS).  THis store has exactly what a man needs; if he is looking for somethin mature and perfect for a night downtown.

3.description: This place is a mess.  Order something and they do not even know the right price.  Plus, this location is over priced compared to others in the area.  Also, it would be nice to get a "thank you" after my order.

1.description: One of the worst customer service Baskin Robbins stores ever! They couldn't understand anything we said at the call up window, nor could they give us a solid on what we ordered! Simply Sad! I am sorry for anyone who goes here to pay $15 for 3 ice creams that are piss poor! Your welcome Baskin Robins on Western in Evergreen Park!!

2.description: Check your order before you drive away. Manager was not friendly when I returned  later  to mention several botched driveup  orders.

5.description: Dunkin Donuts. How I love thee. I always go to Dunkin Donuts at least once while in Chicago, since we still don't have any in the West Coast, though we get the commercials. Such a tease. Anyways, I like going for the #2. You get 2 donuts and a coffee. One thing I'm not use to, is that Dunkin Donuts puts in the cream and/or sugar for you. One person said, they wouldn't know what to order at Starbucks because they don't know the "language" and the fact that they would have to put in their own cream and sugar. Chicago is a different place when it comes to coffee. Regardless, I always recommend Dunkin Donuts and I look forward to the day when they make their way to California.

0.description: Great service I come to this location almost everyday the employees know my order before I even speak, great customer service and extremely fast service too!! Most Dunkin donuts don't give the amount of customer service that this location does! I recommend this one for who ever is in the area!

4.description: The problem I've found with Dunkin Donuts iced tea is that employees are generally clueless in the art of brewing and icing tea. Never minding the refreshing photo advertisement of clear, cold, fresh brewed iced tea that draws customers in, every Dunkin Donuts, until this one, seems to serve a variation of muddy colored gunk resembling a cross between a flat diet coke and lukewarm instant coffee, add ice, but never enough to keep the concoction cold, and call it fresh brewed iced tea. This is the first Dunkin to get it right. Not only did the finished product look like the photos, it tastes like it too. My only gripe, albeit a small one, was being charged $3.00 for a large, original blend iced coffee, instead of an iced tea. Thus the 4 instead of 5 stars. My tea was the ultimate refreshment and I didn't have the heart to correct the cashiers mistake while several cars were waiting behind me - perhaps for one of those picture perfect iced teas I had. Now only if other Dunkin's could do the same for a 99 cent after 2:00 p.m. steal. Until them, it's Starbucks, at $2.93 iced tea for me.

12.description: I've been going to Bookies since I was a kid.  We used to take our bikes up there with bags of books to get store credit.  They were very kid-friendly then, and continue to be.It's a very old-school store.  All store credit gets stored on index cards (pretty sure they still did this last time I was in this year).  They have a "free book" cart for teachers (with ID).  I love this place because they have a great selection of new and used books.Note that store credit means A DISCOUNT on the price on the book, not full coverage of the cost of the book.

7.description: It's nice to have this in the neighborhood.  Many times I've found great deals on new and used books, and I've been able to pick up required reading material for my kids when they were in high school.  Because my kids attended local high schools, Bookie's has a clientele that recycled their books through them. The staff is friendly and helpful, and they give credit for books you donate. I never walk out empty-handed, but I'm kind of a book addict, so I have to force myself to limit my visits. I wish they had a larger store! This is browse-friendly but very cramped.

3.description: Recycle books you no longer want/need for store credit to use toward...more books. Books up the wazoo!!! Excellent selection of used and new literature .  All of  your standard 'classics' are here in paperback, (students....save some $) and since they also deal in trade-ins you can get some fascinating reads (including best-sellers) for a song.  I remember I got an excellent-condition, used, hardcover copy of  "Devil in the White City" here for half of what Amazon wanted for it at the time.  I highly recommend all things authored by "Cleveland Amory" to those who are fond of cats and/or society from a historical perspective. His non-fiction books are some of my absolute favorites and sadly,  a few are out of print and so used book stores are perfect for hunting lost literary treasures and that sort of serious business.Small variety of previously-owned comic books along with some excellent children's stories and fun stickers/temporary tats.  An awesome local business that is environmentally conscious and  sincerely cares about  their community.  Everyone here is extremely friendly and best of all, they have a sense of humor.  (see photo)  37.......

1.description: If you think this store just has used books, boy would you be wrong. I just managed to get three Christmas gifts without leaving the neighborhood!  They have brand new coloring books, children's books, games, and all kinds of unique little items. No more schlepping to Orland to go to Barnes and Nobles and no more waiting days for Amazon. Next time I need a gift for any occasion this will be my first stop!

2.description: Hmmm, I could swear I had reviewed Bookie's. Guess not.Anyway, it's a nice small, neighborhood bookstore. Nice staff, decent prices, and I always do try to stop by whenever I'm in this area. Only thing I'm a little sad about is that they used to be open till 8pm, and they stopped doing that at some point to instead close at 7pm. But that's their own choice. And like others said, they're in a strip mall on the south side of 103rd St. slightly west of Western, next to a 7-11.

9.description: Bookies is really the only book option in Beverly since Borders closed, but never the less a good bookstore. Very small but they optimize the space well.  Helpful and friendly staff. The only ding is the almost impossible to understand discount system for buying books if you have already sold books there. Maybe it's just me!!!! Lol.

18.description: i love used book stores....always looking for new (to me) ones.  but bookies is my absolute favorite.  i've been going there since i was a kid, and i'm still getting discounts from the last load of books i brought in a number of years ago.  like everyone has said, it's old school.  "accounts" are kept on index cards in a little filing cabinet behind the register.  their best sellers are always 25% off, and the selection of used classics is gigantic, and so fun to browse through.  i can spend an hour in there without even noticing.  this is one of the reviews i legitimately did not want to write, because i don't want people knowing about it, but bookies is too great a local business to not give a five star review on yelp.  in the past couple years i think a new owner took over, and now they are open 7 days a week, same hours everyday, which is nice....the hours used to be kinda wonky.  basically im trying to say that this place continues to get better and better.
