10.description: Love bookies!  Their prices are reasonable and the discount for donating books to them makes it even more affordable.  They have a solid selection of books and despite the size of the store, it is pretty browse friendly.I'm a huge fan of mystery novels and they seem to have no shortage in their collection.

13.description: Bookies is the greatest book store around.  Why not shop at a local shop that gives you store credit for returning your old books?  They always have a great selection of books and an eager staff willing to help you find what you need.  They will also special order for you anything you want.  Truly a local gem.

16.description: Good Books at an affordable price with friendly people. What more can you ask for?

17.description: The Bookies is great! Fab prices, so clean and organized. Why pay full price, why not support an independent local bookseller. I bought some VHS tapes for my cottage in MI for $1 each! It's a great cozy shop & you can get anything new or used. If you bring in your old books then you get discounts for purchases. This is a great store!

15.description: Really low prices and you can trade your old books for store credit.  You can find some really nice stuff here if you are willing to look for it.

0.description: Great book store in terms of value & variety. Always a hidden treasure ( usually at fraction of what you'd pay in a mall) to find. Bring your d books in for credit on both used or new books....Can't say enough about this Beverly gem !!!

5.description: It's a good bookstore in an area (and a world) where bookstores are few.  After Bookies, the next decent bookstore is in Hyde Park.  It's a mixture of used and new books.  The prices are decent, but if you have an account and trade in some of your old books, the prices become excellent.  I wish the 7-11 next door would close so Bookies could take over the entire building--I am sure they have enough stock.  In any case, it's the kind of locally-owned bookstore you'll want to support.They also have all the classic high school and young adult texts if you ever need one for a class.

11.description: Well organized, quaint, and friendly. Bookies is the place to go if you're trying to stay local, get a pretty decent deal on a good read, or need to pick up a book for your child's third grade reading assignment. (As I was in the store, several parents came in asking for a book that was on their child's reading list.)The storefront is a little sketchy...with part of the outside walls of the store boarded up, but once you walk in, you won't be disappointed. From children's books to mystery novels, you can find some great finds here. Personally, I was a little disappointed in some of the "used" book prices. For example, for a used paperback fiction book, like by authors such as Jodi Picoult or Sophie Kinsella, you will be paying $4.19. Yes, that is a huge discount from the cover price, but perhaps I was looking for a little bit more of a deal. The fact that returning old books gives you a discount on future purchases probably makes up for this.The store is mapped out very well with twists and turns of new finds. Several 3 for a $1 carts linger among the aisles...some with better book selections than others.Yelp Insider tip: Check-in on Yelp and receive a pretty sweet discount when purchasing at Bookies!

8.description: If I could give them 10 stars, I would. What would I do without Bookies?For someone like me who never has enough to read, and loves the notes you can sometimes find in used books, this is a gem. I found a poetry book here that I prize to this day. Easy on the budget too!

4.description: This place is wonderful.  It is a surprise hidden around every corner.  Each time I walk in there I walk out with a wonderful collection of books.  The discount for the books you turn in is great, on top of their already reasonble prices.  even my children like going in there to look for their books. They are cramped to the gills, but all neatly organized and cared for.  This is a true gem. Best thing about this store is it is locally owned and operated, not some big chain.

14.description: Bookies is the best bookstore to support! It is a book recycling plant. They have a great system where you can donate your books back to them. I purchase all my books from here (check your school reading list -all the books are usually there!) and return them afterwards. I now receive a discount every time I purchase books. Allison has done an amazing job of keeping Bookies up-to-date. They can locate and purchase hard to find books. You will have a pleasant and positive experience shopping at Bookies finding everything you need and much much more!

6.description: I love bookies.  If I want a book I just email them or call them and if they don't have it they will order it.  The kids like it too.

3.description: Great neighborhood bar in a great .Irish neighborhood. I love all the pictures of the great athletes that have graced the city. the beer is cheap and the crowd is young. what more can a young drinking crowd want. they have bands play once a week. The area also has other great drinking establishments in the area if you want to bar hop. So c'mon down. One of the better bars on outskirts of city's edge.

1.description: Has great potential to become one heck of a neighborhood bar, nice and isolated from the rowdy south of 103rd street bars. Only problem is they let any one in, as in 21 and under crowd. This crowd completely ruins the atmosphere with their immature behavior and occassional fights. I would love to adopt this location as my regular spot, but the high school kids really kill it. Check ID's, its easier then the $5000+ city fine.

2.description: Oh well. Dan H. is right... I'm that jerk he went to grade school with.Jo W. and I do enjoy this bar, though.  This was the spot we'd hit up while home from school in the summer."I need an Old Style, End Zone?"And that was that. There is nothing fancy about this place. The pool is free, the sports memorabilia is interesting, albeit a bit disjointed. There is more nostalgia here than novelty, and sometimes you need a bar like that.

0.description: We went to watch a Sunday Bears game and had a great time. Beers were reasonably priced. They had a decent microbrew bottle selection around $4-5 a pop. Staff was helpful. They put together a table and chairs for us in front of a TV right when we walked in. If you're comfortable hanging with a south side crowd where everyone seems to know each other, you'll enjoy yourself.

4.description: Although I've classified this little gem as a dive bar, it really is a shrine to Chicago sports. This is an authentic gritty south side bar, without the pastoral Irishness of Cork and Kerry. There are photographs of Chicago sports legends that cover the walls and really harken back to an earlier, pre-Chad/Trixie era of the city. This is a blunt place, but it has a real neighborhood feel and probably hasn't changed much in the last twenty years. Worth visiting.

28.description: This was our meeting point pre-polish film festival movie.  This place was relaxed and perfect for unwinding after hurling down the dan ryan in rush hour traffic.  The minestrone here really knocked my socks off.  And I don't even like minestrone that much.  This stuff was really hearty and flavorful.  As for the entrees I feel like their chicken marsala gave my favorite Oggi a run for it's poultry.  I did spend the entire meal nabbing gooey globs of baked gnocchi off my companion's plate.  The portions were huge and now our fridge is full of leftovers.  I can hear the leftovers calling my name.  Something tells me they won't be in the fridge for very long...

1.description: Now open for lunch!!! Monday thru Friday 11am! Don't forget happy hour 2pm- 6pm 1/2 price apps and 5$ vodka martinis 5$ wines by the glass (bar area only) make your holiday reservations today! Cheers!!

9.description: For our experience this past Valentine's Day, I would give 3 1/2 stars.My husband and I had reservations for dinner at 7.  We were told there would be around a 10 minute wait and to go by the bar, as they have no seats or area for those waiting to be seated, which was fine.  After only about 2 minutes a man came by to seat us.  The decor is very nice, though seating is a bit tight.  I found myself having to move some empty chairs and excusing myself as we tried to follow the man seating us.  Upon being seated, our server was by shortly with menus.  Our server was Valerie, she began by lighting the candle on our table and asking if we would like Pepsi or some wine "if [we] are old enough".  I kindly stated that I am pregnant and asked for lemonade, which they don't have, so I had an iced tea instead.  As she went to put in the drink order, a bus boy set a basket of bread on our table.  When she came back, we put in our order and began to wait.  Soon after, another couple looking not much older than ourselves was seated next to us.  Valerie came by and began to wait on that couple, but I noticed a few differences in her service.  She told them about daily specials, including the day's fresh fish (I wouldn't have even known they had any specials, too bad, some of them sounded rather tempting).  Then she poured olive oil on their plate in the center of the table (which ours remained dry until I had to inquire about it later).  Our appetizer arrived, which was the baked clams, which were ok, though tiny.  Soon after she came with 2 cups of Minestrone soup, saying they came with our dinner.  Mind you, she mentioned nothing of this when we ordered, and I later found the menu only states "served with soup", which if she would have informed us was minestrone, I would have asked for a salad instead, as I'm not much of a fan.  Regardless we began on the soup, our plate from the clams still in the middle of the table, then as I'm less than half way through the soup, she's trying to set the entrées on the already cramped table, "too much food?" she asks me.  So I took a few more bites of the soup and moved to the entrée.  My husband ordered the pork chop, and it was gorgeous!  Thick, tender, and juicy, with a gorgeous crust on it, served with some potatoes.  I ordered the chicken piccata, which upon first glance looked nice, served over linguine and topped with capers.  I tried to cut into a piece of the chicken, and struggled at doing so.  I was expecting it to be dry, but instead it was oddly rubbery, like over cooked calamari.  My husband asked me if it was ok, so I cut him a piece to try.  He had the same confused look on his face, and asked me if it was cooked all the way.  Now I knew it wasn't just me, and as our server came back to check, I showed her how tough the chicken was to cut and mentioned it's rubber like qualities, so she asked if I would like to order something else, and went to get a menu again, leaving the chicken.  I'm not normally the type to send food back, but being that I am pregnant, I didn't want to take a chance.  She returned saying the owner wanted to see the chicken, which she then took, and returned with the menu.  This time I decided to avoid the chicken, and opted for the eggplant parmesan.  When that finally came up, it was much better.  It was extremely cheesy, topped with some chopped fresh basil (which I love), and served with a side of what looked like either a penne or mostaccioli in a slightly spicier red sauce, which I also enjoyed.  What was beginning to annoy me was our server who rather than sticking to a simple apology, kept going on, every time she came by our table, about how she was glad I enjoy this one better "..if you don't like something, you don't.  They understand, they're a small family owned restaurant...".  I swear, if she would have mentioned it one more time about how I simply just didn't "like" the chicken, I was going to tell her how it's true, I don't like rubber chicken, and that I find it more appropriate for Svengoolie than on my dinner plate.  Good Lord!  LoLAll in all, I want to try giving this place another chance.  It's close by, so perhaps we will return at a later date (when I can actually try some of their selection of wines)...and hopefully we will have a less awkward server ;-).

29.description: This place looks like something out of Wise Guys. Big hair and gaudy decor. The food was just as tragic. I had the chicken vesuvio. How hard can that be. The chicken was ok, but the potato's sucked rocks. And had just as much taste. The place stank like garlic, but it must have been to keep the vampires out. Cuz it wasn't on my plate. My friend had the special linguini, That actually looked pretty good.  I was in the hood for a wake. I would not come back here unless Steve Dahl burnt it down for the anniversary of Disco Demolition. And then I would go eat at KODA two blocks down.

23.description: Awesome and delicious food!My boss highly recommended this place to me so my wife and I went there on the Sunday of St. Paddy's day weekend.  We were in the area for another event so we decided to stop by for dinner on our way home.  The door said they close at 9, but when we got there at 7:20, they said they were closing at 7:30 because they opened earlier for the Irish day's festivities.  Now I usually cringe when ordering my food when the kitchen is closing, as either the quality of the service is compromised or the food may have some extra ingredients that were not intended to be there in the first place. This was not the case here.  The hostess was more than pleasant and said they will serve us.  We were seated immediately and given top notch service.  Food quality was excellent and the prices were more than reasonable.  I would definitely go back , but I'll be sure to call next time to confirm their hours.

5.description: Totally unexpected and delicious!  I would say this restaurant is a bit of a hidden gem in Beverly.  They have a huge, gorgeous kitchen and a great chef.  I had the sausage (home-made) rapini raviolis and they were perfect.  Dessert was also delicious.  We tried the lava cake and the tiramisu which was ALMOST as good as my own.  I'd definitely go back if in the neighborhood.

31.description: Best place in the area, but that doesn't say a whole lot. It will be loud, the food will be delicious and plentiful, the service will be solid.

25.description: I was excited at the possibility of a quality south side italian place.  Well, this place seems popular with other locals, but I have several beefs with it.  First of all, why the hell is there valet parking?  The place sits on a huge parking lot, but you can't park there. You have to let the teenager at the door park it for a fee.  Pissed me off...not a good start.  Luckily there's endless street parking.  At least the kid was really on top of holding the door for us...nice touch, I guess.The first time, we had a server (teenage girl...a common them in Beverly) who knew absolutely nothing about the food or how to serve a meal.  The steak we had was in the Mid 30-$40 range and was of poor quality and absolutely covered in a parmesan 'crust', which really amounted to nothing more than a soggy, 1/2 inch thick layer of parmesan and bread crumbs...no 'crust' to be found.  The tiramisu is served in a glass, and treated as though this is something really unique and special...if only it were any good.  Did I mention the service was terrible and basically clueless?  The second time I went, we had a more veteran server and the food was slightly better...but still a major disappointment for the price.How this place is full, while phenomenal places like Cafe 103 are nearly empty, perplexes me.  If I'm going to spend this kind of money, I'll go to Cafe 103 EVERY TIME...and savor every bite!

12.description: We like the new restaurant. The menu is updated and the quality and price are well worth it.

21.description: I hate deception, and the fact that this place stages its outdoor rooftop with tables is especially galling because it is just that, a stage.  There is no al fresco dining here at all, ever, and the inside is claustrophobically small.  Food good, but can''t get over the attempt to fool customers.

16.description: This place is the best! They have some of the most traditional Italian food ever! I recommend trying their carrot cake and Cocconut sorbet!!!they remodeled awesomely after their Jurassic fireMake sure 2 say hi 2 Nello!

17.description: Just returned for dinner last Saturday.  Wow is all I can say.From the banana pepper stuffed with spicy Italian sausage and the risotto cake as apps, to the halibut and veal medallions entrees all was of the WOW category.Great drinks and wine.  Lovely tiramisu and coffee at the end.  Fantastic service.I'm running out of superlatives.

10.description: Beautiful restaurant. Food is awesome. Bar area is very nice. Love going here. My favorite is the cheese tortellini.

11.description: My parents were coming to visit Chicago from Cleveland.  They wanted to take myself and two of my friends out for dinner before they left town.  Luckily, I have great coworkers who said to go to Franconello's!  We walked in around 5:15 pm on a Sunday night and were seated right away.  We were greeted with two loaves of bread and olive oil with parmesan cheese.  Our server was good and made sure to give us some time to look over the menu before taking our orders.  The menu is pretty extensive and the descriptions make everything look amazing which it is.  The specials also sounded amazing.  The level of good service did not end with just our server for the evening.  The other waitstaff was great.  Sometimes you have to wait forever to get a refill of your drink, not at Franconello's.  The staff was really attentive.As others have said the portions are big which means, I get to have lunch for the next day!  What is not to like about that?The deserts were also great.  I loved the canoli dip.  It tasted great.  Also, the piece of carrot cake was huge and tasted good as well.We all left feel full and satisfied.  One of my friends said it was the best Italian food he has had since he left Italy.  Good job Franconello's.

26.description: A sub-par restaurant for anywhere but Bevery.  The food was bland and as usual for the south side service was poor at best.  I though the sauce was flat and the sausage was so-so. The portion size was huge and the prices are low.  Finally, they have a roof deck that looks cool but I have never seen it open

27.description: I like this place.  The portions are huge.  The Italian sausage is made on site.  The sausage appetizer is one of my favorite dishes.  I usually get the Manicotti Al Forno.  It's huge. After eating my meal, I have another meal to take home.  I've also tried the Chicken Marsala - very good - and they give you 2 chicken breasts.  You definately get bang for your buck.  The atmosphere is ok.  You can definately tell that this place has been around for awhile.  Service is good, but a bit pushy.  The servers like to push the more expensive entrees like the veal dishes.

0.description: As an Italian girl from New Jersey, this place was a little slice of heaven. Proper Italian food prepared and managed by proper Italians; we ordered the oricchiette with sausage, linguine with marinara, sautéed spinach with garlic, calamari and some wine and took our four year old twins with us. Staff was very friendly and the food was delicious. Portions are generous; each entree can probably feed two people. I saw a salad on another table that made my mouth water and I'm still thinking about it; I think it was their chop salad. I will definitely have to return to try it out.

20.description: One of the best moderate priced italian restaurants in Chicago, bar none.When you a get a special here, it really tastes special. Meat is never over cooked and if you want to know how good it is, try any one of the marsala offerings and you'll use all of your bread to wipe your plate clean.Like meat, order " the " pork chop vezuvio".For desert, the carrot cake is delicious !! 1 piece feeds 4 regular people.

19.description: I absolutely love the ambiance here. Although it is LOUD...it is cozy and romantic. My boyfriend and I had a groupon for Franconello's, so since we heard it was a good restaurant we decided to give it a try.The food was delicious. For the appetizer we had the fresh mozzarella with roasted red peppers (delish). My entree was the linguini, broccoli and shrimp pasta. It was a lot of food and so tasty so I decided to doggie bag what I couldn't finish and have it for lunch the next day. My boyfriend had one of the specials and cleaned his plate.For dessert, we had the carrot cake. It was huge! We split it and ate what we could but still had cake left to bring home. I would have given this restaurant 5 stars, but that night there was a small fire in the kitchen and the restaurant got smokey quickly. My boyfriends eyes started to burn and it got to the point where he had to complain to the waitress about the smoke. They then put fans up to blow the smoke out and opened a window.All-in-all...a great night was had. After 3 glasses of wine for me, 3 beers for him, a great appetizer, two entrees and a huge hunk of cake; our total before groupon was close to $97.00...so the groupon brought it down to $67.00.  So I will go back, but I will be sure to bring a fire extinguisher just in case!  :-)

2.description: First time there at the pasta dishes are worth the price, the quantity is for 2-3 people depending on appetite !

18.description: The veal picatta is my favorite specialty menu item. It is very thin, light in flavor and consistently delicious. They have a fantastic Caesar salad, the baked clams are tangy and have a wonderful sauce served under them and the tiramisu is to die for. Franconello's remodeled last year and the newer restaurant is warm, comfortable and inviting. The service and staff are friendly and it is nice to have Franconello back on the map in the community!

13.description: I took my fiancee here last night for her birthday. I've driven by the place hundreds of times and never knew it existed until last week. While the prices did seem a bit steep (including the wine) the quality was extraordinary. The portions for the entrees were large  -  we both had leftovers but the appetizer of bruschetta seemed small for the price. Overall a very pleasant ambiance and experience. A nice place for a special occasion.

4.description: Fellow Yelpers, please use caution when reading others reviews.  Franconellos is amazing and some of these negative reviews are totally absurd.  Complaining about getting a delicious cup of soup you didn't expect? Just remember some people are never happy.  1-steak vesuvio is awesome and puts high rated downtown steak houses to shame. 2- the minestrone they give with entrées is hands down the best I've ever had. It's spicy and broth like amazing!! I've had multiple chicken dishes that were all excellent and their specials never disappoint.  Dessert here another home run and many are very share-able which makes it harder to talk yourself out of!  Everytime we've been here the service has been great. The hostess is always welcoming and warm. The wait staff are always prompt without being pushy.  They are friendly and helpful with suggestions :-)Yelp on my friends!

24.description: The staff & decor always impress me much more than the food. I was in a few weeks ago & I believe our server's name was Susan. Susan went above & beyond for us & for that we left her a very generous tip. I will keep coming back, but it will probably not be for the food.

6.description: My husband and I went on a Sunday at 3:15. It was perfect timing. We ordered a salad which was freshly made and the dressing was superb! I love Italian food. I live near the resturant so it's perfect. We can't always trek downtown so it's great to have local excellent food. The staff was very nice. The food was delivered fresh and hot. Best Italian food on the south side of Chicago. I highly, highly, highly recommend this place.

22.description: My husband and I went here for dinner because we had a gift certificate. I was expecting a lot out of this place, because of the word-of-mouth reviews from the person who gave us the certificate and also from a co-worker. Maybe I should have ordered differently, but I wasn't quite as impressed as they were. First off, the tables are close together. Unfortunately a loud party was seated next to us, and we were so close we could have easily participated in their conversation. However, we did not want to. They were loud and annoying. We ordered two appetizers: breaded shrimp scampi and some kind of artichoke concoction - don't remember what it was called but it was artichokes with cheese and marinara sauce and other yummy stuff. Both appetizers were really good!We ordered soup with our meal but the waitress forgot to bring those, so I can't review them. She also forgot my husband's side of sausage. Bummer. For our entrees, my husband ordered the spicy shrimp scampi pasta (don't remember the exact name of it) and I ordered one of the specials - ravioli stuffed with chicken, spinach and cheese in a vodka sauce. They were good, but I wasn't impressed with either. Maybe I'm just not a vodka sauce fan. But I thought my husband's dish was kind of boring, especially for the price. For dessert we ordered cannoli and the chocolate mousse. Both were really good!Overall, this place is decent if you live in the neighborhood. (We do not, which is why I was bummed this place wasn't fantastic.)

15.description: My wife and I go here as often as we can.  Great food, great service, nicely renovated space, and very fair prices.  With Koda and Cafe 103 gone, this is the best spot to eat in Beverly for something on the nicer side.

7.description: We live close and can always count on a great meal and friendly service. It is the perfect neighborhood Italian restaurant. The specials are very good, a chance to try something you don't find everyday. The bar is also comfortable and worth coming in just for a drink.

8.description: Ahhh..much like Mjolnir, many a treasure has been forged by the majesty of fire.I had visited this restaurant prior to the gas explosion and subsequent fire that left the building's interior in ruins.  While the food was scrumptious, I found the previous service to be lacking and was not particularly fond of the neglected decor.  It seems that Franconello's has enjoyed a surprisingly-savory rebirth! The remodel is a joy with a tasteful nod to the past... An old school Supper club vibe.  Comfy, upholstered booths, a wall of banquette seating peppered with sconces and vintage photos of all the greats bring a smile to this gal who just adores vintage goodies. Consistently fresh entrees with delightful salads (sometimes on special) and house-made pastas and desserts make this spot a win for me.  The courteous servers have grown to be more attentive and are unquestionably eager to please.. If they are uncertain about something, they are quick to gather an informed response.  I cannot recall a meal here that was not immensely enjoyable.  While the ambiance is warm and inviting, it does tend to run rather loud; I suspect this is due to an acoustics issue. Immaculate with crisp linens and a snazzy bar upfront, you'd be hard pressed to find anything similar in the area.  Their Eggplant Parmesan is among my favorites. ***Even as a garlic fiend, I seriously recommend asking them to ease up on the garlic for their garlic-based ENTREES*** (Not appetizers)  By default they are heavy handed with it.***  Since dishes/many sauces are made fresh to order, you can easily omit onions, for example...but onions rule, so don't do that. ;)  For dietary restrictions this is a bonus. When I DO need an  *insane* garlicky fix, I get their Shrimp ala Casa appetizer. The breading is fantastic, so after you've eaten the shrimp, add some olive oil atop the remaining crumbs and dip your warm bread in it!  There are always amazing special dishes of the day. (Lasagna is available only when it is a special, for example.). Some lovely choices on the wine list. The addition of a few craft brews and house-made Sangria  would be a delight!  Martinis and cocktails are well made and ever so tasty.  I'm hoping they entertain the notion of Alfresco dining on the balcony in the near future. Balcony is open for rented parties, however.  Let's spruce up the building front, folks!Private lot with valet available and meter-free parking along Western Avenue. Reservations are recommended on weekends.  After dinner, stroll down Western Avenue and stop in Horse Thief Hollow  to sit a spell over a tasty microbrew or cocktail. Franconello's is a local gem that is in keeping with fine dining you'd expect deeper within the city...only with better parking.  ;)  We do Italian rather well here on the Southside; yes, indeed. Abbondanza!

30.description: Somewhat unfamiliar with the area, and looking for something other than    Leona's and Giordano's, a group of us ended up here last night.  My chicken marsala was decent, though not as good as Oggi's and I enjoyed the bite of filet mignon that I nabbed from someone else's plate.  A very large gin and tonic with Bombay was very reasonably priced.  The food prices are a little high, but the portions are more than enough for one meal and the service was very attentive.  Also there were all these little dishes in a refrigerated case behind us that we thought were ice cream but they were really huge balls of butter.   Awesome!

3.description: A few weeks ago six of us went to dinner here. From the outside it doesn't appear to be much. However we were in for a great surprise. The interior of the restaurant has a modest decor. However the staff was courteous, professional and attentive.We were warmly greeted by our waitress. Who told us about the specials for the day. We were happy that they had quite wine and beer selection. After ordering our drinks we ordered appetizers. We made a few inquiries about the menu. And then decided on splitting our meals. The waitress mentioned that it was large portions ( we were happy to hear that!)There was also no charge for splitting the meal. The salad was fresh, the bread soft and then the main course. The chicken was moist & juicy. The potatoes perfectly roasted. We opted not to have dessert. Simply because we were full. Although I do not live on the southside. I would definitely make the trek back over to have dinner.

14.description: Yeah not impressed at all. My theory as to why the surrounding neighborhood loves this place has to be the fact that they see their friends/neighbors/family there and can catch up with them. Quality from top to bottom is less than any significantly more casual Italian chain. Starting from the moment we walked in the hostess stand was not professional. I mean they take reservations written down on a yellow legal pad. The gentleman taking us to our seat was preoccupied with the valet attendant whom had some sort of issue with the vehicle ahead of ours. Nonetheless the host was not very inviting nor enthusiastic. We were seated upstairs which was bright, very loud due to poor construction of the room, and looked like a small reception room. It was not very aesthetically appeasing and had zero ambience. Our server came over quickly with menus and said he'd be back shortly. When he arrived I asked for a drink menu so he referred to the food menu with all the wine and beer selections. The wine list was by the bottle only and had no mention of selections by the glass. I asked about a martini list and his response was "we don't have any martini's but I guess we could make one." That sort of threw me off since the Yelp review pictures had several posted of martini's. Anyway she decided on a glass of wine instead. On to the food. I started with a Caesar salad which was ok. The romaine for the salad was left in stalks and the croutons were the size of blocks-way too much work for an average salad. Entrees were Gnocchi and Chicken Marsala. Our plan was to share. She tasted the chicken first which yielded a less than pleasant facial reaction. "Here taste this" she says. Never the question you want to hear at a restaurant when someone's face looks borderline disgusted. Well I taste and inmediately understand why the facial contortions occurred as I did the same. The chicken was old/bad/rotten whatever you want to call it. And they used canned mushrooms for it. That's cheap and lazy. Disappointing is an understatement for what some people think is a great place. It shows the lack of decent places in 60643, 60655 zips. I will say the gnocchi was pretty good, but that is kind of hard to screw up. The meatball although pricey at $8 or $9 was very good. It's kind of pathetic what people will settle for so as not to have to drive.

12.description: Amazing! The Blossom Boys did my wedding this weekend and once again proved how amazing they are!  I really had no idea what I wanted. At our initial meeting I showed them pictures of the venue and told them to do whatever they wanted-they're the florist not me. They came with the most beautiful center pieces (people we're arguing about who got to take them home) and bouquets. I would recommend them to anyone. From weddings to just because flowers their is no one better!!

7.description: Ryan and Stephen designed the most stunning flowers for my daughter's bridal shower.  We walked into the room and were stopped in our tracks when we saw them.  Everyone at the shower commented about the unusual and beautiful centerpieces.  What wonderful and creative gentlemen!  I love going to their shop because they take their time educating you about the flowers, and how to effectively display them.  They listened to our ideas and brought them to life.  We can't wait to see the wedding flowers.  I highly recommend you stop in and see a wonderful store with two highly professional and reliable owners, who go out of their way to make your day special.  You will not have the same run of the mill centerpieces, but designs of highly creative flowers.

20.description: This place has the most beautiful flower arrangements. They are so unique, fresh and colorful! Also has tons of jewlery, tchochkes, candles and candy. Perfect for an easy gift.

19.description: Extremely nice and helpful people, amazing arrangements...this place is as good as it gets.

1.description: This is really a superb florist. The flowers in the case are always fresh and long lasting.  The owners are super!  Usually, we just stop by and let the kids pick some flowers from the case for their mom.  For our wedding anniversary, though, I asked the Blossom Boys to recreate my wife's wedding bouquet from an old photo.  The result was stunning (it looked better than the original!) and my wife was blown away.  Highly recommended.

2.description: Awesome experience with the Blossom Boys! This year I decided to order my Mother's Day flowers from a florist instead going to Jewel, and I am very glad I did. The super sweet lady that helped me went above and beyond to make sure I was happy with my arrangement.  Everyone in the shop was very nice, and made the effort to say hello. That's the kind of customer service that will keep me coming back.My mom absolutely loved the flowers. Thanks again!

9.description: Great customer service.  Thank you Steve and Ryan for accommodating our needs on short notice. The floral arrangement for my mother in law's funeral was beautiful.

6.description: I was totally overwhelmed with the good service and the quality of the flowers that I ordered. A very kind and helpful woman on the phone seemed to read my mind in making my selection (sympathy flowers). The flowers were beautiful and much bigger than I thought I was getting for the money.  The card was exquisitely written in calligraphy. I can't remember any place that I have gotten better service and such a high quality product. Thanks!

18.description: The Blossom Boys did such a lovely job with our wedding flowers! Their work was amazing, and they were so easy and friendly to work with from the very start. (Not to mention they stepped in at the last minute--about a month before the wedding--when our original florist fell through). I gave them some ideas of what we wanted, and from there they worked their magic! They created all of the centerpieces, decorative arrangements, personal bouquets and boutonnieres. Everything turned out exactly as we imagined, and we received compliments all night on how lovely the flowers were. Best of all, our guests were able to bring the centerpieces home at the end of the evening, and we kept two huge and beautiful curly willow arrangements for ourselves, which look fantastic in our home and will forever be a reminder of our wedding day.I would not hesitate a second to recommend them to anyone, for any job, large or small.

10.description: This place is the best in the city!! I always go here, service is great! Flowers are top notch and always put together with care. Flowers are always fresh and beautifully arranged, it's a plus when you pick up your flowers to smiling faces, pleasant conversation and speedy service!! Keep up the good work!!

13.description: The Blossom Boys did our wedding flowers, and were a delight to work with.My idea for flowers was that every girl carry a different color flower, and that they be jewel-toned flowers.  Ideally, I wanted the bouquets to be carnation-based.  Ryan and Steve took my idea and ran with it, and the flowers were stunning.  In fact, my mother loved her corsage so much that she's asked that whenever we buy her flowers, that we get them from the Boys.We met with the Boys a few times before the wedding, and they really were able to take an abstract idea and bring it to life.  We also purchased all of the gifts for people who were doing readings, etc, at their store.  They are absolutely wonderful to work with, and I would recommend them to anyone looking for a fun, reasonably priced florist for their wedding.

16.description: I am completely happy to have found this florist. They did a fantastic job of designing my sons boutonnière & his dates coordinating corsage.  They turned out beautifully!

17.description: The Blossom Boys are a true gem in Beverly!  They always have fresh, vibrant and amazing floral arrangements.  From private to corporate events the Blossom boys can make any venue dazzle.  I've seen dozens of weddings with their work and they've never disappointed...even once!Also, stop in and discover the many fair trade items in store!!!  Check out there edibles too....yummy! They are in a class of their own!

15.description: Excellent customer service, good pricing and a sense of style that cannot be replicated. Who needs a florist or boutique on the north side when you've got the Blossom Boys right here? From soap, to flowers, to cards, to jewelry, this is the place.

0.description: Sheer geniuses! We recently used the Blossom Boys for my bridal shower and wedding and their work was nothing short of perfection. Despite living out of state they met with my mom and wedding planner and facetimed me in for all of our consultations. Given my complete lack of knowledge regarding flower types, the Blossom Boys were able to provide great suggestions and truly brought my overall vision to life.  Their creativity and attention to detail is very impressive.I honestly could not have dreamed of what they were able to deliver.It was an absolute pleasure working with them and with that being said, I would recommend them hands down to anyone with out reservation!

5.description: the Blossom Boys did a fabulous job for my son and daughter in laws wedding! The flowers were absolutely beautiful, just what the bride had envisioned. They are very intuitive, seemed to get a sense of what we were thinking of and went from there. They had many creative ideas, and also listened to our ideas. the wedding was at the Morton Arboretum, which is so beautiful, that I was worried that flowers might not stand out. Not true, the BBs flower arrangements aand bouquets blended in, while actually enhancing the environment. It was a a great experience, no stress, worry, set up went very well, flowers fresh.  I have also gone into BBs for flowers on short notice, and they have always delivered a beautiful arrangement.

11.description: Steve and Ryan are wonderful.  They welcomed us to their colorful shop and seated us for consultation in their back room.  There they showed us the beautiful orchid centerpiece and harvest- colored bouquets presented in glass containers and vases that realized our vision.  They even added fair trade bells to reflect the silver bells we planned to place on each table.  Ryan called me at each step of the process to confirm our contract and payment schedule.  He and his assistant arrived as planned to our venue and began to distribute and assemble the floral designs.  We quickly created a solution when it turned out I hadn't told Ryan we added two tables.  Steve and Ryan presented our bouquets in dark wicker baskets which were prefect for my nieces to distribute at the event.  The many flowers for our suits, our parents and special guests were elegantly presented in clear boxes with bright tissue that made the donning go smoothly.  The eyes of our guests filled with tears when we brought white bouquets to our mothers and my sister as a part of our ceremony.  The flowers the Blossom Boys created shine in the memory of our wedding day.  We highly recommend them for their creative design and friendly manners.  Albert and Joe

8.description: We used the Blossom Boys for our Wedding this August.Summary: Beautiful work, but difficult shop to work withDetails: My bridemaids bouquets and groomsmen boutineers were BEAUTIFUL. Seriously picture perfect, exactly what I wanted, couldn't have been better. Maybe one of my favorite parts of my wedding.However, my bouquet was all wrong. When we had our first meeting with The Blossom Boys, I brought in 6 pictures of bouquets I liked. 5 of the 6 were of tight, mounded style bouquets, and 1 was a looser garden-style. I explained, I wanted the mounded style, but I included the other picture because I liked it's colors. I said specifically I don't like bouquets with alot of green leafy filler in them. When we went back for our second meeting to hear their proposal, they had me down for a loose garden-style bouquet. I corrected them, and watched him make the change on the paper. Months later, when we made our final payment, I checked AGAIN that they had me down for a mounded-style bouquet; and they did. However, when the flowers showed up on the wedding day; my bouquet was in a loose garden style with all sorts of extra green buds shooting out of it. My dad and one of my bridesmaids spent a few minutes snipping all the green things off, and it helped ALOT but I still didn't really care for the overall look of it.Additionally, the shop could be very difficult to get a hold of at times. They also made a mistake and tried to double charge us the delivery fee. Also, our wedding was two weeks ago, we made the final payment two weeks before that, but TODAY they replied to a month old email asking when we could come by to drop off our last check. So many levels of not organized....Bottom Line: These guys will do amazing work for you, but you need to be prepared to stay on top of them and be CRYSTAL CLEAR with what you want from DAY ONE. Definitely hold onto all your paperwork from them and expect to have to wait a long time for any emails to be returned.

3.description: Absolutely fabulous custom arrangement...I wanted to support a neighborhood business and needed a superb trustworthy florist to put a 70th Birthday arrangement together for my mother.  I'm her only daughter, oldest child and out of town.  I have had such rotten luck ordering quality flowers/arrangements from Teleflora and ProFlowers. so, I turned to Yelp for help figuring what did I have to loose.I called Blossom Boys on Friday and gave them a little background...I like Yellow Roses and my Mother likes White Lilies, White Roses and Fragrance.  My mother lives on the East side of Chicago and that is out of Blossom Boys delivery range.I'm like okay....I will have my husband pick them up.  Upon arrival the Florist (don't recall his name) was extremely informative and explained and gave background on the various items in the arrangement.My husband took pictures...But my husband the pictures do not convey the beauty and awe as seeing the arrangement in real life...He also said that with other arrangements he has thought, "those are nice" but with the Blossom Boys' arrange he was like "Wow'ed".The arrangement has lots of buds...once the blossom I'm sure the arrangement will be even more breathtaking.Thank you so much Blossom Boys.  I will be a repeat customer and will definitely refer anyone asking to you.  Once again great job...

14.description: Best of the best!  Great creativity and shop is extremely inviting.  Love everything about them!!

4.description: I'm so very sorry  it has taken me several months to write this review. Steve & Ryan were absolutely the most professional, creative, delightful & accommodating designers I have ever worked with. To say that the Centerpiece's, carts and various other floral arrangements that were designed for my Nieces bridal shower were STUNNING is an understatement! Although we met several times and they provided samples prior to the event , seeing everything come together far exceeded my expectations. The customer service, attention to detail and quality of the product are just a few reasons why I would definitely recommend the Blossom Boys.

3.description: I'm addicted!  Tons of  unusual inexpensive jewelry.  Good for gifts or quick accessorizing.  I never walk out without buying something.

1.description: Figlia is great! When I need a gift or a new accessory this is the place to go.  They have a huge selection of affordable and trendy jewelry and scarves, handbags and cute gifts.  Super affordable and packaged so nice you do not have to wrap!The owners are very nice and accomodating.

2.description: Very Chic & Small Boutique... I fell in Love with the accessories, im definetly hooked!

5.description: So....2 days be for Christmas and no idea what to get my girlfriend.  I was totally freaking out to the max.  It was the smartest damn thing I did this year.  I told Becky how much I wanted to spend and she asked me a few questions and within 20 minutes we were done.  Purses, jewelry, scarves, hats, gloves, and I even found a watch for myself.  I always thought boutique meant big money but the stuff was unique and affordable.  Bottom line if your a dude who has no clue what to buy and you don't want to battle mall traffic this is the place.  Thank you Becky, you made me look awesome in front of my girlfriend and her friends.

0.description: What a wonderful addition to the Beverly neighborhood! Figlia sells fun and trendy jewelry, handbags, hats, and scarves at very reasonable prices. Every item is really unique and special, so if you're looking for a statement piece of any kind, this is the place to go! Staff is friendly and welcoming, and the space is really cute. They also have some great candles and other bath/beauty products, as well as men's watches, wallets and hats and some really cute childrens' items. Definitely on my go-to list when I need to pick up a gift, or just want to treat myself to something fun!

4.description: Great addition to the neighborhood.  The items in there are unique and not outrageously priced.The owner is great and always ready to help with ideas/styling tips.  So glad such a great business in close by.

56.description: Best cheese dogs, cheese fries, and banana shakes in town. Very retro, and very unhealthy.

29.description: After hearing that Janson's was open again thought i would give a try since i used to frequent it back in the day when i lived in oak lawn. I was really excited about the trip but very disappointed after dining there. The service was very slow it seemed like the employees weren't properly trained to do their jobs efficiently. The original Janson's had a very nostalgic feel to it. The new place just tried to fit in their shoes but fell very short.....burgers weren't very tasty and as for the hot dogs they were soggy and gross...Janson's you fell short in trying to recreate a classic!!!

42.description: Milkshakes are the best! Nothing else compares... Burgers, dogs and (cheese) fries are the best. Stay away from the tuna melt. It's served cold and the tuna isn't the freshest. This spot is definitely a gut-buster so if you go here normally, I hope you have a gym membership-unless you're pushing for experiencing a heart-attack or diabetes. Enjoy!

23.description: Right by my  job so its very convenient.  Great fast service & delicious food! I'm sucked into getting a shake everytime! One of my favorite spots for lunch.

47.description: Janson's is a great South Side joint with quick hot food & ice cold shakes that doesn't have a drive-thru. In so many ways, this place is summer. Most of my Janson's memories include "Soul Train" playing on the tiny TV inside their enclosed ordering alley. "Do you remember?" Don Cornelius bellowing out that overly dramatic introduction for "Earth-Wind-and Fire." That means Saturdays, late mornings and early afternoons waiting for a pizza puff, a chili dog and some Green River to feed my hunger. So it was crazy that during my last visit, what was the soundtrack to making my deep-fried taco order, Dapper Don prepping the most beautifully Afro-ed dancers to prepare to meet the elements: Earth-Wind- & Fire.

8.description: Best strawberry banana shake ever!!!  Great Rueben! Not the best but really good. Chicago Polish w/mustard, grilled onions and sport peppers...PERFECTLY SPICY and perfectly executed. The staff was amazingly helpful, professional and very diverse. I will surely come back for burger and fries...and another shake!

31.description: Don't botherThey have managed to purchase the worst tasting hot dog available.I ordered a hot dog with everything. Got home and it was plain.Took it back immediately and they made it with everything, but on the same dog I returned, so it was cold. Plus who puts a hot dog in a bag vertically ?Yes they are open, but pure amateurs Skip it, not worth the nostalgia wait.

34.description: When do you open this place every time I go there they are closed good food or not open the door

16.description: They finally reopened!  I didn't try the milkshakes, which used to be one of my mains here, but the dogs and fries were still on point.  The service was very friendly, which was a nice improvement since before their most recent renovation, and I recieved plenty of napkins and ketchup.  I know, napkins and ketchup, but a lot of these fast food restaurants act like they're giving away gold if you ask for something as simple as extra napkins.

13.description: The service was very slow. I mean. Like. Very slow.They also messed up the orderAlso the fries are amazingBut the chicken is bleh

11.description: A pox on this place! I was approaching a state of near-thinness until this establishment re-opened and once again began tempting me with its shakes. The hot dogs and cheeseburgers are good, and the place is much, much cleaner, but the shakes are what brings me back. The shakes are what I call "tobacco," i.e., a priority. For instance, in the old days when I smoked the legal stuff (French: tobacco de nonimprisone), if i had four dollars and was hungry and out of smokes and had to choose between squares and a square meal, I'd always get the cigarettes. I do similar things for Janson's shakes.Like last Tuesday.  I no longer smoke (German: Meine Frau verbotens das smokin'), but last Tuesday I was driving past Janson's when the kids complained of hunger. How convenient! I could shut the kids the hell up and get myself a shake at the same time!  Yet after pulling in to the parking lot, I discovered that I had but five dollars in my pocket. What to do? What to do?All I can say is that the looks my children give me when I emerged from Janson's with a single large vanilla milkshake tugged on my heartstrings for several seconds afterwards. But doggone it, I needed that shake. And let's face it: I saved my kids from another calorie-heavy meal. I kind of should be emulated.I love how they are employing local kids again. And I don't mean "white" local kids, but all local kids. We need that. I'll support Janson's just for that. Not that the workers at Janson's in the final few years before it closed were bad . . . not at all. Near the end, they weren't kids, though. I'm just glad they have kids working there.The new owner is a man from Indiana, I think. I have seen him there on several occasions supervising and helping out. Good vibes.I'm glad Janson's is open.

39.description: I am always happy when I remember Janson's. I got a double cheese, mozzarella sticks and a chocolate shake (typical diet foods) and I loved all three. Janson's never disappoints and if you want good "drive in" fare, you can't go wrong. Moderately priced and quick service. Not much inside, a stand up counter to eat at, but plenty of outdoor seating. Get one of the shakes.

37.description: This place used to be great but borderline sucks now.

0.description: This place is fabulous. It's one of a handful of restaurants I like in the neighborhood. Considering the quality of ingredients I think the pricing is reasonable. The owner is a great guy...thanks for investing in our neighborhood!

38.description: In the nine years I have lived in the Beverly area I have visited Jansons three times. Twice for a milkshake and once for the "chilli" dog. Twice I have been disappointed. The first time, they forgot to put the banana in my banana shake. Why else do you stop at a place that advertises "Fresh Fruit" milkshakes but to get a milkshake with fruit. The last time, and probably the final time, was last week to satisfy my craving for a chilli dog. I knew something was up when I saw the beans overflowing the bun. I guess my definition of chilli is different than Jansons. I did not see one piece of ground beef and I did not taste anything spicy. So, go for the shakes (maybe) but leave the food alone.

51.description: The banana shake didn't wow me as much as everyone says it should but it wasn't bad.  I also really enjoyed my two tacos and how they slowly fell apart onto their wrapping on the picnic table outside and I loved eating everything that fell out of them.  It's pretty far south but in warmer months it's definitely recommended and I anticipate a return trip.Cash only.

27.description: Great hot dogs and shakes.  Reasonably priced as well.

32.description: Open. Great food. Wonderul real fruit shakes. Cheese fries, hot dogs Oscar Meyer all beef. Angus burgers. Deep fried tacos. The best.

54.description: The service isn't as good as it used to be, and my last milkshake from there was without whipped cream (and my inner child wept profusely), but they're still delicious.  Oh my god, the cheese fries.  I know it's just Cheez Whiz, but damn.  So delicious.

48.description: In the time it takes you to ingest a bucket of fresh, real banana milkshake and some excellent jalapeno poppers, you are guaranteed to see at least three ambulances scream by.

44.description: Excellent pizza puffs and fries.Hot dogs are not all beef and therefore, are no good.I think there are better places for greasy food on the southside, i.e. pop's.

24.description: A pox on this place! I was approaching a state of near-thinness until this establishment re-opened and once again began tempting me with its shakes. The hot dogs and cheeseburgers are good, and the place is much, much cleaner, but the shakes are what brings me back. The shakes are what I call "tobacco," i.e., a priority. For instance, in the old days when I smoked the legal stuff (French: tobacco de nonimprisone), if i had four dollars and was hungry and out of smokes and had to choose between squares and a square meal, I'd always get the cigarettes. I do similar things for Janson's shakes.Like last Tuesday.  I no longer smoke (German: Meine Frau verbotens das smokin'), but last Tuesday I was driving past Janson's when the kids complained of hunger. How convenient! I could shut the kids the hell up and get myself a shake at the same time!  Yet after pulling in to the parking lot, I discovered that I had but five dollars in my pocket. What to do? What to do?All I can say is that the looks my children give me when I emerged from Janson's with a single large vanilla milkshake tugged on my heartstrings for several seconds afterwards. But doggone it, I needed that shake. And let's face it: I saved my kids from another calorie-heavy meal. I kind of should be emulated.I love how they are employing local kids again. And I don't mean "white" local kids, but all local kids. We need that. I'll support Janson's just for that. Not that the workers at Janson's in the final few years before it closed were bad . . . not at all. Near the end, they weren't kids, though. I'm just glad they have kids working there.The new owner is a man from Indiana, I think. I have seen him there on several occasions supervising and helping out. Good vibes.I'm glad Janson's is open.

7.description: 3.5 I was saddened when it closed and seemed like it was never going to reopen. I finally made it in passing by while working. I ordered a cheeseburger with extra lettuce onion and tomato. (How I order my burgers and recommend you don't he same)  it put a smile and was what I was looking for. I'm looking forward to returning and having the same, with a side of cheese fries and a strawberry shake. Looks like they opened a dining room nice so you don't need to sit in the car and eat.  Give it a try, put a smile on your face. One issue that should be addressed is the use of Oscar Myer hot dogs, that needs to be stepped up. Go local: Chicago Red Hots,  Vienna, or Scott Peterson. If you feel the same way say something at the counter.

49.description: I hit this place up about 11:30 on a friday. The food was really good. I had the #6. A gyros with fries. The tots were the best around. But the one door in and the same door out was very annoying. They had the garbage can blocking the second exit? I was trying to eat at the counter, Not stools, No room. Fergedaboutit. I had people standing on top of me waiting for their food. And it wasn't busy yet. I did not want to bring the sack in my car. It would take a week to get the smell out. As I was looking around the counter , I wondered if the health inspector ever made it this side of the tracks? Probably Not. I'll stick to Dukes. They at least have a mop.

40.description: The main reason to go to Jansons is the banana milkshakes. Real pieces of banana! Usually I'm a chocolate shake girl, but those are really very good. Other than the occasional pizza puff or hot dog (I KNOW, terrible, but sometimes you gotta have it) I don't eat here much though. The fries are the kind I like, thin and crispy. For better, yet more expensive fast food, check out Top Notch on 95th.

53.description: 4 and 5 stars is way too generous.  This place is living off it's past.Janson's has long since passed it's prime.  They moved Snyder's Hot Dogs into their side of 99th and now ignore what were the best hot dogs in Beverly (don't know about elsewhere, it was a looong time ago).I'll just head west to WoJo's thanks.

30.description: Have always loved their food. They are now under new ownership and they hit the nail on the head.  Food was like i remember, if not better.  Hot dogs are a must, i personally recommend the chili cheese dogs.  Their tacos are fried with taco sauce and cheese sauce filling them, very yummy.What makes me come back time after time are the Cheese Fries, best i have ever had.  And trust me, i have had a lot.Their shakes are also very good.  Worth a trip to get them.I believe they are adding pizza puffs back to the menu and since they always had the best, i expect them to be tasty.   I highly recommend Janson's

46.description: I do a lot of shopping for wine making supplies at Bev-Art at 105th. and Western and pass by Jansons all the time. It looked like my kind of place for fast food as it  looks like it's been around forever.We finally decided to stop in for a beef sandwich - Big Mistake ! Absolutely the worst beef in Chicago.No flavor no taste at all and not even on Italian bread, a mushy white bun. Yuk! Maye for hot dogs and a shake - but no thanks for the beef.

1.description: As a southsider I always wondered when Jansons would come back. I heard about the legendary ketchup tacos, that friends swear by, no matter how disgusting that sounds. When it popped back up in town I was willing to give it a shot, sorry no tacos though. I had a burger which was great, nice egg bun and all the fixings. Fries good, service very fast, and cute inside decor. Second time I went back I got the chicken Capri sandwich. It sounded good in theory, fresh mozzarella, basil, but was a little sloppy. The sauce was soaking the sandwich and it was too much to enjoy. But I won't discount the place, il come back and try one of those awesome banana shakes.

55.description: I've been eating here since I was a fetus. As noted, banana shakes are the best in the metro area and the hot dogs are fantastic.

9.description: I know. It's a classic. But I just can't take it! I've tried. I was thrilled when Janson's reopened and gave it a shot. The food was below average and service was slow. I waited. I tried again. Meh. I waited. I tried...again! Meh! They've been open for months now, so the kinks should all be worked out. The service is better, but the food is just not! The burgers are dry. Dry! The fries are boring and lack taste (and salt!) Plus, I ordered cheese fries and the cheese hardened after I opened it. Hardened! Gross! And when I order a bacon burger with everything on it, that means with cheese! All in all, it's just a weird experience with below mediocre foods. I'm sorry, but hope it gets better!

26.description: Thank you to the new owners and staff of Janson's for bringing this neighborhood staple back to life. Janson's delivers great food in a clean, retro environment. They also make an effort to acknowledge kids and families with prices that are appreciated. Hands down they have the best burgers, dogs, and SHAKES around. Check them out!

25.description: Oscar M.... What!? How dare you advertise Red Hots and only serve Oscar Mayer? Where's the Vienna beef!? It didn't even smell appealinginside and the workers just gossip amongst themselves while we stared, confused, at this menu. This is atrocious.

12.description: Oscar M.... What!? How dare you advertise Red Hots and only serve Oscar Mayer? Where's the Vienna beef!? It didn't even smell appealinginside and the workers just gossip amongst themselves while we stared, confused, at this menu. This is atrocious.

21.description: Amazing pineapple shake!  OMG - I would go back just for that.  Chili dog was wonderful.

17.description: I like the ambiance of Jansen's.  It's a nice throw back to the 50's drive ins.  It reminds me of a place I used to go to (in a different state) with my family growing up.  The food is good enough for return visits albeit not the best I've ever had.  The shakes and malts are pretty good too.  It's great if your looking for a quick lunch or dinner thats decent and close ( if you live in the general area). I personally like it better than Top Notch which according to every Beverly /EP native I know is just crazy, but it's true.  I just don't get why everyone is so gaga over Top Notch?!  But this review is for Jansen's!  Overall, food is good, lots of variety, staff is always friendly, service is fast even when they're busy.  I recommend it.

10.description: Like so many others, I realły wanted to like this place.  Unfortunately, it's just not in the cards for me to me to return here with my family.  The food is decent, nothing really stands out.  The service is efficient and friendly.  The real nail in the coffin here is that I'm pretty sure my husband got food poisoning from the sandwich he had. It's kinda hard to return after a loved on spends the night praying to the porcelain God over Italian beef.

5.description: I hate to post updates that go in a negative direction, but Janson's closed and then, to our great delight, opened again. But there is trouble in Paradise!They really increased their prices. Even if you share a side and a large drink, it is really expensive. The food is okay but not great, as it had been. I don't know why. Maybe they upgraded their ingredients, and maybe the "old" way they cooked their food was worse for you but more delicious.Service is still friendly and fast. I hope they add specials or offer coupons. This place is an institution. I think they are resting on their laurels now, and assuming that loyal customers will always come back...but some of us won't be here anytime soon.

3.description: The food is amazing the place is very clean and also great friendly staff. The one this is when they re opened they got rid of all the specials which is terrible idea..yes they have special offers here and there and came out with some sort of discount if your text a certain number.. but still the increase in prices just way to much. If you bring your family there your going to be paying  for it.. I love this place but do not go there anymore because of the price hike when there is other places to get more bang for your buck.

35.description: I'm so excited for the reopening of Janson's. They have the BEST cheese, which also means the best cheese fries, and cheese dogs. Their tacos have the perfect amount of grease, and the strawberry banana shakes are a classic. They've been doing trivia questions on Facebook to win a 25 dollar gift card, which a couple of my friends and I were lucky to win. Can't wait to indulge! This is a must go to place if you're wandering the streets of Western or looking for a place with a history of great food and Southside originality.

19.description: Stopped by on a recent visit to Chicago, and was relieved to find that the updated Janson's still makes a proper Chicago dog. The menu is smaller and a lot of the charm is gone from the scene behind the counter (well, I call it charm--you might call it funk, grunge, trashiness, scariness, or no-man's-land). But if that's what it takes to keep Janson's in business, I'm game. Go, Janson's!

28.description: Stopped by on a recent visit to Chicago, and was relieved to find that the updated Janson's still makes a proper Chicago dog. The menu is smaller and a lot of the charm is gone from the scene behind the counter (well, I call it charm--you might call it funk, grunge, trashiness, scariness, or no-man's-land). But if that's what it takes to keep Janson's in business, I'm game. Go, Janson's!

45.description: Oustanding. I grew up on this stuff. Great for burgers, dogs, shakes and, of course, the cheese fries cannot be beat.

33.description: Much, Much better than the previous owner. This place is cleaner, and just all around better than before. Night, & day difference. Before the counter seemed closed off like they were hidding something,  & now it's bright,  & open. I had a double cheese burger, & onion rings, & both were huge. The burger beat most in the area. Welcome back.

43.description: Hasn't been the same since it was sold years ago. I believe it was actually run by a family named Janson. Still a decent place to eat.Anybody remember "Snyders" hot dogs across the street?

2.description: I'm surprised the other ratings are as low as they are. It's a decent place. Burgers like you make at home, fair prices...I haven't tried anything else food wise.  Cool retro atmosphere though.

18.description: After hearing that Janson's was open again thought i would give a try since i used to frequent it back in the day when i lived in oak lawn. I was really excited about the trip but very disappointed after dining there. The service was very slow it seemed like the employees weren't properly trained to do their jobs efficiently. The original Janson's had a very nostalgic feel to it. The new place just tried to fit in their shoes but fell very short.....burgers weren't very tasty and as for the hot dogs they were soggy and gross...Janson's you fell short in trying to recreate a classic!!!

41.description: Not bad...inexpenseive... decent quality... this place has been here ever sincei can remember... way back when evergreen plaza had a movie theater... so they must be doing something right lol!

52.description: Another great classic institution in Beverly(besides Original Rainbow Cone, and NOT one that you can merely just go to the Taste to try, but actually have to make the trip down here to go to it!). The cheese fries are definitely worth getting, if you're ever in this neck of Chicago. And its a good thing I was meeting someone at Evergreen Plaza, otherwise, I never would've been lucky enough to finally try this place out, which was already(back then) on my list of places to try.And mmmmm, such greasy goodness those (cheesy!) fries are. :)

50.description: Five stars for the memories.  I won't tell you how many years ago, make that decades, I went hamburger cruisin' through Jansons with my two BFFs from Morgan Park HS, Peek & Penny.  I was Puff.We had our summer Saturday agenda:  First we took a bus to Rainbow Beach and got a sunburn, and put peroxide/lemon juice in our hair to make blond streaks.Then, looking slick as shit, we needed a little something new to wear.....so next was shopping at Evergreen Plaza.Then, come evening, we piled in somebody's parent's car and headed out on our route: we hit a few places up the street, including A & W, perhaps down to Rainbow Cone for a sugar fix, then always we ended up at Jansons because that's where the boys were. The cute boys from Brother Rice, to be precise.Do any old people remember a girl in a dark blue Corvette cruising the Beverly drive-ins?  That was me!  And I still am looking for the f*ucker who threw the eggs that one night!And hey....talk about dedication to cruisin':  when I wrecked my leg in a car accident on my college spring break, and came back to Chi in a body cast, my BFFs took me through Jansons to lift my spirits.  I could not bend in the middle, I had to be either standing or lying flat on my back.......so I laid across the back seat of Peek's big car and waved at everyone.  Couldn't see a thing, and all they could see of me was my arm.  But hey, it's the thought that counts......Jansons, you will never be forgotten.(Somebody post a photo to this listing!  I'm in LA, can't do it myself!)

4.description: The food here is never disappointing and the service is always fast. The banana shake is to die for. I always order a turkey burger . I'm confused as to why it's not on the regular menu because I always think they must have gotten rid of it but it's just not displayed on the menu! I strongly recommend it! The only complaint is that it is rather pricey so I can't eat it as much as I'd like to :)

6.description: I had some time in between work appointments and decided to try this place out! It's very fun. Old timey feel with updated flat screens for their menu. What I ordered was based off of what people recommended. I'm not a fan of banana so I got a chocolate shake with fries and an avocado bacon burger. I'm a cheese burger kind of girl and totally forgot to ask for it and I think I would have really liked the burger with cheese. It was pretty good without as it is. The fries are good too, they are crinkle cut and remind me of Portillo's fries. But the chocolate shake was really good! Creamy but not too thick, it was easy to drink out of a straw plus there was a large dollop of whipped cream on top. Service was efficient. Not terribly friendly but not rude by any means but there was a decent crowd so there wasn't much time for pleasantries. I'd come back to try other things and I'd see if I could have a chocolate/banana shake.

22.description: cheese fries.... oh em gee, soooo goooooood! everything from here is delicious, I cant stop going.  oh and shockingly for a fast food place, the salads are also delish!! the chicken is amazzzzing! definitely a staple in my diet haha

15.description: New Janson's has really improved upon everything that was wrong with the original restaurant. The food is delicious, staff is friendly, and there is actually a dining area inside! A little more expensive than say, Nicky's down the street. But also tastier. I recommend the Avocado Bacon Chicken sandwich and a chocolate shake!

20.description: This place has a really good charbroiled chicken sandwich. The seasoning is good and the wheat bun that it comes on is great! The fries are pretty good too, but make sure you ask for fresh fries (I've gotten an old batch before that were no good). The thing that's kept me coming back, even when it was owned by the previous owners, is the pineapple milk shakes! These aren't your fancy "real ice cream" milk shakes, LOL, but they're good nonetheless.I've been coming to this place for over 10 years and I must say, whoever the new owners are have done a great job revamping the menu and updating the decor.

36.description: If you have a taste for a sloppy greasy neighbor-"hood" burger, Janson's is your best bet.  It could be a tad cleaner though...just saying.

14.description: There are better places that serve the same type of Chicago staple food at lesser prices and better taste. I had ordered 2 cheeseburger combo meals with cheese fries and while I was impressed with the fresh, golden buns I feel it was more of an attempt at copying Culver's than an original take on the food. 20 dollars for 2 combos is overpriced considering I could have had 5 Guys or Meatheads or Smashburger for the same price. Not to mention places like Nicky's on 116th, Rosie's on 103rd and Pappy's on 95th which serve Chicago food at way better prices. I won't be coming back anytime soon.

3.description: This salon is cute. The decor is well done, it's really clean and neat. But, really, for a girl coming from Hyde Park, I'm willing to make the trek for the stylists! Alecia and Jausaulyn are fabulous. They are both amazing at what they do and are sweet and care about their clients.  If you're looking for extensions (all types--braids and weaves), Jausaulyn is your girl. For real. I went in with a TWA, and came out looking FIERCE, with a HUGE fro. I've gotten nothing but compliments! She made me so happy with my hair.  And, Alecia is super creative with her natural hair styles.  It was well worth the commute, and an escape from the bland, blow out styling of HP.  I'm glad I came across them on styleseat.com, and plan to be a client for a minute.

1.description: I went to Ten Shades Glam Lounge after seeing some excellent reviews on styleseat. com. Boy, were those misleading!!!! All I  wanted was a trim, and a curl define which according to the styleseat website takes about 45 minutes. I was in this salon for 3 HOURS!The stylist was unprofessional, and unapologetic. Now granted, they can do some hair, but it just felt like I was doing her a favor by being in her presence.*Here's the topper* They even took time to talk about a client who wasn't completely satisfied with her hair right in front of me. I wouldn't recommend this salon to anyone. My time is way too important and precious to waste in this salon.

2.description: Just don't go. The atmosphere was loud and unprofessional. The only reason they get 2 stars is because my hair turned out ok. But, I made an appointment  and was seen until 2 hours later. I don't have all day to waste in a salon.

0.description: So after having a not so great weave job from Nella Mobile Salon (braids came down the next day), I visited Jausalyn for a weave repair.Jausalyn was excellent!  She told me how to care for my hair and the weave itself.  She was was attentive and really listened to what I wanted. Even when I wanted more tracks added in the next day, she managed to fit me in her schedule and didn't charge me extra.  She did an excellent job on braiding my hair which is very soft and does not hold the braid without extra hair or a net (she knew this without me telling her!!) I have gotten so many compliments on how natural it looks and I love that I can do so many styles (my fav is a ponytail) without tracks showing or adding extra pieces.   Bonus: Her prices are great and the ladies keep me laughing!

4.description: I recently had my lashes done here. And they were great! Lynn was courteous and got the job done quickly. I really appreciated that, as it was an emergency and I needed my lashes done before going to Europe. I called back a few days ago and one of the owners (who I won't name but I know it's the owner because the name is listed on the website) answered and told me that no one was available to  do lashes. I don't know too many small business owners who won't even try to accommodate a client. And I don't mean because they couldn't fit me in right then and there--I'm realistic. I mean she didn't even bother to ask if she could schedule an appointment for a later time or date before saying "bye" and hanging up. I was really put off, but I hope to find another local lash salon soon. Mine are looking a little scarce!

attributes.Hair Types Specialized In: African-American Hair, Curly Hair, Extensions, Coloring, Kids' Hair

3.description: Funny, I ordered a Domino's pizza on 1/14 also.  Mine was a pick up and it was what I expected.There are so many good pizza places in the neighborhood but for a quick, inexpensive pizza, it's ok.

1.description: Please do not waste your time or money.  The people that work here are so rude and could care less if they send you the wrong order.  The in-store employees do not know the meaning of customer service.  Delivery drivers are rude and come to your door with their bad attitudes, loud music and saggy pants. Would rather wait a little longer for pizza and wings from Fox's.

2.description: We are pretty loyal Domino's customers, we get pizzas about once every two weeks. Needless to say we were over the moon when this new and closer location opened.  We experienced a definite honeymoon period, but they delivered what can only be described as pizza soup. I didn't know where to begin with this pie. Terrible.  I'm so disappointed, mostly because we don't have many delivery options out way and now I have one less.  Very unlikely that I will be back.

0.description: tip: order thin crust.will review later

4.description: I thought things at Domino's has changed, but I see they have not.  They said it would be here in 30 minutes and that turned into 1hour. I open the boxes and the pizza is partially burnt and dry looking. It was like rubber. This is a brand new Domino's.  NEVER Again!!!

28.description: When I first became interested in cake decorating I was pretty bummed on the idea of mail ordering all of my supplies. Sure, I can get a lot of Wilton stuff at Joann Fabric, but I don't know... it lacks soul. So when I discovered Cake walk I was psyched. Truth be told, I have only ever purchased one book and a set of sugar skull molds here because a lot of things are priced a bit high for me (I guess this is the trade off for shopping in a boutique as opposed to a chain store.)
