But there are a lot of inspiring items here, including droves of cookie cutters. I don't even make rolled cookies, but I wanted to buy all of them. So if you're into decorating and you're not an old pro yet, check this place out. I've always found the staff (who I'm pretty sure is just the owner and her husband?) to be very helpful and friendly. They offer classes here, too, including an "adult cake" class you won't find at Joann's.

1.description: This review is solely related to the chocolate making class. I saw a Living Social deal for $27 (regularly $55) for a chocolate making class and thought that sounded like a really cool idea. Unfortunately, the chocolate making class was more of a chocolate dipping/chocolate molding class with most of the time devoted to waiting for our chocolate to harden in the freezer. I'd say there was one good thing about the class: the woman who taught the class was really sweet. We had a few people in our group who waited too long to buy the Living Social deal, but she allowed them to join anyway. The same problem has happened to me in the past for other activities in Chicago and I thought it was super generous of her to let the rest of our group in for the Living Social price. That is why this review gets 2 stars instead of 1. I knew I was in trouble when she started  the class with "I've never done this before." I wanted to hope for the best at that point, but I felt an ominous sense that things were going to get worse (spoiler alert: they did). Following this revelation, she spent 20 minutes talking about the products they sell to make chocolate and then verbally telling us how to use them to make chocolate, but we NEVER made any chocolate. Instead, there were several crock pots filled with melted chocolate that we used for the class. It was also disappointing to know that they sell 4 different kinds of chips to make chocolate (white, dark, milk, and mint), but we only used two during the class. Following the verbal demonstration, we filled 6 small molds, dipped a pretzel and twizzler, and made a cracker and Oreo chocolate confection. We also learned how to make a turtle, which was the coolest part of the class. Unfortunately, we were provided with mixed nuts rather than what turtles are normally made out of (e.g., cashews). They say the class is 2 hours, but the class (with the 20 minute instruction) takes between 45-60 minutes. What do you do the rest of the time? You wait your turn to put your molds into the freezer because they don't have a big enough one for the class (this would have been true even if the extra people were not let into the class). I think that this is a REALLY neat idea, which is why I bought the deal. Unfortunately, they need to seriously consider how to present this in the future if they want to continue offering this class.

9.description: I've been there twice for cake toppers that they didn't have. Nothing naughty for a bachelorette party nor an Oscar party. So they don't have everything. But nice friendly service & small Indy owned. I just suggest a phone call ahead if you're looking for something specific.

29.description: This store is not a bakery, but a cake decorating, candy making, and pastry supplies store. Their advertisement and web site say they have A LOT of stuff you need to do all your cake, candy, and pastry. I walked in there, and it is the smallest place I have ever been into. I mean to advertise and say you have a lot of stuff means you have a lot of space to hold your stuff in right? The place was small, things were very disorganized and not to mention dusty. They do not have as much as stuff as they say they do. It is also a hard place to find. Its on a very busy street and next to their shop are rails with metra trains constantly dropping people off.  No wonder metra always says.."We're on time. Are you?" They come every five minutes!If the owner is not there, they have a hard time finding prices for their items. They had to call people and flip through catalogs.Positive side: they are nice people and they offer classes. But i read through the website they only accept four people per class. If four people did not sign up and you signed up... then no class for you.

23.description: As a birthday treat, my girl took me here to learn how to decorate my own birthday cake.  A sweet gesture.Be forewarned that Cakewalk Chicago isn't in the greatest neighborhood.  I mean, I like abandoned factories and adjacent train tracks as much as the next guy, but it's very outskirts-y.Also, Cakewalk is basically in a shack.  It's a run-down old house.  Up front is a room filled with cookie cutters, cake decorating accessories and other baking supplies.  On the day I arrived a trio of small tables were set up for our class.God forbid you have to use the bathroom in the back.  This place barely has running water, which makes you kind of worry about the fact that they're handling actual food here.Despite those major setbacks, the class itself was fun.  Chef Lori will give you a quick & dirty tutorial on how to decorate a cake like a pro.  Whether your cake comes out looking like a pro did it... that's up to your skill.  It was a fun couple of hours, and it was nice to take home an edible souvenir.Oh, and it was fun to have the added floor show of Lori browbeating her husband every now and then.  He'd come up to start asking her a question and she'd answer before he'd finish speaking.  And then he'd have to ask his actual question again and she acted annoyed.  Good times!If you want to learn something fun in a building that should be condemned, Cakewalk Chicago is for you!

5.description: Making and eating candy should always be a fun event.  I room a class here with my cousin, and had a blast.  Lori's passion for the delicious and her sense of humor really came through.  I highly enjoyed learning how to make turtles, chocolate covered pretzel rods, and chocolate truffles in a casual yet highly informative environment.  Small female owned businesses like this need our support- and I'll gladly do what I can to get the word out about Cakewalk!

25.description: It is truly an unfortunate occurrence when people who are not bright enough to notice when a business listed as a CAKE DECORATING and CANDY SUPPLY SHOP is not a bakery, but also that the size of a stores venue does not suggest that the items offered are not rare nor the selection is less than abundant.  Not everyone who writes a review should be allowed to issue an opinion, especially when it is uninformed.Whether you are a first time cake decorator/candy maker with inspiration and vision -or- you are a practiced professional, CakeWalk Chicago is one of the very best resources in Chicago. They have consistently met my needs (and beyond) and I am a happy frequently returning customer. CakeWalk Chicago is extremely well stocked and their customer service (which seems to be a dying art - like common sense) is well above average. Traditionally, the craft of cake decorating was primarily practiced in the UK and Australia. It is not as popular of a trade/hobby in the US which is why it is so difficult to find may specialty cake decorating tools. I have lived and visited several countries around the world and have had the privilege of learning about professional cake decorating by some of the best known sugar craft artists in the world. Not only is Lori a bevy of information and tips, she is passionate and professional and her shop reflects this. They are extremely well stocked and if by chance there is something you want and they don't have it, if she can find it, she'll get it. They have even delivered product to me for my bakery in extremely short notice. I have called her to check my facts or asked for advice and she is always ready and willing to help. She offers classes and instructs in a very uncomplicated and approachable manner without ego.Thank you to Lori and her husband for always being eager and willing to help, teach and offer advice. FIVE STARS all the way around.

12.description: If I need something--they have it. Recently, I purchased items here to make different colored candies for a bridal shower. They are always very helpful.

21.description: i was looking to stock up on some cake decorating supplies and this was the first listing that popped up when i googled  it. i didnt have anything to do, so i took the trip down there. beverly was a bit of a trip for me from the nw burbs, but this store seriously had everything i could need or want. like other reviewers have said, it is very, very small and a bit disorganized. but the owners are awesome about helping you find what you need. i also saw that the female owner, lori, teaches some classes. and i saw samples of her gumpaste flowers....very, very impressive. i am looking forward to possibly signing up for a class in the future. :) great job cakewalk chicago!

16.description: I went here recently for a cupcake decorating class and it was great! First the store has all this amazing stuff,top quality and its very reasonable priced. The class was alot of fun,I learned sooo many different things and I was only there for about 1.5 hrs.Lori is a great teacher,its a family enviornment. Her kids were there being adorable,her husband was the photographer.It's a pity it takes me 45mins to get to her shop...I definitly would like to make it a once monthly field trip for myself tho.

17.description: They've got it ALL. The best of everything for Cake Decorating, Candy Making and All Pastry related needs. Owned and operated by a Lori who is a Professional Pastry Chef. Whether you're an occasional baker or a Pro. This is your one stop shop. They are always happy to see you and they truly appreciate your business.

10.description: I set out to make a cake that my sister in law saw a picture of and became quite excited over. I stumbled upon a quaint store conveniently located right off the Beverly Hills Metra train stop. But don't let the size fool you they are home to an abundance of baking/candy making supplies. I can confidently and proudly say that I am a fan of Lori. She was so helpful, knowledgeable  and polite this morning when I went into Cakewalk. I went in unsure and nervous about the cake I was trying to create or re-create.  Lori took a look at the picture and took me right to the products I would need also provided helpful tips and suggestions. She demonstrated how honest this establishment is by giving me tips on how to use one product in multiple ways in stead of trying to sell me multiple items or products. I had a really satisfying experience in the store and I can't wait to go spend more money with them. Lori even seemed interested in my finished product. Cakewalk is now my go to for all things baking and candy making. I recommend you at stop by and check it out for yourself.

11.description: Having taken a class here over the weekend, I cannot do anything but highly recommend that you check out Cakewalk! The location was easy to find (with plenty of parking) in a surprisingly cute neighborhood. The instructor, Lori, was super pleasant, professional, and gave great advice. The supplies available during the class were outstanding ( I have never had so much fun decorating baked goods!) and the supplies at the store were beyond! I ended up buying some basic cake decorating supplies like tips and bags, but I could have purchased detailed cookie cutters, yummy fillings, professional-grade icing, or beautiful baking accessories. If you need any kind of decorating supply, I would go here first. It is an independent, family run business, and I can't wait to come back for another class!

26.description: The older I get, the more domestic I yearn to be.  In fact, I'm even contemplating making a turkey this Fall for the first time ever.  Earlier this year, I took on the task of making a cake for a baby shower.  My inspiration of course came from Martha Stewart.   Nine 4in x 4in cakes covered in pastel tinted fondant and decorated to look like baby blocks.I really didn't know what I was getting myself into.  Luckily, the staff at Cakewalk was extremely knowledgeable and helped me pick up all the supplies I needed and gave me lots of great tips (I literally took notes).  When all was said and done, it took me a good six hours to put this cake together and it didn't quite look like the picture on the Martha website.  It seemed to be a hit at the shower and I received many compliments--not sure how genuine they were, but it's the thought that counts, right?I plan to head back to Cakewalk soon to pick up supplies for Christmas cookies.  Decorating I can handle, but I could use some advice on how to evenly roll out sugar cookie dough.  Cakewalk to the rescue!

27.description: A friend and I just baked our first large wedding cake - and we probably wouldn't have done it without our visit to Cakewalk.  We took the Metra to the shop, and found that not only did it have almost everything we needed, but Lori who was working there when we arrived, talked us through making a wedding cake and even pointed out certain recipes in a cookbook we brought with us.  She's an expert and incredibly generous in sharing her knowledge.  The store is small in size - but it is entirely stocked with cake and candy making supplies.  It may not have everything you're looking for, but it had all the basics we needed, and a few products that we didn't know about that helped us tremendously.  It's local and family owned - and an incredible asset to Chicago cake-bakers!  This is my first yelp review - and I'm only writing it because I think the place is great and wanted to share it with others.

0.description: One-stop shop for all your baking needs! They have a comprehensive inventory of items for baking and decorating.  When my daughter wanted a "Frozen" cake for her birthday, they had snowflake sprinkles in-stock!  We also like to get big 1lbs blocks of handmade caramel for dipping apples around Halloween. Definitely worth a visit.  You won't be dissappointed.

20.description: Ok I want to say cakewalk is tbe BEST.  As far as a shack it's not, if you bake cakes and look @ how everything is placed u will find everything u need. I'm a baker everything I neeeeeeed is there. If u r indeed a true baker u will appreciate the store and the service they provide.... This is from a professional stand point, we love places like this. CAKEWALK keep doing what u do MAD LOVE!

19.description: Glad I Made the TripLooking at some of the reviews, you should know that this is a smallish, store front building in a residential neighborhood. Looking at some of the reviews, some folks need to get out more. Come on people, being close to a Rapid Transit stop does not make this a reason not to shop here. I'm not a baker but volunteered to make iced cookies for a family event.  I was really stuck on how to go about making Royal Icing. Lori's Cakewalk was the only place in Chicago that had the Ateco Meringue Powder that several on-line cookie sites rave is the only way to go with Royal Icing.  The woman who helped me was knowledgeable, friendly, and patient. We got on to the subject of the dough for the cookies and she kept pondering on why my dough was not firmer and made comments about the science of the ingredients. That later turned out to be a lifesaver for me as I continued making cookies that evening. I was cutting the cookies (dough was on a plastic cutting sheet) on my glass counter cook top. The light above it is halogen and heating up the surface of the cooktop, making my dough too soft. The particulars are not important, but how rare is it now a days to get great advice on how to do something? The big box stores don't offer that (i.e. Michaels, etc.). I am so appreciative that she took the time to think through why I was having difficulty.  Yes, it's out of the way but if I wish I had gone to that place first when I began this project.

2.description: Saw a deal on LivingSocial for a 2-hour chocolate making class in my hood.  $27 seemed like a good deal, full price for the class is $55.   I rounded up some friends and we decided to go for it.  Scheduling the class required me calling, being put on hold and/or told to call back in "two-minutes" a few times in a row.   Eventually, I got through and booked the class.Cakewalk is a tiny storefront on 99th Street & Wood.  If you blink, you may miss it.  Street parking is available.   There are two rooms to the shop.  The first room is the store to purchase baking supplies and the second room is where they hold classes.  It is a small, cute space.  The owner, Lori, is great.The chocolate making class was more of a chocolate demonstration.   It was about 90% demonstration, and 10% filling chocolate molds with pre-melted chocolate.   We were given about 20 minutes in the middle to go and shop in the store.   Really, this was not worth the $27 deal, and for sure not worth the full price of $55.   We dipped two pretzel rods, one twizzler, one Oreo, and filled about 6 tiny molds.   Once they cooled in the frige, wrapped them in saran wrap and took them home.  Great owner.  Cute store.   If you are looking to buy some cake decorating items, I would recommend.  I would not invest the money into a "class".

18.description: Ok I want to say cakewalk is tbe BEST.  As far as a shack it's not, if you bake cakes and look @ how everything is placed u will find everything u need. I'm a baker everything I neeeeeeed is there. If u r indeed a true baker u will appreciate the store and the service they provide.... This is from a professional stand point, we love places like this. CAKEWALK keep doing what u do MAD LOVE!

13.description: As a professional cake decorator, I usually try to find a cake supply shop to visit any time I go somewhere and Cakewalk is the place I wanted to find in Chicago.  Anyone who visits very many cake supply shops knows that they tend to fall into three categories:  small and cluttered, more party than cake supplies so they're bigger, or they do a stiff mail order business and can afford more space.  This one is small and cluttered but well worth the effort.  I spent the first 20 minutes just looking at the cookie cutter rack because the variety was so amazing.  Indeed, Lori had almost everything I've collected and use in my own shop and a few things I didn't have, which I promptly purchased.  Things I asked about, she was more than willing to order and ship to me in a USPS one price box which saves me a minimum order with the same supplier.   Well worth the trip if you are a cake decorator.

4.description: A traveling salesman is driving down an old country road one evening when his car breaks down. He walks to a nearby farmhouse and asks if he can stay the night before going to get help the next morning. The kindly farmer tells him he can stay, on the condition that he does not touch any of the extremely delicious cupcakes that he had just finished baking earlier in the day. In the middle of the night, the salesman wakes up hungry, walks down into the kitchen and eats all the cupcakes. The cupcakes totally let him too, because cupcakes are sluts like that. *Thanks to Brodie Brohkie for that. :) I was at Cakewalk for a cupcake decorating class (yay Yelpppp) with Lori, who is warm and friendly, and came back to buy some supplies once I was inspired. They have everything! Fillings, melting chocolate, guava essence, whatever else you need to bake amazingness. I made some cake pops for Food Friday at work today (it is what it is.) and I made lavender vanilla and then grapefruit guava. Amazing. Anything you need and more, plus classes! I wish it weren't so far... but it's probably for the best.

24.description: Five stars for the friendly service, great items, and informative classes. It's off the beaten path if you live in Chicago or just north of the city, but its well worth a trip out. Cakewalk has so many items and they will order anything you want that they don't have.  I will definitely return for all my baking needs!

6.description: As a birthday treat, my girl took me here to learn how to decorate my own birthday cake.  A sweet gesture.Be forewarned that Cakewalk Chicago isn't in the greatest neighborhood.  I mean, I like abandoned factories and adjacent train tracks as much as the next guy, but it's very outskirts-y.Also, Cakewalk is basically in a shack.  It's a run-down old house.  Up front is a room filled with cookie cutters, cake decorating accessories and other baking supplies.  On the day I arrived a trio of small tables were set up for our class.God forbid you have to use the bathroom in the back.  This place barely has running water, which makes you kind of worry about the fact that they're handling actual food here.Despite those major setbacks, the class itself was fun.  Chef Lori will give you a quick & dirty tutorial on how to decorate a cake like a pro.  Whether your cake comes out looking like a pro did it... that's up to your skill.  It was a fun couple of hours, and it was nice to take home an edible souvenir.Oh, and it was fun to have the added floor show of Lori browbeating her husband every now and then.  He'd come up to start asking her a question and she'd answer before he'd finish speaking.  And then he'd have to ask his actual question again and she acted annoyed.  Good times!If you want to learn something fun in a building that should be condemned, Cakewalk Chicago is for you!

22.description: If you're into cake decorating or candy making, they have everything you need.  If you're not sure, call ahead and they'll be happy to order it for you.  I had quite a time trying to find a candy making supply store in Chicago, and was happy to make the trip down to Beverly to visit Cakewalk.  What a find!  The owners clearly take great pride in serving their customers.  I'm sure I'll be back.Oh, and if I cared about a fancy building I'd go to a big-box store in Niles.  No thanks.

15.description: If you're into cake decorating or candy making, they have everything you need.  If you're not sure, call ahead and they'll be happy to order it for you.  I had quite a time trying to find a candy making supply store in Chicago, and was happy to make the trip down to Beverly to visit Cakewalk.  What a find!  The owners clearly take great pride in serving their customers.  I'm sure I'll be back.Oh, and if I cared about a fancy building I'd go to a big-box store in Niles.  No thanks.

7.description: My 300th review calls for something special. Cakewalk Chicago, you're it! I was able to attend the Cupcake Decorating Class via Yelp Gets Cultured Week and I had a wonderful time. Pastry Chef Lori was a wonderful instructor and pretty entertaining as well. Her friendly manner and enthusiasm made it a very comfortable and fun class environment. We learned some basic piping techniques and basic fondant techniques and got to be as creative as we wanted to be on the dozen cupcakes each of us got to decorate. I'm excited to incorporate these techniques in my future home-baked goods. I was so excited after class that I spent some time shopping in the store. It's a small shop, but it's loaded with many many different supplies that can help folks decorate cookies, cupcakes, cakes, etc. There is also a huge selection of cookie cutters and candy molds. I felt the prices for many of these items were pretty reasonable and I'm ready to channel my inner Martha Stewart and get going on my cookie and cupcake projects! It's a bit of a drive out to Beverly for this suburban gal, but totally worth it for the fun class and decorating goodies I bought.

8.description: I took the cupcake decorating class through Yelp Gets Cultured and I was blown away.  My cupcakes normally taste good, but don't look particularly nice.  After that class, I have no doubt that my cupcakes will look as good as they taste in the future.  I was surprised at how fun and easy it was to make the cupcakes look nice once I learned the proper technique.Lori was such a great instructor, and a really sweet person.  After the class I went into the store and bought filling, food coloring, and a tip for the pipping bag and it was only $12 for everything.I am surprised that I have never been to this store before, because it seems like a place my mom would love.  This store would be most bakers favorite places.  So many of the items are things I have ordered for my mom from bakers catalogs, but it would be way more fun to buy them in a store than to order them from a catalog.  Plus the people in the store can answer any questions!

3.description: We are in a mission to make a Tangled Tower Cake...we found Cakewalk on Yelp and headed out. It felt like a road trip from downtown Chicago!!!We pulled up and it was closed.  As I read the sign I learned they were on vacation. I turned to my wife and said, "Lucy...you've got some explainin' to do!" no I didn't say that but I sure thought it.  Just then the owner Lori came and opened the door. She said that they were closed but invited me in to look around.  That is called Customer Service and deserves 5 Stars!!!  Wow a business owner who cares!!!Lori and I talked about my research on making a cake tower and we came up with some good ideas. She was so helpful.  I bought edible paint, brushes and other things to start my project. (This is my wives fault because she thinks I can build it...and I've gotta accept the challenge.)My wife also got cool things to make little mini flowers for her cupcakes...I'm also gonna need flowers for my tower too.  So now we start building!!!The store was fun and there were so many things to see. Thanks Lori for opening your doors and letting us shop!!!Lori also gave us directions to see the old historic houses and the castle at 103rd street. She is also a great tour guide too. She takes pride in her business and the area she is from!!!  I think she needs to start a cupcake walking tour!!!  Thanks again Lori!!!

14.description: I took the cupcake-decorating class with Lori through Yelp Gets Cultured and it was fantastic!  We were given 12 cupcakes to decorate and all kinds of fun frosting, fondant, toppings, and tools.  Lori gave us an overview and then let us loose to try things out, while she walked around to offer helpful advice.  She is delightful and clearly loves what she's doing - her husband and children were around and were adorable as well.  The shop has all kinds of baking supplies and every type of candy mold you can imagine.  Per Lori's advice, I also explored Beverly a bit and was surprised to find such a verdant neighborhood full of mansions and interesting shops.  The only reason I'm taking off a star is that I felt the price of the class is a tiny bit high.  I wouldn't have been able to afford it if it hadn't been complimentary through Yelp.  Overall, though, the store is fun, Lori is fantastic, Beverly is lovely and the class was a blast!

1.description: So far so good.  The best part has been no obnoxious and entitled groups of coffee drinkers. Also, no one ordering those ridiculous concoctions that you need a note pad to remember the ingredients. Ex: 1. Triple, Venti, Half Sweet, Non-Fat, Caramel Macchiato. 2. Grande, Quad(4 shots of espresso), Nonfat, One-Pump, No-Whip, Mocha. 3. Venti Iced Skinny Hazelnut Macchiato, Sugar-Free Syrup, Extra Shot, Light Ice, No Whip.    Just coffee for me please. And I'm pretty sure no one will tell me they can do a pour over if I'd like because the coffee house is out of coffee.

0.description: Thank goodness for an alternative to Starbucks in Beverly. It's much quieter than the Starbucks on 103rd & Longwood, which makes it a terrific place to have a conversation with a friend. The owner has clearly invested in the space...new windows and expanded the space. The coffee is terrific plus they've pasteries from a local bakery in Blue Island (Iversen's ). Worth checking out!

3.description: Hands down the best running store I have been to. All other stores seem detached and a bit distant from their customers. Bev and Jim absolutely love running and it shows in their interactions with their customers. Always helpful and kind while shopping in the store, Bev helped me figure out some solutions to feet issues and answers all my questions whenever I am in there. Jim helped with some idea for cross training and recovering from an injury. These two truly love what they do.Other workers have been helpful and very kind. All their prices are comparable with other running shops, but this shop has the right feel and atmosphere. Even if something was a little more expensive I would be willing to buy from here because of the experience I get with the purchase.

1.description: They were extremely helpful in finding me inserts and socks for plantar fasciitis. My feet were killing me--there were days I could hardly walk, and that is not an exaggeration--and I tried many different shoes and inserts, but it wasn't until I went here and was directed to the right products (which were less expensive than they would be at Dick's or The Walking Company) as well as other resources that I found some relief. The woman who sold me the products directed me to a few websites that show how to deal with plantar fasciitis. She herself suffered from plantar fasciitis and, as a runner, knew the science behind foot and leg problems. I am grateful for her time and her ability to explain all of this to me. Like I said, there were days where I could hardly walk. It was getting ridiculous. Locally owned! That's usually enough for me, but combined with competitive pricing and a staff who knows what they are talking about, and there's no reason to go anywhere else on the SW Side. I'll be back.

2.description: I've purchased most of my running shoes here. They are pretty knowledgeable about running gear and are runners themselves. They also offer a free gait analysis!  Will be stopping by soon to purchase another pair.

9.description: Finally, it's great to have a local running store! Employees are very nice and helpful. So glad I don't have to make the trek into the city or the burbs anymore :)

10.description: I am a very beginning runner, so walking into a running store was intimidating , but I was instantly put at ease and felt like I was treated like an elite runner.  My gait was checked, and three different types of shoe were recommended to me.  I've since been running in the shoes, and I was encouraged to join their weekly running group.  This place was great.

4.description: Great people who know what their doing. If you want something and they don't have it, they will go out of their way to get it. Plus, the run groups are great, filled with friendly people, any pace, any experience, runner or walker doesn't matter, it only matters if your doing it. Thanks for being apart of the community.

6.description: After two years of trekking to Fleet Feet on my lunch break, I'm estatic to finally have (discovered - apparently they've been there about a year) a local running store!The owners (Jim and Beverly) are as knowledgable as they are friendly.  Jim was with another customer when I walked into the store, but I was immediately greeted and acknowledged.  During the fitting, Jim was very chatty asking about my races and running in general.  He even convinced me to check out the Saturday morning running group.  And I'm glad he did!The Saturday morning group run is awesome!  There were way more people than I expected which meant the was someone run with even at my slower pace.  Everyone I've met has been wonderful to run and talk with.  (I imagine the Tuesday and Thursday group runs are equally as awesome, but I don't get home from work early enough to make it to these.)  Running with people is far better than running alone, and I've been jealous of my city friends who can run with the many Fleet Feet group runs.  I'm so glad Running Excels has made my hate my friends a little less!Oh, and prices seem right on par with other running stores I've visited.

12.description: I attend the fun runs here and everyone is nice and helpful. The owners are passionate runner who are helpful and informative.

5.description: As a first time runner, I'm happy I came to Running Excels. I signed up for my first 5K to support a local event, and with Running Excels as a sponsor, I wanted to thank them for their support too. The selection is small if you're hoping for style points, but right on the money if you're looking for a staff that knows their product and how to fit you properly. They watch your stride, film you on the treadmill, and with a step-on pad analyze your arch before bringing out several pairs of shoes to try on. I was happy with their attentive service, comfortable in my new kicks, and even finished my first 5K!

11.description: I finally got around to visiting this store! They owners were a delight! My neighbor (Jeanne S.) was absolutely right about how nice and knowledgeable they are! I plan to join them on one of the fun runs very soon! Look forward to Champaign in April! Thanks for the invite!

8.description: I just had one of the most enjoyable shopping experiences I really have ever had. All the other reviews nailed it--the owners take the time to get to know you, to learn your habits, and to make helpful suggestions. You can also tell they're big supporters of their neighborhood, which I appreciate. I must confess to usually shopping for the cheapest shoes online or at the big chains. No more. I finally found a local running store where I'm happy to shell out a few extra dollars for the experience and service.

0.description: Showed up to the store about ten minutes after close. Beverly was working late, saw me near the door, and let me in. It was refreshing not to be shut out. Second time I've purchased shoes since moving back to the area. Both times, I was assisted by an employee who had a strong grasp of what shoe fit my running style. From novices to dedicated runners, I highly recommend this place. Outstanding service and product knowledge.

7.description: Great staff, and 3/week group runs/walks!  You have to check this store out!

1.description: Got a pair of shoes one time and it was OK. Only went here because of a coworker shopping here and liked their experience. Accidentally ordered the wrong size shoe tried calling them but no one picked up sent email but didn't get a response until over 48 hours later saying to call store to talk to someone. Which I did call and talk to an employee, not manager, about the situation. Wanted to give me size I wanted but already got the shoe from somewhere else because they took forever to respond back. Tried to work out deal so I could get a different shoe so money wouldn't have to be refunded but didn't want to work deal out.

2.description: Had an amazing shopping experience!  Wide selection of shoes and very friendly staff.  I would shop here again without question!!

0.description: Nice clean space! The team working in the Padded Room is very down to earth, friendly, and knowledgeable! Any hot new releases be sure to hit them up first before they sale out.   This is a great place to go for quality authentic shoes!

Beverly Bike & Ski are excellent @ what they do & so friendly too.  They give you all the instruction you need, walk you thru the littlest things, just amazing people!The owner (Paul) worked with me & I couldn't have asked for more.  Mike put my bike holder on the car, walked me thru the entire process- great.  They're open to questions & offer to help you in the future.I couldn't be happier.  Thank you Paul!

58.description: Oh yeah!  I passed by while visiting someone in the hospital and I had to stop in: so glad I did!  I got a slice of the sweet potato pie with honey cream cheese icing -- I'm mad that I didn't eat it sloooooower!  I had the sweet potato cobbler too -- it was OK.  But the sweet potato yogurt was really good, and since it's dairy-free, a healthier alternative than ice cream (will definitely stop by on those hot summer days). I Highly Recommend This Place!

56.description: JIMMY JIMMY JIMMY!I am starting to look like a Sweet Potato I love this food sooooo much!

29.description: I came to update my review. Why, you might ask, did I come back to update my already-glowing aforementioned review? Because the best just got better, straight up.So. I was sold on the dairy free sweet potato ice cream at the start, yes. This remains a constant truth even now. But not being a tremendous fan of sweet potatoes (I enjoy them, but I am--or was--hardly what one would call obsessed with the sweet tots), I figured it'd be a great summer stop, but nothing more. I was wrong, you guys. I was very, very wrong.A month (or so) ago, my husband wanted to try the "loaded sweet potato with chicken", so I decided I'd grab a plain sweet potato with a little brown sugar on the side. Suffice to say, we'd probably eat there every day if humanly possible. No, really. It was THAT incredible.I figured a plain sweet potato would curb my hunger but otherwise be...boring. This place makes sweet potatoes so good, so tender, so creamy that with the hint of brown sugar, I thought I might've died and went to food heaven. Oh, and the size of the sweet potatoes? Giant. No, really. They are enormous. And they are luscious beyond words.My husband is head over heels with the loaded sweet potatoey goodness. For one, it's absolutely a dish worth sharing (if you both consume meat and dairy, that is) or at the very least, it will serve you well for two separate meals. He's been meaning to try both the sweet potato stew and the steak sandwich on sweet potato bread, but he hasn't been able to let go of this loaded sweet potato desires. That says something right there, no?Anyway, go, go, go, GO to Jimmy Jamm's as soon as you possibly can. Maybe sooner, even. Preferably now. Yep, now would be the best. You can thank me later. :)

42.description: Two rules:1) People who love sweet potatoes will be in absolute heaven here.2) People who claim to hate sweet potatoes - please take a bite of anything off the menu here, and then please refer back to rule #1.Folks, I am rarely in this area, and stopped on a whim.  I am here to tell you this place is no joke.  I was able to sample the ice cream, and the plain pie.  Whatever spices they use, is in perfect proportion and complements the potato exactly.  The slice I bought for myself, the Banana Rum Honey Cream Cheese (yes I did just write all of that to describe one thing) was out of this world.  Perfectly flakey crust, smooth as silk frosting, and the sweet potato was rich, dense and creamy.  Not to mention how charming and welcoming the guy running the place was.  SO nice, and he explained what all of the menu items were, when was the best time to order them, and of course, the aforementioned samples.  I loved how passionate he was about this place!I haz a sad though reading about the magical chicken and waffles some people were able to try - this was not an option on the menu when I was there.  If it was a special or just a test Jimmy Jamm, I highly recommend you bring that back!  You cant go wrong with chicken and sweet potato waffles!Only bad thing is you need a nap after eating anything here!

23.description: I love this place! The staff is super nice and the goodies are absolutely delicious. I need to go back soon to get another fix.

47.description: Just perfect! Thank you, Jimmy Jamm.I've been working out of town, but wanted something for my family Thanksgiving in Beverly. Asked mom if they would mind picking up the pie on Wednesday and she obliged. I've been scoping out Jimmy Jamm's for awhile, and knew we had to try it. We even converted some family members with the Honey Cream Sweet Potato Pie (didn't think they liked sweet potato pie), it was so tasty and flavorful.Mom and Dad picked up the pie, since it was Operation Thanksgiving week, they couldn't see the normal offerings, but everything went smoothly - the ordering process is done by hand, so expect a little wait to find the order (which I was able to pre-pay over the phone).Next, I'd love to try the sweet potato cake roll, we'll see when we get another chance.

8.description: The best sweet potato pies I've ever had. Every time I drive in from the suburbs I have to stop. The whole family lives their pies

31.description: Remember that scene in Forrest Gump when Bubba starts talking about all the different ways to prepare shrimp...  well, that's what I thought about when we got to Jimmy Jamm Pies, except instead of shrimp, the star ingredient here is SWEET POTATOES.  We're talking sweet potato pies, sweet potato cookies, sweet potato bread, sweet potato cheesecake, sweet potato stew, sweet potato non-dairy ice cream, well, you get the picture...and no, I am not kidding, Jimmy Jamm's sells all of these items.  Of these I tried the ice cream (FAB!), and the following pies:  plain sweet potato, banana rum sweet potato, sweet potato with honey whipped cream.  I also have about three other items in my fridge waiting for me to try.Every item I tried was better than the next!  Now here's the thing, I am not exactly a sweet potato fanatic, personally I think most people make them too sweet, I do, however like a good slice of pie.  Jimmy Jamm's pies are not sweet at all (at least not the one's I've tasted so far) it's just the right amount of sweetness, and the pie crust is perfect, even after sitting my fridge for a day -- that's a true test of pie crust!  The other thing that I loved is how great we were treated at the store, super friendly customer service.  He answered all of our questions, gave us a yummy sample of the ice cream and was as nice as could be.  And we also loved the price.  We bought a ton of items and only spent a little over $20...a bargain!  This is some top-notch stuff here!  That banana rum alone was worth $5 a slice easy, but was no where near that price.  This place is a true gem, I wish they opened a shop closer to me.  But it is totally worth a drive to Beverly to get our Jimmy Jamm's pie fix!  And try a sandwich on that sweet potato bread with some of that sweet potato stew!

34.description: We walked and were immediately greeted and given the rundown. Everything has a sweet potato component and were then given a sample of sweet potato ice cream. It was delicious. We ended up with a few slices of pie, the plain was great and honey cream cheese topping was even better. This was as good as any sweet potato pie that I've ever had. Read what others are saying, even if you don't think that sweet potatoes are tasty, try this place. I can't say enough good things about the service, it's friendly and inviting. It obvious that the owner really cares about making a quality product. The other nice thing is that you can see the kitchen, it's nice and clean.Sweet potato pie is a dessert and a meal in one.

16.description: Oh. My. God.Where else are you going to find a shop that's ONLY about sweet potato/yams??? That's the first reason you should go. Once you're there, you can't go wrong with anything you get there - every item has the right texture and is delicious without being overly sweet and heavy. The pie crust is perfect. The banana rum cream cheese topping....do I have to say more? It has the perfect consistency. And that ice cream - Harold, you are a genius.Jimmy Jamm is worth the trip and the calories!!!!

13.description: Was taken care of by Pastry Chef, Cedric ...super friendly, funny, helpful. We talked about his former blue hair, my purple peek-a-boos, rescuing animals and before ya knew it, we had the phones out and were  braggin' on our pitbulls while I was waiting on my goodies. . Was given a complimentary tasting of their  dairy-free sweet potato ice cream. Soooo good. I'd kill for a sugar-free version. Argh!  They DO have sugar-free pie slices though. Oh, so divine! Oodles of cakes, pies and yummies to choose from. You can also dine in and enjoy sweet potato waffles and fried chicken or their heavenly sweet potato fries. Snagged a hearty loaf of bread for making some killer sammies.Sweet potato lovers, Jimmy Jamm's is a dream. I'll be hitting them up again...and again.

11.description: This is an absolute gem on the south side.  Came here with a bunch of friends having no idea what to expect.  The seven of us were the only ones in the restaurant, and one of the managers gave us unparalleled attention.  Great food-- deff save room for dessert.

39.description: This place was awesome!!! Harold and Richard treated us like we were family. Sampled the sweet potatoe ice cream and ended up taking home a pint. It is truly some of the best ice cream I have ever had. I cant wait to go back. It was worth stopping for!!!!

37.description: This place is amazing!The dairy free ice cream & sweet potato pie was exquisite!I was visiting a friend in Beverly who lived near Jimmy Jamm, but had never eaten there. We called to see when they were closing. The gentleman stated 7:00 pm & it was 6:57 pm.We asked if they could wait and stay open a few extra minutes.They obliged and when we got there, we were greeted at the door with a piping fresh pie, straight from the oven. While they were boxing it up, they offered us samples of their sweet potato ice cream. I took one taste and walked out of the place with a pint and a pie!Heavenly!Thank you for existing!

0.description: This restaurant is just not a bakery for pies and cakes they also make loaded sweet potatoes with either chicken or steak and it also includes mushrooms peppers onions and seasoning and it is truly tasty. They make everything sweet potato from a cheesecake, cupcake, pound cake, cobbler pie, bread, and some great sweet potato ice cream. If you like sweet potatoes you will love this place.

38.description: Amazing...staff is awesome! Such a friendly environment. Everyone welcomed us the min. we walked in with free samples and warm conversation. It was nice to get that kind of service. The sweet potato ice cream was phenomonal!Check this place out u won't be sorry!

51.description: My fiance and I stopped in here after visiting the business next door. We'd never noticed it before today and the mention of sweet potato pie jumped out at us (shopping while hungry will do that.)  It was a wonderful experience and I was very pleasantly surprised.I didn't expect the owner to be so nice, friendly and welcoming. I mean he was REALLY nice and made us feel at home. He asked us and everyone else who came in if they'd been in before. If they said no, he gave them an overview of the business and invited them to try a sample of sweet potato ice cream, which was extremely delicious and smooth. An atmosphere where customers are welcomed the way we were here is hard not to notice. And it rubs off! We even struck up conversations with a couple of other customers around the topic of the delicious ice cream.I ended up getting a turkey sandwich on sweet potato bread with sweet potato fries while my fiance liked the ice cream so much he got a cup of it for the road. I have to try the sweet potato pie with this honey cream cheese icing everyone is talking about. It looked good. I was not disappointed and definitely plan to return and will tell everyone I know to check it out!

27.description: I had really high expectations after reading some of the yelp reviews. As other posters stated, the customer service was impeccable. The decor was, well, out of place. I felt like I was at a wedding reception, almost a gaudy feeling.We ordered the fries, pie, and ice cream. Fries: Honestly, I have made better at home. They were soggy and really nothing special. I would consider these super surgery fill-food--nothing more, nothing less.Pie: The pie was good, not great. Interestedly, the pie was not sweet enough. It was plain and definitely not crave-worthy. Ice Cream: The ice cream was good. It is nondairy and tastes like punkin pie-seriously. It is good in extremely small servings but eating a bowl of it would be a chore. Overall, I really like the owners and employees and tried really hard to like it. But, you cant force yourself to overlook the shortcomings here.Too bad, it is a great concept.As my girl friend said, "how can you mess up sweet potato fries?  Fries are like level one sweet potatoness, perfecting these should be a piece of cake."

32.description: Jimmy Jamm's place is a HIT!  We stopped by today and just had to pick up a slice of almost every pie they had in the fridge!  We were welcomed by a taste of some really delicious "Sweet P" ice cream that is sooooooo good!!!  I can't wait til the summer time to stop by and enjoy it!  For those of us who either need to eat with little or no sugar, or who are afftected by diabetes...they have a very appropriately delicious sweet potatoe pie.  All in all, this place is worth the trip to enjoy!

54.description: Hello, FOOD SNOB here.This review is only based on the Sweet Potato Pie.   And what a Pie it was.   Just what this Foodie expected after reading all the good reviews from you wonderful Yelpers.   Had the perfect taste. Not too rich like some Pies could be.And then there"s the Crust.   If your a person who leaves the crust in the plate, you won't be after you taste this one.  Just what you would expect from a Mom and Pop Bakery.Also on the menu are steak and deli sandwiches which I can't wait to try hopefully soon!!

48.description: Sweet potatoes, sweet potatoes, everywhere.  If you're a fan of em, and we are,  you need to make it here sometime.  It was a little out of the way, but I was in the "ballpark" and swung by, and picked up a sweet potato pie for $12, and a sweet potato waffle plus fried chicken for $8.99.  The latter has been offered for 2 months, and comes with 4 chicken wings.  The pie was very fresh, sweet and cinnamon-y.  The waffle and fried chicken combo was a novelty and it was good, after sitting for an hour drive.I met Harold, who is a co-owner, and Jimmy's husband.  Very friendly guy, and he offered a free sampling of their SP ice cream, as well as their honey cream cheese and rum raisin toppings.  All very nice.  The toppings run $4 additional per pie.  if it weren't such a trip back to Naperville, I'd bring home some of the ice cream.  They've been there for 3 years, and also have SP cupcakes, breads, pastries, and sandwiches with SP bread.  Will be back again sometime when in the ballpark.

44.description: One of the best pie's I have ever had.  We drive 90 miles round trip to get this pie.  Honey cream cheese frosting is genius!  Great owners.

24.description: Awesome! Friendly guys helped us behind the counter, talked to us, gave us complimentary ice cream (!)--great service.Also the sweet potato pieces (confectionaries and other goods) are delicious: sweet but not insanely sweet. Thank you very much.

7.description: Even after a satisfying dinner I had pie on the brain.  My tummy always saves room for a little sumpin sumpin.  I've had this place bookmarked for a while and we were finally in the neighborhood.I was welcomed, by who I can only guess was Harold the owner, with a cheerful greeting and asking if I had been in before.  To my "No" reply, I was given a sample of their sweet potato dairy free ice cream.  No words can describe how utterly creamy, sweet and amazing it was.  I ended up getting two desserts to-go to share with the hubby.  A giant slab of sweet potato cobble and fat piece of rum banana sweet potato pie.The cobbler was good, would have been phenomenal if I could have had the foresight to heat it up before pigging out.  So sweet and the spices were amazing.  Then there was the rum banana sweet potato pie, talk about earth shattering.  So sweet, so rich, so creamy...O.o.mg.  If I didn't believe in being able to taste "love" in food before, I believe it now.  They were both MADE with lots of lovin'.

49.description: Go try it! Go love it!  Go again and take a friend!  The ice-cream is dairy free, they offer sugar free pie that is delicious, you can get a cake for your celebration, have chicken and sweet potato waffles anytime and the service is always above fine.  You owe it to yourself to add some flavor and flair to your palate.

40.description: This place is awesome! I had a sweet potato sandwich. I never would have thought about trying something like this. It was delicious. The ice cream was really, really great. If you have to come in here and get one thing try the ice cream. It's kinda spicy too which is crazy. It's really good though.

53.description: i drove by this place on the way to the way to a doctor's appt and will now be stopping every time i have an appt. i'm kinda looking forward to my appts because it's an excuse to hit up this fine establishment.every single item lists sweet potato as an ingredient? sign this girl up. on the overall creativity and deliciousness of everything i tried, i give this place 5 stars. i can't wait to try more.that said, my favorite sweet potato pie still comes from a local vendor at the farmer's market in ann arbor, mi. my mouth is watering just thinking about it.

30.description: I wish that I had thought of this super clever name for a store and even more, I wish it had been around when I was little and we had pretty boring sweet potatoes on holidays.  Anything made with sweet potatoes is for sale here and I mean anything.  Plus, the man who worked here was so helpful, friendly and kind that I just kept putting more things on the counter.  He looked at my pile, looked at the clock and noted that it was 5:45.  He predicted that I would taste them all and have time to be back before they closed at 7:00.  He was such a fun guy, told us about them being on TV and just made it a pleasure to shop here.My husband and I spread them all out and tried a tiny sliver of each one.  We then decided if it was an eat now, eat later or pitch.  Here are our results.Sweet potato Cheesecake - pitch (we are not big Cheese cake people.  I may have gotten over excited while buying.)Sweet potato pie - good, save to eat for laterSweet potato pie with cream cheese frosting - very good, save to eat for laterSweet potato cake - delicious, split and eat nowSweet potato cup cake - very delicious, divide and eat nowSweet potato chocolate cupcake - reminiscent of red velvet, outstanding - we ate it that very second and watched to make sure the cupcake was cut evenly.I plan on returning when I am in Beverly for book club and buying cakes and cupcakes  Then I will go home and hide the chocolate cupcake just for me!

46.description: The best sweet potato pie ever!  Reminded me of the delicious sweet potato pies from my beloved South and by South I mean Georgia, not Orland Park.  What I love about this place, other than the people that own it/work here is the high quality service and super fresh ingredients.  Everything I tasted was made with sooo much love!  I hate places that over spice the hell out of sweet potato pie, making it taste the same as pumpkin pie!  However, this place does it right each and every time!  Sweet potato pie should be warm, comforting and simple and here it's perfect, WOW!  My fave is the sweet potato pie with the honey cream cheese, totally orgasmic!  Everything they have is ridiculously delicious, so come on by.  Your mouth, tummy and soul will thank you!!!

1.description: I'm SOOO happy we found Jimmy Jam Sweet Potato Pies via Yelp.. There IS truth in advertising. My sister and I stopped by last Saturday afternoon to pick up Sweet Potato pies to take to our separate homes for dessert. Love the relaxed vibe here. As we walked in we were warmly greeted by the proprietor Harold and offered menus...also taking the time to discuss options and recommend the LOADED sweet potato. BTW, there is a display case near the counter with a nice variety of fresh slices of pie packaged to go. They all looked SO delicious we ended up buying 3 whole pies 1 Honey Cream Cheese and 2 Sweet Potato pies, a slice of Praline Pecan pie and 1 cupcake to take home. There is still MUCH more deliciousness to try in the future. Yummm! You MUST come and check out the savory yet naturally sweet and wonderfully seasoned "LOADED Sweet Potato with chicken" OMG..DeLish!! We ordered 4 to go...hot, fresh and the portions are VERY generous. Dinner with family at home was fabulous. And the pies were divine. Great food, Great service, Great value, you can't go wrong. We will return to try the various other sweet and savory menu items.. including "Sweet Potato ice cream ." You can tell when someone loves what they do. Flavor, flavor, flavor!  Jimmy Jamm Sweet Potato Pies is an ammmazing culinary breath of fresh air!

55.description: Sweet potato pie?   Yes, please.    This sweet potato pie was as good as I expected and the honey topping made it even better.    Since everyone seemed to be raving about the sweet potato ice cream I begrudgingly tried it.   To my surprise, it was delicious, absolutely delicious.   They also were handing out samples of their waffles which were also incredible.   This place does justice to the sweet potato!   We will be back

9.description: Don't let the digs fool you, this food is on point!At the persistent insistence of my better half, AKA The Ball, I hiked 90 minutes through Friday night rush hour to try this little south side gem.  Walking in, at first, I was ready to turn around based on décor alone but figuring we had nothing to lose, we loaded up on some single serving desserts all made with some sort of sweet potato from this eclectic little specialty shop in Beverly.  I am not what one might call, a "dessert kinda guy". I usually eat a few bites and call it a day. I devoured all of these sweet potato slices of heaven like they were my last meal and was sad to see the end of each. It was the perfect balance of texture with a perfect sweet/salty crust. You will note I am not picking out any specific items, it's because they were all ridiculously good. (Although my favorite was the cheesecake if you really must know) I am simply amazed to like this place as much as I do because I am not a sweet potato fan, or a dessert fan...yet I drooled over each of these treats like a dog with a T-bone.I am oh so going back for one of those baked sweet potatoes soon. So to sum it up for those of you not quite paying attention up to this point: So, It's not often I dig out that 5th star, and I certainly don't offer it to places with "falling down strip mall" décor, but wow was this food good.This place rates 5 stars on food quality alone, despite its terrible décor, limited menu from items which I traditionally do not like, and is worth even Friday night traffic hell to visit...think on it as you plan your trip to Beverly.

26.description: Was taken care of by Pastry Chef, Cedric ...super friendly, funny, helpful. We talked about his former blue hair, my purple peek-a-boos, rescuing animals and before ya knew it, we had the phones out and were  braggin' on our pitbulls while I was waiting on my goodies. . Was given a complimentary tasting of their  dairy-free sweet potato ice cream. Soooo good. I'd kill for a sugar-free version. Argh!  They DO have sugar-free pie slices though. Oh, so divine! Oodles of cakes, pies and yummies to choose from. You can also dine in and enjoy sweet potato waffles and fried chicken or their heavenly sweet potato fries. Snagged a hearty loaf of bread for making some killer sammies.Sweet potato lovers, Jimmy Jamm's is a dream. I'll be hitting them up again...and again.

25.description: Their ice cream is one of the best I've ever had.

12.description: I wish that I had thought of this super clever name for a store and even more, I wish it had been around when I was little and we had pretty boring sweet potatoes on holidays.  Anything made with sweet potatoes is for sale here and I mean anything.  Plus, the man who worked here was so helpful, friendly and kind that I just kept putting more things on the counter.  He looked at my pile, looked at the clock and noted that it was 5:45.  He predicted that I would taste them all and have time to be back before they closed at 7:00.  He was such a fun guy, told us about them being on TV and just made it a pleasure to shop here.My husband and I spread them all out and tried a tiny sliver of each one.  We then decided if it was an eat now, eat later or pitch.  Here are our results.Sweet potato Cheesecake - pitch (we are not big Cheese cake people.  I may have gotten over excited while buying.)Sweet potato pie - good, save to eat for laterSweet potato pie with cream cheese frosting - very good, save to eat for laterSweet potato cake - delicious, split and eat nowSweet potato cup cake - very delicious, divide and eat nowSweet potato chocolate cupcake - reminiscent of red velvet, outstanding - we ate it that very second and watched to make sure the cupcake was cut evenly.I plan on returning when I am in Beverly for book club and buying cakes and cupcakes  Then I will go home and hide the chocolate cupcake just for me!

59.description: i wish this wasn't so far from me.. but i have a friend living in the area.. so i think i will be asking her to stop for me =)first the owner is awesome.. everyone is so nice and friendly.i tried the sweet potato ice cream. which also happens to be vegan, which i'm not but know a few that are.. it's really good, especially for not having dairy.. it still maintains some yummy creaminess.I then tried a cupcake with the banana rum honey cream cheese topping.....holy jesus!!! probably the best cupcake i've ever had.. and i must say that cupcakes are kinda my thing.. and the price is awesome and not overpriced like most of the fancy cupcake spots!

21.description: This place is outstanding, I didn't know you can make so many delicious things with a sweet potato. My friend and I checked it out, I had the loaded baked sweet potato and she had the turkey sandwich on sweet potato bread. It was the best sweet potato I ever had, the workers were very friendly & it made me feel like I was in North Carolina with the southern hospitality. I would definitely go there again. I want to try their sweet potato cupcakes, and the pie with the cream cheese.

17.description: Sweet potatoes, sweet potatoes, everywhere.  If you're a fan of em, and we are,  you need to make it here sometime.  It was a little out of the way, but I was in the "ballpark" and swung by, and picked up a sweet potato pie for $12, and a sweet potato waffle plus fried chicken for $8.99.  The latter has been offered for 2 months, and comes with 4 chicken wings.  The pie was very fresh, sweet and cinnamon-y.  The waffle and fried chicken combo was a novelty and it was good, after sitting for an hour drive.I met Harold, who is a co-owner, and Jimmy's husband.  Very friendly guy, and he offered a free sampling of their SP ice cream, as well as their honey cream cheese and rum raisin toppings.  All very nice.  The toppings run $4 additional per pie.  if it weren't such a trip back to Naperville, I'd bring home some of the ice cream.  They've been there for 3 years, and also have SP cupcakes, breads, pastries, and sandwiches with SP bread.  Will be back again sometime when in the ballpark.

10.description: I had the sweet potato pie and cake. The cake was good, but the pie took it all the way home for me. I will definitely be back to taste the ice cream and cheese cake. I can't get enough of that pie with the honey cream cheese topping.

5.description: This place has all types of sweet potato goodness in almost every form imaginable. I enjoyed a slice of the traditional sweet potato pie and the cream cheese and sweet potato pie. Unfortunately, they were out of the sweet potato cobbler, but I will be back to try it. Upon entering this establishment, we were greeted with big smiles and open arms.

3.description: Very tasty sweet potato pie and just as tasty loaded sweet potato. The air conditioning was out the day I was there (and it was hot), but the food was good enough to make up for it.How is it that fries made from regular potatoes are common, but sweet potato fries and baked sweet potatoes are less common? These things are delicious.

35.description: I was in the area  last Friday and remembered  that I had been wanting to try this bakery out for quite some time. I decided to get two slices of sweet potato pie: one with a honey cream cheese topping and the other praline.The praline was a bit too sweet for my liking but okay nonetheless. I enjoyed the honey cream cheese topping. The proprietor asked if it was  my first visit  and when I told him that it was, he welcomed and  thanked me for coming and gave me a a sample of the sweet potato ice cream. It's  dairy free which is an added bonus for me because I don't  tolerate dairy well. It was soooooooooooooooooooooo delicious. I had a good experience here: the people were nice and the food is good. They also make sandwiches on sweet potato bread which I can't wait to try! Stop by you won't be disappointed

19.description: I came to update my review. Why, you might ask, did I come back to update my already-glowing aforementioned review? Because the best just got better, straight up.So. I was sold on the dairy free sweet potato ice cream at the start, yes. This remains a constant truth even now. But not being a tremendous fan of sweet potatoes (I enjoy them, but I am--or was--hardly what one would call obsessed with the sweet tots), I figured it'd be a great summer stop, but nothing more. I was wrong, you guys. I was very, very wrong.A month (or so) ago, my husband wanted to try the "loaded sweet potato with chicken", so I decided I'd grab a plain sweet potato with a little brown sugar on the side. Suffice to say, we'd probably eat there every day if humanly possible. No, really. It was THAT incredible.I figured a plain sweet potato would curb my hunger but otherwise be...boring. This place makes sweet potatoes so good, so tender, so creamy that with the hint of brown sugar, I thought I might've died and went to food heaven. Oh, and the size of the sweet potatoes? Giant. No, really. They are enormous. And they are luscious beyond words.My husband is head over heels with the loaded sweet potatoey goodness. For one, it's absolutely a dish worth sharing (if you both consume meat and dairy, that is) or at the very least, it will serve you well for two separate meals. He's been meaning to try both the sweet potato stew and the steak sandwich on sweet potato bread, but he hasn't been able to let go of this loaded sweet potato desires. That says something right there, no?Anyway, go, go, go, GO to Jimmy Jamm's as soon as you possibly can. Maybe sooner, even. Preferably now. Yep, now would be the best. You can thank me later. :)

28.description: My wife & I recently stopped by Jimmy Jamm's for some dessert. At first, we were like a kid in a candy store unsure of what to try?  L  o  n  g  story short, we tried the Sweet potato pie w/cream cheese & Sweet potato pie w/pecans & a sugary praline topping!   We Njoyed the sweet potato pie w/cream cheese best. As far as the other one, lets just say if U R diabetic it should come w/a warning label on SUGAR!!!

45.description: This place is as good as it gets and I mean tha!.  I was actually looking for a bakery that makes sweet potato tartlets, so I googled and stumbled upon Jimmy Jamm's Sweet Potato Pies.  I called and spoke to "Richard", I believe that was his name.  Although they did not have the tartlets at the time, he recommended the sweet potato cupcakes.  I told him to put 20 to the side and I'd be there in an hour to pick them up.  When I got there, boy was I pleasantly surprised!  Not only were the cupcakes tasty, but he let me try the sweet potato pie with the homeade honeycreme icing and the sweet potato ice cream...what a treat!  They has an array of sweet potato products that sure to convert any non-sweet-potato-pie-eater.The staff was super nice and went out of their way to accomodate me.  I felt as I was talking to family.  I am an event planner and will most definately purchase pies and treats for dinner parties, holidays, picnics and special events.  I'm a customer for life!

33.description: 3.5 stars!Yelpers, you have done it again for me! I was randomly looking for a dessert place after dinner, and saw that Jimmy Jamm had great reviews (plus I wanted to see just how many things can be made out of sweet potatoes), so I decided to brave the elements of driving down 95th Street (which I feel is one of the worst streets to drive on in America due to always being congested and stupid drivers) to Beverly for a piece of sweet potato pie.The establishment is small, but there are places to sit and dine in. At the counter, I noticed there were few items in the display case--they were nearly sold out of everything!!! One of the employees told me that they were completely sold out of whole pies (I am sure it was due to Thanksgiving this week), and all they had left pastry-wise was in the display case. Luckily they had pie slices, but I also noticed a sweet potato cupcake with the honey cream frosting, and sweet potato cookies. Note: if you're on a diabetic diet, they also have sugar-free options.I was given a sample of the dairy free ice cream. It was cramaztastic (crazy/amazing/fantastic)!!! So fresh and very tasty, and I couldn't believe it was dairy free. I nearly bought a pint but had to stay focused on the pastry I came there for.The sweet potato pie was very good. Not super sweet, but not bland and tasteless. Good size for the price ($3.00)Yelpers, please support this business, especially if you want something different from the usual chocolate desserts. In fact, they also have soup, sandwiches, and loaded baked potatoes. Great people, great business, great quality!Ok, enough with this review. Typing this has encouraged me to head back there for that pint of ice cream. Happy Turkey Day to all of you!

43.description: The sweet potato ice cream is delicious and dairy free!

2.description: I had been riding past this place for years and finally went in. It was empty but the older guy who was the nice and offered me samples of each sweet potato item. He cooked the food right in front of me and assured me that I would be back! They took the sweet potato waffle and fried chicken off the menu so sadly I won't be back. But the food was good and customer service was excellent.

18.description: Well, they only have one vegan item on the menu: sweet potato ice cream.  But it's amazing.Imagine a sweet potato pie. Now turn it into a soft-serve ice cream frozen yogurt thing, and you've got Jimmy Jamm's sweet potato ice cream. Creamy, cold, cinnamon-y clove goodness! And you get a giant cone for about $2.00.I don't go to 95th very often, but on a 90 degree day, it might just be worth the trip.

41.description: My cousin mentioned on facebook that he just had the best pie of his life. So being the growing foodie that I am, I had to ask from where. So as soon as I had the chance I wanted to see what the fuss was all about. I had passed the place many times, but never stopped. Well I must of had the "I'm new" look because the guy behind the counter began to explain what is what and then gave me a sample of the sweet potato ice cream. Now why did he do that?! Just writing this makes me want to run and get some. It was beyond good it was GMG GOOD. I like sweet potatoes but never thought about ice cream it was the best ever. I also got two slices of pie one plain and one with nuts and frosting along with a nice big cup of the cream. This place is a gem with goodies and great service. Will be back like soon!

52.description: I had the chicken and sweet potato waffle special for lunch today and it was amazing.  The sweet potato waffle was sweet and moist and complemented the crunchy, spicy fried chicken perfectly.  By the way, I shared this with my sister and half an order was plenty for a filling lunch.Harold is a wonderful host.  He really goes out of his way to make you feel welcome.I live pretty far from Jimmy Jamm's unfortunately, but I intend on going back as soon as I can!

50.description: If you're a fan of the sweet potato in all its spiritually-awakening forms, a trip to Jimmy Jamm is your Wailing Wall and your Mecca, and your Taj Mahal, all rolled into one (one sweet potato cake roll, perhaps?). During my visit today, I sampled the non-dairy sweet potato ice cream (smooth and spicy) and the cake rolls (downright sinful). I couldn't resist purchasing some sweet potato cupcakes, a cake roll, and a couple of pieces of sweet potato pie: one regular... divine simplicity, and one rum banana with cream cheese honey on top, that one tasted like sweet potato nirvana to me.If you're in the mood for something more substantial, there is a small menu with some delectable-sounding entrees: a loaded baked sweet potato big enough to sink a small boat, a couple of sandwiches, fried chicken and sweet potato waffles (!), etc. I'm definitely coming back for the sweet potato and waffles! There is also a small dining room to enjoy whatever sweet potato delight you've chosen from the menu. And you'd better sit down, otherwise you might faint from sweet potato-induced spiritual overload.A visit to Jimmy Jamm should be required for every budding baker, restaurateur. The two gentlemen behind the counter are passionate about what they do. They're eager to give out samples, talk about what they do, talk about the family history of the business. If every small, independent bakery and restaurant was as good as Jimmy Jamm, we'd surely be living in heaven. We're not that lucky, but I definitely achieved sweet potato nirvana today. Buddha would be jealous.

4.description: Restaurant not really sit-in style place, it's clean but they definitely need to update look in front of house for it to be on 95th street. They do have variety of food choices allude with sweet potatoe my favorite . The method of making that involves microwave time, is only thing I don't like...they should have potatoes baking in oven and then put it together

6.description: SOLD. My last visit during closing hours left a smidge left to be desired for that remaining 5th star. After this visit, I dumped out all the stars I had.Came in with my parents and purchased $50+ worth of food and ice cream. When we walked in we were warmly greeted and given some dairy-free sweet potato ice cream to try. Yum! The man cooking our food was hilarious and kept the conversation going the entire time we waited. Everything is cooked to order and delicious!

22.description: I believe this Pie Shop was voted for one of the best Sweet Potato Pies in the nation!  And when you try a slice, you will realize why.  It has incredible flavors that I would never have thought sweet potato pie could taste like.  It is one of those pies that keeps calling your name... and sooner rather than later, you have eaten two or even three slices.  And surprisingly, they make amazing food too!  Their sweet potato theme is carried on among all their menu items and it definitely shines in some more than others. But whatever you order, you will not be disappointed.

15.description: Delectable pies and treats! A friend of mine loves sweet potato pies, and I wanted to buy her one for a special gift. So I Googled "sweet potato pies Chicago" and the top hit was Jimmy Jamm Sweet Potato Pies bakery. After tasting their pies, it's no surprise they're number one. I purchased the famed honey cream cheese sweet potato pie for my friend, and the sweet potato bread pudding and banana rum cream cheese sweet potato pie for myself. The flavors are so rich and authentic! For instance, the banana rum actually tastes like banana rum (not some artificial flavoring pre-packaged concoction). The banana flavor is a very interesting twist on a classic. Although both tasty, I'd recommend the honey sweet potato pie over the banana rum, but you can't go wrong with either! Jimmy Jamm, you should start selling your pies at other Chicago stores like Whole Foods or other grocery markets! 95th Street is a bit far for non-southsiders. But totally worth the journey though.

57.description: I don't even like yams, but damn they can prep a sweet tater!I can't wait to get a kick ass cake for my brother's b-day from here because he'll flip.  You don't even have to like sweet potatoes to appreciate the creative recipes and awesome flavors that you'll find here.  This is totally a hidden gem, thanks Yelpers!!  I'll update after I get ahold of the aforementioned b-day-shindig-flavortastic cake.

20.description: Even after a satisfying dinner I had pie on the brain.  My tummy always saves room for a little sumpin sumpin.  I've had this place bookmarked for a while and we were finally in the neighborhood.I was welcomed, by who I can only guess was Harold the owner, with a cheerful greeting and asking if I had been in before.  To my "No" reply, I was given a sample of their sweet potato dairy free ice cream.  No words can describe how utterly creamy, sweet and amazing it was.  I ended up getting two desserts to-go to share with the hubby.  A giant slab of sweet potato cobble and fat piece of rum banana sweet potato pie.The cobbler was good, would have been phenomenal if I could have had the foresight to heat it up before pigging out.  So sweet and the spices were amazing.  Then there was the rum banana sweet potato pie, talk about earth shattering.  So sweet, so rich, so creamy...O.o.mg.  If I didn't believe in being able to taste "love" in food before, I believe it now.  They were both MADE with lots of lovin'.

36.description: I went to Jimmy Jamm's for the first time Thursday and I was impressed. When you walk in, there is someone to greet you and offer you a sample. I sampled the dairy-free ice cream. Delicious! I brought home a slice of the honey cream cheese sweet potato pie and the sweet potato cake. Both were very tasty. I definitely plan to try a few more of there items, especially the steak sandwich. I LOVE sweet potatoes so they will see me whenever I'm in the area.

14.description: I was so excited to try this place because I'd heard great things about it. I was given a sample of the ice cream and it was tasty but I settled on the plain sweet potato pie (I wanted to start simple).  To my disappointment, it was just ok. Actually it was too sweet, like caramelized syrup sweet. I only made it through a couple of bites. I gave the rest to a relative who also thought it too sweet. However, the service was great (the reason for two stars)! I felt like I was talking to family as the many options were explained to me. I read the yelp reviews after my visit and it seems like the food choices amd non pie sweets seem are favorites. Since my fellow yelpers have rarely steered me wrong and I'm a sucker for good service,  I will definitely return.

1.description: This place f***** ing sucks!!!! Three drinks all flat. The waitress knew the Pepsi was flat and still let me order it. 45 mins for stuffed pizza ... Lol try 1.5 hrs for the pizza. Literally got full off the flat a$$ drinks.Waiting on the pizza 3 other couples came in ate and left. After the first hr waitress comes to table talking bout the messed up the pizza. I ordered a damn cheese pizza. Worst service ever!!!!

9.description: Ashley was great! The food was amazing! Took a bit long for us to be served, but ashley was very attentive and super nice!

29.description: My induction to the real Chicago deep dish pizza. Having lived up in NorCal and having Zachary's in Berkeley/Oakland  for years, I can now say I can tell the subtle differences.  Zach's is still very much a Chicago style pizza but there are some CA elements to it. The sauce is sweeter and the crust more buttery, with the spinach and mushroom being the staple.
