While at Giordano's the sauce was more savory and the crust a bit drier with a sausage, mushroom, and peppers, being the pride and joy. Even though they're similar, they're still worlds apart and I love them both. We came here for a post wedding rehearsal lunch and ordered pretty much every special pizza listed on the menu. Not one of those pies went undevoured. As an absolute pizza lover I can now proudly add Giordano's to the pizza quiver.

23.description: I'm done. It's official. The box was leaky when it arrived lukewarm (not hot) and  judging by the look of it,  the pizza may have been turned upside down because some of the cheese and sauce were on top of the inside of the leaky pizza box. So I shelled out 41 dollars for leaky, partially topped, warm, pizza. Thanks.

5.description: Once again this place never dissapoints. Best pizza I ever tasted. We ordered the original with spinach and The BBQ chicken.  #foodporn to the extreme.

25.description: Haha..I gotta laugh at the 2 reviewers from CALIFORNIA rating the famous Giordanos as crap..and one even saying PIZZA HUT was better! LOL! California trying to rate pizza and beef sandwiches is HILARIOUS! My ex sister inlaw who grew up in Chicago and now lives in Cali even says these people wouldnt know a real pizza and beef  if their life depended on it.Anyway...inane reviews aside, I had no idea this location has been around for years, I just recently got a flyer from them and they deliver to my house...Gios DELIVERING TO ME???? YAY!!!!! I tried them twice so far and their pizza is just as good as the one on 63rd by Midway airport..mind you if you have them deliver, the dudes who do are not too bright. One time I ordered 2 ZAs and the guy left one in the car...another time, one guy left my sammy in the car..not too bright..also looked like they were on parole...lol...hey, its 96th & Western..someones gotta deliver the pie..

12.description: I was doing some shopping in the area with my friend and sister.  We decided to do lunch but didn't know where. Initially, I would jump at the chance to go to Giordano's but I didn't like this location. It had been years since I'd been here.  My friend assured me that it had changed.Well, she was right. We preordered 45 minutes before going in to be seated.And if you don't know to pre order pizza in Chicago, shame on you.The pizza came out buttery and delicious. It tasted like it did many moons ago, when I was a teenager.  We also had the Parmesan fries, which were pretty tasty.  The service was great. It was a young lady who actually had the customer service sensibilities of an experienced waitress.   It was very enjoyable.

21.description: 2.5 hours and counting...for a pizza and salad!!! $50. These guys need to be better than this.  This is not acceptable. Driver calls me to tell me he's at the wrong address and Ill have to call the store to figure it out.  The store manager tells me he'll have to make me a new pizza because he can't deliver a cold pizza. Meanwhile, we have a house full of starving kids!  He promised the NEW delivery a 1/2 hour later. Well, now its a hour later and it still not here!

16.description: Ordered on a Tuesday at 8:30 P.M. One hour and forty-five minutes for our pizza to be delivered, and we had thin crust! The pizza was terrible!!!!! The cheese sticks were worse!! Wasted $47...should have tossed a frozen pizza in the oven. Would have been done faster and tasted better!! Don't waste your hard earned money! Learned my lesson...no more ordering pizza on a Tuesday when all the good pizza places are closed!!

17.description: Awful! This location provided my family and I with less than quality food three dinners in a row. This last trip, 10/13/14,has put the nail in the coffin. The deep dish pizza was extremely soggy and the boneless buffalo wings were so  overcooked that there was no chicken. Last visit!

10.description: Don't waste your time. Terrible customer service and unprofessional! If you would not mind waiting 30 mins for your waitress to even greet your table then you'll love this place. No high chairs for children.

11.description: We placed our delivery order over the phone, I was hung up on twice,  Tasteless spinach pizza, hardly any spinach, too much cheese.  Been ordering pizza from them for years, this is the worst experience ever.  The delivery boy was very nice and courteous, but will never order from them again.

26.description: My cousin took us here because it was supposed to be a very popular place to get the famous deep dish chicago pizza. However I was not impressed... just don't get what the hype is about.

27.description: Eh....not sure what the hype is about deep dish pizza. The crust was bland, the sauce was just soso and I expected more from the sausage, more flavor or something.  Just wasn't memorable enough to entice me to eat another slice. Also had the fried calamari and fried zucchini which was just okay. Their water tasted like crappy tap water which it probably was, not even lemon wedge would have helped, it was worse than LA's finest, come on now.

0.description: I don't eat pork so I'm familiar with the turkey alternatives in the area (Home Run Inn, Chuck's, Reggio's).  This is the best by far!  I phoned in a chicken sausage & spinach thin crust with extra sauce.  Pick up was uneventful and the pizza was delicious.  I'm annoyed I haven't been ordering from here before now.

20.description: I love Giordano's while my parents think it's too much. I love the crust and even though I'm lactose intolerant, the amount of cheese on their pies do nothing to my stomach. #winning... I mostly order take out from this location since it's much quicker to drive here and back versus waiting at home for an hour or two. I've never had bad customer service or an incorrect order.

19.description: I love Giordano's while my parents think it's too much. I love the crust and even though I'm lactose intolerant, the amount of cheese on their pies do nothing to my stomach. #winning... I mostly order take out from this location since it's much quicker to drive here and back versus waiting at home for an hour or two. I've never had bad customer service or an incorrect order.

2.description: By far, the worst customer service experience of my life! I will never dine here again! Don't get me wrong, the deep dish pizza that we ordered was good (just as good as any other Giordano's restaurant). The wait staff was lousy, nonetheless. I had to ask my waitress to refill my drink three times before she brought my first refill. When it came time for the check, I gave the waitress a Giordano's gift card and told her to put the rest on my credit card, so she took both cards. She gave me a receipt, which I signed and gave back. Then, she tells me that she needs her manager to input the gift card, at which point I should have just left since I had already paid my bill in its entirety how it was presented to me. However, the manager asked for my credit card again, and I complied. I thought he was just going to verify the signature on the back of my card, but what he did was swipe my card again. He then gives me a new receipt with a higher amount and no explanation. So, being a careful and conscious consumer using a credit card, of course I wanted to know why there was a difference in the amount. The manager started stuttering while he tried to explain (with a very heavy foreign accent) and from what I could understand of him, the waitress put in the wrong amount when closing out my bill. I would've had no complaints if the waitress or even the manager would have admitted the error and informed me that there was going to be a change in the bill amount due to said error instead of swiping my card again without my permission, however that didn't happen. I understand that everybody makes mistakes; adding and subtracting numbers was obviously not this particular waitress' strong point, but if she would have admitted her error instead of trying to hide it, things would have gone a lot smoother. (By the way, no one from the restaurant's staff ever apologized for the inconvenience, even though the mistake was made by one of the restaurant's employees.) At first, I refused to pay the difference because I was given a receipt with one price, which I paid with my credit card, and then the manager increased the amount on my bill without explaining, admitting, or even apologizing for the waitress' error! I checked my bank account using a mobile banking app, and of course the last two transactions were the two separate charges from this restaurant for the two different amounts! I asked the manager to cancel both transactions and I would pay cash, which he refused to do. I asked him to call the restaurant owner because I was sure he would resolve the issue. I WAS WRONG! He failed to ensure repeat business, lost a loyal customer and provided very poor customer service. I told him I would pay the difference even though it was not my error, but I would never come back to that restaurant. And his reply was, "Good, because we don't want customers like you!" Again, I got no apology for the inconvenience by either the restaurant staff or owner. I've worked in customer service a very long time; I know there are ways to talk to customers in cases like this and then there's unacceptable, rude behavior toward customers. This restaurant's staff (including the owner) exhibited the latter. I would encourage anyone who dines here, to inspect their receipts very well before paying. This restaurant's employees are con-artists, especially the restaurant manager, and they are exceedingly unprofessional, including the restaurant owner! In closing, I just want to send a message to Giordano's. If your employees make a mistake with your customers, it's okay! Just own up to it and apologize to your customers. That's all we ask for.

18.description: Being the poor, working, student that I am, I really can't afford to shell out extra $$$ for pizza. However, once in a while I like to eat out. I've eaten Giordano's since I was in high school, but they've definitely changed. 2 stars because no line and I got my food right away. Once I got it, feeling the box I could tell it wasn't hot, but whatever. The spinach was rubbery, and the edges of the pizza had no cheese, which I find odd considering that's the main ingredient. Like, why are you charging 20+ for pizza that isn't made right and is not hot. Disappointed.

13.description: This is a nice place--I mean, the restaurant is tastefully furnished, and I wish more Beverly people would go here. The take-out is excellent, as Giordano's always is.

4.description: I have ordered food from this place online about 10 times. Nine of the times there was no problem the 10th however. I'm waiting for the food, it's about an hour late. I call and ask about my order. The woman asks for my address. I give her the info and she tells me I'm not in the system. I ask her to check my confirmation number. She flat out refuses telling me if my addresses in the system my order isn't in the system. So she refers me to the manager. The manager comes on the line and asked for my address, he checks it and my address is not in the system.I ask him to check my confirmation number he refuses. I tell him I've already paid and I want my money back. He tells me to shut the f**k up, and hangs up on me. So I go into the restaurant, and the manager takes my confirmation number and looks it up. Two minutes later he comes back, someone pulled my order and it was on the counter getting cold. Had they checked my confirmation number all of that would have been avoided. Months later I order again for the 11th time. Food is delivered, cold. The delivery driver, doesn't even have the food in an insulated bag.

24.description: This is not pizza. They don't give u anything but sauce and cheese !!! I haven't ordered from here in over a month because I've been so disappointed. $34 for a pizza and all you get is sauce and cheese in a deep dish

6.description: I have been at this location before and very happy with the service. Also I have had my food delivered from this location. Very happy!!!

22.description: The management at this location is sucks.  I am a long time customer both take out and dine in.  I was sitting at a table by the window before rush hour.  The manager came and asked me to move to the middle because he wanted that table for a party of four.  I was so offended that I will not be returning.  You should treat all money as good money or it will go elsewhere.

15.description: I wish I could try the food to find out if, in fact, Chicago has better pizza than my hometown, New York.  Well, they refused to serve us, even to go, when we arrived 30 minutes before closing.  So, no thanks.  No business from me ever.

7.description: This Giordano s S. Beverly location has Great Pizza and timely delivery service. THANKS

8.description: Gave me the wrong pizza drove all the way home came back and only offered me my money back

3.description: Service - 5 STARS!! That goes for Erin especially but also the woman at the front as well as the cooks!The toasted Raviolis were excellent. The Family Ceasar salad was more than abundant as well as delicious.The deep dish Chicago style Pizza though great, is still not as amazing as nor equal in quality to New York Pizza. Though if I was ever in Chicago I would gladly return not only to Giordanos but to this Beverly location. Wonderful first impression and experience.Thank you Erin & everyone here.

14.description: Food was good. Atmosphere sucks kind of tiny, FYI BYOB, even though their website has a beer/ alcohol menu. I recommend delivery. Service is decent.

3.description: Over the years I've been here several times,  and I don't think they have ever gotten my order right.  It's almost like they try to screw up. Morons work here.

1.description: Slow, slow and slow.  Every time I visit this store it takes a total of 15mn to get a sandwich.  This has happened three times in a row.  I realize it is busy, but 15mn.  I can go to Top Notch and get quicker service.

2.description: You can find better food service in a war lord-controlled prison camp in Somalia.After two years of living in Beverly I can say with confidence that Wendy's on Western Ave is consistently awful in both their command of the English language and order accuracy.

5.description: Typical Wendy's food-wise. Good food, but bad service. Employees are usually rude, and food takes an unusually long time for a fast food establishment. Who doesn't love a Junior Bacon Cheeseburger?

6.description: Fresh food. One time had a bad interaction with drivethrough person but overall its good

7.description: Eww...this place reminds me of a haunted house. If you're thinking of ordering things on the main menu go there early because it's gone and the chef is lazy to make more. The service is retardedly slow!

8.description: There's a fairly high turnover rate at this Wendy's as with any South Side restaurant, so I'm not sure that I can accurately comment on the "typical" speed of service.  I would lean toward saying that it's usually slow.  Also, they often run out of the best items - chicken nuggets, sweet and sour sauce, and frosties.  Fortunately for them, Wendy's is a great fast food restaurant and probably won't be phased out for a long time.

0.description: Come here on a Tuesday or Thursday evening.  That's when you'll find Daequan working his magic on the fry machine.Mad props to you, Silky D!

4.description: I'll probably crave Wendy's less after moving out here since this is the closest one. I seem to receive the wrong stuff every time I order. I don't think "large orange Fanta" sounds anything like "medium Coke". But that's what I got stuck with on my last visit. If you enjoy incompetent employees with bad attitudes, this is your place. I'll pass.

29.description: I absolutely love Calabria!! It's so good that I'm willing to drive from the nasty suburb of Naperville to here (with gas at $4 a gallon) just to get a sandwich. To me, that's devotion. I like to play it old school, no hot pressed sandwiches for me. I went with the Italian sandwich and a cup of Shrimp Bisque. The soup was quite tasty and I don't think I came up for air at all. I kept wanting to eat it, it was that good. The Italian sub was excellent! All the flavors of the Italian meats, cheeses and spices literally melts in your mouth. I've really never had a sandwich that good before Calabria. And yes I'll say it...definitely meat-gasm for sure. Nothing beats a freshly made deli sandwich. You just don't get those flavors anywhere else, especially from a cheap chain sub shop.Love, love the place. It's definitely a place to make a special trip just to enjoy one of their sandwiches. Totally worth it!

23.description: Pizza set ups are good. Beef sandwiches are great, with fresh au jus and not the greasy nasty portillo's kind. Chips are great. I've liked all the different sandwiches I've tried and the mini cannoli are tasty as well. They sell THE most delicious pecan cookies ever, which I guess a little Italian lady makes from scratch. I will say though, that I liked the Evergreen location better, as the staff were much friendlier and welcoming. I'm sad that location closed, but the food is the same over here, and overall very good.

8.description: I've passed this place a hundred times, yesterday I finally stopped in for some quick carry out. I ordered the chicken Parmesan and the eggplant Parmesan. Both for about 7 bucks each. It was pretty good. I'll be back, fast service , good food , good prices.

31.description: I know that mostly everyone else had a positive experience but I certainly did NOT. The staff here is awful and rude.  One guy in there was extremely nasty when I wanted to order a sandwich like he didn't want to make it all.  And the food there is not good at all...The bread is hard, the meat was dry and there is no taste to their cooked food at all. I will NEVER go back to this place.

34.description: First, I would like to thank the reviewers that came before me.  You convinced me to come here, and to order the Blue Heaven.The Blue Heaven, it was unbelievable.  The steak was kind of Philly like, in that it was thinly sliced and chopped, slightly charred and crispy, as well as tender.  It had a great beefy flavor, mixed with grilled onions and plenty of blue cheese under it that had melted slightly.I'm not a french fry person, but I finished all of them.  They were steaming hot, very crunchy, and seemed to be slightly battered or something.  They were certainly worth getting, and came with my sandwich.The natural sodas they have come in a myriad flavors, and are made with ingredients like "pure cane sugar" and "cherry juice."  A child could pronounce all of the ingredients.  They don't have fountain pop, but with flavor like Black Cherry, why would you want fountain pop?The deli itself had great prices.  Muenster cheese was $2.99/lb, and off the bone ham was $3.99/lb.Even though we had to pay for metered parking, we'll be back.

16.description: Visited twice now for their breaded eggplant sandwich, and have yet to be disappointed. Plenty big and packed with thinly sliced eggplant. A slight attention to detail during construction would help, as the marinara and cheese have been inconsistent, but it has all the makings of a 5-star meal. Add some hot giardinera, and its a meal fit for a king. Dining in will net you some of their homemade chips, but they're nothing worth waiting for. Grab a sammie and some napkins...you're going to need them.

13.description: Warning! If shopping do not go into Calabria hungry! Every time I go I can not resist all of the wonderful fresh homemade Italian specialties. I love the bruschetta and fresh ricotta in the deli, the fresh bread from Molino and their homemade pasta and soups. I usually get the pizza set ups and stock up on the fresh Romano cheese. Often I do all of this shopping while waiting for a dinner or two to go because I can not wait to go home and cook. What a delicious dilemma to have. Thanks Calabria for being there when I get off the train and have a hungry family to feed!

11.description: Great deli, great food and great people. I've been going to this place since it was in Blue Island and I've never been disappointed!!! They also cater to all events so check them out.

39.description: I love Calabria.  Every one who works there is so nice, the food is prepared quickly, and the prices are good. My favorite sandwich is the Caprese, and I also LOOOOVE the Blue Heaven (although I ask them to go easy on the bleu cheese).  They also have great frozen pastas, and their pizza set-ups are good and cheap (three crispy cheese pizza set-ups for under $10). Their grocery and deli items are good, too. I love their bruschetta, and their breads (pretzel rolls, too!) are fresh and delicious.

37.description: Lasagna was nasty. Beef sandwich was good. Fried were delicious. Tirimisu was probably the best I ever had. I have to come back. I think the lasagna was a huge flop. :(Gotta come back so I can love it like everyone else.

0.description: Great little hidden gem.   Nothing like a fresh Italian deli to hit the spot.Calabria made me a delicious spicy Italian sub with great homemade potato chips.  Parked right in front and had super friendly service.  This is my go to place for lunch when I'm in the area.

38.description: We had them do catering for a party, and also went here to pick up some stuff before a trip to Ravinia.  Here's my impressions:1. Catering: Best in Beverly/MoPo.  We ordered a full tray of lasagna, salad and garlic bread.  The lasagna and salad were absolutely delicious- the garlic bread was too crispy for our tastes. The cost was cheaper than Fox's.  Definite hit. 2. Deli: Also, really really good.  Really affordable as well.3. Service: GREAT to deal with, no attitudes, super-friendly and usually pretty quick. It's a really nice find, and I'm glad they're in the neighborhood!

27.description: I've been eating here since early teens, and I will continue to be a regular customer! Local guys and gals who work there really care about your experience. I love the place, try their Blue Heaven sandwich. You will be sold!

32.description: Very old school Chicago.  Service can be hit or miss-they are a moody group an not overly friendly.   I am usually coming off the train toward closing time and they can be come across as a little grumpy and you can tell they are excited to close up and go home but aren't we all.  It gives it character so I kind of dig the attitude.  None the less they accomodate and the spagetti and meatballs, lasagna, sandwiches and salads are all really good.  I'm a fan.

44.description: It's just my favorite sandwich shop in the whole city because the Blue Heaven is just the best sandwich in the whole city. I always look at the whole menu and am tempted by at least three or four of Calabria's other lovelies, but the Blue Heaven always wins out. But let me just admit this to you - my second choice is the Grilled O'Donnell, a grilled turkey and cheese (mozzarella? provolone?) on flavorful rye. Sometimes, when I'm really hungry, like I was today, I get a sandwich as a side for my other sandwich. And it is nice. For full on pleasures of the carb, they make great curly fries and those freshly fried spiral chips. And their new redesign has really opened up the place a lot. I know where my bread is buttered. Heavily buttered. Mmmm....butter.....

24.description: Visited twice now for their breaded eggplant sandwich, and have yet to be disappointed. Plenty big and packed with thinly sliced eggplant. A slight attention to detail during construction would help, as the marinara and cheese have been inconsistent, but it has all the makings of a 5-star meal. Add some hot giardinera, and its a meal fit for a king. Dining in will net you some of their homemade chips, but they're nothing worth waiting for. Grab a sammie and some napkins...you're going to need them.

7.description: Before commencing my review, I had to say yelp disappointed me by shutting down for maintenance at approximately 1030 hour today.  That was the reason why I couldn't check in or post pictures.  Now back to business, I've regained my faith in Italian food in Chicago so here's another one that I would recommend.  I ordered the Mickey (fried eggplants, marinara sauce, and cheese wrapped in a baguette) and hubby chose the caprese (Mozzarella, tomatoes, and basil in a baguette).  My Mickey was a mischievous boy who really made my hands and mouth messy (lol)!  However, it was quite tasty if you could manage to eat it.  Likewise, the caprese sandwich looked pretty hearty in terms of the amount of mozzarella.  The ingredients were fresh and were made to order.  The menu is pretty extensive.  Other than sandwiches, they have pasta, soups, panini, and antipasti.  We were the only patrons in the house, but the workers were busy working on some catering orders.  That's a shame that the Subway next door still gets business because it's a mockery of Chicago-style Italian sandwiches.  Calabria Imports is way better for sure!  This is located within walking distance from 103rd. St./Beverly Metra station.  The prices are comparable to a "Subway" sandwich that's SO all-American (I guess Americans run on corporations...Well, I thought the founders wanted Capitalism).  If you like the old America, support the local business then.  They also sell some light Italian-brand grocery items and house-made pasta sauce.  The dining area is pretty spacious.  Overall, it's a lovely lunch spot in the neighborhood.

30.description: I had the pizza. I wish I hadn't.

1.description: Wish that I could give this a higher rating. The service was great! Very quick, I did go in about 30 min prior to closing - but got my food to-go. I ordered a Roast Beef sandwich cold with mustard and provolone. It was okay. The bread for the most part was almost too hard to eat. So mostly I picked off the meat and cheese and ate that.I also had their chicken noodle soup. I would have preferred it with out the chicken. It tasted as though it was left over grilled chicken and had an odd flavor. Probably something with the spices. The broth - tasted like straight bullion cubes smell. But wasn't salty. The veggies where great though. Maybe this was because I came in so late, and hope it was. The rest of the deli items looked phenomenal.

9.description: Been going here for awhile and have always liked it but some prices are just a rip off. Do not get the Curley fries which cost 3.99 for about 5 fries. Absolute rip off.. Disappointed being a loyal customer.

26.description: We recently catered two- 3 foot large subs from the 95th street store in Evergreen Park.  They gave us the lettuce and tomato on the side , but only enough for one of the 3 ft. subs  lettuce arrived wilted and brown already and tomatoes were not ripe ...ended up going to Jewel and buying fresh lettuce and tomatoe for sandwiches.  Another time I was there, they again didnt know what they were doing, waited 25 min. for a 2 sandwich carryout (and no one else was in the store.) Lastly, I once catered chicken lemone, and it was just so so. I have not found this worth while at all, wont try it again .

25.description: Go to the deli here about once a week, sometimes more! We often get the coupon for the 3 ft sub in the Beverly Review! Great deal on great subs! They have some of the best macaroni salad on the south side, only once did they switch it up the recipe, but the next time I went it was back to normal. Thank God! I would suggest you get the Italian chicken salad and add it to your spaghetti with marinara or on top of a salad. It will take your spaghetti and salad to a whole new level of deliciousness. The homemade potato chips are also a special treat. Fresh and made to order. For some odd reason I have never really eaten any of their hot sandwiches. After reading all these reviews I am questioning why I have never had the blue heaven before and how fast I can get there to get one!

12.description: Friendly staff, good food, and a nice selection of branded and self-branded Giardiniera sauce, make this the go to place in this area for good Italian American food and provisions. The bakery goods are top notch, and the meatballs were good. But the house branded Giardiniera is some of the best I have ever had. Truly amazing stuff. The girls working here the night we visited sold us some "nut cups" that are made by someones grandma and are yummy and go well with coffee. Just a bunch of friendly people here selling some great food. Excellent place.

21.description: I am handicapped and getting into places and ordering stuff can be a problem  This place is very understanding and cooperative.  I try to order on off hours so I won't disturb the workers there - and - they have been absolute ANGELS!  The food is incredible - their home made potato chips (comes with hot sammies for FREE) are fantastic.  They make spagetti with meat sauce that is TO DIE FOR!   Great Sunday gravy (ragu).  The prices from the deli counter are wonderful - and their home made pecan crescent cookies melt in your mouth.  Italian food from here is a tiny bit of italian heaven!

17.description: Best italian deli around !! Everything is so fresh and home made . Perfect place to just stop in and have a sandwich .

10.description: I treat this deli like a restaurant...because it is a restaurant too. The weekly specials are fantastic! All dishes and sandwiches are great! I highly recommend it for a lunch if you're looking for a relatively quick stop. A good value.

5.description: A nice enough neighborhood sandwich, and Italian market place, which the Chicago has a lot of other examples of out there(i.e. Piatto Pronto, Alpine, Bari, etc). I was starving really badly just before I hit my friend's wedding party last summer, and couldn't wait any longer for a snack to eat after riding the Metra Rock Island train. And of course, preferred an option that wasn't Subway if available, though I know that isn't always possible everywhere. So this ended up being a good bet, with a good enough sandwich.They even had a World Cup 2014 soccer game airing on their TV, which was really cool. Whenever in the area again, I'd definitely come back. Keep in mind they are closed on Sundays and aren't open late, but great option for the Monday-Saturday daytime and early evening hours.

3.description: When we moved to the neighborhood, Calabria was one of the first places we visited, and the first place to really make us feel at home.   The hot sandwiches are excellent--my favorite is the "Blue Heaven", italian beef & blue cheese on garlic bread.  Our kids love their pizza set-ups for fresh, homemade pizza.  Service is great, friendly and fast.  I've had their catering at many events and parties in the neighborhood, and it is always superb and makes the host happy.  You can't go wrong here.

35.description: Calabrias is a great deli, we love getting their pizza setups and sometimes subs. They taste great and are pretty reasonably priced. One summer we even took up their offer in our local paper to do a backyard bbq catered by Calabrias. Everyone enjoyed the food and the chef who grilled for us couldn't have been more friendly. We loved it and it was such a big help! We continue to stop in and pick up some meats and cheeses on a regular basis, we love it!

19.description: Office now located in the city instead of south suburbs so I spent all last week looking for good lunch spots. After reading many reviews I headed to Calabri Imports in Beverly. I got the blue heaven with steak. Great sandwich and handmade fries come with it. I cannot wait to come back and try different sandwiches. Staff is very friendly and the service is quick.

28.description: Yum!  I've been eating here for years!  I grew up in the area and now live 45 minutes away and will still make the commute for one of their eggplant parmesan sandwiches!  The freezer items are great to take with you and the grocery section is truly amazing.  Best Italian place around!!!

45.description: It's like a new restaurant/deli with great food that I already love now. Inside Calabria, there's been a remodel that's made a world of difference. More tables and chairs now throughout the interior since the center aisle of shelves of speciality items, oils, sauces, pastas, etc, have been shelved to a wall to open up the place. What a nice improvement. And best of all, still really good, quick tasty food.

33.description: First off, let me say that I have had almost everything on Calabria's menu at least twice. I live right down the street so naturally I gravitate to this eatery. I have to say that some things on the menu are pretty darn good, like the chicken parm ! But yesterday i ordered the grilled chicken salad at a cost of $ 6.00 and change. It was absolutely inedible! I tried the slices of cucumber and I had to spit them out because they tasted like they were coated in some kind of hand sanitizer., The "grilled" chicken was more like jerky. And to boot, the tomatoes were turning brown. I didn't have the heart to tell the owner, he is a nice fellow. So I just chucked the whole salad in the trash. Word to the wise: skip it ! Go to Subway instead.

43.description: Authentic Italian deli, formerly of the more working class Blue Island neighborhood. High quality domestic and imported Italian staples at reasonable prices.Carried out two sandwiches from their daily lunch specials menu. This menu updates weekly and is posted online, check before going if you're one of those be prepared types."Chicken Fontina" - Crispy chicken on a gourmet wheat bun w/sliced fontina, deli mustard, lettuce, & tomatoes  w/fries. A little heavy on the poupon but tasted great."The Fresh Tomato Panini" - Fresh mozzarella on a 6" pretzel roll w/tomato vineger, red roasted peppers, & fresh basil w/a .33 bag of chips. Loved it. This one was just a little heavier on the balsamic than I care for but it was a fantastic sandwich.Nice families were eating in at the spacious, clean dining area.Enjoyed some great samples of pasta made with Italian sausage, pesto and artichoke, and some locally-made gelato.Friendly service all around. Keep up the good work guys.

2.description: Grabbed a foot long Italian to go with a jar of their homemade Giardiniera.This was the biggest foot long sub I've ever seen.Seemed more like a 15 inch sub.The bread was awesome.Their home made chips are great.Really enjoyed their take home pizza kit.The crust turns out really good.Will probably add spinach next time we make it.

18.description: This used to be a good Italian deli, and in some ways it still is. The lunch meats, cheeses, and breads are good.  However, the formerly good buys of the frozen dinners & soups are no longer. In fact, they have gotten very bad over the last few years.  Portions have been cut back dramatically and quality has suffered. Made to order sandwiches are decent, but the hot soups (much like their frozen counterparts) are not good.  I recently had to toss an $8 frozen soup because it was so bad - no flavor and missing ingredients. And it wasn't the first time I found a soup deficient from its labeled ingredients.  Too much money spent on wasted food. Unfortunately, too big a gamble to go back.

41.description: Calabria is a fantastic Italian Deli in "Downtown Beverly" right off the 103rd St. Metra stop. You can get fresh meats, cheese, bread, and anything you need to cook a great Italian dinner or just order and wait and take it home cooked. They also have prepared dinners frozen to take home alo. You can eat in or take it to go. My favorite is the eggplant parmesan sandwich.  It is excellant! See my blog: beverlymorganpark.net for more

4.description: Calabria's has one of the best if not the best Italian subs in town. I bought one of their sandwich trays for a party of mine, and everybody devoured the sandwiches. They used to have some great pizza puffs too but I'm not sure if they have those anymore. I remember going to Calabria's when they were located on Western Ave. before moving to 103rd and they still have the same great food and service.

6.description: So far I am a fan!  We grabbed take out sandwiches once and they were great.    Last weekend we used their catering to get a couple of subs, pre cut and on trays. They were good - no complaints.    I did however cut what they sent me in half - we were really looking for smaller sized pieces.    (which worked well, because when we got the trays it seemed like a small amount of food.   Cutting them smaller and putting on a nicer tray worked out perfectly.

22.description: Started going here about a year ago for sandwiches which are awesome, but it is now a regular stop.  Won't go anywhere else for deli meat and pizza setups.  Prices are great and the freshness can't be matched at the big grocery stores!

15.description: I feel lucky to have this little gem so close to my house.  We stopped in today and took advantage of their special - buy 2 foot long subs and get one free.  Huge subs, totally delicious, and more than enough for 4 adults.  Staff is also really friendly.  Our toddler was getting antsy waiting for our subs, so the guy behind the counter sliced our daughter a fresh slice of cheese for a little snack.   This place will be a weekly stop-in for us.

20.description: Friendly staff, good food, and a nice selection of branded and self-branded Giardiniera sauce, make this the go to place in this area for good Italian American food and provisions. The bakery goods are top notch, and the meatballs were good. But the house branded Giardiniera is some of the best I have ever had. Truly amazing stuff. The girls working here the night we visited sold us some "nut cups" that are made by someones grandma and are yummy and go well with coffee. Just a bunch of friendly people here selling some great food. Excellent place.

36.description: Pretty good mom and pop deli. I had the chicken parm sandwich, and wish I woulda got it with giardinara.  Pretty reasonably priced, plus, they have black cherry soda, which for some reason, is really difficult to find.

14.description: I have had most things on the menu and I like everything I've had. I usually get the chicken Cesar wrap or buffalo chicken wrap.  The home made chips that come with the wraps/sandwiches are great.

28.description: Mel is the running expert.  He's a hands on owner and does a great job of training his employees.  This guy knows everything about running.   Mel takes the time to fit the person and their running regimen to the shoe.  Every time I drive by the store, I see Mel or one of his employees on the sidewalk out front watching people running back and forth, trying out shoes.

1.description: Amazing shoe store! Great shoes and great customer service. The employees truly care that you have the right shoes.The Fun Runs on Mondays at 6pm are a great way to meet other runners. All levels from walk/run to fast runners. If you aren't a runner, they have a beginner runner program that runs a few times a year. It's an awesome way to get started with a group.

9.description: Excellent running supply store, they have everything you need.  I've bought my daughter all her running supplies here as of late. Training shoes, spikes and racing flats. I highly recommend this place for novice to expert runners. Staff is very helpful and knowledgeable.  Will be back again in a couple of months spending some major cash again.

26.description: It was a bit haul for me to drive (or ride with a friend) to Palos, but not only did I get to share some quality time with a new friend, I found the last place I will EVER buy shoes again.  RUNNING FOR KICKS is an amazing store.  I walked in and was immediately greeted by Gail.  She sat me down, took of my shoes, measured my feet, watched me walk, and fit me with the best pair of running shoes!  We tried 4 or 5 pair out first, running up and down the sidewalk in front of the store.  Gail was just awesome.  The store was celebrating 15 years in business and had coffee, bagels, pizza for lunch.  EVERY.SINGLE.EMPLOYEE I spoke with was helpful.  I could spend hours in this tiny shop looking at everything.  It's covered from top to bottom!  They sell, laces, hats, shorts, compression socks and pants, arm sleeves, bumper stickers, sunglasses, GU, anti-chafing gel, orthotics, bracelets, etc.  I will never go anywhere for shoes again!  Thank you Mel, Happy 15th Anniversary and thanks Gail for my perfect new kicks!

23.description: 10 stars !!!! What else Can be said that hasn't already been said ?!?! Best running store around. Fun runs on Monday , couch to 5k program is FREE !!!!Thank you to everyone one at RFK ... Y'all keep me moving forward .

31.description: This is a great running shoe store.  I would compair it to the old Vertel's (When it was on Wells).  The people seem to know their stuff and the selection is pretty good.   The owner seems to be there every time I've been to the store (which is good) and if you are a joiner they have different running groups.  Overall, this is a great asset to running on the south side.

25.description: The staff is VERY knowledgeable. They will spend as much time as needed to find the perfect shoe for your foot and lifestyle. It doesn't matter if you're a marathon runner or just walk for fun. I also appreciate the fact that Mel supports many different organizations such as Susan G. Komen for the Cure and Team in Training.

10.description: Despite repeated recommendations from friends, I held off going to Running for Kicks because it isn't the closest to my house. what a mistake on my part.I spoke with Colleen when I went to pick up my packet for the Newton Ready to Run and was so impressed I went back. She took the time to talk to me about my running style, analyze my feet, discuss the type of shoes she was bringing out and why she thought they would be good for me. I had originally hoped to buy Newtons (which the store doesn't have yet) and in looking at how my shoes were wearing, Colleen talked to me about my gait and running form giving me excellent tips.I was so impressed with her knowledge and the time she spent with me and I really felt that I bought a pair of shoes that will work.  Best part, I felt comfortable trying these new shoes knowing I could return them if they didn't work for any reason.  I didn't feel I was sold a pair of shoes just to be sold.I will definitely be buying all future running shoes at Running for Kicks and recommending the store to my friends.

21.description: I really appreciate Mel and Running For Kicks. Bought a pair of shoes Monday. Hurt my toe running. Returned them Tuesday. Those were too big. Returned them tonight and got my third pair. Went for a 4 miler tonight and love them!! Thanks Mel. And thanks for being patient and committed to me!

16.description: A very long time ago, I visited a podiatrist regarding some corns on top of a couple toes.  I was told I had hammertoes, but I disagreed because I didn't see a curled toe situation.  Fast forward to today...wanting to have unscathed toes for sandals, I was thinking of seeing a podiatrist again, but I didn't want to spend the $115.00 for the visit, when all I really needed was to be fitted with a correctly sized shoe.  Instead, I asked the office person where the doctor normally sends his patients.  I was told Running for Kicks.  Mike, who was most kind and patient, did not see a hammertoe situation either.   I tried on five different pairs, starting at a 9 M, and I learned that to be sized corrected, it is a very personal, custom situation, which needs to be done by a trained person, not in a doctor's office.  We finally decided on 9.5 W, well built Saucony, instead of my usual 8.5 M that I had been wearing for years from department stores.   So, instead of paying double, (doctor visit and then shoes), I walked out of Running for Kicks with an amazing, light as air pair of everyday shoes that feel like nothing on my feet for $120.00.

17.description: As soon as I wanted to try on a shoe, Mel had 8 other pairs out for me to try before I could sit down and try on the first! Loved that he was clearly intent on me getting into the best possible shoe that I would continue to enjoy long term, not just shove me out the door with the first pair I was sorta ok with. I get the same feeling with everyone else I run into when I go in there. It's pretty cool that they let you "test drive" the shoe before you buy it by taking a light jog in front of the store. Did not like the fit when I got home in one of the pairs of shoes I bought from here once, and returning them for a different pair couldn't have been more easy. This is the kind of business that I want to continue to give my money too, because people like Mel and his team clearly care about the customer over the bottom line, and deserve to stay in business!!

12.description: Both of my brothers and I are runners. We have been coming to Running for Kicks since high school for new shoes! Even after moving to Chicago I make a trek out to the suburbs for new running shoes. Mel and his staff are the absolute best!! The staff are extremely knowledgeable about their shoes and other products and what shoe will work best with your feet. You are always able to test the shoes out on a treadmill or outside before purchasing, which is key for any runner. Associates never try to up sell you with additional products or pressure you into buying new shoes if nothing works out. Overall, extremely satisfied with Running for Kicks.I love the customer service which is the reason why I keep coming back! Two thumbs up in my book.

5.description: I have edited my original review. .The reason  for the edited review is that the owner of this shop is committed to customer service and will do what it takes to make everything right . This shop is a bit out of the way for me but the commitment to customer service that Mel has shown is well worth the few extra miles.  Keep up the great work

11.description: Running for Kicks is awesome!Their selection of shoes was great.  The staff was helpful, knowledgable, and very nice.  They also weren't super pushy which I've felt at a few other running stores.  I actually didn't plan to buy new shoes even though I desparately needed them, but I ended up leaving with a new pair of kicks.They didn't have "my shoe" (the New Balance 880) in my size, but the guy (Regretfully, I didn't get his name.) brought me a Brooks Revennas and told me it was similar.  I was a bit hesitant since my last pair of Brooks (Adrenalines) didn't work out for me so well, but the guy explained to me what made this shoe different from the Adrenalines and assured me the Revennas were more similar to my beloved New Balance.  I tried them on and went from a quick jaunt up and down the sidewalk in front of the store, and was pretty quickly sold.  Plus, I was assured I had 30 days to return the shoes if they didn't work out.I'm hoping to make it out for a couple of their Monday night group runs.  Now that I have new shoes, I really have no excuse not to get out there!

22.description: Wonderful store wonderful staff! I bought my first pair of running shoes from this place a few years ago and those were the best shoes I've ever had! Mel was the one who helped me and I was impressed that he could tell what I needed just by looking at how I stood and walked. I've been to a few other stores that use all types of technology when fitting their customers and have never been as happy with the service and more importantly the shoes that I bought at those establishments.I recently returned to this store to help my dad find a better pair of running shoes and of course to buy myself a new pair as well! The lady that helped him was so kind and patient--my dad asked A LOT of questions. She never made us feel like she was in a hurry even though the store was packed with people. They really take their time with their customers to make sure that they walk or run ;) away with the best equipment possible!  Even if you don't live in the area, this place is worth the drive!

19.description: To anyone who is a serious runner in the south burbs, GO TO THIS STORE. Staff are extremely knowledgable, patient, and helpful. They take the time to assess your specific gait while running and waking and find absolutely the best show tailored for your feet and based on your gait. They also give you advice regarding injury prevention and improving your time. It rocks. Go there even if you're not from the area, totally worth it.

0.description: Amazing shoe store. I had foot surgery last year on both my feet and recently got back into walking and the athletic shoes that I had made my feet so sore after my walks. A few friends of mine recommended I try going to a store where they evaluate my feet as I walked, so I did some research and this was the store I picked. The staff there was so friendly and after I explained my foot problems the gentleman went in the back and picked out 3 pairs of shoes for me. I tried all 3 pairs on and walked down the block and back and picked out the best shoes. I purchased them, walked out of the store with them on, came home and did a 3 mile walk with no foot pain at all. I will definitely be back in 6 months. They have earned my business and I will recommend them to all my friends!!

20.description: Despite repeated recommendations from friends, I held off going to Running for Kicks because it isn't the closest to my house. what a mistake on my part.I spoke with Colleen when I went to pick up my packet for the Newton Ready to Run and was so impressed I went back. She took the time to talk to me about my running style, analyze my feet, discuss the type of shoes she was bringing out and why she thought they would be good for me. I had originally hoped to buy Newtons (which the store doesn't have yet) and in looking at how my shoes were wearing, Colleen talked to me about my gait and running form giving me excellent tips.I was so impressed with her knowledge and the time she spent with me and I really felt that I bought a pair of shoes that will work.  Best part, I felt comfortable trying these new shoes knowing I could return them if they didn't work for any reason.  I didn't feel I was sold a pair of shoes just to be sold.I will definitely be buying all future running shoes at Running for Kicks and recommending the store to my friends.

3.description: My boyfriend and I have shopped here before. Last time we were here was about 2 years ago, and he purchased new shoes while I just hung out. We returned last night with intention of shopping around for new running shoes. We had no plans to purchase shoes, but the experience was very positive and it became apparent that we needed to make a purchase.We were greeted by a very friendly woman whose name I did not get (Blast!). But she had short cropped hair and very athletic long legs. She took a look at both of our shoes and our feet and really tried to find the best fitting shoes.She also took the time to explain them to me and how my patterns of running looked based on the shoe wear. It was delightful to talk with her and she didn't just have the mentality that all she wanted was to sell shoes. She asked if I had goals or if I was going to do any races this year.The shoes I picked out were $110 and Dan's were $115. I know that I could go home and buy them on ebay or amazon for a little cheaper. But this small business took the time to let me try on new shoes and wear them. They gave me personal attention and really listened to me. You don't get that at Dick's Sporting Goods or Amazon.com.We both bought a pair of shoes and couldn't be happier. What a great little local shop that I would recommend to anyone seriously taking up running or training!

33.description: The family has been going to Running For Kicks for years. We started when my daughter who ran track for Queen of Peace told us about it, and have been going back ever since. Mel & the rest of the staff have always been on top of new improvements with all the shoes they carry. As he has run in and helps sponsor numerous runs/marathons he knows of what he/they speak. Excellent place to shop and learn about what's current in running or walking.

2.description: I am a true runner I ran in college, and I really do believe that for the most part you get what you pay for in shoes. Unless you are buying nike, That is usually a hit or miss. And a rule of thumb is any shoe that needs marketing for it probably isnt the best shoe for you.The people her analyze your running gait, etc and really help you choose the best shoe for YOU. They must have a great hiring process because I have been coming here for YEARS and everybody is so nice here and really give you nice tips on running etc.You really need a good shoe every 500 miles so pretty much it is true that if you have foot, knee or back pain, a simple solution might be just to change your shoes.Nonetheless, I love this place. They even have group runs on Monday nights. What store does that?I think the people here are genuine and nice and are really just here to help everyone.They love what they do and are very passionate. What more can I say

34.description: How can I be the first reviewer? This is the best frigging running shoe store in the southlands, and possibly in Chicago. The selection is unbelievable, and the staff are all trained to analyze your gate, detect pronation, and otherwise give very detailed technical advice on running shoes. They carry a good selection of both running shoes and trail runners. If you are a Chicago runner you HAVE to visit this place.

32.description: Four weeks out from my first marathon, I came here with my hair torn out and nearly in tears because my new pair of Brooks were making me blister like crazy and I couldn't run more than 3 miles without peeling the skin off my feet.  They calmed me down, took my Brooks and fitted me with another, much better pair.Mel is always quick to dispense advice when you need it about training, racing, tapering, ANYTHING.  Everyone here is friendly, experienced, and knowledgeable, but not at all judgmental about your level of fitness or running experience.  They just want to get you the best shoes for your feet.

18.description: Mel is the running expert.  He's a hands on owner and does a great job of training his employees.  This guy knows everything about running.   Mel takes the time to fit the person and their running regimen to the shoe.  Every time I drive by the store, I see Mel or one of his employees on the sidewalk out front watching people running back and forth, trying out shoes.

13.description: 10 stars !!!! What else Can be said that hasn't already been said ?!?! Best running store around. Fun runs on Monday , couch to 5k program is FREE !!!!Thank you to everyone one at RFK ... Y'all keep me moving forward .

4.description: Mel is seriously a running shoe genius!!!! I was having problems with my IT band and hamstring... In therapy and everything and he's like your wearing the wrong shoes..: your feet aren't made to be in that shoe and it's pushing your legs out too much... Changed my shoe and the pain is gone!!!!The workouts they have there are great too!!! They always are super inviting and helpful

24.description: Friendly, knowledgeable staff. And they are very supportive of the local running scene - the owner is also the race director for the Southwest Half Marathon. Make sure to stop by for their group run - Mondays at 6pm! Everyone is very friendly and all paces are welcome.

6.description: I've been running for a while - and always gotten "running shoes" from Kohl's or the like. I'm sorry, but shoes really do make a difference when running and after years of my knees aching I finally showed up at Running For Kicks and was ready to pay for a decent pair of real running shoes.I'm a mom, and I rarely get a moment without my two young kids. The first time I went into the store, I had my two little ones along with me. After talking with the gentleman (didn't get his name...) about what kind of running I do, he recommended some shoes and helped me try them on. I got a good fit, was super excited to try them on a run, and off I went.Much to my complete dismay, these shoes did not help me one bit. They were cute lol, I really wanted to like them, but they simply weren't any better than my department store shoes and might have almost been worse! I went back to the store after three runs in them and explained my problem. The lady working the counter didn't even hesitate. She immediately took them back and asked to see me jog a little back and forth in my bare feet. I took a few paces and she recommended a different shoe style. Turns out I roll my right ankle in when I run - who knew!? I tried on a more supportive shoe, she watched me jog around again to see how it changed my stride, and away I went! I LOVE these shoes! No more knee pain, no more sore feet, just happy running! Great customer service! I was so disappointed after the first pair didn't work out, but they took great care of me and it was no trouble at all to swap out the pair for one that worked better for me! Couldn't ask for better care.

27.description: Mel and his team provide expert advice in an extraordinarily friendly way (which is particularly nice for new runners)! Customer service is top-notch--both in the store, and online. I frequently purchase my shoes online (which is super easy) and they arrive to my doorstep within 2 days. Keep it up, Running for Kicks!

15.description: Wonderful store wonderful staff! I bought my first pair of running shoes from this place a few years ago and those were the best shoes I've ever had! Mel was the one who helped me and I was impressed that he could tell what I needed just by looking at how I stood and walked. I've been to a few other stores that use all types of technology when fitting their customers and have never been as happy with the service and more importantly the shoes that I bought at those establishments.I recently returned to this store to help my dad find a better pair of running shoes and of course to buy myself a new pair as well! The lady that helped him was so kind and patient--my dad asked A LOT of questions. She never made us feel like she was in a hurry even though the store was packed with people. They really take their time with their customers to make sure that they walk or run ;) away with the best equipment possible!  Even if you don't live in the area, this place is worth the drive!

7.description: Fantastic experience at running for kicks last night.  My daughter was expertly fitted and we were able to exchange a shoe that didn't work from a previous purchase.  Thank you thank you.

8.description: I recently bought a pair of running shoes from Colleen at Running for Kicks.  She was awesome!  I can't say enough about her knowledge.  What I loved even more is that they didn't try to sell me anything that I didn't' need.  That was key for me.  I will most certainly be back.  Thanks Colleen!!

30.description: Running For Kicks is fantastic!  The staff is friendly, patient, and very knowledgeable.  They will help you find exactly what you are looking for and make sure you leave satisfied.

29.description: The staff at running for kicks are very knowledgeable, and very personable. The staff are seriouse runners. I had mentioned  in January that I was going to run my first 5 K and Nadine (sorry if I spelled your name wrong) got excited and printed out a training calender.  I was excited to let her know I completed my first 5 k.    I was able to try the shoes outside before I bought them.  I would highly recomend running for kicks.

14.description: It was a bit haul for me to drive (or ride with a friend) to Palos, but not only did I get to share some quality time with a new friend, I found the last place I will EVER buy shoes again.  RUNNING FOR KICKS is an amazing store.  I walked in and was immediately greeted by Gail.  She sat me down, took of my shoes, measured my feet, watched me walk, and fit me with the best pair of running shoes!  We tried 4 or 5 pair out first, running up and down the sidewalk in front of the store.  Gail was just awesome.  The store was celebrating 15 years in business and had coffee, bagels, pizza for lunch.  EVERY.SINGLE.EMPLOYEE I spoke with was helpful.  I could spend hours in this tiny shop looking at everything.  It's covered from top to bottom!  They sell, laces, hats, shorts, compression socks and pants, arm sleeves, bumper stickers, sunglasses, GU, anti-chafing gel, orthotics, bracelets, etc.  I will never go anywhere for shoes again!  Thank you Mel, Happy 15th Anniversary and thanks Gail for my perfect new kicks!

12.description: Awesome subs!

3.description: Good sandwiches. The bread is what makes it great. I like the badabing with giardiniera. The Italian beef is ok. I go here from time to time. Good neighborhood joint.

1.description: Tasty subs are here. Yummy, I ordered the 6' tuna sub. Can you say delish, I will definitely be back for more

2.description: Sweet sandwich shop right in my new neighborhood!  Large subs to share with someone you like.  The Big L is awesome and you have to get the hot gardinera.

9.description: Decent place to get a big sandwich with a bunch of sliced, porky, spicy, reddish Italian meats you might not have heard of before mixed with a bunch of sliced, porky, spicy, reddish Italian meats you have heard of before.And sometimes that's just exactly what you need.

10.description: So walking into Fontano's in the south-side suburb of Beverly for lunch today, I encountered the following crowd: 2 old-timers eating soup and reading the paper, 2 police officers ordering food and chatting up the employees, 2 blue-collar workers taking their lunch break, and a couple of businessmen in suits grabbing a quick lunch--pretty typical for a south side Italian deli, eh?  Based on the crowd, I knew this place had to be good.  And....it was.  Nothing special, nothing fancy, just a good, old-fashioned, hearty sub.  Get it with everything and you won't be disappointed.  The food here is probably 3.5 stars, but I'll round down to 3 stars because of a pretty blah dining area.

4.description: Great home made meatball and the wise guy sub.

6.description: Best subs around! great value and fresh every time!

15.description: pretty good italian subs...   extremely messy to eat, especially when you get everything on it.  they also have soups, not-homemade tiramisu, and a few other italian deli type items (meats, jardiniere, pasta,  etc.. nothing too exciting though).   not the cheapest subs in the world, though a 12" is easily two meals (12" "Big L" is just over $10ish).

0.description: Nothing negative to say about this place.. I really hope it never closes or gets new management bc the subs are perfection. Meat=delicious and they do not skimp on quality. No cheap rubbery, crappy toilet food lunch meat that Subway offers. This is real shredded turkey, corn beef etc. Fresh rolls, quality soups and sides. It's not glamorous inside so if you want snazzy decor maybe head over to Potbellys, but the food won't be as good. 100% recommend.

5.description: Just had a nice tuna sub from here. TASTY!Nice clean friendly place. Just what you want from a neighborhood sub place. I don't like having to feed the meter on 95th. Call first. Run in. Grab food. No meter. I haven't had a bad sub from here. They are generous with all things between the bread. Check it out. You won't regret it.

13.description: Another great quality sub. Always fresh, always high quality meats and soft bread. The staff is always pleasant even when you order many sandwiches with hot or mild, provalone or american, onion or tomatos. I fax my orders in and list the person's name by their sandwich. Then I pick them up an hour later. It is easy to feed 20 people!  They have a few table for guests, but this is a take-out place.

11.description: Solid food. Meat on bread. With cheese. There's also some tuna (and OK) chicken salad. I'm on a chicken salad kick right now. Can't even explain it. The atmosphere is comfortable enough for a spot right on 95th Street. Didn't realize this was a chain until checking on Yelp! - which is a good thing since it really seems to fit the South [Sox] Side/Beverly area. Yeah, they got some of those azz hot pepper for your sam'mich, if you want them. But why go that route?  Enjoy your food and don't set your stomach on fire.

8.description: Sandwiches are great, but the employees I came across were pretty unpleasant. Barely acknowledged I was in there for about 10 minutes and not more than 3 words came out of their mouths.

14.description: great food thanks!   later hours would be great..wishfull thinking

7.description: Love this place! Their sandwiches taste amazing! The ingredients are fresh. The food is prepared fast and it's done right.

3.description: I am hooked on the chocolate there. I especially like the little marsh mellow birthday style cakes. Its like my birthday everyday with a little mock candle on the top. The owner Katie Murphy is as sweet as she can be. They can make anything and have a wide variety of goodies; fudge, pralines,  grahm crackers.  Even had Oscar cookies for Oscar night. She also has some penny candy. Go there and go next door to Blossom Boys, flower and gift shop and the coolest ladies boutique on the corner.While you are in Beverly go down three blocks to RH Design and consignment shop on 103rd and Wood for cool furniture.

1.description: Sweet Freaks is a cute little family-owned candy store located in a group of quaint little shops right next to the 99th Street Metra station in Beverly. Even if you're not a huge chocolate lover, you'll love this place. Besides chocolates, they have a variety of other candy and fudge. However, their main specialty is hand made chocolates and candies--hence the name Sweet Freaks. One step inside and you can tell they're passionate about what they do. Everything is meticulously made and tastes incredible. Must try's are the Howies, Jakes ( their version of a Turtle) Jaques and cherry bites (chocolate-dipped red licorice. Because everything is made fresh in small batches, they might be out of something, but there's always plenty of other options. I guarantee, once you give their stuff a try, you'll be hooked.

2.description: My family and I were in Chicago  for a vacation and saw the great reviews on Sweet freaks and decided to give it a try. The owner was very friendly and kind. They have a wide variety of fudge,chocolate, and candy. We loved the Jakes and Jacques, Great trays and platters of chocolate  for parties and guests with a sweet tooth. Me and my family order chocolate all the way from North Carolina because we love it so much!

0.description: This is a fantastic neighborhood candy store.  The kids love it (obviously), but the handcrafted chocolates are really amazing.  Our favorite gift for any occasion is a box of their famous, handmade chocolate Jakes: chocolate, caramel & pecans, yum!  The owners also offer treats for the kids as a reward for good grades on their report cards.  That is what it is all about.

4.description: If anyone is looking for some fresh ideas when it comes to catering, including some terrific sweets, please check out Sweet Freaks. Lunch is served Tuesday thru Friday from 11 until 2. The food has great flavor and the soups are homemade. Portions are excellent and the prices are reasonable. A 1/2 pound cheesebuger with fresh cut fries is only $6. The chef also makes his own line of chocolates which go quick! If you have the chance grab a bag of Cherry Bites on your way out. It doesn't seem like this combo should work, but I am addicted. A copy of his catering menu is available online at sweetfreak.org.This kitchen is in the Elks Club and is run independently with a portion of the proceeds benefitting the Elks.

28.description: Two words: Greek Salad.  I know that most people come here for a good burger and order of fries, but I come all the time for their Greek Salad.  I know, random, but the veggies are really fresh!

1.description: You always need a respectable greasy spot.  This is it!  Plus, the Greek salad with chicken (a healthy amount of chicken) and Caesar dressing hits the spot.  You could almost share that salad.  For dessert, yogurt or ice cream!

9.description: lol racist ?? really never ! they will however take ur order first some times if ure a regular.im black and every time I go into Nicky's they take my order right away. And ive been so much they know exactly what I want ! Best turkey burgers and fries in Chicago ! U can even ask about me ! Black kid who always come to order turkey burgers. They even gave me free meals ! Lol @ Racist smh. You people ! Best Fast Food restaurant ive been to! h I could ve them 10 stars but ill settle with 5

29.description: Great dogs!! It's about time we got a new jansons!!!

23.description: This is an out if the way, family friendly restaurant. I would recommend the chicken chopped salad.

5.description: This a small family owned fast food place with the friendliness and quality you hope for. The food variety is both expected and surprising. The sandwiches taste fresh as they are made to order. The fries need work. You would hope that they were better to accompany the higher quality sandwiches. Parking is almost always an issue. So I don't recommend you go at the usual meal rush times.

31.description: I've lived in the neighborhood for over 11 years but have only been here a handful of times.  The food is good, the service is ok, the location could be better - sometimes hard to find a place to park.  I've had the grilled chicken and it was delicious.  My niece had the gyro and said it was great with the exception of the pita bread.  They have just about anything a typical burger place would have PLUS a nice variety of ice cream (only place outside of Michigan where I've seen Blue Moon icecream, yum!) They've been offering $10 groupon for $5 so a great deal if you can get that.  I'll be back there again.

25.description: This review is only about the yogurt. Yes, I thought it was a contradiction to be a grill and a yogurt oasis :-) but the yogurt was good and the portion you get for what you pay is very generous. I'll be returning this summer.  Parking can be difficult.

12.description: I've been so bored with the choices in the Beverly area. This place is fast, cheap, and the food is amazing!  I've been here 3 times this week and I still can't get enough. The regular gyros and chicken gyros are to die for!

37.description: Hands down, the best pick up and go fast food joint in the area.  Com paired to Wojos, Nicky's Drive-Thru, Janson's.... Nicky's is IMO the BEST.  Their burgers are verrrry tasty, the Gyro meal is very neatly prepared and delicious.  Also try their Chicken Pita with teriyaki sauce.  If you still have a appetite after a large meal, try the yogurt also, you wont be disappointed.

21.description: I recommend the chicken pita! These guys would have a gold mine if they had a drive-through!

16.description: Again I love this place! I've never had my order wrong. And the guys behind the counter are nice and friendly and they seem to recognize me every time I come there.  It's nice to see that they are slowly improving the inside of the restaurant. They have an iPad for a cash register. And now you can fill your own drinks at the soda fountain.

17.description: love this place. the chicken gyro is to die for! all the ice cream is soo good too.  very clean and pretty cute inside.  not to mention the guy who takes the orders, he is entertaining and very friendly.  love it!!

10.description: Love this place...Been going to this establishment for years & the food is great, service is great. I give Nicky's a 5star rating & recommend it for anyone who wants a good meal at reasonable prices!

11.description: My go too place since moving to the area.  Everything I've had on the menu has been great so far.

26.description: racist food-maker. i was standing in line but when a person who was the same race (mexican) as the guy behind the counter came in after me, he took his order first (in spanish). i wasnt even acknowledged, so i left. i will never step foot in this dump again

27.description: Been coming here since high school with my girlfriends whenever we are in the mood for a chicken pita, they make the best! Guys in there are always so friendly, too.

35.description: You can buy a cup of $6 froyo here, too.  If you want a 32 ounce cup of it.  That's right.  They do frozen yogurt here with no damn frills, for cheap, cheap, cheap.  A small is only $2.  And they were doing it before it was trendy.  I don't even think they give a shit if it is trendy, but the people who work here are really cool. They use Edy's brand. and they have like four or five flavors of it everyday. It has a slightly less creamy, more icy texture and I don't think any probiotics are going on in this stuff at all - no real tanginess.  I had a small Honey Almond with caramel and it was such a big portion I had trouble finishing it.The vibe is a fascinating mix of people that is all Beverly - rich, poor, black, white, old and young.  There was the one guy in there wearing all Chicago Bears gear and knee pads, but he was at least 65 years old, talking to himself and pretending to have an argument on the pay phone, coupled with people rolling up in Jaguars.  So that was entertaining.Ice cream is a Michigan brand, and they dole out large, cheap portions of that too. They also have grill style, mostly fast food.  Get anything with grilled chicken - it is fantastic here.  Especially if you get the lemon-pepper sauce on it.

8.description: I love this place! It's great for fast food. Their burgers, pizza puffs, and fries are items that I usually come in for. Oh! Can't forget about their grilled chicken; it's perfectly seasoned. Guys are friendly and service is fast, so no complaints whatsoever on my behalf...

0.description: Jerk chicken salad is fantastic.  Service is fast and friendly.

20.description: Again I love this place! I've never had my order wrong. And the guys behind the counter are nice and friendly and they seem to recognize me every time I come there.  It's nice to see that they are slowly improving the inside of the restaurant. They have an iPad for a cash register. And now you can fill your own drinks at the soda fountain.

19.description: I recommend the chicken pita! These guys would have a gold mine if they had a drive-through!

33.description: The food and service is good no matter when you go or what your order.  However, if you're lucky enough to visit the restaurant when the tall, thin Caucasian guy is taking and ringing out orders; you're in for GREAT food and terrific service.  He and his crew are extra friendly and make sure each order is 100% accurate and will even suggest some of the "tasty norms" that accompany your requests if you don't ask.

2.description: Tops for any fast-food fix.  Mighty tasty gyros and all-beef dog specials here, but if you want something quick and healthy, Nicky's has still got you covered for about ten bucks, tax included.  Try a formidable Chopped Salad, Southwest Salad or their Buffalo Chicken Salad using grilled (or breaded) chicken breast. (Skip the raw onions in your salad unless you like an insane amount of yellow onion.) Tzatziki sauce is fresh and on point. A "Gyro Platter"comes with 2 pitas, small Greek Salad and fries, & easily feeds 2 peeps on the cheap.(Cheese fries available) Nice that they'll throw some juicy, roasted gyro on the grill for me to give it a slight sear and their grilled chicken pita never fails. I add a hint of tzatziki to the grilled chicken and it's flavorful with a fraction of the gyro guilt. Ice cream scoops,  shakes and fat-free yogurts are a delight. Try the banana pudding flavor! There's usually one sugar-free soft-serve on tap.  Menus available to phone-in your order if you're in a rush. A few tables if you care to dine-in. Heads up, evenings..especially weekend nights, there's groups of males often lingering ..loudly. Keep alert. Staff is super friendly...seriously, a kind crew... and the line moves quickly, but you have to repeat back your order/double-check your bag before you leave!! Even check your dressing. When the tall, Greek guy or the funny dude in the ball cap is on register, that's the bomb. Service is definitely elevated with their  presence.  Parking is tight, but quick turnover keeps vehicles moving. Now on BELLY!As my original review mentioned, there's usually a mangled pile of BMX bikes dropped by the door come summer; just hop over those and you're golden.

34.description: Nicky's has it all... Great location with parking (sometimes), Great people working there and great food. The Gyro Burger is a glutten delight. Turkey burger is damn good, and the hot dogs are vienna beef. Even the salads are impressive.

32.description: Decent place for some decent junk food.The gyro burger was a good deal at about $5.  2 burger patties, tons of gyro meat on top, with fresh lettuce, onion, tomato, and pickles.  I wasn't able to finish it.  They actually have a grill, with flames, that they cook the burgers on, instead of putting them on the flat stainless steel "grill" like most places.  Unfortunately they use the premade pressed gyro meat made by Kronos.  After having gyro meat made from scratch, there's nothing close to it.  I also had frozen yogurt.  A large was under $4, and they give you an absurd amount.  I only ate what was above the top of the cup, and put the remainder in the freezer.  It's still delicious today.  Dutch chocolate frozen yogurt, extremely rich.What was nice, was they verified each part of our order before starting the cooking process, ensuring everything was exact.  If I needed to grab a quick bite and I was in the area I'd stop again.  If I lived down the block I'd probably go there about once per week, but I won't go out of my way for it.

18.description: This is certainly the best not-chain-fast-food restaurant in the area. The food I've eaten (from grilled chicken salad to burgers and fries to gyros) never disappoints and certainly justifies the price. The yogurt and ice cream always come in a variety and offer a great combination of toppings. You will never leave hungry if you have a few bucks to spend. The service is always efficient and the staff are friendly and very helpful. However, it can be very crowded sometimes so dining in (comfy atmosphere) may not be possible. Also, parking can be crazy as the location is a small-ish strip mall. So, whether you're craving greasy, delicious food or want to be calorie conscious, this place suits your needs!

13.description: This is the best place on the South side!

4.description: They have the best Chopped Salad Ever!!! The food is delicious here from the Philly Cheese Steaks to the Blackened Catfish . Although when I have called my order in I have had to wait for an extended amount of time .But the food at Nicky's is sooo worth it!!

24.description: This is certainly the best not-chain-fast-food restaurant in the area. The food I've eaten (from grilled chicken salad to burgers and fries to gyros) never disappoints and certainly justifies the price. The yogurt and ice cream always come in a variety and offer a great combination of toppings. You will never leave hungry if you have a few bucks to spend. The service is always efficient and the staff are friendly and very helpful. However, it can be very crowded sometimes so dining in (comfy atmosphere) may not be possible. Also, parking can be crazy as the location is a small-ish strip mall. So, whether you're craving greasy, delicious food or want to be calorie conscious, this place suits your needs!

6.description: As far as fast food goes, this place is top notch. They have the stuff you want, plus healthy alternatives. Salmon burgers, turkey burgers, chicken gyros. In addition to ice cream, they have gelato and several flavours of froyo. The interior is nice too, for a fast food joint - all wood. They are fast, servings are good sized and hot. Plus they're not a corporate outlet. Great business model.

22.description: The food is always hot and delicious.  The owner is friendly and really appreciates his regular customers. The portions are more than adequate.  The atmosphere lends itself to family dinning.  The prices are slightly higher than some hotdog stands,  but the consistent quality of the food makes it worth the trip. I highly recommend this establishment.

15.description: I've had my share of gyros in life from time to time.  Not only are the chicken and lamb gyros extremely tasty here the service is consistent, friendly and fast.** Be sure to ask for an extra tzatziki sauce on the side as the sauce is minimum on standard order- guess they allow the 'meat' to speak for itself- and it does!Only criticism:  It's 9:36p.m. Saturday night - they close at 9 on weekends and 10p during weekdays.  Would be nice to be able to have a tasty gyro or pita sandwich right now.

7.description: Im giving this place 5 stars not because my gyros were that amazing (they were decent) but because the rest of the peeps i went with said their food was amazing.order 1: chicken gyros and fries- it was decent, nothing too spectacularOrder 2: bbq sandwich with fries- really good, bbq sauce was bit too sweetOrder 3: cheeseburger and fries- very good and very juicy! must try!!!overall i had a good experience at Nicky's the food was good, people were very friendly, and polite, oh and the place was pretty cosy!!!

36.description: Excellent food! Everything on their menu is good, you can't go wrong with Nicky's at all....from there yogurt, ice cream, burgers, gyros, salad, hotdogs and chicken!  What I like most about them is that they are very clean and their service is GREAT! 5 stars for NICKY'S!!!

30.description: I love this place! I am a frequent customer due to their ever changing flavors of low cal, low/non fat fro yo. My favorites include pumpkin, pecan praline, red velvet, and white chocolate macadamia.  I also love their greek salads which you can top with lots of gyro meat and gyro sauce.  The cherry on the top for this restaurant is their workers.  They are always glad to see and serve you. Definately a must try.

3.description: This place has always been really good. From the ice cream to sandwiches. Love the cheese fries too. I would recommend nickys to anyone you can call ahead for pick up and they also have a website with the menu and daily specials on it. Big salads and great philly cheese steak and gyros.

14.description: If you want gyros, dogs, burgers and salad.. oh and I can't forget ice cream, NGYO is the place to go. The food is typical Greek-ish fast food, but the service is what makes this place stand out. They're quick, efficient and my order has always been accurate.  I'm not sure the brand of ice cream they use, but it is pretty good. Inside you'll get a good mix of folks... lots of cops, and lots of people with a bad case of the munchies (wink wink nudge nudge know what I mean).
